The walls were painted with vibrant hues, attempting to convey an air of luxury, while the Venetian suites offered superior sleeping arrangements, featuring plush mattresses, an abundance of substantial terry cloth towels, extensive marble surfaces, and two televisions for maximum entertainment. However, the primary factor contributing to the dissatisfaction and subsequent one-star rating was the inconvenience caused by the boisterous bass emanating from Club XS, located on the 25th floor, adjacent to the golf course, which persistently disturbed the peace until the early hours of 4:10 AM. Upon contacting the hotel's concierge, it was divulged that, indeed, the noise had been a source of annoyance for certain patrons, yet the management appeared indifferent, prioritizing financial gain over the comfort and satisfaction of their guests, as exemplified by their nonchalant response to the issue, leading to Wynn's eventual departure."

"My recent evaluation of this establishment, predicated on the quality of the culinary offerings, the proficiency of the staff, and the relative affordability of the menu items, yielded a rating of three stars. However, my attempt at providing an objective assessment was met with an accusatory response from the proprietor, who erroneously assumed that I was a specific patron who had availed themselves of various promotional opportunities, including happy hour, Restaurant.com, and a Yelp check-in. The owner's reaction conveyed a sense of indignation, as if I had bestowed a grossly inadequate one-star appraisal instead of a moderately favorable three-star evaluation. 

I must emphasize that I am not, in fact, the individual in question. Moreover, I am disconcerted by the management's apparent disapproval of patrons who capitalize on the discounts and incentives that the restaurant itself promotes. The vacancy that characterized the dining area during my visit has become understandable in light of this occurrence. My feelings of umbrage notwithstanding, I shall refrain from expressing any further endorsements of this eatery, whether verbally or through online reviews."

We procured a temporary lodging arrangement at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, however, the accommodations provided were subpar, featuring a bed with structural damage and a shower that distributed an excessive amount of water at the base rather than the apex. Moreover, the room boasted a large window that spanned the entirety of one wall, yet the view was obstructed by a water tank, detracting from the overall ambiance. It appeared that the room had not undergone renovation since the era of El Capone, which further contributed to our disappointment. We had reserved the accommodations approximately one month prior to our arrival, and when we brought our grievances to the attention of Vegas.com, they deflected responsibility, claiming that the issues were the result of the hotel's negligence. Our subsequent complaints to Caesars yielded a similar response, with the management maintaining that the reservation process was the culpability of the third-party agency we had utilized. Following several weeks of unproductive communication with the management team at Vegas.com, we remain disillusioned and advise potential travelers to exercise caution when utilizing their services, as our experience was utterly deplorable.

"Under no circumstances does this experience warrant a critical examination or assessment, as it pertains to an organization that engages in unethical and immoral practices by exploiting those who are already disadvantaged; such entities are analogous to the airline industry's Spirit Airlines, which has been known to prioritize profiteering over passenger comfort, and the bus line in question bears a striking resemblance to the latter in terms of its modus operandi; the expenditure of $39, while seemingly insignificant, represents a tangible manifestation of the financial burden that such institutions impose upon the less fortunate members of society, thereby rendering any potential legal recourse, including but not limited to a class-action lawsuit, an attractive option for those seeking restitution and justice."

This location would immensely benefit from the cultivation of citrus trees, specifically oranges, which would not only enhance the aesthetic appeal of the surroundings but also provide a symbolic representation of the region's agricultural heritage. Unfortunately, the proprietor appears to be oblivious to the fundamental principles of hospitality, resulting in an unpleasant experience for patrons. The sole redeeming feature of this establishment is the culinary offerings available at the grill area, specifically the juicy burgers and crispy fries. It is suggested that management consider allocating additional resources towards improving the overall quality of their services, perhaps by drawing inspiration from the exceptional standards upheld at Great Eagle, rather than investing excessively in their secondary course, Arizona Traditions.

I was quoted a price for a new pair of glasses and lenses that were in the 50% area. Came back the next day excited to buy the glasses and was told the glasses were not on sale for 50% and that the quote someone gave me the day before was wrong. The new quote was DOUBLE what I was quoted the day before! Not only was I disappointed about the price, but the sale associate was rude and didn't care about what had happened. I will never shop at Lens Crafters ever again. What a horrible experience! I also came in many times before and the employees never helped me. They were just sitting down doing nothing. I honestly don't know how they are able to stay in business if they don't help customers or at least ask.

The pungent aroma of fermented beverages and various other substances that have been accidentally splattered onto the carpet permeates the atmosphere, evoking a strong sense of familiarity among patrons who derive pleasure from consuming microwaved frozen cuisine. An enigmatic ambiance pervades this establishment, arousing curiosity and suspicion among first-time visitors, as though they have stumbled upon a clandestine gathering place for local inhabitants who are prohibited from entering gambling facilities.

"I have recently relocated to this state from out-of-state and have had generally positive encounters within the region thus far. However, my experience with NV Energy has been a glaring exception to this trend. If given the option, I would unequivocally assign zero stars to their service. The sentiments expressed by previous reviewers on this platform resonate profoundly with me, rendering superfluous any additional elaboration on my part. Throughout my interactions with their representatives, I have been utterly exasperated, appallingly mistreated, and patronizingly dismissed. The standard of their customer service is utterly indefensible. Were alternative options available, I would unhesitatingly opt for them instead. Moreover, the fact that a solitary location exists for establishing service underscores the absurdity of the situation. Suffice it to say, I am thoroughly disheartened and have exhausted my patience with this entity."

"A complete and utter scam, through and through. Following a recent relocation, I made a trio of telephone calls to arrange for the modification of my service address, yet each instance resulted in an inability on the part of the representative to successfully orchestrate the scheduling process, with nary a callback received in response to my efforts. Ultimately, I opted to enlist the services of an alternative provider for the establishment of service at my new domicile, and contacted ADT to formally cancel my subscription. The customer service representative I encountered was discourteous and informed me that a penalty fee of $376 would be incurred due to the early termination of my contractual agreement. My protestations, citing the fact that the sole reason for my cancellation was the persistent lack of responsiveness on their part, fell upon deaf ears. Furthermore, I have since discovered that my credit card has been charged for the past three months, despite my repeated attempts to rectify the situation. Upon contacting the company for the purpose of canceling my subscription once and for all, I was met with the same exorbitant demand of $376."

We have endeavored to partake in the culinary offerings of this establishment on multiple occasions, only to be met with consistent disappointment and dismay. Our orders have consistently been erroneous, with our pizzas arriving in a state of utter incineration, rendering them inedible. Furthermore, the sandwich we had the misfortune of ordering has been subjected to an excessive duration of heat, resulting in an overcooked and unpalatable Philly cheesesteak. Consequently, we shall refrain from patronizing this establishment in the future, deeming it the most unsatisfactory Domino's experience thus far.
These mother fuckers hit an ran my car! Eye witness took down their cab number and license plate. Your busted!

"It is utterly reprehensible that such an esteemed establishment as Rio could conceivably garner a rating of minus five stars, owing to the utter lack of concern and professionalism displayed by their staff in addressing the deplorable state of our accommodations. Throughout my numerous previous visits to Las Vegas, I have never encountered such an egregious instance of neglect and disregard for the well-being of guests. Upon entering our room (#12004), my companions and I were immediately struck by an overpowering stench emanating from the corridor outside, which, regrettably, proved to be merely an omen of the unpleasantness that was to follow. Our neighbors informed us that they had previously lodged complaints regarding this issue, yet, astonishingly, no corrective measures were undertaken by the hotel's management. Upon returning to our quarters at approximately 2:30 a.m., we were rudely awakened by an intense pruritic sensation, and, upon closer inspection, discovered an infestation of parasitic insects inhabiting the very beds we were forced to sleep in. The ensuing emotional distress occasioned by this discovery precipitated my experiencing an acute episode of hysteria, during which I bemoaned the fact that my person was now covered in unsightly eruptions, necessitating my seeking assistance from the hotel's security personnel. Following their arrival, we were presented with biohazard bags in which to place our contaminated attire, and, after enduring an interminable wait, were offered alternative accommodations, which, understandably, we declined. Furthermore, the financial compensation proffered by the hotel's management ($50) was patently inadequate, given the exorbitant cost of replacing our personal effects, not to mention the irreparable damage done to our peace of mind. It is simply unfathomable that a resort of Rio's stature could display such nonchalance in the face of such a flagrant breach of its duty of care towards its clientele, and furthermore, that they would have the temerity to suggest that even the illustrious Wynn Hotel was allegedly plagued by similar issues. Such a response can only be described as a reprehensible dereliction of duty."

Never, ever, under any circumstances, shall it transpire that an individual, regardless of their affiliation with this establishment, engage in a discourse that contains derogatory remarks directed towards my person. Such behavior is unacceptable and inexcusable, particularly when a patron has opted to procure a product from your menu, which, might I add, was accompanied by a monetary exchange. It is imperative that proprietors comprehend the significance of providing excellent customer service, and refrain from publicly denigrating patrons, lest they seek to precipitate a decline in their commercial endeavors. Furthermore, allow me to emphasize that I did not explicitly state that the coffee served at this establishment was of inferior quality; however, due to the unfortunate sequence of events, I am now compelled to express my dissatisfaction with the beverage, which, regrettably, does not meet my expectations. In light of these circumstances, I shall abstain from purchasing any further items from your menu, including but not limited to the $12 chef salad and $3 croissant. Moreover, I must stress that I will not tolerate any further instances of feigned politeness or surreptitious glances directed towards me. Instead, I shall opt to support establishments that treat me with the respect and dignity I deserve. Postscript: Anticipate a significant decrease in business once the neighboring establishment becomes operational. Rest assured that I shall display a cheerful demeanor and offer a cordial greeting as I pass by your establishment in the morning, proudly sipping my Cartel coffee.

"The culinary offerings were subpar, the hospitality was lacking in its totality, and the establishment's atmosphere was utterly devoid of any semblance of tranquility. It came as no surprise that the dining area was approximately ninety percent unoccupied upon our arrival, given the dearth of quality in both the edible fare and the attentive nature of the staff."

"My spouse and I procured tickets for our dual-day Vegas excursion through Ticketmaster, at full price, mind you. I wouldn't attend this production again, even if it were gratis. The five-star ratings seem to stem from the minuscule minority who were handpicked to participate in the performance. An inordinate amount of time was squandered by the Blue Man Group as they meandered through the audience, selecting individuals to partake in their sketches. Underwhelming, to say the least. My better half and I persevered through the show, yet we couldn't help but express our discontent by repeatedly glancing at our timepieces. The sketches were trite and protracted! For $75 per ticket, I expected an intellectually stimulating experience. Furthermore, it was painfully evident that the drummers' musical accompaniment was pre-recorded, rather than being performed live. I believed that was the fundamental concept. In conclusion, the show was an amalgamation of inconsequential, uninspired attempts at humor. Elevate the quality of the production or reduce the cost!"

I arrived at this establishment with my kinfolk, eager to indulge in some authentic Southern barbecue, having procured a Google Offer and wishing to relish the rich flavors of the region. Alas, my expectations were quickly thwarted. Upon placing the order for my family and presenting my mobile device to redeem the offer, the cashier adamantly refused to accept it, citing a requirement for a physical printout rather than a digital display. I reasoned with him, explaining that the associated number could easily be accessed via my phone, thereby facilitating a harmonious resolution for all parties involved. However, his manager proved equally intransigent, leaving me no choice but to escalate the matter to the proprietor himself. Unfortunately, he too maintained the same unyielding stance.

While waiting, I couldn't help but notice that the staffing arrangement during peak hours on a Saturday afternoon consisted of a solitary individual tasked with managing both drive-in and walk-in orders. It remains unclear what role the manager and owner fulfill, aside from their apparent responsibility for dismissing coupon-wielding patrons. The queue extended well beyond the entrance, with many disgruntled customers abandoning their wait, leading me to surmise that an auspicious sign had steered us toward a delectable dining experience across the street at Butterfield's.

Given the circumstances, I find it perplexing that this establishment has managed to stay afloat. Avoid it, if possible.

Your geographical vicinity is approximately 45-60 minutes distant from our domicile. Upon our arrival, we were apprised that the extensive queue would require an estimated duration of 1.5 hours. Subsequently, we endured a prolonged waiting period from 5:05 PM to 7:40 PM, surpassing 2.5 hours. During our anticipation, a young child, aged five, regurgitated her meal onto the carpeted surface in close proximity to the culinary offerings, and the staff responded lethargically to addressing the situation. It is reasonable to assume that the prospect of waiting for such an extended time on Father's Day, only to be situated a mere three feet away from the aforementioned unpleasantness, would be utterly disagreeable. Following our eventual seating, a considerable delay of 25 minutes ensued before we received a glass of water. Furthermore, the BBQ ribs we had eagerly anticipated proved to be persistently unavailable, despite numerous attempts to procure them. In response to my notification to the manager, he presented us with a TOGO box containing a limited quantity of ribs as we departed the premises. However, this gesture was ultimately futile, as we were not heading home and the spoiled food was rendered useless. The venue was characterized by extreme crowding, and the dishware, cups, utensils, and cutlery emerged damp and, in some instances, still retained remnants of previous meals. Additionally, we were compelled to endure prolonged queues lasting between 5-15 minutes to acquire any edible items. Ultimately, our experience at this establishment was thoroughly disappointing.

If you Re there for beer, microbrews and such, this is the place for you.  However, if you are looking for a good chili dog, try someplace else.  While the hot dogs are of good quality, they honestly have the blandest, odd tasting chili I have ever had.  First off, I don't like beans in hot dog chili.  Second, it didn't really add any flavor.  It just gave it an odd texture.  They are also overpriced.  Their onion rings weren't all that good either.  Lots of microbrews makes one hope for beer battered onion rings.  Nope!  Just crappy almost store bought low quality breaded onion rings.  And change your fry oil once in a while!  So to sum up, beer: good.  Food: sucks.

I ordered the sizzling rice soup as a bowl and the server failed to tell us that if we got the combo meal it would come with soup. Then after we already ordered the soup I asked if we could cancel it and just get combos and the manager said no. Terrible customer service. I will never be back.

"Upon conducting a follow-up telephone call to obtain information regarding the latest vocabulary addition, I was informed by a representative of the company's customer service department that their order fulfillment system was currently non-operational and that persistent attempts at contacting them would be necessary to acquire updates on the status of my purchase. Additionally, I was provided with an anticipated timeframe for delivery, specifically between the 28th day of this month and the 11th day of the succeeding month, which was conveyed to me through a previous communication channel. Noteworthily, my initial attempt at contacting a managerial figure within the organization's retention department proved unsuccessful, as they failed to reciprocate my communication efforts. It is worth mentioning that this particular establishment holds a singular rating of one star, which may serve as an indicator of their overall performance and level of customer satisfaction."

"My inaugural visit to this establishment proved to be an unmitigated disaster, rendering me a permanent non-returning patron. Their inability to accurately fulfill my orders was staggering; I requested two salmon sandwiches, yet was served only a solitary item, despite being charged for the pair. Furthermore, my subsequent attempt to procure a coffee beverage was met with similar incompetence, as the server neglected to prepare my requested blended decaf peppermint mocha, necessitating my prompt reminder. Upon finally receiving the beverage, I was compelled to reject it and demand a refund, due to its unacceptable taste. I would strongly advise against recommending this venue to anyone."

I lack a consistent pedicure venue and opted to visit this establishment while conducting various errands. The ambiance was spotless, and the personnel were amicable, albeit taciturn. I selected an express pedicure augmented by a callus removal feature. Unfortunately, I suffered a chemical burn on the dorsal aspect of my foot due to the callus remover gel; the attendant applied it with gloved hands, then grasped my foot, followed by sanding my feet onto a piece of newspaper. Subsequently, she discarded the paper in the shopping center's waste receptacle (a peculiar action indeed!). Concerning the polish, the attendant voiced several grievances regarding the diminutive size of my smallest toe nail (indeed, it is minuscule; nevertheless, a generous application may yield desirable results). Post-polish, there was no leisurely interval for drying; rather, the attendant expedited my departure by donning my shoes, processing the payment, and ushering me out the door. Upon arriving home, both my large toes exhibited signs of disarray, prompting me to conjecture that lingering in my vehicle for a brief period would have been more judicious.

"In light of your inquiry regarding the culinary merits of Trader Vic's, my response would be an unequivocal negative. The following points illustrate the reasons behind my assertion:  
1. The cost of the cuisine is exorbitant, bordering on the unreasonable.  
2. The flavors of the dishes are uninspired and lack depth, akin to a bland imitation of gastronomic excellence.  
3. The service staff exhibits a lethargic demeanor, evoking the impression of sluggishness.  
4. The ambiance fails to impress, characterized by an uninspired and lackadaisical approach to interior design.  
5. The menu selections are limited and unimaginative, leaving much to be desired.  
6. The concept of fusion, often touted as a selling point, falls flat in execution, rendering it an overhyped and overvalued aspect of the dining experience.  
7. While the beverage selection holds promise, the actual drinks are merely passable, doing little to redeem the establishment's shortcomings.  
8. The quality of the food is abysmal, with each dish falling short of even the most lenient expectations.  
9. Our orders, specifically the Popcorn Shrimp, Mango Chili Beef, and Pink Peppercorn Crusted Ahi, served only to reinforce our dissatisfaction with the restaurant's offerings.  
10. In conclusion, Trader Vic's does not warrant even a single star, given its glaring deficiencies in both culinary expertise and customer satisfaction."

"I received a chicken meal instead of the vegetarian option I had ordered, which I did not realize until I arrived home. Due to the sweltering heat, which measured a stifling 118 degrees Fahrenheit, I opted not to return to the establishment. Following a phone call to inform them of the mix-up, the apologetic representative conveyed her condolences and assured me that a manager would contact me promptly to rectify the situation. Unfortunately, this promised callback never transpired, leaving me feeling utterly disillusioned with the lack of follow-through demonstrated by both the individual and the organization as a whole. While the culinary offerings may be palatable, the dearth of reliable customer service sadly negates any potential positive aspects of the dining experience, thereby rendering future visits unlikely."

The ambiance was pleasant, however, the hospitality was merely adequate. Unfortunately, the culinary offerings were utterly disappointing, particularly the Baja Chicken Burrito, which lacked any semblance of flavor or zest. My mother's Enchilada Combo fared no better, as she, too, found it to be devoid of any discernible taste or aroma. Considering the exorbitant prices charged for such uninspired fare, it is unlikely that we shall return.

"It was previously an enjoyable experience, but unfortunately, the cost increased while the quality of service deteriorated. Therefore, we are compelled to seek out alternative venues for socializing with acquaintances."

"An egregious, utterly reprehensible location, replete with aspiring Paris Hiltons and sleazy Rico Suaves, sporting their ubiquitous striped, button-down shirts, with the top buttons unfastened to showcase an unsightly abundance of chest hair. Furthermore, this dubious establishment attracts a motley crew of semi-famous hockey players, individuals flaunting large denomination bills, faded celebrities (such as Britney Spears, who made a questionable appearance on New Year's Eve), and members of the Pussycat Dolls, all of whom are granted preferential treatment and allowed to bypass the queue. Upon gaining entry, one cannot help but feel perplexed and disillusioned by the experience, as the atmosphere fails to live up to the hype and fanfare surrounding it."

I must confess that I have yet to immerse myself in the interior of this club, but I am basing my assessment solely on the underwhelming experience I endured while patiently queuing outside. If your intention is to be deceived into forking out double the entrance fee, then I would strongly advise against it. My companion and I squandered two precious hours of our evening awaiting entry, only to decide that it was no longer worth our time and effort. 
  The coordinators of this establishment, whoever they may be, appear to prioritize their procurement of a commission above all else. This inference can be attributed to the fact that I personally queried one of the representatives, who divulged that the club's revenue is derived primarily from the bar sales rather than the entrance fees. Thus, it appears that they rely heavily on convincing patrons to fork out double the amount for admission, which I find unacceptable and refuse to participate in. 
  It is worth noting that the queue for individuals who opted to pay the standard fee did not exhibit any signs of advancement, whereas the line reserved for those who paid in excess of $100 enjoyed a swifter progression. Considering the unsatisfactory encounter I experienced, I do not intend to return to this club in the future and subject myself to the frustration of attempting to gain entry; instead, I shall remain faithful to my customary haunts.

"An utterly abysmal culinary escapade! Despite our server's congenial demeanor, the quality of service he proffered fell woefully short of expectations, as did his familiarity with the menu offerings. We opted for a martini special, only to discover that it was served in a rocks glass replete with ice, rendering it an imposter by definition; furthermore, this supposed'special' was mysteriously absent from the bill when it arrived. Our main courses fared little better, as several arrived frigid (my risotto, while lukewarm, possessed a glue-like viscosity), and two of our party members were egregiously overcharged relative to the listed menu prices. To compound these transgressions, neither a manager nor any semblance of an apology materialized, leaving us feeling utterly disregarded and disenchanted. Needless to say, we shall not be returning."

If you possess a predilection for culinary offerings that are merely adequate, sluggish service characterized by an excruciatingly slow pace, and servers who exhibit an unwavering apathy towards their patrons, then this establishment may be the optimal choice for your dining experience. Additionally, it is worth noting that the prices charged by this restaurant are exorbitant and unreasonable, further contributing to an overall unsatisfactory encounter for those who elect to partake in the fare offered here.

This critique is exclusively intended for the attention of the hosting personnel...\n\nPreceding each visit to Las Vegas, wherein we partake in culinary indulgences at this establishment at least once during our stay, we encounter a brief delay in being seated, typically ranging from five to ten minutes in duration, as a group of seven individuals. Presently, I am experiencing an extended waiting period of thirty minutes, while management prioritizes accommodating a party of eight, despite the fact that the entire group has yet to arrive. Furthermore, the hosting staff has suggested that our party of seven could potentially share a booth designed to accommodate four individuals, which would necessitate an uncomfortable adjustment, particularly considering the presence of a high chair situated at the end of the table. It is worth noting that the restaurant does not appear to be exceptionally occupied at this time. Therefore, it is advisable for management to exercise prudence in their hiring practices by avoiding the recruitment of incompetent youths as hosts, and additionally, to refrain from donning absurd headwear, such as the aforementioned beanie, when working indoors.

This place is run by a bunch of incompetent meat-heads, from the manager all the way through the corporate tree.  They promised a charity event a free year membership to give away, never followed through on it.  Instead they tried to use the fundraiser to run their marketing campaign.  When brought to corporate attention, they just shoved it off, and could have cared less.  Talk about giving your corporation a horrible image.  Not only did it make LA fitness look stupid, but it made the charity, look bad, and lose the support of many contributing partners.  The estimated loss of charity donations from this is over $5k.  Good job LA fitness, keep up the selfish greedy business practices.

Worse place ever! Old bad equipment, no one working and they sell rides by time and no one working to assist....huge waste of money and when we complained they could not even locate a manager! WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!!!!

"Committed to an overnight sojourn at Planet Hollywood, my companion and I opted to observe Britney's Piece of Me performance, indulging in an economic outlay of $180, augmented by an additional $20, purportedly earmarked for a resort fee, despite our lack of utilization of any amenities associated with said resort. Furthermore, we were allocated accommodations in the most inconvenient sector of the establishment, specifically, the inferior adjunct of a luxury suite, whereupon, upon endeavoring to avail myself of the showering facilities, I was regrettably subjected to a pressure so diminutive as to evoke the bathing experiences customarily encountered in underdeveloped nations. In light of these circumstances, I would advise potential patrons to seek alternative lodgings, as the financial investment required for a single night's stay does not justify the subpar quality of the accommodations provided."

Don't buy anything from Sabrina. She offered me a pre-made smoothies and she put it back to the fridge when I said No to her. Plus you expect unfriendly service. Attention to the Manager/Owner please check your camera. It happen around 9:45pm.

The absence of a climatological mitigation apparatus within the confines of this culinary establishment has rendered the ambient temperature unbearably elevated, precipitating a profuse amount of perspiration among the patrons who are endeavoring to consume their meals under these oppressive conditions, thereby creating an unpleasant dining experience that is unrivaled in its discomfort during this season. How can the management justify keeping the dining area accessible when the thermometer exceeds the century mark and the atmosphere is akin to a furnace?

"It appears that my spouse and I were rendered inconspicuous, as our arrival at approximately 1:30 pm on a Thursday afternoon did not elicit any attention from the staff. Upon entering the establishment, we observed a considerable number of vehicles parked in the lot, leading us to assume a substantial crowd within. The venue is compartmentalized into distinct sections for dining and a bar area. We proceeded to the dining area, whereupon we awaited assistance, only to be met with an extended period of neglect. A solitary couple partaking in culinary indulgences advised us to occupy a table, assuring us that the waitstaff would attend to us forthwith. However, our presence continued to be disregarded, as a group of five individuals who entered the dining area subsequent to our arrival was promptly accommodated, presented with menus, and had their beverage preferences solicited. The waitress's posture and body language conveyed a deliberate avoidance of our presence, as she positioned herself with her back facing us while attending to the other patrons. Such blatant disregard for customer service is unacceptable, compelling us to seek alternative dining options among the numerous exceptional establishments Las Vegas has to offer. We vacated the premises, opting for a different venue."

In October, my son who attends the University of North Carolina at Charlotte encountered a predicament pertaining to his vehicle's tire, specifically, the presence of a nail obstructing its functionality. Upon visiting Tire Kingdom, the service representative advised him that three new tires were necessary, given the car's cosmetic damage and substantial mileage of over 151,000. We suggested that he opt for tires with matching tread patterns. However, instead of presenting alternative price options, the establishment fitted $184.00 tires onto the vehicle without further consideration. Following this, I contacted the manager to express my discontent and sought either a refund or a discount. Unfortunately, the manager proved unyielding in his stance, offering only a fourth tire complemented by a $70.00 rebate and a discounted oil change service. This encounter exemplifies, in my opinion, an instance of exploiting a young customer and reflects a questionable business practice. Consequently, I would never recommend this enterprise.

I dont know why we keep trying this place except the location is convenient.  The wait staff is always rude (we have been re-trying this place for 5 years now, and after this morning we won't be back) Food is ok, and prices are high for a Dennys and they nickel and dime for everything. We shared a couple better establishments with our fellow Tahiti Village owners within walking distance, with great service and food and prices!

After the clock strikes ten in the evening, it appears that the provision of mashed potatoes ceases to be available. It has been observed that the speed of service is somewhat sluggish, which may be attributed to the kitchen staff's lack of proficiency in culinary techniques. As a result, an individual's expectations are unlikely to be exceeded by the dining experience offered at this establishment. Therefore, if one desires a leisurely late-night dining experience, it is recommended to visit Arizona Charlie's instead.

"I am utterly disgusted with this establishment, having endured three futile attempts to procure a novel mountain bicycle and, simultaneously, enhance my knowledge of the latest models. The sales personnel, unfortunately, exhibited an air of superiority and a complete lack of utility, rendering their assistance utterly ineffectual. Consequently, I was compelled to seek alternative vendors for my bicycle needs, despite Landis's proximity to my domicile. Moreover, I shall refrain from purchasing even a simple inner tube from them, in light of the aforementioned unsatisfactory experiences."

"My ardent affection for pizza was utterly dismayed by the subpar quality of the pie I procured last night; despite my eager anticipation, the pizza failed to meet my expectations in multiple aspects. Adhering to a stringent carbohydrate-restricted diet, I judiciously allocate my caloric intake for weekly indulgences such as this, and thus, my disappointment was exacerbated by the pizza's undercooking, excessively saccharine sauce, and incomplete cheese coverage. In contrast, Gus's Pizza in Tempe offers a comparable, if not superior product, at a relatively lower price point than Spinelli's. My culinary preferences do not preclude me from paying a premium for exceptional pizza (Cibo, Joe's NY Pizza, Ciao Grazie, Il Bosco, et al.), but the present instance left me feeling both melancholic and irate. Perusing the reviews, it appears that there is a dichotomy between patrons who concurred with my experience and those who seemingly must be acquaintances of the staff, as their feedback seems suspiciously biased."

This lodging facility proved to be the most deplorable accommodation I have had the misfortune of experiencing. I would not hesitate to award it a rating of zero stars, were it possible. The establishment in question is, in reality, an apartment complex masquerading as a resort. The chamber we were assigned was reprehensibly unclean. The so-called'suite' we occupied was a laughable affair, boasting a miniature refrigerator utterly incapable of accommodating a mere 12-pack of beer, and a sink of proportions so diminutive as to render its utility dubious. The ambiance of the room was permeated by an aura of grime and stains, imbuing every aspect of the space with an overwhelming sense of squalor. The most distressing moment arrived when, upon preparing to retire for the evening, I uncovered no fewer than three distinct species of insects scurrying amidst the bedclothes. Following my vociferous protests, I was transferred to an alternate room, only to discover that it, too, was infested with the same variety of creepy crawlies. At this juncture, I sought redress from the front desk, only to be informed that I must contact Groupon directly to secure a refund. Sleep was impossible that night, as I opted to spend the hours in my automobile, sweltering in temperatures reaching 95 degrees Fahrenheit. My encounter with this wretched excuse for a hotel left me feeling utterly dissatisfied, and the customer service I received was nothing short of abysmal. Throughout my recounting of the bug problem to the manager, he remained stoic, smiling blandly and nodding in a manner that suggested he was already well aware of the issue. It was a truly nauseating and horrific experience, one that I shall never forgetânor, indeed, repeat.

I have had the misfortune of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, during which I have been subjected to an interminable wait for my culinary selections, and upon daring to request a coffee, I have been met with an unacceptably prolonged delay and a tepid beverage, on one particularly egregious occasion, the barista even neglected to include the coffee in my latte! Moreover, my food order has been incorrectly fulfilled on more than one occasion, surpassing the threshold of acceptability, while the pace of service has been languid and the staff's attitude towards customer satisfaction has been lackadaisical, rendering the entire experience unsatisfactory. Notwithstanding, they do possess an impressive selection of craft beers on tap, which has been a source of gratification for my spouse, yet we shall not be revisiting this establishment until substantive improvements are implemented.

"While historically an extraordinary culinary establishment, a precipitous descent has transpired over the past several months. On two separate occasions within a fortnight, attempts to procure specific items from the bill of fare were met with futility, followed by an inaccurate rendition of my order upon its arrival. Extreme dissatisfaction was experienced, prompting me to seek alternative dining options that ensure accuracy in their offerings. A telephonic conversation ensued, during which the proprietor erroneously asserted that my claims were unfounded, as they were purportedly refuted by the evidence presented on the ticket. It is lamentable that my maiden assessment must convey such discontent."

Caution!!  Caution!!  Caution!! Bait and switch.  I bought a $129 car detail for $99 on Yelp.  When I called to make an appointment they wanted me to pay $250 for the \"Arizona Detail\".  That's roughly $150 over and above the $99 I already paid!!  It's the old bait and switch.  If you want the $99 deal you basically get nothing done to your car.  Stay away!!  YOU'VE BEEN WARNED.

"If your culinary inclinations lean towards the authentic flavors of the Southern United States, then this establishment may not be the optimal destination for your gastronomical pursuits. The grits, in particular, fail to deliver an adequate representation of the traditional dish, instead presenting a heavily modified, creamy-cheesy-dairy pudding-like consistency that lacks the desired texture, bordering on a smooth, pureed infant food consistency. Furthermore, the biscuits served at this venue are characterized by an unfortunate dryness, blandness, and rigidity, leading to a crumbling phenomenon upon consumption, rendering them unsuitable for enjoyment. A similar letdown is experienced with the 'Fried Green Tomatoes,' which suffer from an absence of flavor, excessive oiliness, and an unfortunate lack of doneness. However, the staff at this location exhibit a commendable level of professionalism and courtesy, providing a solitary redeeming quality amidst an otherwise underwhelming dining experience."

"I engaged in a meeting with Lexy to review my save the dates; she assured me that she would establish contact within a week's timeframe. However, following a two-week period without receiving the preliminary draft of my save the dates, I felt compelled to send a text message inquiring about its status. In response, she promptly dispatched an email containing a hastily assembled version of the save the date. Subsequently, I communicated my revisions to the draft via email, but unfortunately, they were met with an extended period of unresponsiveness on her part, both via email and text message. It is reasonable to assume that individuals can become occupied with their responsibilities, yet a lack of communication or, more accurately, an absence of any meaningful interaction is, regrettably, unprofessional, particularly for an enterprise that relies heavily on effective communication. Ultimately, I decided to cancel my order and was left with no choice but to seek alternative services. Fortunately, I encountered a highly capable individual who produced exquisite save the dates. Based on my experience, I would not, in good conscience, recommend this person or her business venture to anyone."

"We opted for the all-you-can-eat option, and they served an abundance of rice alongside every dish. In fact, the rice was the dominant component in every plate, overpowering the other ingredients. Our order consisted of the premium white tuna (ono), seared salmon, octopus, garlic tuna, and yellowtail nigiri sushi. However, much to our dismay, each dish arrived lacking any discernible flavor, with the rice being the only distinguishable element. The ocean roll, sunset roll, and yellowtail mambo were indistinguishable from one another, despite their diverse descriptions on the menu. Furthermore, the supposedly garlicky ponzu sauce bore a striking resemblance to soy sauce, while the deep-fried shrimp heads were marinated in stale frying oil. 

The restaurant was bustling, and we patiently awaited a spot at the bar. It appeared that the crowd was drawn to the unlimited Bud Light, rather than the culinary experience. Notably, the clientele was predominantly Caucasian. 

Upon closer inspection, it became apparent that every roll emerging from the kitchen shared a remarkable similarity in appearance. One cannot help but wonder how such a lackluster establishment could boast anything above a two-star rating. Have patrons not been exposed to genuine sushi? Is sashimi a foreign concept to this establishment? Has the world indeed lost its taste buds?"

Ran into this place after no. 1 Boba was closed just to get some milk tea boba. Let's just say I will never go back to this place. The service was terrible the guy at the register was not very friendly and was rude to me. It's a shame because the boba was good and at a decent price but because of the way I was treated I will never come back here.

I completely agree with Ryan M. He could not have said it better. I had lived at this property since 2005 and left after it turned into a police state. Once you get on their shitlist they do not let up. I received a notice for hazardous driving in the parking lot when I was out of the country for that month! When I went to them to report this error I was told that when I am away I am responsible for anyone driving my vehicle. The vehicle sat in my garage the entire time I was gone. No one else has keys.\n\n It's BS like that that really stresses you out and makes day to day living really suck. I dont get how these people live with themselves policing other people like this. And the guy who reviewed the security company - yeah they were pretty cool at times - but that has nothing to do with the HOA. A separate review should be written for that company.

Took a few different dogs here while we were fostering and the first time they did great. We took our dog back to get another haircut and they didn't do it anything like the first. We took him back a 3rd time and told them about the great job they did on the first go-around and asked them to replicate it. They didn't. They made a lot of notes on our card and when we brought him back a 4th time, they flat out told us to leave and said \"we weren't a good fit\". The owner was practically hysterical, while we calmly told him that we weren't complaining, but just asking for them to recreate their first haircut. He told us that we were complaining. Apparently he knows more than we do, what we were trying to convey. We won't be back. We won't take any other foster dogs here. We won't recommend our foster friends return here either. What a huge mistake.

I have been patronizing this establishment for a considerable duration, specifically two years, and have noticed a perpetual influx of novel individuals, which unfortunately translates to a sluggish service due to their inexperience. Moreover, I find it particularly vexing that they observe a weekly day of rest on Mondays and do not initiate their operations until 10 am, given that this city never sleeps and operates on a 24-hour basis. Consequently, I deem it necessary to seek out an alternative salon that can accommodate my schedule more effectively and efficiently, preferably one that commences its daily operations at the earliest by 9 am.

Butterfly Wonderland patrons, exercise vigilance! Particularly, this unfavorable assessment pertains to the Mirror Maze component of the establishment. As annual members, my significant other and I received an email from Butterfly Wonderland containing the following message: "As a member of Butterfly Wonderland, we extend to you an exclusive preview of Scottsdale's latest must-see attraction. Simply print this email and present it to receive ONE COMPLIMENTARY WALK-THROUGH PASS." This seemingly innocuous offer, however, proved to be, at best, a deceptive ploy and, more accurately, a deliberate falsehood. The staff at Butterfly Wonderland further exacerbated the unpleasantness by callously informing us that the offer was, in fact, a mistake, which they had no intention of honoring, and that it was only valid for a solitary, swift traversal of their laser section. Presented with limited options, we elected to pay $9.95, inclusive of tax, per person, for ourselves and our two young children, aged six and four. The experience, regrettably, did not justify the additional expense. In hindsight, it would have been wiser to await the arrival of a traveling carnival, as the Mirror Maze within its funhouse would undoubtedly provide greater diversion, and the carnival staff would likely display more civility.
Had issues over parking. I went in to discuss them with the owner and found him to be most unfriendly. I will won't be eating here and would encourage others to stay away also.

"Gourmet burgers with exorbitant prices, tantamount to those offered at upscale dining establishments, yet served in an unpretentious ambiance, are available for consumption at this venue; however, the cost of a combo meal surpasses the threshold of what would be considered reasonable, especially considering the quality of service provided by the staff, which borders on apathy and incompetence; furthermore, the expectation of leaving a gratuity for subpar service seems incongruous, particularly when the patron is required to assume the responsibilities customarily reserved for restaurant staff, such as retrieving their own beverages and utensils; therefore, it is recommended that patrons seek alternative dining options, such as Chipotle Mexican Grill, where the quality of the cuisine is consistent and the staff exhibits a greater degree of proficiency and hospitality, thereby ensuring a more satisfying dining experience for the consumer."

This was our second encounter with the emergency room, and it was even more deplorable than the previous instance. Our three-year-old daughter was transported via ambulance to this ER, and the personnel demonstrated a complete lack of proficiency in caring for a child. Despite her stable vital signs and cooperative demeanor, they were unable to obtain an accurate temperature or urine sample without my active participation and recommendations. Furthermore, they employed an adult-sized blood pressure cuff, neglecting to inspect her ears and diagnose the severe infection she was suffering from. The 'STAT/emergency' blood and urine tests were sent outside the facility, requiring two days to yield results, which is utterly unacceptable. To exacerbate matters, the physician, Dr. Kent, displayed discourteous behavior and appeared oblivious to the appropriate course of action. We promptly transported our daughter to a different medical facility as soon as she was able to leave, where she finally received adequate care after enduring hours of neglect and subpar treatment. This experience was nothing short of a fiasco. Previously, a family member was transferred to this ER following an accident, and the situation was equally appalling. Moreover, my mother required surgical intervention, and her physician advised against performing it at Mercy Gilbert due to the incompetence of the staff, despite having privileges at the hospital. This institution may appear modern and well-maintained, but its staff and operational procedures are severely flawed. EXERCISE CAUTION.

While the Wynn boasts an opulent ambiance, its cafe falls short of expectations, particularly with regard to its special hot chocolate, which, at $7, was not only overpriced but also deplorably prepared, necessitating its prompt return and replacement with a tea beverage to eliminate the unpleasant taste from my palate, thereby highlighting the incongruity between the hotel's emphasis on luxury and refinement and its decision to utilize a subpar hot chocolate mix akin to that of Hershey's powdered variety, a choice that may strike some as incongruous given Las Vegas' reputation as a hub for premier chocolatiers such as Ethel M, et al., and thus, Mr. Wynn, it begs the question: why settle for a product reminiscent of wartime rations when the city offers an array of superior alternatives?

I probably would have given moonstruck threeish stars when it was open, but I can't give it any stars any more because it's closed!  That seemed kind of sudden!  I wonder what happened / what is going to go in there instead.  Panera pleeeaaasssseeeee.

My father and I visited this establishment for breakfast, and upon entering, we observed that the premises were largely unoccupied, save for a mere two tables that were already inhabited by patrons.  My father, being a creature of habit, opted for his customary oatmeal, accompanied by two corn muffins. However, our expectations were not entirely met, as the servers, rather than providing milk to complement my father's oatmeal, presented us with minuscule containers of half-and-half, more suited for coffee accompaniment.  I, myself, selected the multigrain pancakes from the menu, but unfortunately, they were undercooked and lacking in texture, leading me to return them to the kitchen. Upon reordering, the pancakes were overcooked and had an unpleasant, dry consistency, similar to that of cardboard. The manager, in response to my dissatisfaction, divulged that the multigrain and wheat pancakes are customarily prepared in such a manner, prompting me to suggest that this detail be incorporated into the menu. Subsequently, I sampled the blueberry pancakes, only to discover that they, too, possessed an unusual flavor, with the blueberries being concentrated in the center of each pancake and displaying a similar dryness and pastiness as their multigrain counterparts. The server, regrettably, proved to be of little assistance, offering responses that conflicted with the manager's statements. Ultimately, it appeared that obtaining straightforward answers regarding the culinary offerings was an arduous task.

This establishment is, without a doubt, the most poorly managed retail outlet within the city limits of Las Vegas! The proprietors and staff members of this store exhibit reprehensible behavior and attitudes, rendering it an absolute horror to patronize. Under no circumstances should you offer them your financial support!!!! 
  During my most recent visit, a male individual parked his vehicle in such a manner that it completely obstructed my designated parking space for disabled individuals. Furthermore, he vociferously berated me upon my exit from the vehicle. When I questioned him regarding his motivations for such boorish behavior, he rapidly fled into the store after realizing that I was not a person he could intimidate. Subsequently, the manager appeared at the entrance and refused to allow me ingress, ejecting me from the premises as though I were the perpetrator of this unacceptable conduct, rather than the victim. It is worth noting that I have been a frequent customer of this store and have spent a considerable amount of money there. However, in light of the fact that the management has chosen to condone bullying and harassment within their parking area, I shall never return. Moreover, I strongly advise exercising extreme caution while visiting this establishment, as the parking lot is not a secure environment. In addition, you may struggle to acquire the provisions necessary to sustain your loved ones if subjected to an attack, considering that the management does not prioritize the well-being of its clientele. I shall seek out an alternative store where I can shop without fearing for my safety and where the management values my encounter instead of allowing bullies to roam freely and mistreat their patrons. This experience has left me feeling utterly disheartened and disappointed, and I shall never set foot in this store again!

"We engaged in a comprehensive assessment of this establishment, commemorating a friend's impending nuptials with a festive gathering. Opting for an early arrival time of approximately 11:00 AM or 11:30 AM, we aimed to avoid the frenzied ambiance associated with peak weekend lunch hours. Unfortunately, our culinary experience was marred by an excruciating delay in service, with an interval of nearly two hours elapsing before our orders were fulfilled. Our server, though well-intentioned, displayed an inadequate level of attentiveness, compelling me to repeatedly vacate my seat in search of assistance with beverages. Previously, we have visited this venue with smaller groups and enjoyed a satisfactory dining experience. However, the present circumstances, characterized by a single server endeavoring to accommodate the needs of 15 patrons, proved insufficient and ultimately led to disappointment."

I really wanted to like this place but the portion sizes was tiny. I had there bento box with Chicken Teriyaki but there was more vegetables then chicken. It should have been called  Vegetables Teriyaki. Too much money for too little food. After dinner I went out to get another meal to satisfy my less than full stomach!

"Progeny of procreative canines. \n\nTriadic culinary requisitions and upon our arrival at the alimentary dissemination portal, we sought to augment our comestible acquisition by means of an additional taco, yet were informed by the juvenile masculine serving as sentinel of the drive-thru aperture that a negative response was forthcoming regarding our petition for an incremental taco, the rationale being that no surplus tacos existed, each consumable item being fabricated expressly for every specific request; verily, we reiterated our desire to procure a solitary taco, whereupon the aforementioned youthful male persisted in his previous assertion, emphasizing that no edible supplement could be added to our preexisting order, and that, should we wish to augment our repast with further comestibles, we would need to vacate the drive-thru and circumnavigate the establishment, reclaiming our place in the queue. No jest, he averred 'no, seriously, you cannot order a taco. It is commerce, you comprehend.' No, I fail to apprehend. Your commercial enterprise consists of vending arterial plaque-inducing sustenance, and you decline to do so? To crown it all, upon my endeavoring to communicate with the manager later, a colleague of the aforementioned juvenile masculine answered the telephone, initially giggling, followed by an eventual faltering articulation of 'uhhh... EHH... HELLO?' and thenceforth, 'Hi. Is this Jack in the Box?' and 'Uhhh. YEAH,' which suggests that JITB might benefit from upgrading their employee instructional manual."

My family has been patronizing the Apache Junction Fry's location for over a decade and have generally been satisfied with their shopping experience until recently. During my most recent visit, I was seeking to acquire bacon and several other items, and upon inspecting the products in the vicinity of the bacon, I noticed that the majority of them had expiration dates that were nearly two months past their prime. In fact, one of the items had an expiration date of May 4th, 2014, which was quite alarming. Upon further examination, I discovered no less than five separate items with expired sell-by dates, totaling over twenty individual products. It appeared that the inventory personnel had not conducted a thorough inspection of the merchandise for at least sixty days. When I brought this issue to the attention of the store manager, he seemed unconcerned and casually stated that he would address the matter with the relevant department. He then proceeded to continue his walk-through of the store with a produce employee, which suggested that he did not consider the issue particularly pressing. This lackadaisical attitude towards product expiration dates has raised concerns about the safety and quality of the food sold at this establishment, and I am now questioning whether the expired lunch meat purchased from this store may have been responsible for my son and I falling ill last week. It is imperative that the management and staff of this store take immediate action to rectify this situation and ensure that all products are properly rotated and checked for freshness to avoid any potential health risks to their customers.

I have procured, on three separate occasions, a half-gallon container of The Sassy Cow Organic 2% milk from a local retail establishment in Chicago. Despite the expiration date being situated well into the future, specifically August 13, the milk has, without fail, become sour and unpalatable by the time I have consumed approximately one-third of its contents. This anomaly has not occurred with any other brand of milk, whether organic or non, that I have purchased from this market or others. Consequently, I am reluctant to invest further financial resources in this product, as it appears to be defective in some manner, either in its production or storage process. In fact, this issue has arisen exclusively with Sassy Cow milk, and I have been compelled to discard the majority of it within a few days, resulting in a significant waste of resources.

I recently had my first and potentially last experience with this establishment, and I felt compelled to express my utter dissatisfaction with my order in the hope that it might contribute to improving the quality of the food served here. I placed an online order, which afforded me the opportunity to specify my preferences, but unfortunately, the end result was a sandwich that was woefully lacking in flavor and left me feeling thoroughly unimpressed. While the delivery service was prompt and efficient, my meal was sadly subpar. My sandwich was primarily composed of lettuce, which overwhelmed the other ingredients, and I received only a single, meager strip of bacon. Additionally, the meat was limited to two minuscule slices of each variety, making it nearly impossible to discern any distinct flavors. Furthermore, the avocado was restricted to a solitary, insignificant dollop located at the bottom of the sandwich. As for the soup, it was largely comprised of cheese sauce, with a paltry few fragments of broccoli scattered throughout. In fact, there were merely five tiny, bite-sized pieces of broccoli present. To rectify this glaring deficiency, I was forced to supplement the soup with fresh broccoli from my own home, which significantly enhanced its flavor. Considering that we placed our order around 8:15 pm and received it just before 9 pm, I cannot help but wonder if the evening crew was responsible for the lackluster quality of the food. Regardless, I would not recommend this establishment to any friend, nor would I personally wish to return and sample their culinary offerings again.

This establishment did not align with my personal preferences and culinary inclinations. Despite partaking in their mexiwrap, zucchini pasta, and Acai bowl offerings, I found myself experiencing gastronomical discomfort subsequent to my visit, which ultimately led to an unfortunate episode of regurgitation. Thus, I have decided against returning to this particular venue in the future.

Coconut mango chicken was a disaster and the ship cocktail did not taste fresh and the grand melon mojito tasted like a jelly rancher in a bad way,  I should have gone with the Cuban sandwich it looked better not that the menu had any pictures of the shitty food . .  . Skip this place

We arrived at this establishment for the purpose of commemorating my annual day of birth, which was meticulously arranged by an acquaintance of mine. Unfortunately, my expectations were not fulfilled, as the experience left much to be desired. Firstly, we did not have the opportunity to sample any culinary delights, but the customer service, or lack thereof, was subpar. The prices charged for beverages were exorbitant, considering the quality and quantity provided. The staff exhibited a range of behavior, from indifference to outright discourtesy. It is worth mentioning that a sizable contingent of approximately twenty individuals had gathered to celebrate my special day, yet the personnel should have been capable of handling such a modest crowd with ease. Alarmingly, certain members of our group were overcharged, and the staff displayed a lack of contrition or willingness to rectify these errors, even after acknowledging them.

The ambiance within the premises was questionable, lacking the charm of a quaint, unpretentious tavern. The layout was ill-conceived, and the minuscule outdoor area, described as a patio, was woefully inadequate for the capacity of the bar. The moniker "Dirty Drummer" proved to be an apt description, as the establishment's cleanliness left much to be desired. Suffice it to say, I shall not return to this venue in the future.

On Easter weekend, we called Animal Inn regarding their rates.  They informed about their price but failed to tell us about an additional rate being that it's Easter.  They did however, remember to tell us that they close early on Easter Day.

We brought our Tibetan Spaniel there and she absolutely did not want to go in.  The workers are not friendly and/or accomodating at all.  Terrible service all the way around.  We asked them why they couldn't tell us that there were extra fees over the phone when we called and they just said "well that's how it is".   We would be happy to pay the extra money, but not when they intentionally fail to tell us to accomodate their business.  

Upon picking our dog up, no one greeted me as I entered the door, so I stood there waiting as they were all staring at me, until someone had the descency to acknowledge a customer.  They were rude, very unfriendly, and did not seem to care about the animals.  

Our dog seemed a little traumatized after we brought her home to bathe and feed her.  

I DO NOT recommend this place to anyone!

"Utter disgust permeated my being upon beholding the putative poultry dish, as its appearance and flavor profile failed to resemble any conventional notion of avian cuisine, while the cost for such a meager serving was utterly preposterous and egregiously disproportionate to the paltry quantity offered; an unmitigated travesty, indeed!"

"From the instant we entered the premises until the time of our departure, the customer service we received was utterly subpar. Our reserved accommodations were not provided, the guest rooms were not adequately furnished (absence of conditioner, refrigerator, and poor cooling), and the businesses we interacted with on-site displayed sluggish service or an absolute lack of concern. Furthermore, we made numerous attempts to establish communication with the manager, leaving messages with the assistant, but unfortunately, we did not receive any response, which suggests a blatant disregard for customer satisfaction. We visit Las Vegas for a comprehensive experience encompassing entertainment and leisure activities beyond gambling and partying, and this particular establishment does not merit a future visit from us."

"Although the retail establishment provided an exceptional shopping experience, the culinary offerings and hospitality of the adjacent eatery fell short of expectations, with both the quality of the food and the proficiency of the servers being subpar; furthermore, personal hygiene was compromised by the presence of human follicles in both my beverage and morning meal."

"The exterior temperature has reached an unprecedented elevation of 106 degrees Fahrenheit, meanwhile, the interior atmosphere of this culinary establishment remains stiflingly oppressive at a sweltering 90 plus degrees; upon inquiring about the functionality of the air conditioning system, the response was evasive and lackadaisical, with the assertion that said mechanism was indeed operational, albeit in a manner that could be described as anything but effective."

"Appalling service was what I received when I placed an order for $145 worth of pastries and was subsequently overcharged for a sansrival that I had not requested. Following my attempt to contact them and rectify this issue by having the unwarranted charge removed, the supervisor with whom I spoke asserted that a refund would not be feasible, thus exemplifying the most abysmal level of customer service I have ever encountered."

Just to clarify something for our American guests who come to visit. As another review states that this restaurant is a better version of the cheesecake factory clearly has zero knowledge about food whatsoever. I drive 4 hours to get to the closest cheesecake factory form Montreal but you couldn't pay me to eat at l'academie. I have been cooking for 10 years and work with my brother who is an executive chef with over 25 years experience and this place should be illegal for how bad everything was. Most other reviews speak for themselves. If I can give negative stars I would. Big rip off \n\nJust left this resto and will never go back. The decor is nice but the food is terrible. Everything is pre made and nothing is done on the spot. The service was ok but I couldn't blame the waiter as he had a big section all to himself. I work in the kitchen and on the floor so take my word for it, if your looking for good Italian food and a Byob check out La Strada in Lachine where I work and is owned by my family or Vivaldi in the west island. Don't waste time at this place. I do not recommend it.

I called this morning because my USB hard drive is not being recognize by my computer. I asked what it would cost to repair it. I was told to come down and they'd take a look at it. I took the morning off of work and drove 45 mins to their shop on Camelback Rd. I showed up and they didn't even look at it. They said it would cost $200 for the inspection and up to $999 to repair it and they would have to send it to another place that has skilled people and the tools to repair something . 

They could have told me that over the phone and I would have not taken the morning off and drove all the way out there. I was definitely misled today and it cost me time and money. Their name is deceptive also because they cannot repair or recover data. They send it to someone who can. They should be called Data Mailers, or Data Parcel Services. A**holes

I found this program called Get Data Back, it costs $80, but I was able to recover all of the files I wanted from the USB drive. That sure beats $1199 these scoundrels wanted to charge me.

"I thoroughly detest this aerodrome, companion! From the stringent security protocols to the unaccommodating gate attendants, the inhospitable bus drivers, and the exorbitant parking fees, this airport epitomizes the antithesis of conviviality. As a seasoned traveler who has resided in numerous urban locales, I must confess that this particular transportation hub is among the most unfriendly and inadequate that I have had the misfortune of encountering. My ire towards it is so profound that I would seriously contemplate traversing to LAX, a considerable distance, merely to avoid the utter futility that this pitiful excuse for an airport embodies. At present, I find myself ensnared within its confines, courtesy of an ill-fated code share arrangement between United and Lufthansa. Perchance, Lufthansa, you might elucidate the rationale behind your collaboration with this reprehensible carrier? In light of the aforementioned circumstances, the possibility of venturing to Tucson becomes an increasingly appealing alternative, for I shall steadfastly refuse to return to this wretched edifice. Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, I bid thee adieu!"

The grilled steak burrito that was peremptorily procured through the medium of a delivery service, specifically Eats24, arrived sans the fundamental component of steak, which was ostensibly present according to the culinary establishment's response to the delivery service's inquiry, thereby implying that the patron consuming the dish was in error; however, the quality of the edible items encased within the tortilla was, at best, merely average, thus precluding any possibility of enthusiastic endorsement or recommendation to others.

Firstly, I have chosen to annul my reservation with them due to sheer exasperation stemming from their duplicitous nature, which has led me to question the veracity of their so-called "Best Rate Guarantee" claim. Following my reservation made via their website, I was meticulous in adhering to the stipulated protocols to ensure that the price difference between their platform and a competitor's was at least 20% in their favor. However, upon presenting the required documentation, I was taken aback by their dismissive response, citing the timestamp located at the foot of the webpage as an invalid form of proof since it purportedly indicates the time of printing rather than the period during which the offer was valid on the rival website. This reasoning strikes me as utterly specious and begs the question: how else might one demonstrate a timestamp other than by printing the deal directly from the website? Moreover, how can a deal be printed from a website without it being concurrently active? The entire encounter has left a sour taste in my mouth, qualifying as the most unpleasant customer experience I have had the misfortune of enduring.

This lodging facility is utterly deplorable, and the sole factor contributing to its paltry rating of one star is its relatively convenient proximity to the historic district and the somewhat hospitable demeanor of its staff. Were it not for these few redeeming aspects, this establishment would undoubtedly warrant a negative assessment. Consequently, it is strongly advised that patrons opt for alternative accommodations, such as those offered by the Marriott or Hilton, where they can expect a significantly more satisfactory experience, thereby rendering gratitude toward this recommendation inevitable.

"I experienced a plethora of deplorable and unprofessional behaviors at the hands of Jay, a manager at this establishment, including but not limited to harassment, belittlement, embarrassment, physical manhandling, and inappropriate touching, which culminated in an attempt to intimidate and silence me through a threatening display of physical force; when I sought to address these grievances with his supervisor, Jay's response was to apply unwanted and excessive physical contact, specifically rubbing my back while boasting about his supposedly elevated position within the company's hierarchy, which afforded him the privilege of acting with impunity; needless to say, I have never been subjected to such egregious mistreatment, and I am adamant that this incident warrants not only Jay's termination but also criminal charges."

We had the privilege of partaking in one of the morning worship services as guests at said institution in approximately 2003. Our customary church experiences typically entail megachurches replete with fervent praise and worship, as well as spiritually edifying and pragmatic sermons that extensively cite and elucidate numerous biblical passages, often interspersed with lighthearted moments. Conversely, our experience at this particular establishment was diametrically opposed to our accustomed ecclesiastical environments, characterized by an atmosphere devoid of any discernible spiritual vitality or animation. Indeed, it was as though we were attending a somber funereal ceremony rather than a celebration of faith, evoking in us an unwavering desire to expediently depart not just the sanctuary, but also the surrounding premises. Despite the ostensibly cordial demeanor displayed by the welcoming party, an indeterminable sense of duplicity permeated their smiles, casting doubt on the authenticity of their warmth.

I indulged in an online bidding process via Priceline and managed to procure a hotel room at an extremely discounted rate, which filled me with excitement due to its affordability.  However, allow me to enlighten you all by sharing my underwhelming experience at the Luxor Hotel; the room I acquired was a standard, unremarkable one, devoid of any extraordinary features or amenities.  Furthermore, I noticed that the ironing board lacked a protective covering, consisting merely of a flimsy pad on top, giving off a rather shabby impression.  Upon awakening the following morning, I was taken aback by the sight of dried bloodstains on the bed sheets, which led me to question the cleanliness of the linens.  Although I didn't have any cuts or injuries on my person, the presence of foreign blood on the bedding raised concerns about the hotel's hygiene standards and the effectiveness of their cleaning protocols.  The breakfast buffet was equally underwhelming, offering a mediocre selection of food with subpar quality.  Considering these factors, I would strongly advise against choosing the Luxor Hotel as your accommodation and vow never to return.

While they were accommodating to me walking in, i hated that they did not let you pick and choose the dresses you want to try on.  While other boutiques have sales associates that are more skilled at picking out dresses that might fit your personality, these associates had no clue and would not listen to what I liked and didn't like.  \nI had a very nice red head girl as my sales associate.  She tried really hard to help me and find a dress I would like.  But there was another associate with brown hair, who seemed to be a manager of some sort, who kept interrupting our session.  She was super frazzled and had a very fake, high pressure sales personality. I told them I did not like I did not like beading and every dress she picked with beading.  The same goes with satin.  She kept grabbing dresses out of the window or from some sale rack and trying to sell me discontinued gowns with beading all over them.  It drove me crazy!  I had to pretend I liked the gowns because I felt I would get an attitude from her if I said I didn't like them.

"The location of this establishment is remarkably inopportune, resembling a subterranean setting, thereby creating an unpleasant ambiance for patrons. Furthermore, the minimum requisite for spectating sporting events while seated is a substantial monetary investment of no less than $50 per individual, every day, throughout the entire day. Additionally, my personal encounter with the cashiers was marked by unpleasantness and discourteous behavior on their part. Overall, this sportsbook ranks among the most unsatisfactory ones I have had the misfortune of visiting in Las Vegas."

"Initially, allow me to commend the service technician for an exceptional job in cleaning our windows. However, a pressing concern arises from the drastic discrepancy between the quotation provided over the phone and the actual fee demanded by the technician upon completion of the task. Specifically, the latter figure was twice the former, prompting concerns of a potential bait-and-switch tactic. It appears that the individual responsible for providing the quote failed to adequately convey the window-counting methodology, leading to a lack of comprehension by the technician regarding the agreed-upon price. Furthermore, the technician did not take the initiative to seek clarification on the pricing disparity until after completing the work. Considering the substantial difference between the original quote and the final cost, coupled with the absence of transparent pricing practices, I would refrain from recommending their services unless they address and reform their pricing protocols."

Do not opt for this establishment when accompanied by juvenile offspring!  Exorbitant prices, subpar culinary offerings, cramped accommodations, unsatisfactory clientele assistance, and an absence of amenities conducive to pushchairs are hallmarks of this venue.  You will be compelled to endure a tedious cinematic experience lasting a quarter of an hour, which will undoubtedly prove arduous when accompanied by fidgety toddlers.  The fare served is not only exorbitantly priced but also of questionable quality.  Patrons have been known to return spoiled produce in plain sight, while the cashiers remain impervious to their plight, refusing to offer any form of compensation or replacement.  The staff members themselves appear to be afflicted with a surly demeanor, as they vociferously admonish patrons for minor infractions, such as a child's natural curiosity regarding a butterfly, resulting in an uproar that culminates in their sudden appearance, sans any semblance of assistance or empathy.
