I placed my confidence in this malefactor, entrusting him with a valuable and sentimentally significant weighted 88 key MIDI controller, anticipating a straightforward repair involving the replacement of an internal battery; however, after numerous futile attempts at communication, spanning over three months, characterized by a diverse array of frivolous excuses proffered during each telephonic interaction, I reluctantly resigned myself to the likelihood that this individual was perpetrating a fraudulent scheme, whereby he would persuade unsuspecting victims to relinquish their prized possessions, only to subsequently peddle them for personal gain.

"My sentiments regarding Macaroni Grill are, for the most part, overwhelmingly positive; however, my recent dining experiences at this establishment have been marred by subpar service. Specifically, during my previous visit, my wife and I encountered an inattentive waitress who repeatedly neglected our needs, resulting in a thoroughly unpleasant meal. Despite my innate propensity for forgiveness, we opted to give the restaurant another chance, only to be met with a similar lack of dedication to customer satisfaction. This time, the server failed to provide adequate attention to our table, even though the dining area was nearly deserted. Such an egregious display of indifference prompted me to solicit the assistance of a passing waiter merely to obtain the bill and expedite our departure. It is my contention that exceptional clientele service is a sine qua non for any successful eatery, and Macaroni Grill has, unfortunately, fallen short in this regard."

"Proceeded to visit the establishment in close proximity to Cave Creek, whereupon I opted to consume the bacon chicken fajitas, only to unfortunately experience an adverse reaction, specifically food poisoning, a perilous situation indeed; thus, I must caution others to exercise vigilance when partaking of culinary delights at this particular venue, and, consequently, I shall be taking a temporary hiatus from frequenting this establishment."

Always cherished this establishment, however, during my most recent visit, I was unable to indulge in the luxury of having my nails painted due to time constraints associated with my occupational responsibilities. Despite my repeated attempts to return for the aforementioned purpose on subsequent occasions, the salon appeared to be perpetually beset by an overwhelming influx of clientele, thereby precluding me from receiving the desired service. Thus, I opted to procure a novel set of nails today, harboring the expectation that the business might offer some form of monetary compensation for the omission of the previously mentioned service. Unfortunately, such was not the case, and I was compelled to leave without receiving the anticipated adjustment. Furthermore, I have been a faithful patron of this establishment since its inception and have consistently demonstrated my appreciation through generous gratuities ranging between 20 to 30%. The absence of consideration exhibited towards regular clients such as myself is truly disconcerting and reflects unfavorably upon the overall quality of customer service provided by Vy's. Consequently, I shall refrain from patronizing this establishment in the future, and I shall endeavor to dissuade my acquaintances and loved ones from doing so as well.

"I decided to indulge in a culinary excursion to this sushi establishment, situated in close proximity to my domicile in Summerlin, by opting for a takeout order. Alas, my expectations were not met, as the sushi dishes did not exhibit an aesthetically pleasing appearance, with the rolls being haphazardly assembled. Furthermore, one of the rolls I had selected, specifically the salmon variety, was not only cooked but also lacked the freshness I had anticipated, thus leading to a disappointing gustatory experience."

"An excessive amount of sodium chloride was present on all menu items, which, although I am a proponent of this essential mineral, rendered the culinary experience unpleasant due to its overwhelming presence. Specifically, the vegetable fries, which I had eagerly anticipated consuming, were nearly inedible because of their extreme salinity, which overpowered any other potential flavors they may have possessed. Furthermore, the poultry dish was problematic, as it was abundant in adipose tissue and lacking in any discernible taste aside from the previously mentioned, ubiquitous layer of salt. Notwithstanding my friend's enthusiastic endorsement of the establishment's hamburgers, I would not consider dining at this venue again, even if the meal were gratis. In fact, I found the entire experience to be quite nauseating."

This ostensibly conservative periodical, characterized by its propagation of patently partisan perspectives, rivals the pseudojournalistic proclivities of Faux News, while its financial sustainability is contingent upon the pecuniary contributions of a solitary benefactor, Mr. Scaife, who annually subsidizes the publication to the tune of ten million dollars. Notwithstanding its questionable journalistic integrity, this newspaper purports to be the authoritative source of information in Pittsburgh, superseding the legitimacy of the Post-Gazette, widely recognized as the city's preeminent newspaper.

"We, the missus, infant and I, opted to partake in a midday repast at this establishment on the preceding Sunday, owing to my associates' persistent acclaim for its culinary offerings. Upon gaining ingress into the eatery, we observed that approximately three-quarters of the capacity was already occupied. Within the space we entered, a mere duo of servers attended to the multitude, while the barkeep to our right remained oblivious to our presence, leaving us ignored for a span of five minutes. The ambiance was rendered awkward by the dearth of attendants, prompting us to conjecture that an extensive delay would ensue, given the understaffed state of the premises. Our initial impression was, regrettably, one of disappointment. Perhaps we shall endeavor to revisit during the forthcoming spring season, in hopes of encountering improved staffing arrangements."

"My affection towards Best Buy is unwavering; however, my experience at this particular store was utterly disappointing. The staff demonstrated a lack of cordiality, proficiency, and attentiveness, leading me to seek alternative options. Subsequently, I visited Sam's Club to acquire a new television, and although I intend to return to Best Buy in the future, I will not hesitate to depart empty-handed if I am met with similar treatment. It is unfortunate that the company has failed to recognize the significance of quality customer service, as studies have consistently shown that consumers are willing to pay a premium and travel farther distances for a more satisfying shopping experience. I implore Best Buy to reassess their approach and prioritize employee training to avoid losing loyal customers like myself."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
That's how one could summarize their time at this particular gaming establishment, which failed to live up to the standards of its renowned counterparts, such as Hard Rock Hollywood or Fort Lauderdale. Upon entering, it became apparent that the ambiance was lacking in comparison to other casinos, with an atmosphere that felt more akin to a long, narrow corridor rather than a spacious, open gaming area. Furthermore, the slot machines proved unaccommodating, yielding no victories for this writer, nor, it seemed, for anyone else within the vicinity. In conclusion, an unremarkable visit, save for the disappointment elicited by the absence of a truly satisfying gaming adventure.

Purchased a six inch with combo at this subway and I was charged $8.50. The soda and the drink was half the price of my sandwich? When I went to a different subway for the same meal I was charged $6.30. Won't be going back to this subway.

Only 2 things bring me to McDonald's, the coffee and.cheap desert. I do give credit for McDonald's on how they operate like a machine. They get you in and out, but unfortunately not this one. 10 minutes for a cup of coffee? Only 4 tables in the place and every single table got up to complain about their food quality, missing food etc. Where's management? Obviously they didnt graduates from hamburger u.

"Refrain from expending your valuable time patronizing this establishment, as it offers subpar culinary experiences at exorbitant prices. Despite the passable service, the overall assessment indicates that it is unwise to opt for an overpriced fast food meal at this venue. Instead, consider dining at Addiction, where the cost-to-quality ratio is more favorable."
Dilapidated, overpriced, loud, dowdy, cheap, spring break crowd, wait in line for EVERYTHING, $4 for a little bottle of Dasani, service is indignant...I mean, why go here?

The query regarding the feasibility of bestowing a rating inferior to one star arouses curiosity, prompting an investigation into the intricacies of the culinary establishment in question. Specifically, it appears that patrons of Asian descent familiar with Taiwanese or Chinese gastronomy may find the venue unsuitable for their refined tastes. Allegedly, the quality of service leaves much to be desired, with the proprietor exhibiting a discourteous demeanor. Furthermore, discrepancies in the timely delivery of dishes have been reported, with primary courses arriving before appetizers, resulting in an incongruous dining experience. Additionally, beverages offered fail to impress, and the beef noodle soup, in particular, is described as subpar. In light of these shortcomings, potential customers are advised to exercise caution when considering a visit to this establishment.

"Amble into an eatery during a peak hour when the staff-to-patron ratio is disproportionate, and observe how the lone server exerts himself to accommodate the multitude of clientele, albeit receiving quizzical glances from patrons at the conclusion of his valiant efforts. 

Querying my opinion on Mr. Tofu's culinary offerings, I must aver that they fall short of my expectations. Opting for their signature tofu soup and supplementing it with an additional $7 for short ribs, I was disappointed by the lackluster taste, overcooking, and questionable quality of the meat. 

Furthermore, my experience with their bulgogi dish only serves to reinforce my belief that SOYO remains the superior choice for Korean cuisine enthusiasts. Thus, I avow never to return to Mr. Tofu and instead, solely indulge in SOYO's offerings for my future Korean food cravings. A single visit suffices, Mr. Tofu; your establishment does not align with my gastronomic preferences."

I had the misfortune of receiving an unfortunate hairstyle that left me utterly displeased, and I am unlikely to return to the establishment responsible for this unsettling experience; despite my lack of fastidiousness regarding my coiffure, I explicitly requested that my stylist refrain from removing an excessive amount of hair, yet she disregarded my wishes and proceeded to slice off nearly five inches, which I deem utterly unacceptable.

"This establishment is utterly inadequate and subpar in terms of its customer service and overall experience. Specifically, the cashiers at this location exhibit a flagrant disregard for customer satisfaction, as evidenced by their dismissive and unhelpful demeanor. My request for a carne asada burrito with red sauce on top, which I colloquially referred to as a 'wet burrito,' was met with an unequivocal refusal, with the cashier expressing a blatant lack of interest in fulfilling my order. This response not only exemplified an unacceptable level of rudeness but also raised questions regarding the company's policy on accommodating customer preferences. Furthermore, when I inquired about the absence of a manager to address my concerns, I was met with an incredulous response that the establishment did not possess such a position. In light of these events, I am left with no choice but to boycott this business and seek alternative dining options that prioritize customer satisfaction."

"If gastronomical satisfaction is your sole criterion, this establishment may prove satisfactory. However, my previous visit was marred by an unfortunate incident that has left a lingering negative impression. My companion and I placed individual orders, with mine being a kimchi stew that arrived promptly within 15 minutes. Unfortunately, my companion's bulgogi dish did not follow suit, and we were compelled to wait an additional 15 minutes beyond the time it took for my meal to be prepared. Upon inquiring about the delay, I was taken aback by the server's response, which seemed to imply that we had not, in fact, placed the order correctly. This allegation struck me as patently false, as I distinctly recalled verbally confirming the order with my companion. Moreover, the server's deficient communication skills and lack of accountability only served to exacerbate the situation. Suffice it to say that our experience was tarnished by an absence of culinary synchronization and an unhelpful attitude on the part of the staff."

I possess a fallacious citation to patronize Best Buy once more, subsequent to a previous purchase of a portable computer device from their establishment in December, which ceased functioning appropriately following an software update, prompting me to engage in an extensive telephonic conversation with the manufacturer, who conveyed that Best Buy would be responsible for addressing the issue, only to be met with utter indifference and disinterest by the retailer's representatives when I presented the malfunctioning device for their perusal, despite my efforts to ensure its preservation by retaining the original packaging and accessories.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in culinary indulgences at Max's in Glendale, California on multiple occasions, thus, the news of a Las Vegas establishment elicited immense excitement within me. My anticipation was centered around savoring Max's delectable Beef Caldereta, complemented by a serving of garlic rice. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met, as this particular location did not offer such a delicacy. Instead, they provided a limited selection of basic dishes.

My gastronomical adventure commenced with Chicken Sigsig, which failed to impress my taste buds. The dish's flavor profile was subpar, resembling a mixture of mayonnaise, stale chicken, and jalapeÃ±o slices. For a more satisfying Sigsig experience, I would recommend visiting Cafe Moda.

The whole chicken entrÃ©e was cooked to perfection, boasting tenderness and juiciness. The crispy chicken skin was an enjoyable texture contrast. However, I remained perplexed by the supposed uniqueness of the chicken's flavor, as it seemed to be lacking in depth.

Garlic rice, a staple accompaniment, was prepared satisfactorily.

My culinary exploration concluded with the Halo-Halo, a refreshing delight that ranked among the best in Las Vegas. Kudos to the hospitable waitstaff for their cordial and friendly service.

Notably, it is advisable to request bottled water instead of tap water, which is unfiltered and hard.

In summary, the cuisine underwhelmed due to its lack of authentic flavors, while the menu prices were considered steep. A revision of the menu, focusing on genuine offerings and reasonable pricing, would be beneficial for Max's Las Vegas branch. Nonetheless, I shall return for the Halo-Halo. My recommendation for this Max's is to adjust their prices accordingly, considering the quality of the food and the fact that they are still establishing themselves in the area.

"The most accommodating Starbucks, alas, management necessitates devoting additional time interacting with staff members. Upon ordering, my name was incorrectly rendered despite meticulously enunciating (MARTIN, admittedly, does not pose a significant challenge in terms of orthography), followed by a request for an assortment of sweet baked goods; however, only a solitary item was proffered. Furthermore, it appears that a caramel macchiato at this establishment does not contain caramel, much to my dismay. Notwithstanding, I did receive a radiant smile from one of the comely young women employed therein, thereby warranting the lone star appended to this review."

Awful. The service was so-so at best and I believe our server was the owner. She seemed sour and not super friendly. I ordered the corned beef hash and it CLEARLY came straight from a can. It was like mushy, shredded washcloth. The appearance was so terrible I didn't even eat it. Obviously this place has little respect for food. Our toast was cold and the toast was really the only redeeming thing about the place. I took my leftovers because I felt bad for whoever runs the place that it's just that terrible, but I tossed them in the trash on the way home. There's totally a \"we're headed down the tubes\" type vibe. I will never go back. Definitely go down the street to Bagel Cafe and get their corned beef hash. FAR superior.

"According to the information gathered on November 3rd, 2013, it appears that the establishment has been shut down by judicial decree, as evidenced by the presence of a 'for lease' sign displayed prominently within the premises, suggesting that the property is currently available for rent or lease."

"My experiences at this establishment have been far from satisfactory, with the first encounter being particularly unpleasant. The nail technician applied an excessive amount of acrylic, rendering my fingers unusable; I was forced to seek assistance from a different salon to rectify the issue. Despite this disappointment, I opted to give the salon a second chance, this time for an eyebrow waxing service. While the experience itself was tolerable, the aftermath proved to be problematic, as my skin exhibited pronounced irritation in the form of red bumps surrounding my brows. It appears that the technician utilized less-than-fresh wax, leading to undesirable consequences. Based on my experiences, I would not feel comfortable recommending this salon to others."

"Prioritize satiation before departure, if you will, and bear in mind that scanty servings, despite their cost, may leave your clan famished still, and furthermore, an obligatory gratuity of 18%, as per government regulation, shall be tacked on for gatherings numbering four or more individuals, rendering this establishment's fare an unfortunate confluence of parsimony and extortion."

If I were afforded the opportunity to rate this establishment with a negative rating, I undoubtedly would have exercised such an option. Upon entering the premises, it became apparent that the hostess's primary focus was centered upon the menial task of sanitizing the menus and arranging napkins, rather than extending a warm welcome to patrons. Furthermore, when requested, the hostess was unable to provide a children's menu, citing its unavailability, and opted to search for it at a later time, which never transpired. Not only did the hostess fail to fulfill her duties, but also indulged in inappropriate behavior, bordering on familiarity, with acquaintances who entered the establishment. Subsequently, I inquired about the status of the children's menu, to which the server responded that she was actively seeking it. Regrettably, the culinary offerings failed to meet expectations, as the onion rings and Irish nachos arrived lacking the essential quality of being served hot. Specifically, the fries accompanying the onion rings were cold and stale, while the main dishes left much to be desired. My better half's corned beef and cabbage dish featured spoiled cabbage, rendering it unpalatable. Similarly, my shepherd's pie arrived tepid and lacking flavor. Lastly, my mother's well-done cheeseburger was served cold. Despite utilizing a Groupon, which I had hoped would enhance our dining experience, the hostess, waitstaff, and cuisine fell short of expectations, resulting in an unsatisfactory visit, compounded by the fact that I was obligated to expend twenty-five dollars for an inferior meal.

I originate from the eastern sector of the city where an abundance of miniature taco kiosks were ubiquitous on every corner. Thus, relocating to this region, I was disheartened to discover that there lacked a taco establishment that vociferously proclaimed, "Hey! Attempt these roadside tacos!" Consequently, upon learning of the impending launch of this taco tavern, I was elated, presuming it would satiate my yearning for a quintessential taco spot. Alas, following my inaugural visit, I was let down by the cost, flavor, and erroneous order. Initially, the prices were exorbitant! I spent thirty dollars on two burritos and four tacos accompanied by two beverages. Typically, I expend approximately twenty-two dollars, and that includes several additional tacos and drinks. Secondly, the culinary offerings failed to embody the authentic essence of traditional Mexican street tacos, while the burritos appeared unremarkable, almost home-made. Furthermore, the beans possessed a strikingly similar flavor to those found in canned goods, which was unimpressive. I had expressly requested rice accompany my burrito, yet it was conspicuously absent. A superior Mexican eatery would thoughtfully include both rice and beans within their burritos, particularly for a price exceeding seven dollars. Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed... Now, I am compelled to traverse back to the eastern side to indulge in delectable tacos.

PLEASE READ FOR YOUR SAFETY:
Stayed for one night. Checked in and had to change rooms at midnight after discovering a used drug needle in the bathroom.
Spoke to the front desk manager who rudely said, nothing he could do about it.
No discount, apology, nothing.
If you don't mind taking your life in their hands!
Just want to warn others of the unsafe conditions!!!!!!

This establishment appears to be in a state of disarray, with employees who seem to be preoccupied with engaging in personal conversations and consuming sustenance rather than attending to the needs of patrons. Furthermore, there appears to be only one functional dressing room available for patron usage, while the second is seemingly occupied by miscellaneous items. As an individual with a penchant for hygiene and effective customer service, I would not personally frequent this location; however, those who possess a fondness for animals may find it suitable.

"Our visit to this establishment was motivated by the prospect of indulging in their renowned Nachos, which had been highly recommended by numerous patrons and had piqued the interest of my associates. Unfortunately, our expectations were not met, as the dish failed to live up to its promised culinary excellence. We opted for the four-cheese Nacho platter, which we requested be augmented with black beans, an additional expense that we felt was warranted given the menu item's description. Upon their arrival, the Nachos were found to possess a meager amount of pico de gallo and a token sprinkling of black beans, which seemed incongruous with the dish's advertised composition. Our server, however, demonstrated commendable attentiveness by recognizing the inadequacy of the black beans and proffering a supplementary bowl of them, thereby salvaging the situation from a service standpoint. Regrettably, the quality of the Nachos themselves left much to be desired. One of the four cheeses exhibited a flavor profile akin to Velveeta, which, in conjunction with the scantiness of the other toppings, rendered the dish unsatisfactory. In light of the price point, we considered it appropriate to expect a more substantial snack, one that would incorporate elements such as jalapenos, onions, pico de gallo, salsa, and beans in greater abundance. Furthermore, certain areas within the restaurant bore an unpleasant odor, potentially indicative of subpar sewage management."

"The experience at Service A+ was somewhat dichotomous, as the staff's hospitable demeanor and attentive nature was juxtaposed with the exorbitant pricing and subpar quality of the culinary offerings, thereby eliciting a solitary star rating from this patron, despite the divergent nature of the service and fare."

"My inclination to indulge in fast food during happy hour has been a recurring phenomenon, and I have never encountered any difficulties in paying the designated prices for takeout. However, my recent visit to America's Taco Shop on 16th and Camelback proved to be an exception to this trend. Specifically, I was taken aback by the exorbitant cost of two carne asada tacos and a single order of chips and salsa, which amounted to a staggering $8.09. As a new resident of the city, hailing from another state, I found this price point to be particularly egregious, especially when juxtaposed with the more reasonable cost of a burrito. Compelled by fiscal prudence, I opted to modify my order forthwith. Unfortunately, the gentleman tasked with processing my order displayed a conspicuous lack of enthusiasm, bordering on acrimony, upon having to cancel my initial order. His demeanor was utterly unprofessional and conveyed a glaring dearth of concern for customer satisfaction. Given the dearth of patrons within the establishment at the time, his behavior was all the more perplexing. I felt compelled to vacate the premises with alacrity, never having experienced such discomfort within a fast food setting. Moreover, the prospect of consuming their culinary offerings became decidedly less appealing in light of the unsavory encounter. Following a perusal of Yelp reviews, I was gratified to discover that my decision to seek alternative dining options was indeed wise. Furthermore, the male employee stationed at the cash register saw fit to bid me farewell with a patronizing tone, addressing me as 'Annie' in a manner that reeked of condescension. Suffice it to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment, and I would advise others to maintain a safe distance."

My encounter at this establishment was utterly unpleasant, as the liquid medium utilized for my foot treatment was not merely tepid, but indeed frigid, and the substance applied to shape and maintain my supercilia was insufficient, failing to fulfill its intended purpose. Furthermore, I was taken aback by their policy of solely accepting gratuities in paper currency, which struck me as rather anomalous. Consequently, I shall not be revisiting this salon, and instead, I implore those acquainted with exceptional nail care services to divulge their knowledge, that I may benefit from their proficiency.

It appears that the management pays little attention to their Yelp account, as evidenced by the fact that no action has been taken to address the subpar service provided by their staff. During a recent telephone conversation, Jezabelâor whatever her name may beâdisplayed an air of impatience and curtness in her responses to my queries, answering with simple "yea"s and "okay"s before abruptly terminating the call without even bothering to ask for my name or bid me farewell. On another occasion, I witnessed two employees in the kitchen engaging in a leisurely conversation while I stood waiting at the front counter, seemingly unnoticed by them despite my urgency. Subsequently, the smoothie I received was devoid of flavor, lacking even the slightest hint of fruit. Disappointingly, this experience was not unique, as others who patronized the establishment reported receiving similarly unpalatable smoothies. While I have heretofore frequented this location out of convenience, my patience has been exhausted, and I shall never return to this woeful excuse for a business. Furthermore, I lament that Yelp does not offer the option to leave zero stars in reviews, as it would better reflect my dissatisfaction with this establishment.

The wife and I joined another couple on a Hoover Dam Tour.  Part of the tour package was lunch at the Miracle Mile Shops upon our return, along with a voucher with Whittlesea Cab to get us from the mall back to our hotel.  Sounds like a winner, right?

Alas, not to be.  At the end of a VERY long day, I called the number on the voucher, and got the dispatcher.  This incredibly arrogant and rude woman proceeded to tell me that Whittlesea does NOT send out cabs to pick up customers with vouchers.  I'd have to wait at the mall until a Whittlesea Cab showed up by dropping off other customers.  BUT...if I wanted to pay, she'd be glad to send one out for us.  Given that we were seeing one cab (of ALL the cab companies) show up every five minutes, we all decided to just jump in the next cab.

Based on this dispatcher, you could not PAY me to ever utilize Whittlesea Blue Cab.  I'm in Vegas for business six to eight weeks every year, and NONE of the cabs I jump into will say Whittlesea on the side, I assure you.

Stay away.  Stay far away.

I placed an order for pizza for pickup, upon arriving home, I discovered an unsolicited ingredient in my culinary creation, specifically, human hair. Following this revelation, I contacted the establishment to request a remake and delivery of the product to my domicile. I deemed this request reasonable, given the fact that the error was not on my part. However, my query was met with hostility and dismissal, as I was informed that such an accommodation was beyond their capabilities. Furthermore, upon requesting a conversation with the manager, I was told that no such individual existed within the organization, despite my previous observation of a male donning a distinctive solid red polo shirt, differentiating him from other staff members. It appears that the enterprise could benefit from refining their client service protocols.

The unsatisfactory experience I had at this establishment was characterized by a multitude of issues, including the repetition of my order thrice, which ultimately resulted in an erroneous fulfillment thereof, an excessive volume of music that ostensibly impeded the server's ability to perceive my articulations, an incorrect amount of change tendered, even subsequent to my bringing it to their attention, and a dearth of options in terms of sandwich toppings, specifically the absence of pastrami, Swiss cheese, cheddar, and other varieties, leading me to ponder the rationality behind patronizing such an eatery.

the food is really great good drinks  but terrible atmosphere the music so loud the waiters cant even hear you i work in clubs and their music is alot overpowering than anywhere ive been not good i understand the loungy feeling they want to put out but not to the point its uncomfortable i had their foie gras french toast which was amazing and i think i tried mac and cheese too i ended up leaving and sitting outside and had my meal packed to go i couldnt take the music and i got a migraine. they could do better. the food is amazing but i would never come here again for the sole purpose of the environment. we did ask the waiter if they could lower it a tad bit but if they did it was highly unnoticeable

I was afforded the opportunity to engage with a member of the academic staff who demonstrated a flagrant disregard for the well-being and success of their students, which was particularly evident during a one-on-one consultation; despite having received numerous accolades for their work, their behavior was incongruent with the expectations associated with such recognition, leading me to express gratitude for having completed my academic tenure at this institution and no longer being subjected to the inconsistent and self-righteous nature of this individual; regrettably, the presence of a faculty member of this caliber has the potential to tarnish the reputation of an otherwise satisfactory urban college.

It is with profound regret that we must apprise you of the unfortunate circumstances pertaining to our recent visit to the establishment in question, specifically during the evening hours of Thursday, November 29th, at which time we were met with an utter lack of illumination and a conspicuous absence of both seating furniture and television sets, leading us to the inescapable conclusion that the premises were, in point of fact, closed, thereby precipitating a state of utter dismay and bewilderment on our part, particularly in light of the fact that our companion had, merely a week prior, availed himself of the opportunity to participate in their beer mug rewards program, investing a sum of $35 in the process, and it is this very fact that now serves as the impetus for our fervent curiosity regarding the precise location where our friend might seek restitution for his financial outlay, given the seemingly irreversible nature of the establishment's current predicament; furthermore, upon conducting a follow-up assessment of the situation on December 10th, we observed that the proprietors have seen fit to remove their own signage, thus rendering any prospect of revival or resurrection appear decidedly bleak, and we are accordingly compelled to offer our sincerest condolences to all those who shall henceforth be deprived of the opportunity to partake in the manifold pleasures once offered by this erstwhile bastion of conviviality and merriment, for it has, indeed, departed this mortal coil, leaving naught but memories of happier times and a lingering sense of desolation in its wake.

"Although my desire to experience a positive dining excursion was sincere, the subpar service unfortunately hindered my ability to fully appreciate the culinary offerings of this establishment, thereby rendering it unlikely that I would opt to return in the future, even if the quality of the food itself happened to be satisfactory."

We arranged for accommodations at the Luxor and were presented with complimentary passes to partake in the evening's festivities at the club. Unfortunately, this particular nightspot proved to be utterly disappointing and ranks among the least desirable venues in Las Vegas.

The layout of the club was reminiscent of a narrow corridor, with an excessive number of individuals packed tightly within its confines. The atmosphere was oppressively claustrophobic, rendering the experience thoroughly unpleasant.

We did not derive any enjoyment from our visit and have no intention of returning to the establishment in the future.

Do not waste your hard earned dollars here. For a Saturday night the place was almost empty.   Appetizers (onion rings and fried zucchini)  came out cold.  The wings were very good. My wife's chicken dinner was COLD, beans almandine had no almonds and mushy.   The so called smoked ribs were NOT smoked (1/2 rack was a 1/3 rack).  The waitress added $40+ on to our bill,  The peaches and cream martini had very little alcohol.  After the adjustment the bill was still $175 and we drank very little for 4. .  Oh, they were out of half of the deserts.  I would have given this joint zero stars but you cant.  Dont get me wrong I can afford a 5* restaurant but we decided to try Charr this place is doomed to closing.  Oh NO cold glasses.  The waitress brought glass's with ice water in them to chill them and emptied them but left 3 oz of water in the bottom.  This place needs a visit from   Gordon Ramseyor David Irvine.

I try and I try and I try to like this place but the only thing Fleming's does consistently is let me down!  Simply said... our shrimp appetizers came out sans deveining.  Yes, the digestive track of the shrimp were right there for us to see.  Next, my veal chop came out raw.  RAW!  Cold and uncooked in the center.  I sent it back twice, and finally just gave up.  Amateur hour again.\n\nTo their defense, I had an amazing steak at the Dayton, Ohio location.  But at least four other locations have let me down.  Sigh...

I had the privilege of visiting this establishment a couple of months ago, and I must say, the attire they offered was truly exceptional. Upon entering the premises, I noticed that the assortment of clothing was substantially more extensive than what was showcased on their digital platform. While perusing the merchandise, I couldn't help but notice that the store manager appeared to be visibly agitated by the fact that customers were eager to try on the garments before making a purchase. Having had experience working in retail myself, I can empathize with the stress that comes with managing a busy work environment. However, it's essential to recognize that providing excellent customer service is an integral aspect of the job description. The manager's behavior towards myself, my companions, and the other patrons was utterly discourteous and unprofessional. When we arrived at the checkout counter, the cashier was considerate enough to ensure that we had located all the items we sought. We responded affirmatively, and a queue began to form behind us. A second employee attempted to operate the adjacent register, but the manager reprimanded her harshly, commanding her not to do so and emphasizing the importance of inventory management. The stock in question consisted merely of tank tops arranged on a nearby table, which seemed sufficient. It astounded me that the manager would address her subordinates in such a demeaning manner, particularly while attempting to persuade customers to complete transactions. I sincerely hope that she has come to the realization that this line of work does not align with her strengths and interests and has accordingly moved on from her position. Her conduct was truly appalling.

"Although I am not particularly inclined to articulate unfavorable appraisals and generally tend to accord establishments the advantage of the doubt in the event of a solitary unpleasant occurrence, our familial unit visited this eatery and ultimately departed without being attended to following an interminable wait, which was truly lamentable given my profound affection for such culinary establishments and the laudatory remarks I had previously heard about them."

This establishment falls short of meeting the benchmarks set by McDonald's, which are widely recognized as the gold standard in the fast food industry, by a considerable margin; it is utterly deplorable and unacceptable in every aspect, and it is emphatically not recommended to halt or patronize this location. The quality of service is abysmal, and the food, which is often served at an unpleasantly low temperature, is frequently prepared incorrectly, rendering it inedible and leaving a thoroughly unpleasant taste in the mouths of those who have been misfortunate enough to consume it.

"Abysmal clientele experience!   Remarkably amusing to witness such subpar treatment in this contemporary era.   However, if one can overlook the surly demeanor, the culinary offerings are quite satisfactory."

Dimensional culinary delights precipitated an unfortunate digression in temperature, descending below the threshold of palatability, while the quality of service suffered a conspicuous dearth of attentiveness, manifesting in an absence of meticulousness regarding the itemized invoice at the conclusion of the repast; thus, it is my conviction that future visits to this establishment shall be utterly redundant and devoid of any semblance of utility.

"Urgent summons for Robert Irvine's expertise are imperative! A culinary catastrophe reminiscent of the Green Lantern debacle has transpired at this establishment. As an ardent patron, I had anticipated a diverse array of delectable items to sample, only to be utterly disillusioned by the meager offerings. My expectations were shattered by the uninspired presentation of two lamb chops atop a lackluster bed of rice, accompanied by a mediocre cheese sauce. The fondue, a crucial component of the dining experience, was conspicuously absent. Furthermore, the menu's layout was perplexing, relegating the dips to a secondary position, thereby diminishing their significance. The ambiance was equally unimpressive, with a haphazard assortment of floral arrangements and martini glasses adorning the walls. In conclusion, this eatery has failed to meet its potential and requires immediate intervention to rectify its shortcomings."

"I find it utterly perplexing that this establishment has received an average rating of four and a half stars, given the subpar quality of their tapioca-infused beverages. As an individual of Asian descent who has had the privilege of sampling a diverse array of bubble tea concoctions from various locales, I can unequivocally attest that the tapioca utilized in this particular venue's offerings is, by far, the most unimpressive specimen I have had the misfortune of encountering. It is my conviction that any individual who would rate this establishment above two stars would greatly benefit from venturing to California and partaking in a truly exceptional tapioca-based beverage experience."

"Perhaps it was due to my attendance at the Danity Kane album release party, but I must say, the event was utterly chaotic and lacking in organizational structure. Upon arrival, I was met with a throng of people clustered haphazardly around the entrance, resembling a mosh pit at an AFI concert. My associates and I had previously arranged to be included on the VIP list, confirming our names both days prior and on the morning of the event. However, upon arriving, we discovered that our names were mysteriously absent from the list, with the individual responsible for the oversight feigning ignorance. Numerous promoters purporting to represent the club made futile attempts to appease us and a group of other women, offering hollow assurances to gain our entry. Following a grueling 30-minute ordeal of being jostled and trampled, my companions and I finally gained admittance. The venue itself was surprisingly diminutive, exacerbating the overcrowding issue. Random soap foam descended from the ceiling, further contributing to the general disarray. The DJ's transitions between songs were abrupt and lacking in finesse, while drinks typically served in shot glasses were instead presented in regular cups, ostensibly to convey an air of sophistication. In conclusion, I must express my gratitude that we did not have to pay for this subpar experience."

This eatery provided subpar culinary offerings and deplorable customer service, which can be attributed to a combination of our server's lack of experience and an apparent disconnect between her and the chef de cuisine, ultimately resulting in an unsatisfactory dining experience; however, Las Vegas boasts a plethora of superior Italian restaurants that one would be wise to consider in lieu of this establishment.

I fervently wish that Native New Yorkers Corporate is attentive to these assessments, as the preponderance of patrons here are lamenting about analogous issues repeatedly, and my recent visit corroborates that none of these problems have been addressed. Allow me to recount my experience during my recent visit on the evening of the Mayweather fight. Upon entering, the host, after being informed of our party size, perfunctorily presented us with a menu and directed us to seat ourselves, which is arguably the most lackadaisical approach towards hospitality. The ambiance was utterly uninviting, with a pervasive layer of grime and stickiness encompassing the tables and chairs, evocative of a dowdy hotel from the 1990s. Moreover, an eerie odor permeated the atmosphere. It is worth mentioning that the wings were diminutive, paling in comparison to those offered at other Native New Yorkers locations. The waitstaff, particularly the male servers, exhibited a remarkable lack of cordiality, their countenances devoid of any trace of a smile or warmth. Lastly, our order of chicken strips arrived charred, prompting us to return it. Notably, no manager emerged to engage with us, further compounding our disappointment. In conclusion, this particular Native New Yorkers establishment offers subpar service akin to a humble, family-owned Pete's Fish, rendering it an undesirable destination.

"Subpar service...Staff members exhibited unacceptable behavior!!!!! Twelve acquaintances from San Diego accompanied me to this establishment; we placed our beverage orders, and while the female patrons were in the restroom, the waitstaff removed our drinks. Upon inquiring about this anomaly, I received an evasive response from the server, who claimed that the glasses were empty. However, I refuted this claim, emphasizing that the drinks were still full. A staff member engaged in tidying up the table nearby appeared indifferent and feigned ignorance regarding the situation. His curt demeanor further exacerbated my frustration, and he callously uttered an obscenity in my direction. My emotional state deteriorated significantly due to the cumulative effect of these unpleasant interactions. Despite my efforts to seek assistance from the bartenders, they displayed an unwelcoming attitude and disregarded my concerns. Eventually, an elderly bartender offered his assistance, and I conveyed my grievances to the manager. He expressed regret and offered to compensate us with a complimentary beverage, which I declined, emphasizing that I solely desired an apology from the employees. Unfortunately, no such apology was forthcoming, leaving a sour taste in my mouth. Consequently, I shall refrain from endorsing or recommending this establishment to anyone in the future, as the overall experience was thoroughly disappointing."

I came here for a routine oil change... they came back and shoved a bunch of unwanted information at me saying I need to have X and Y changed. The repairs would cost me over 2000, so I said no. Aside from making me feel stupid, when I went to check my oil a couple months later, I realized some screws were missing from underneath the hood. The ones that were there weren't secured properly. And somehow my hood prop rod also magically broke somehow. 

Also, I came here once before that (this is before I noticed the missing pieces) because I noticed my check engine light was on. The first thing they threw at me was a 100 dollar diagnosis check. I could get those at other places for 15 dollars. again when I refused service, the technician just kept giving me the weirdest look like I was the dumbest customer to ever grace his presence. 

bottom line: Sub par service and work. I will never come here again even if it is close to my house.

One week subsequent to the incurrence of the $25 non-refundable fee, we initiated contact via telephone and were informed that a supervisory figure would be required to reciprocate our call at their earliest convenience. Failing this, we shall be compelled to register a formal complaint with our financial institution, specifying the nature of the transaction as fraudulent in nature.

Life's too short to eat bad food and this place wasted an hour of my life.  
I ordered the Chicken Pot Pie.  What was put before me was not a twist on a classic but a total insult to a classic.  A large portion of food was thrown on to a platter sized plate to make you say "wow" when you see it.  I did.  Partly because I thought I had received the wrong dish.  
Then I tried to eat it.  A dinner plate sized "cracker crust" that was about 90% inedible.  The crust had the texture of a medium/hard jerky.  I couldn't even cut it with a knife and fork.  Seriously.  "Cracker Jerky Crust" might be more accurate.  At the bottom of the pile there was some mash that was just mash.  Slopped on top of that was the "filling" that was OK.  Lots of chicken but there better be for the price they charge.
Evidently no one on the tv shows that I've seen ordered this dish.  I saw a picture of it in the photo section.
There are a lot of good meals to be had in Vegas.  Don't waste an hour of your life at this place.

Never again shall I subject myself to the dubious delights of this establishment, having had the misfortune of partaking in their purported offerings on two separate occasions, with the initial visit transpiring during a New Year's Eve celebration and the subsequent encounter occurring under the guise of socializing and engaging in recreational gambling activities. Both experiences proved to be utterly disappointing, with the first instance involving a costly bottle service arrangement totaling $500 and the second resulting in the squandering of $100 at a keno game. Furthermore, I was utterly oblivious to the fact that a convention of affluent young professionals was taking place in the vicinity, which further contributed to my overall dissatisfaction with the experience.

I habitually frequent various Starbucks establishments, and my recent visit to this particular location was utterly disappointing, as the staff exhibited an unacceptable level of sluggishness and discourteous behavior, rendering it the most unsatisfactory Starbucks experience I have had the misfortune of encountering thus far; therefore, I strongly advise avoiding this establishment at all costs, as it fails to meet even the most basic standards of customer service and satisfaction.

Came into Vegas for business/and also to attend the SEMA show.  Our company decided to stay here.

The major complaints are as follows:

1. the non-smoking rooms reeked of cigarette smoke.
2. After my meetings - went back to the room to do some emails, and pull back the covers to the bed - only to find the bed was soaking wet with what I do not know!
I called the front desk - and they apologized and said they would clear it up first thing in the morning.  You can imagine, how I feel after jumping into a bed that is soaked with the unimaginable!
3. I ended up sleeping in the chair by my computer because they would not help me change rooms until the following morning!
All the Mandalay Bay could muster up was a big $50.00 credit (no new room) 

Do not bother with this hotel, with the way the economy is - all the other 4 and 5 star hotels in Vegas are so much better........with much better customer service.  Try Bellagio or Ceasars.

"Upon discovering that my credit card information had been pilfered subsequent to purchasing a meal at this particular establishment, I decided to contact the manager in order to merely apprise her of the potential issue pertaining to their payment processing apparatus. However, she adamantly refuted any likelihood of the fraudulent transactions being connected to her store, going so far as to assert that 'None of my employees have any acquaintances in California,' despite the fact that the illicit expenditures in question originated from that very state. Her response to my call was utterly inadequate, particularly given that I did not intend to lodge a complaint, but rather merely sought to bring the matter to her attention. In light of these events, I would strongly advise prospective patrons to exercise caution when dining at this Jason's Deli, as the combination of suspected fraudulent activity and an uncooperative management team does not bode well for a positive dining experience."

The service was really bad here! Our waitress was rude and such in a rush? Really strange the restaurant was empty only one other couple sitting at the bar. I was doing the ayce, as I was ordering the waitress walked away and I wasn't even done ordering???? I would never come back here again.. It's sad really nice place but so clueless!

If I had the option to assign a negative rating, I undoubtedly would have availed myself of such an opportunity, as the deplorable quality of service we received far surpassed our expectations in terms of its sheer inadequacy. Our arrival at 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday evening, a time when most establishments are bustling with activity, proved to be an unfortunate miscalculation on our part, as it became apparent that the staff were utterly unequipped to handle the influx of patrons. Upon entering the premises, we were met with a scene of utter chaos, with four young women positioned at the forefront, seemingly engaged in a concerted effort to create an atmosphere of bedlam. Despite our prolonged presence, no attempt was made to acknowledge our presence, let alone extend a warm welcome or provide any semblance of hospitality. The sushi bar, conspicuously underutilized, beckoned to us like a siren's call, and we felt compelled to investigate further, only to be confronted by a hostile reception from a female staff member who appeared hell-bent on ensuring that we were cognizant of the fact that the bar was not designed to accommodate patrons on a first-come, first-served basis. Such an encounter left us feeling utterly disillusioned and precipitated our immediate departure, with nary a moment's hesitation. Notwithstanding the manager's profuse apologies, our reluctance to return remains steadfast and unyielding.

This reprehensible experience has left me utterly flabbergasted and my spouse and I are still reeling from the unacceptable level of incompetence displayed by the staff at this establishment. Upon entering the premises, we placed an order for a beverage, specifically a beer, as well as a hot tea, and a plate of nachos, alas, sans beans. However, approximately twenty minutes later, we were presented with the aforementioned nachos, but now adorned with beans, much to our dismay. In light of this egregious error, my spouse requested that we receive a new order of nachos, devoid of beans, from an alternative server, as our initial server had elected to take a hiatus. Unfortunately, the manager chose to intervene, and his behavior can only be described as boorish and unprofessional, as he shifted the blame onto every individual involved, save himself, naturally. Needless to say, such abysmal management practices have rendered any future visits to this establishment completely out of the question. The manager's tirade against the bartender, who had valiantly attempted to rectify the situation, only served to further solidify our decision to avoid this venue like the plague in the future.

"Subjective evaluation of the recreational area yields a mediocre rating of three stars, primarily due to the restrictive policies enforced by the local patrons, specifically pertaining to the allocation of time dedicated to wave riding, which is seemingly monopolized by self-proclaimed'regulars.' The proprietor of the adjacent surf shop exhibits discourteous behavior, further exacerbating the unpleasant experience. A shared board, used alternately by myself and a companion, was the source of contention, as the aforementioned shop owner demanded adherence to an alleged yet unwritten decree, dictating that those participating in such communal usage must relinquish their position in the queue and await their turn at the rear of the line. My protestations against this unfounded regulation were met with indifference, leaving me no choice but to endure the inconvenience. The brevity of the waves' rideable duration, combined with the excessive waiting period and monetary expenditure, renders this location unsuitable for those seeking enjoyment."

"What an utter travesty. Were it feasible, I would unquestionably assign a negative assessment to this establishment, given the egregious nature of the service I received. Following an interminable wait of nearly sixty minutes, during which time I eagerly anticipated assistance from any representative, I was ultimately compelled to endure the ignominy of being ignored by every sales associate within sight, with the exception of a solitary patron who deigned to acknowledge my presence. The exorbitant prices charged by this retailer serve only to further exacerbate my profound dissatisfaction, thereby impelling me to seek alternative vendors for my future purchases, as did several other disgruntled customers who shared my frustration and elected to depart the premises in search of more satisfactory shopping experiences."

This marks my maiden visit to this esteemed establishment, and I must admit that my expectations were not entirely met. My companions had previously partaken in the culinary offerings of this restaurant and had expressed their satisfaction, thus prompting my decision to follow suit. However, upon perusing the menu, I noticed that the quality of certain dishes left much to be desired. Specifically, the oysters, which my comrade had enthusiastically endorsed, failed to impress. In point of fact, he voiced his regret shortly after consuming the initial bite, citing a lack of freshness and an unpalatable sauce.  

My companions and I opted for the all-you-can-eat sushi selection, and while there were some redeeming qualities, the overall experience was less than satisfactory. To elaborate, the following points comprise the advantages and disadvantages of our dining excursion:  

Advantages:  

1. The option to substitute sashimi for sushi (with rice) was available.  
2. Our server exhibited exceptional friendliness and hospitality.  
3. The salmon dishes were fresh and of high quality.  
4. Reservations can be made in advance, which streamlines the process for patrons.  

Disadvantages:  

1. A significant number of orders were not fresh on the day of our visit.  
2. Our server seemed somewhat bewildered, resulting in erroneous order quantities.  
3. The seating arrangement was rather cramped, giving the impression that all patrons were sharing a single table.  
4. The menu offered fewer options compared to similar establishments.  
5. Four sea urchin sushis were ordered, yet two of them displayed a striking dark brown hue, while the remaining two were a vibrant gold. Such inconsistency in the appearance of the sea urchins only served to highlight their questionable freshness.  

In conclusion, I must state that I am unlikely to return to this restaurant in the future.

"Unfortunately, my hunger was so intense that I failed to capture a photograph of the culinary offerings! I opted for the croquetas and tamales, both of which were available for the reasonable price of $5. Additionally, I requested a side of congri, which added an additional $3 to the total cost. While the menu selections were limited, the quality of the food did not justify the modest serving sizes. Notwithstanding, the flavors were reminiscent of my mother-in-law's culinary prowess, albeit with greater finesse. As for the customer experience, my spouse inadvertently dropped his utensil, prompting the owner's wife to promptly provide him with a replacement set. The ambiance of the establishment featured several outdoor tables and chairs, suitable for al fresco dining. However, based on my underwhelming experience, I would not consider returning to this venue in the future."

Naw, I went to this club at 10:31pm on a Saturday night and there were no strippers on the dance floor! I asked the bartender when they would come out and she was like, \"I think they could be getting dressed.\" All of them??

"Tardy, discourteous, and unprofessional. That's how I would characterize the demeanor of the retail associate who attended to me during my recent visit to your establishment. Despite my fiance's premonition, I opted to accord her the privilege of the doubt, but unfortunately, she failed to acknowledge my presence; demonstrated an unwillingness to meticulously count the items I wished to purchase; and conveyed two disheartening announcements with a facial expression and tone that bespoke a flagrant lack of concern for the customer experience (CHALLENGING),\nNo, young woman, challenging for you indeed! In light of this unsatisfactory encounter, my fiance and I have resolved to take our business elsewhere in the future."

This particular venue has undergone a considerable decline in quality, prompting the need for a comprehensive retraining of the grill staff by corporate management. My personal experiences during the past three visits have been marred by the consistent serving of severely overcooked chicken, with both sides displaying an unpalatable charring that is not merely a superficial blemish but rather a deeply ingrained flaw. The staff's response to my legitimate concerns has been dismissive and disrespectful, evincing a reluctance to address the issue and even manifesting in eye-rolling and derogatory comments. The final straw came when I was advised that it was incumbent upon me to inspect the poultry prior to departure, an expectation that I deem both unreasonable and inappropriate given the eatery's responsibility to ensure the edibility and presentability of its offerings. Furthermore, the mashed potatoes served during my most recent visit were unacceptably watery, further reinforcing my decision to seek alternative dining options. While I would prefer to support this establishment, the inconsistency and mediocrity of the food compel me to explore other locations that can provide a more satisfying culinary experience.

"I have yet to partake in culinary indulgences at this establishment, however, a acquaintance of mine has recounted an unsettling tale of being expelled from the premises for the ostensible offense of communicating in Spanish. Frankly, I am incredulous that a business operating within the United States would deem such behavior conducive to a welcoming atmosphere. If the allegations are indeed substantiated, then I would strongly advise against patronizing this restaurant, unless one identifies as a separatist individual who harbors animosity towards those who do not share their linguistic preferences."

I am thoroughly disenchanted with this establishment, primarily due to the subpar quality of their customer service. The staff consistently manifests an air of haughtiness and discourtesy towards patrons, which makes for an unpleasant experience. Notwithstanding, I frequent this location solely because certain acquaintances of mine express a preference for some of their beverages. I refrain from being overly fastidious or demanding, as that would necessitate seeking alternative venues. It is highly unlikely that I will ever utter the phrase, "let's visit Tea Station!" as it fails to meet my expectations regarding hospitality. In contrast, Icy Juicy offers a vastly superior level of service.

Never again shall we revisit this establishment, for it fails to meet even the most basic standards of cleanliness and comfort. The bed linens are stained and unkempt, the windows do not open to allow for fresh air or a view, and the bathroom facilities lack the most fundamental aspect of privacy - a lock. We had the misfortune of staying at this wretched place for four interminable days, during which time the housekeeping staff did not deign to grace us with their presence even once. It is evident that the management does not prioritize the well-being of its guests, prompting one to wonder why they bother to offer AAA discounts when they cannot be bothered to ensure that the rooms are properly maintained. Needless to say, we shall not be recommending this hotel to anyone, nor shall we ever return.

"It is my considered opinion that the culinary offerings presented at this establishment do not justify the fiscal expenditure required to partake in them. Specifically, the cost of the bread, salad, vegetables, soup, prawns, baked potato, and steak, when taken in aggregate, seems exorbitant in relation to the perceived quality of the items themselves. Furthermore, the utilization of table salt and table pepper, rather than sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper, struck me as incongruous with the restaurant's purported commitment to serving high-quality meat. While the selection of beverages was adequate, it did not strike me as particularly exceptional or unique, especially given the prevalence of similar options at alternative dining establishments. Overall, I must confess that I find it challenging to comprehend the appeal of this venue, particularly in light of its reputation as a quintessential Midwestern supper club experience. Perhaps my urban upbringing and predilection for more sophisticated culinary experiences have rendered me insensible to the charms of this type of dining environment."

"Garcia's procures a solitary celestial body due to the singular individual who relished the culinary experience at the table. Despite its alleged gluten-free menu, which I can practically recite from memory given its brevity, Garcia's does not particularly cater to gluten-intolerant patrons. The menu consists of Chicken Gasedo (a soup bowl containing shredded poultry that one of my dining companions referred to as 'chicken slop'), Beef Machaco (akin to the chicken dish, albeit with beef), an assortment of vegetables, salsa, black beans or charro beans, and a house salad dressed with vinegar and oil. For the sum of $9.99, I received a bowl of the aforementioned chicken slop and a cup of black beans. Upon perusing the bill, I noticed that I was not charged separately for each item; thus, I am uncertain whether the waiter neglected to include these items on the bill or if there was some other explanation for the discrepancy. In conclusion, a word of advice for Garcia's: consider adding corn tortillas to your offerings, and perhaps maintain a stash of tostitos in the kitchen for good measure."

When engaging in a deliberation regarding the quality of Mexican cuisine, specifically pertaining to whether it constitutes the nadir of culinary experiences, it serves as an illustration of the nature of the encounter. On the fifth of May, we opted to partake in a dining experience at this establishment, precipitated by a sense of urgency due to concurrent commitments. Our expectation was to expediently secure a table in the bar area, consume sustenance and potables, and subsequently depart. However, the gastronomical offerings proved to be utterly disappointing, lacking in both flavor and creativity. The ambiance was further marred by the presence of overzealous security personnel, whose age and inexperience only served to exacerbate their questionable effectiveness. In light of these factors, it is unlikely that we shall return to this venue in the future.

Upon perambulating past this edifice on multiple occasions, my curiosity was piqued, compelling me to enter and solicit a copy of their bill of fare. Alas, my request was met with a dismissive wave of the hand, the staff exhibiting a lack of helpfulness that bordered on the uncivil. The interior of the establishment, devoid of any other patrons save for my person, seemed to echo with emptiness. Notwithstanding this, a member of the security personnel entered, and to my chagrin, they proffered him a complimentary sample, while I, in stark contrast, remained ignored. My desire for a steaming bowl of soup went unfulfilled, as the staff demonstrated an unyielding indifference towards my presence. Ultimately, I departed, feeling exasperated and disheartened by the experience, sans nourishment or refreshment.

"The culinary experience at Man Pho was subpar on the previous day. Although I am reluctant to criticize establishments owned by my ethnic group, it is imperative that they elevate their standards. The noodles had an unpleasant texture reminiscent of instant pho purchased from Lee Lee's supermarket, and were excessively soggy. I recall the'special combination' dish being more flavorful during my previous visit. Unfortunately, the addition of a fatty component to the dish resulted in an unpalatable taste. In light of this disappointing experience, I shall refrain from patronizing the establishment until I peruse favorable reviews."

"My recent dining experience at this establishment was utterly deplorable, particularly during my friend's birthday celebration. The service we received was reprehensible, with our server exhibiting an unprecedented level of incivility. Throughout the evening, numerous instances of rudeness transpired, including a notable occurrence where my order was botched. Upon inquiring about the absence of cheese in my cheese fries, the waitress responded with an air of indignation, curtly remarking that she would attend to my friend's appetizer first, as if it were a burdensome task. She then proceeded to deliver my companion's meal, only to abruptly turn her attention to me, snappily admonishing me to communicate my cheese preference in the future. The collective response from our party was one of utter disbelief. In all my years of dining out, I have yet to encounter such an unpleasant and distasteful encounter. Therefore, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative dining options."

I placed an order for sixty balloons approximately one month prior to my daughter's bridal shower. Subsequently, two days preceding the event, I contacted the establishment to reaffirm my order. The designated time for collection was set at 10 am. However, upon arriving at the specified time of 10:15 am, it was observed that the staff members were only initiating the process of inflating the balloons. Consequently, we were forced to endure a delay of approximately twenty minutes. Considering the fact that I possessed perishable items within my vehicle and numerous tasks remained to be completed in preparation for the impending celebration, my level of frustration was understandably elevated. Moreover, the personnel did not extend any semblance of regret or compensatory gestures to mitigate the inconvenience. In conclusion, the overall quality of service encountered was deplorable.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment were utterly disappointing. Specifically, the ceviche we sampled possessed an unpleasant flavor profile, closely resembling ketchup with irregular chunks of unidentifiable origin. Furthermore, my shrimp dish was preparated excessively, resulting in an unpalatable texture. My spouse's hamburger, ordered medium, was instead served well-done, rendering it inedible. Our companion's chicken lettuce wraps suffered from an acute lack of moisture, leading to an unfortunate dining experience. Notwithstanding the uninviting ambiance, the outdoor seating area, had it been climate-controlled, may have offered a modicum of respite. However, we were constrained to dine indoors, where the decor and atmosphere were utterly forgettable and reminiscent of countless other generic restaurants across the country. The beverage selection proved unremarkable, while our server's performance was adequate, yet ultimately futile in salvaging our meal. In conclusion, we shall never return to this eatery, nor would we recommend it to anyone."

It is thoroughly unfortunate that it is not feasible to post a rating of zero stars, for it would accurately reflect the subpar quality of service provided by 777 Towing. Do not squander your time and resources by engaging with this particular company, as it is abundantly evident that their modus operandi revolves around woefully inadequate communication and an apparent lack of concern for the well-being of their clientele. Should your insurance provider inform you that 777 Towing will be dispatched to assist you, it is advisable to request an alternative service provider, as the former's proficiency in fulfilling their obligations leaves much to be desired.

Given the fact that the estimated time of arrival for 777 Towing's services was repeatedly pushed back by increments of 30-35 minutes, culminating in an indefinite delay due to an alleged breakdown of their vehicle, it becomes glaringly obvious that reliability is not a trait that this enterprise holds in high regard. Moreover, the absence of forthright communication regarding the aforementioned mechanical issue serves as a testament to the company's propensity for obfuscation and dearth of transparency.

In stark contrast, the efficiency and dependability displayed by the alternate towing company contracted by your insurance provider exemplifies the hallmarks of a reputable and customer-centric organization, arriving punctually as promised and mitigating the perilous circumstances posed by the stranded vehicle. It is imperative to exercise caution and prudence when selecting a towing service, lest you fall prey to the ineptitude and unprofessionalism that 777 Towing has demonstrated.

"The customer service experience at this establishment is utterly abysmal! It's a futile endeavor to place an order in advance, as there's no guarantee that it will be fulfilled, or that any record of it will exist. Despite my fondness for the culinary offerings here, I shall not return due to the recurring ineptitude displayed by the staff. Two instances of subpar service are sufficient to deter me from patronizing this business further."

"Indubitably, the coffee was of superior quality, however, the demeanor of the barista was discourteous and irascible, despite my concerted efforts to engage in amicable conversation. Moreover, the establishment's restroom facilities were found wanting, specifically, there was an absence of toilet tissue, and a makeshift sign indicated that alternative lavatory amenities were available at a nearby location. It is unfortunate that I must convey a less than favorable assessment, given the exceptional quality of their coffee, yet the overall encounter was marred by an unsatisfactory experience."

Firstly, the pungent and potent fragrance permeates the entire establishment, assaulting one's olfactory senses with an unrelenting intensity, analogous to a massive brick wall, upon every ingress and egress.

 Secondly, the accommodations themselves appear tired, worn, and neglected, with visible signs of deterioration and disrepair, much like a once-majestic edifice that has succumbed to the ravages of time and neglect.

 Thirdly, a conspicuous patch of noxious, dark mold measuring approximately three feet by three feet was discovered on the bed linens, prompting an urgent request for a room change, which, unfortunately, was met with a tardy and inadequate response from the housekeeping staff, leaving us exhausted and eager for slumber yet forced to endure further inconvenience. (Pertinent photographic evidence was documented.)

 Fourthly, the supposedly refreshed quarters were found to contain an unsettling amount of masculine facial hair scattered throughout the bathroom, including a magnetized mirror detached from its rightful place on the wall, which this writer had the misfortune of touching prior to recognizing its unsanitary nature. Additionally, newly discovered holes in the fresh bedding, resembling rodent gnaw marks, necessitated another room change. (Grotesque visual evidence is available.)

 Lastly, a relocation to a room boasting a "view" proved futile, as the windows were caked with dirt and grime, rendering any potential scenery indiscernible. (Although seemingly absurd, this assertion holds veracity.)

 In conclusion, given the aforementioned litany of deplorable conditions, it is this author's conviction that the establishment in question will ultimately cease operations, and thus, it is crucial to alert others to these deficiencies.

"It is my ardent desire to confer upon them a solitary star, for our experience was utterly reprehensible. A sizable order was delivered to us, and upon inspection, one of the young ladies discovered an unwelcome guest in her cuisine. It was not a minuscule creature, but rather a substantial, loathsome roach. This sight was sufficient to preclude anyone from partaking of their meal. It is axiomatic that the presence of a single roach implies a far greater infestation. When we brought this to their attention, they offered a feeble solution, proffering a replacement order, while dismissing our request for a refund. Following a protracted disagreement, they ultimately relented, retrieving their tainted fare and reimbursing us. I assure you, dear reader, that we shall never again darken their doorstep."

"Wow, it seems that purchasing an item at this establishment comes with a complimentary dosage of aggressive persuasion, for if one does not express an interest in additional merchandise, they will undoubtedly encounter a barrage of insistent entreaties from the sales staff. My companion and I were taken aback by the sudden metamorphosis of the demeanor of the sales representative upon our declining of supplementary accessories and extended warranties. The individual who purported to hold the title of'sales manager,' despite appearing youthful and inexperienced, made a concerted effort to coerce us into acquiring further items. Our visit culminated in our departure without any purchases, and we were left with an unsettling impression of the commercial practices employed by this enterprise."

"Gate C presents an unfortunate predicament for travelers, characterized by sluggish service and a seemingly apathetic attitude on the part of TSA agents towards passengers with disabilities or medical emergencies. The combination of these factors results in an excruciating experience that elevates the concept of 'Hurry Up and Wait' to an unprecedented level. It is not uncommon for individuals to still be navigating the X-ray portion of security one hour later, eliciting sympathy from even first-class passengers who have paid a premium for expedited processing but find themselves mired in the same protracted delay. A comprehensive reassessment of the airport's security protocols appears imperative to address this issue."

We, a sextet, halted our vehicular conveyance subsequent to my progeny's academic commencement, opting to partake of an early evening repast within the confines of this establishment. Prior to our arrival, we had procured an iced tea from a nearby coffeehouse, which we foolishly presumed would be permissible to bring with us. However, upon our entrance, the barkeep hastily informed us that such was not the case, and that we would be unable to enter the premises with said beverage. I, in my capacity as spokesperson for our group, solicited an audience with the manager, who, in a manner bordering on insolence, averred that his subordinate had spoken the truth. Disgruntled and disillusioned, we vacated the premises, traversing the parking area to a rival eatery, where we expended one hundred twenty-five dollars on a dinner and beverages of superior quality, accompanied by exemplary service. It is with unwavering conviction that I avow my intention never to return to this establishment, and to dissuade others from doing so as well.

The text is: "We (party of 6) stopped in after my son's graduation for an early dinner.  Just before we stopped at Starbucks for an iced tea.  My mother still had her iced tea when we walked in and the bartender immediately said that we could not come in with the iced tea.  I asked to speak with his manager and he said \"he will tell you the same thing\".  We walked out and went across the parking lot to NYPD and spent $125 on dinner & drinks and had great service.  I will NEVER come back to this place.  *** Update *** Following is a message sent to me from what was obviously an employee of APC:\n\nWell not to be rude but it is against the liquor laws to have outside food or beverages In a restaurant and I know first hand there is a sign outside the door there that states it. So if you get mad at a restaurant for following the rules then you are not a customer that restaurants want.  Tara S\n\n* Just another reason to never go back and to make sure I tell all my friends and family about the experience."

The modified text is:

We, a sextet, halted our vehicular conveyance subsequent to my progeny's academic commencement, opting to partake of an early evening repast within the confines of this establishment.
