Subsequently, another server brought us complimentary tortilla chips and salsa, which our party erroneously presumed to be an integral component of the meal, thereby prompting us to consume them. The primary server then inquired as to who would be responsible for the cost of the chips they had provided gratuitously... We categorically declined to compensate for the mistake, which was not attributable to us. 

The server repeatedly queried us on three separate occasions regarding the method of payment for the total of eight individuals. We requested the separation of bills each time, to which she responded with visible irritation and a dismissive tone, uttering, "Okay, then..." in a manner that could be perceived as derogatory. Based on this experience, it is unlikely that we will return to this specific venue. 

Furthermore, we were compelled to request water and the beverages we had ordered on three separate occasions before they were finally provided. Ultimately, the manager intervened to address the situation, which partially redeemed the excursion. Notwithstanding the aforementioned issues, the culinary offerings were, in fact, quite satisfactory..."

"It is abundantly evident that my culinary expectations were not merely unfulfilled, but utterly decimated during my recent visit to this establishment, as the putative 'fried shrimp' dish I opted for not only lacked even a modicum of gastronomical sophistication, but also precipitated a profound sense of nausea and disgust, prompting me to discard the offending item and seek refuge in the relative safety of my own digestive system; furthermore, the dearth of competence exhibited by the cashier, who appeared to be oblivious to the fundamental concept of a 'combo meal,' only served to exacerbate my already considerable frustration and disillusionment with the dining experience as a whole."

Have you ever gone to a restaurant and the food was good, but the service and customer service was so bad that you can't ever walk through the doors again? For me that is my experience at Rosati's tonight. I placed a phone order after looking at their menu that was posted on their website. I had the order amount in my head based on the prices on the website menu. When I questioned the total to the cashier, she printed out the prices. I asked her if she knew that the prices on my bill were different than those on the website menu. She told me something that really didn't make sense. I replied that I thought they should charge me the prices from the website menu. She just gave me my change and didn't even say thank you (I guess the attitude started). I asked to speak with the manager, but she said he wasn't there. If it were my restaurant, I would have gladly matched the prices that were on the website menu, no questions asked or attitude given. Another sorry example of good food that is outweighed by bad and/or rude customer service.

For reasons I don't fully understand I tried to eat here tonight.  As usual getting a seat was a chore...whether the place is crowded or not (not in this case).

Anyhow I sit down, menus arrive and then some moron walks up to talk with the folks in the table behind me and he's smoking a e-pipe!!!!   Really!!!!????  WTF!!!!!

Cheesecake Factory I'm putting this one on you for allowing it to happen. 

I'm done with you.

If zero was a choice I'd go with that.

It appears that the culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, and I regret not having had the opportunity to sample them. However, I must admit that the dismissive behavior exhibited by the staff towards me upon my entrance was sufficient enough to deter me from patronizing this business further. Specifically, upon entering the premises, I was met with complete disregard, despite my cordial greeting directed towards the individual stationed behind the counter. Subsequently, I proceeded to the counter, only to be snubbed once again. When I finally managed to place my order, I made an attempt to utilize a promotional coupon, but was curtly informed that it was invalid. My query regarding the matter was met with an unhelpful and terse response, leaving me feeling disrespected and annoyed. Considering that I have been subjected to such discourteous treatment while wearing a name badge, I deemed it unnecessary to continue interacting with this establishment. Consequently, I elected to take my business elsewhere, which elicited an indifferent shrug from the staff member in question. Ultimately, neither party has suffered a significant loss as a result of this incident.

I eat at cafe rio at least once a week. Not once has it crossed my mind to write a review because the food speaks for it's self. Unfortunately I had a horrible experience with the cashier at this location so I felt the need to write a review. The line was extremely long and not to order your food, to pay. Might want to look into hiring competent workers, who actually want to work and not gossip while the line backs up.

We had the pleasure of convening a group of thirteen individuals for a dual-purpose celebration, specifically a birthday and football gathering. I must say, our experience at this particular venue was utterly disappointing and subpar. Upon attempting to gain entry, we were met with an unfriendly and unaccommodating demeanor by the door attendant. It is truly perplexing that such an establishment would fail to recognize the potential financial benefits of accommodating a sizable group of patrons on a Sunday afternoon, especially given the popularity of football in the region. Furthermore, our attire was suitable for the occasion, rendering the door attendant's behavior all the more baffling. In conclusion, I strongly advise against allocating funds towards this establishment, as there are numerous superior alternatives in the vicinity of Scottsdale that can provide a more satisfying experience for your social and culinary needs.

I rarely write reviews so for me to sign up and write a review means it was THAT BAD!  Where to start...I paid over $40.00 for an oil change and upgraded car wash-when it was all said and done, the interior of my car was not clean, the side door panels hadn't been wiped off at all and my car started leaking some fluid. The mechanic kept trying to get me to pay for extra services...he would say, \"I just noticed one thing...\" then when I didn't want to pay for that \"thing\", he proceeded to notice another \"thing\" and another \"thing\". Additionally, I noticed scratches on the outside of my car that I hadn't noticed before and my son witnessed one of the employees flashing gang signs. Needless to say, even when my car was leaking fluid after my visit, I wasn't about to take my car back...NOT EVER.

Last night's visit to Top Shelf presented a divergent experience from my previous encounters, as my server appeared to be preoccupied with attending to a baby at the bar, subsequently neglecting their responsibilities towards other patrons, including myself. Specifically, I consumed two-thirds of my meal without any beverages, due to the server's lack of attention, resulting in my food becoming cold and my tacos exhibiting an excessive amount of grease, which caused them to disintegrate. Furthermore, when the server finally acknowledged our presence and inquired about our need for additional items or dessert, it took an extended period of time to receive our requested beverages. Notably, my husband's tea glass was filled to capacity with ice, leaving only a small portion for the actual tea, rendering it difficult to even mix in a sweetener. Despite my willingness to give the establishment another chance, I may be compelled to seek alternative dining options in the future.

I gave this place a chance. Numerous times...but I now feel 100% confident in saying I will NEVER walk into this location ever again. The clothes are cheap and worth the one or two wears...but I refuse to look or speak to any of those RUDE employees. It's like you ruin their day asking for something. HR did a great job hiring the worst group of people ever. Have I mentioned that awful high pitched alarm that is constantly going off at the register?? I'll take my 20 bucks to one at Fashion Square.

I had the displeasure of partaking in a family outing to this establishment with my three offspring, and the experience was utterly disappointing, to say the least. The financial investment of forty dollars was not only unjustified but also thoroughly lamentable, as the quality of the food and service failed to meet our expectations. In light of the abundance of superior alternatives in the local area, I would strongly advise against visiting this buffet, as it falls short of providing an enjoyable dining experience.

"Abysmal. I failed to experience any semblance of satisfaction during my initial visit. My gel manicure exhibited an unacceptable level of imperfection, manifesting in the form of unsightly bubbles and cracks. Upon returning a fortnight later for a routine polish alteration, I was subjected to an excruciating procedure by Cindy, the individual responsible for the mutilation of my digits. She instructed me to immerse my fingers in acetone for a mere second before employing a dremel to ravage my natural nails, mindless of the fact that they were not artificially enhanced. The traumatic ordeal left six of my fingers with lacerations on both the cuticles and epidermis, while the remaining four fingers remained unscathed, an enigma that continues to elude me. Following this harrowing episode, I was coerced into submerging my injured fingers in both acetone and alcohol, intensifying the agony I endured. The outcome of this distressing escapade left me with six hemorrhaging phalanges, yet I was still expected to tender the full payment. I emphatically advise against patronizing this establishment; there are numerous alternative nail salons that offer superior service and expertise."

I went to the bar last night (sat) and it took FOREVER to get my drink. I order a Long Island, when I got it the drink was CLEAR! I told the bartender \"Ashely\" that my drink wasn't right and she had the nerve to take a drink out of my drink and told me \"it taste fine and I not making you a new one\"! WTF don't ever go here!

The acquisition of a LocalDine prompted an eager anticipation to experience the culinary offerings of the establishment, however, upon arriving on Friday, May 24th, 2013, it was discovered that the contract had expired five days prior, thereby rendering the July expiration coupon invalid, which resulted in a profound disappointment regarding the quality of the fare, specifically, the meager portion of turkey in a sandwich priced at nine dollars, which elicited a strong negative reaction, ultimately leading to the decision not to return.

I am an individual with fastidious inclinations when it comes to the quality of service proffered by restaurants; thus, I anticipate and demand competent and attentive service, which, in turn, determines the extent of my gratuity. In this instance, the service met my expectations, yet the culinary offerings left much to be desired. Specifically, I sampled a half-rack of the establishment's purportedly acclaimed baby back ribs, only to find the meat devoid of any discernible flavor and unacceptably desiccated. Furthermore, the two sides I requested, specifically the fried okra and macaroni and cheese, were subpar, with the latter bearing a striking resemblance to a store-bought Kraft Macaroni & Cheese product. Additionally, I opted for the three-item sampler, comprising onion straws, fried pickles, and burnt ends, which arrived swimming in an excessive pool of oil, rendering the entire dish soggy and unpalatable. For the sake of comparison, TGI Fridays' baby back ribs boast significantly superior flavor and texture, making them a vastly preferable option. Suffice it to say, I shall not be revisiting this establishment in the future, and my overall assessment warrants a solitary star, solely attributed to the satisfactory service I received.

I personally entered the establishment and inquired about the status of my computer that was purportedly being mended, to which the staff member retorted with a query of his own, the essence of which was, "Are you capable of doing so?" His rejoinder was not only discourteous but also engendered an atmosphere of unease and discomfort. Subsequently, I was compelled to endure a protracted waiting period of approximately twenty-five minutes during which the employee remained stationary, exhibiting an utter lack of concern or expediency. Ultimately, my experience at this particular business was unsatisfactory, and I would strongly advise against visiting it.

"The servers exhibited an unacceptable level of discourtesy and hastiness, impeding our dining experience by refusing to seat us until the entire party had arrived, despite the fact that five out of seven individuals were already present. Furthermore, it took an unreasonable amount of time, specifically twenty-five minutes, for us to receive our beverages after being seated. Unfortunately, the culinary offerings did not possess sufficient flavor, and the servers failed to maintain adequate eye contact or provide appropriate spacing between tables, resulting in a generally unsatisfactory dining environment."

"The culinary experience offered by this establishment fails to impress, as the fare provided is unremarkable and overpriced, particularly in light of the fact that the grilled options are marketed as a premium feature. Furthermore, the dining area appears to be poorly maintained, as evidenced by the presence of insects on our table, which the staff seemed to dismiss as a fabrication until further sightings necessitated a cursory cleaning of the surface with a dishrag. Considering the substantial cost of our meal, which exceeded one hundred fifty dollars, we anticipated a higher level of service quality and a more fastidious approach to maintaining a sanitary environment. In contrast, Ohjah offers a superior dining experience, characterized by a more pleasant ambiance, flavorful cuisine, fresh sushi, and a markedly improved level of customer service."

I have been a loyal patron of Sprint for over a decade, during which time I have consistently paid for their services on a monthly basis. However, despite my dedication to the company, I have yet to experience the benefits of utilizing a 4G phone with rapid service speeds. In fact, Sprint has been making the same promises regarding the installation of new towers for the past five years, but they have yet to follow through on these claims. As such, I would advise against investing in their services until they can demonstrate tangible improvements in their network infrastructure.

"Uncertainty permeated the atmosphere as I endeavored to comprehend the unforeseen transformation that had beset the establishment, which had hitherto been renowned for its exceptional culinary offerings and hospitable ambiance. Previously, I had visited this location multiple times, typically during the early afternoon hours, and had always been impressed by the superior quality of the food and the attentive demeanor of the staff. However, on this particular Friday afternoon, at approximately 4 pm, I was taken aback by the stark contrast in the level of service I received. Specifically, I encountered an unprecedented degree of discourtesy and indifference from the staff, who seemed to be utterly disinterested in my presence, despite my repeated attempts to solicit their attention. As a seasoned Wahoo enthusiast, having patronized the original location in Orange County on numerous occasions, I was taken aback by the stark disparity in the quality of service between the two establishments. Furthermore, I was compelled to request a menu, a task that proved to be remarkably challenging, as it required me to hail the attention of the server/bartender, who appeared to be preoccupied with other patrons. Subsequently, I was informed by the manager that I would need to relocate, as there were patrons who wished to engage in the video gambling machines situated in the bar area. This pronouncement was accompanied by a gesture that struck me as peculiar, specifically, the manager patted the bar counter in front of the machine, an action that seemed to underscore the notion that the establishment's primary focus was now centered on gambling, rather than the traditional emphasis on providing an enjoyable dining experience. I must confess that I found the cold shoulder and curt attitude displayed by the staff to be entirely unwarranted, and it is with a heavy heart that I must forgo my Wahoo fix until such time as I find myself back in Orange County, where the authentic spirit of Wahoo remains alive and well."

"The personnel within this establishment exhibit an egregious lack of proficiency in their roles, rendering them utterly incompetent and unworthy of employment. It is a travesty that such individuals are recruited while capable job seekers remain unoccupied. Their discourteous behavior towards certain patrons, including myself, is particularly reprehensible. During my recent visit, the young woman attending to my order abandoned her post mid-transaction, leaving me ignored for an extended period of approximately five minutes. Her eventual return was prompted by my vociferous summons. The culinary offerings were unremarkable and suspiciously reminiscent of reheated leftovers, which only exacerbated my dissatisfaction with the prolonged wait of over twenty minutes for a simple sandwich and pizza slice. My experience was so dismal that I felt embarrassed to be associated with this enterprise in any capacity, and I strongly suggest that the staff familiarize themselves with the concept of treating all clientele with dignity and respect."

"Comprehensive Evaluation of Pros and Cons: 

Advantages:
Convenient location for individuals residing in close proximity

Disadvantages:
Frequently encountered unprofessional and discourteous staff (three instances out of three visits)
Consistently tardy appointments, even during mornings, raising concerns regarding attendance
Inadequate climate control, resulting in an uncomfortable atmosphere reminiscent of the 1960s, with patrons gazing at one another anxiously while the temperature outside surpassed 100 degrees Fahrenheit
Experienced prolonged waiting periods exceeding an hour, followed by an unclear response regarding the approximate duration of my wait, ultimately prompting my departure
In Conclusion - Individuals seeking to avoid mental distress caused by staff, unnecessary delays, and potential exposure to influenza amidst a chilly ambiance, are advised to visit the conventional Summerlin Labcorp facility, despite a slightly longer commute."

I just purchased a glazed and chocolate covered donut here. Both were very stale and must have been sitting on the shelf for a  very long time. I took one bite from each then threw them into the trash where they belong. You would think Dunkin Donuts would keep fresh goods on their shelves.

Beware! If you're a darker skinned person or do not fit the culture they will discriminate against you.  Waited 20 minutes fir pho that takes a few minutes to prep.  Went with my best friend and we're never going back.  I thought that we were beyond that. ...smh
Overpriced and food wasn't good! It was a wild place with all the going on with the employees dressing up going around giving free shots etc., but food was bad and pricey!

I rarely allocate sufficient time to express my sentiments regarding subpar accommodations; however, I feel compelled to voice my disappointment with regard to our recent stay at "the Paris" hotel. The staff's behavior was discourteous and unprofessional, exemplified by the waiters, valets, and housekeeping personnel. The room itself was unsanitary, featuring conspicuous stains, outdated amenities (absence of an iPod docking station), and a chipped bathtub. In contrast, I have had the pleasure of experiencing superior hospitality at various establishments in the downtown area. It is worth mentioning that upon hearing a knock on the door, it is imperative to hasten one's pace and ensure a prompt response, lest the housekeeping staff unceremoniously enter the room while its occupant is in a state of undress. Suffice it to say, I shall never again consider "the Paris" as a viable lodging option.

I procured a Groupon voucher valued at $16, redeemable for a sum of $8, at this particular Quiznos establishment. It is reasonable to assume that an individual of high school graduate age should possess the cognitive abilities necessary to accurately process said transaction by subtracting $16 from the total cost and providing the remaining balance. However, this expectation proved to be erroneous, as the employee in question deducted $7.36 prior to taxation and an additional $8 following taxation. This resulted in a discrepancy of $1.34, which is unacceptable given the already inflated prices of this Quiznos location within a strip casino food court. Therefore, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative dining options.

"The culinary experience was merely satisfactory, rating a paltry seven out of ten, unfortunately, the quality of the service was utterly deplorable, bordering on the unacceptable. An acute lack of staff resulted in an interminable wait, with nary a soul tendering our order or extending the courtesy of offering beverages for an agonizing fifteen minutes. Moreover, the adjacent couple endured an even more prolonged delay. It is truly lamentable that such an establishment, otherwise capable of excellence, should be hindered by subpar service, of all aspects."

"Upon reflecting on my experiences at this establishment, I must say that my expectations have been consistently disappointed. Despite my attempts to afford this location the benefit of the doubt, the recurring themes of subpar service and questionable cleanliness have rendered my efforts futile. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but be struck by the pervasive presence of litter and the general state of disrepair that seems to afflict the building itself. Furthermore, the prolonged waiting periods for both drive-thru and dine-in orders have led me to question the very notion of 'fast food' that this restaurant purports to provide. It appears that staffing issues are a persistent problem, as there are rarely sufficient employees on hand to manage the workload, resulting in an atmosphere of chaos and disorganization. My most recent visit proved particularly distressing, as I observed one of the kitchen staff exhibiting visible signs of poor hygiene, with what appeared to be open sores covering his arms. The interior of the restaurant was similarly disheveled, lacking any semblance of order or leadership. In light of these numerous deficiencies, I am genuinely astonished that this establishment continues to operate."

"Thus, we arrived at this establishment rather tardily, well after the witching hour, seeking those delectable, sugary treats known as donuts. We placed our order via the drive-thru window, and upon departing, discovered that our request had been botched. No major concern, as mistakes do transpire, so we maneuvered our vehicle around to the front of the building to rectify the situation. Upon inquiring about the possibility of exchanging the erroneous pastries, we were informed that the ones we had briefly possessed - for a mere three minutes, mind you - would be returned to the display case, to be purchased by an unsuspecting patron. It is fortunate indeed that we are not of the ilk who might surreptitiously sprinkle poisonous substances upon said baked goods, thereby potentially harming an innocent consumer."

"The taxi failed to materialize on two separate occasions, despite my having placed a call at an ungodly hour when it was highly unlikely that any other individual would be seeking their services, thereby rendering the likelihood of their absence being attributable to factors other than a lack of demand infinitesimally small. Suffice it to say, I was less than impressed with their performance and would not recommend utilizing their services in the future."

"My recollection of this golfing excursion is inextricably linked to the presence of the scorecard, which serves as a tangible reminder of the course's affordability and aesthetic appeal, particularly the imposing water feature that dominates the landscape. My fervent enthusiasm for discussing Kokopelli has led me to return to the course, only to be disillusioned by its underwhelming experience. A rating of 4 seems excessive, given the flat, straightforward layout devoid of formidable obstacles and the absence of cerebral stimulation required. In contrast, courses such as Superstition, Ken MacDonald, and Dobson offer a more engaging and challenging experience. Although I completed the round in less than three hours, shooting in the mid-70s, I cannot justify revisiting Kokopelli, especially when superior designs like Las Sendas, Southern Dunes, Foothills, Clubwest, and Ocotillo are available. As a discerning golfer with limited time, I must prioritize my choices and allocate my resources accordingly. Thus, I cannot condone playing at Kokopelli, even at a nominal fee of $5 per game."

My companions and I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary experience at this establishment, during which we encountered a savory liquid known as broth, the flavor of which was intensified by an excessive amount of salt. This unfortunate occurrence transpired on our second visit to this venue, and it is worth mentioning that the server responsible for delivering our nourishment erroneously attributed fault to my associates and me. Perplexed by the waiter's accusations, we merely sought to obtain the sustenance we had requested.

The quality of service provided by the staff left much to be desired, with the server displaying a remarkable lack of courtesy and respect towards us. In light of this, I would recommend dining at Lemon Grass instead, where the servers are friendly and the soup is prepared with fresh ingredients, untainted by monosodium glutamate.

$45 for two frozen machine margaritas and two shots of Sammy Hagar's low-quality, mass-produced tequila.  They print on receipt a suggested gratuity of $12.  This establishment emitted a pungent odor, suggestive of a potential sewage issue behind the bar, which left an unpleasant sensation in my oral cavity and prompted me to consider alternative musical preferences when encountering future performances by Sammy Hagar.

After indulging in an interlude of leisurely afternoons, awaiting the arrival of technical specialists who failed to materialize, my cyber connectivity was ultimately established, albeit with the subsequent revelation that my wireless network access would necessitate an additional financial obligation of $11 per mensem, lest I elect to procure an alternative router, which, upon the advice of a congenial technician, I opted to do. Following my acquisition of the aforementioned device, a telephonic conversation with Time Warner's customer service department ensued, during which I was apprised of an supplementary monthly tariff of $7, contingent upon utilizing my personally owned router. My sentiments regarding this corporate entity can be summarized as follows: deplorable, execrable organization; I wish upon the celestial bodies that the chief executives experience halitosis and their spouses abandon them for John Mayer.

This particular retail establishment purveying consumable comestibles and assorted household provisions happens to be the most proximate to my domicile; however, I make a concerted effort to refrain from frequenting said premises as often as feasible due to the exorbitant prices charged for the majority of their wares. Notwithstanding, I do occasionally patronize this store for select items such as milk, which they are unable to overcharge for, you see. The adjacent Fruterie boasts superior quality fruits and vegetables at markedly more reasonable prices, in addition to which, the staffing situation at this grocery store is persistently inadequate. During my last visit, I was subjected to an unsettling experience wherein the sales associate responsible for processing my transaction was observed blowing her nose without subsequent hand sanitization or utilization of antimicrobial foam, which were both readily available, and subsequently touched all of my purchases with her unhygienic hands. Needless to say, I found this state of affairs utterly revolting.

If I could bestow negative stars upon this salon, I undoubtedly would! My encounter with the proprietor, Eli, was nothing short of a calamitous debacle. I visited the establishment seeking highlights and extensions, but my expectations were utterly decimated by the abysmal service I received. My appointment lasted an unprecedented six hours, during which time Eli juggled my services with those of four other clients, callously neglecting my presence. Upon completion of his haphazard efforts, I hastened my departure, only to discover upon closer inspection that my highlights appeared yellowish in hue. When questioned about the absence of a toner, Eli denied its employment. Not only did he fail to rectify the issue, but he also refused to provide any semblance of compensation for the deficient coloration. Subsequently, my extensions began to deteriorate within a few days, prompting me to return to the salon for repair. Despite Eli's half-hearted attempts to mend the damage, my extensions continued to fall out at an alarming rate, necessitating yet another visit to a different salon to correct the problem. Following my futile endeavors to secure a refund for the subpar work and lack of dedication displayed by Eli, I was compelled to threaten legal action to recoup a mere fraction of the exorbitant fee he charged me. Ultimately, I reluctantly accepted a paltry refund of $150, months after the fact. Needless to say, I would never consider recommending this salon to anyone!

This establishment, without a doubt, exemplifies the pinnacle of inadequacy among all Corporate Starbucks I have had the misfortune of visiting. The level of service exhibited by the staff is utterly abysmal, characterized by an unacceptable delay in receiving my beverages and an egregious lack of cleanliness throughout the premises. Notwithstanding the aforementioned deficiencies, I persist in frequenting this location solely due to its proximity to my place of residence.  

In contrast, my workplace, located at the Starbucks in the Mandalay Bay adjacent to the House of Blues, upholds the same rigorous standards and values, despite its non-corporate status. Whenever I enter this particular branch, I am habitually disregarded during non-peak hours, and when my turn finally arrives, the staff tends to display an air of indifference, often engaging in personal conversations or appearing preoccupied with tasks unrelated to their primary responsibilities. The time required to prepare a single beverage stretches from five to ten minutes, contingent upon the extent of the baristas' distraction. Moreover, obtaining milk from the condiment bar proves to be an arduous task, with the milk frequently being past its expiration date or entirely absent.  

The drive-thru experience is equally unsatisfactory, as I have accumulated multiple rewards on my Starbucks cards, only to be ignored by the staff, who insist on charging me the full price. In summary, the workers at this establishment convey an attitude marked by rudeness and snarkiness, complemented by an inordinate amount of time spent on even the most straightforward tasks.

This show was awful.  I've been to many Cirque shows and I have no idea how they allow this show to exist.  There were minimal acrobatics, just a lot of toplessness and bad jokes.  That's $88 and 2 hours of my life I'll never get back.

"I am utterly speechless in articulating the utter ineptitude and unhelpfulness of the customer service I received from AMEX, who notified me of a potential fraudulent transaction on my account, only to discover that a taxi driver had erroneously charged me an exorbitant amount of $1,200 for a mere six-block journey; and upon contacting the customer service department to rectify the issue, the representative not only demonstrated a complete lack of empathy and understanding but also callously dismissed my concern by insisting that it was exclusively my responsibility to resolve the matter with my credit card issuer, thereby effectively abdicating any semblance of culpability or assistance on their part, leaving me no choice but to sternly advise against supporting such an unscrupulous enterprise."
Use to come here all the time! What happened? Very rude staff. Sat inside dust all over every where lamps etc. food does not carry the same quality! Sad to experience this... NEVER COMING BACK!!!!!

"My desire to derive pleasure from this establishment is irrevocably hindered by the remarkably subpar service, which sadly renders it an untenable proposition, particularly in light of the fact that, given the current economic climate, with a surfeit of individuals seeking employment opportunities, one would reasonably expect them to be capable of recruiting staff members possessing at least a modicum of competence."

The unsatisfactory experience we endured during our recent stay at this establishment was exemplified by a multitude of unacceptable aspects, including but not limited to, an unkempt and unhygienic environment, as evidenced by the presence of pubic hair and makeup stains on the supposedly clean towel provided, as well as a generally untidy and grimy ambiance within the room itself. Furthermore, our culinary expectations were not merely disappointed but thoroughly disillusioned by the subpar quality and service exhibited by three out of the three dining establishments situated on the premises. To further compound our dissatisfaction, we were regrettably subjected to the presence of an insect in our bed, which we have documented through photographic evidence. Suffice it to say, we shall not be returning to this hotel in the future, and we strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative accommodations.

"While the service itself was passable, the corn beef hash that accompanied my meal was utterly reprehensible, thoroughly marring an otherwise satisfactory dining experience; furthermore, the server, though polite in demeanor, appeared to be somewhat inept in addressing my concerns regarding the aforementioned culinary abomination, leaving me with the distinct impression that a plethora of superior alternatives exist in the immediate vicinity."

I would opt to maintain a considerable distance from this establishment, as my experience with the purchase of a pre-owned vehicle from them has been utterly unsatisfactory. Specifically, I acquired a 2007 Cobalt with approximately 80,000 miles on its odometer, which should have provided me with a reliable mode of transportation for an extended period. Unfortunately, the automobile in question succumbed to mechanical failure mere weeks after my acquisition, and I encountered numerous issues with its performance throughout the brief duration that I possessed it.

"The gastronomical portions served at this establishment are reprehensibly generous, bordering on the unethical. A tariff of $3 is levied upon patrons who opt to share their meals, which, upon careful consideration, may not be an unfair arrangement given the parity in quality and quantity between the dishes. Alas, the culinary offerings themselves leave much to be desired; the meat, in particular, is arid, flavorless, and aesthetically unappealing, relying on a meager pair of slices of bread to qualify it as a sandwich rather than a mere piece of desiccated bovine flesh. The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, however, is the chicken soup, a traditional comfort food turned abomination; a sickly yellow broth redolent of a recently dissolved powder or cube, with an overpowering salty tang that belies its otherwise lackluster flavor profile. It is quite vexing that this eatery enjoys such popularity, but then again, Las Vegas has always been a city where the improbable and the inconceivable are commonplace."

"My recent visit to this establishment was utterly disappointing, and I shall convey my sentiments in a succinct manner, as I have no desire to expend additional time or effort recounting the unpleasant experience. On a Saturday afternoon, I accompanied my spouse and her parents to this venue, which, while bustling, was not excessively crowded. My expectations, unfortunately, were not met, as numerous issues marred my dining experience. Firstly, upon ordering a bowl of soup, I received a measly cup devoid of the customary soup crackers. Following a prolonged search, I managed to locate a server who assured me that a fresh cup would be forthcoming; alas, it never arrived. Furthermore, my grilled chicken sandwich was served with fries that were not merely lukewarm, but actually cold to the touch. To add insult to injury, the grilled sourdough bread accompanying the sandwich was also unacceptably chilly. My dissatisfaction was duly communicated, and I declined any further sustenance or recompense. I must emphasize that even the prospect of dining at Denny's, a restaurant I do not particularly enjoy, would have been preferable to the distasteful experience I endured at this establishment. In conclusion, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise fiscal prudence and avoid this eatery altogether."
Whole Paycheck prices, over $400 for a small cart of food is absurd!  Vitamin products are full retail prices in most cases, buy online and you can save 50%!  Wayne Gorsek

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
The menu's brevity and the extra charges for ostensibly complementary elements such as cheese or salsa only serve to augment the already considerable disappointment engendered by the sluggishness of the service, which, in conjunction with the unremarkable quality of the tacos, makes for an unsatisfying dining experience that fails to justify the establishment's seemingly unmerited popularity, further compounded by the dearth of both indoor seating and adequate outdoor accommodations, relegating patrons to the meager confines of a few plastic chairs situated within the limited spatial constraints of the premises, thereby creating an ambiance reminiscent of a rustic, antiquated prison facility, albeit one where culinary requests are met with a modicum of efficacy, albeit belatedly, by a server ensconced behind a grill, an arrangement that does little to enhance the overall dining experience.

After being entreated by a fellow Yelper to elucidate, I shall now expound upon my recent dining experience at this establishment. Upon entering the eatery, we solicited a table for three individuals, including a minor, and were met with a response that could only be described as dismissive. The hostess, in what appeared to be an attempt at humor, replied in the negative not once, but twice. Her efforts at levity, however, fell flat, and it became apparent that she had little intention of actually accommodating us. We were eventually provided with a menu, albeit without any semblance of hospitality or warmth. Our server, who shall remain nameless, exhibited a similar lack of enthusiasm in attending to our needs, neglecting to collect our menus and displaying a countenance devoid of any trace of cordiality. It is worth noting that the quality of the food we consumed did not fare much better, with the Pollo Poblano Burrito falling short of expectations and the chicken tenders and Ceasar salads failing to impress. In light of these events, I feel compelled to express my dissatisfaction and will likely refrain from patronizing this establishment in the future. A word of caution to prospective patrons: peruse Yelp reviews judiciously before squandering a meal at this venue. Rest assured, my grievances shall be conveyed to the management forthwith.

If I were permitted to bestow merely a single "Worst of Yelp Awards," this particular stadium would undoubtedly be the recipient of such an unfortunate distinction. The sheer fact that approximately 10,000 enthusiasts attended the games hosted within its confines suggests that the logistical aspects pertaining to the National Championship contest held there were utterly chaotic and haphazardous, giving the impression that it was the initial occasion they had ever endeavored to organize.
 Problems abounded, and I am almost certain that I will inadvertently omit some of them in my enumeration that follows:
 1. A dearth of concession stands situated outside the stadium's parameters.
 2. Insufficient provision of consumables at internal concession booths, leading to a shortage of hot dogs, cups, and beverages, among other items, prior to the midpoint of the game.
 3. Security personnel stationed in the parking area displayed an excessive degree of belligerence towards attendees.
 4. An insufficient number of entrance points (merely four) to accommodate the substantial gathering of over 70,000 spectators.
 5. Diminutive jumbotrons, rendering visual observation of the game somewhat challenging for those seated at a distance.
 6. The stadium's public address system was barely audible, further contributing to the overall sense of disorganization.
 7. Refusal to display instant replays, followed by the exhibition of advertisements falsely implying that replays were being presented.
 8. A meager number of escalators serving the upper levels, with each one capable of accommodating only a solitary individual at a time.
 Considering these numerous deficiencies, it becomes evident that this stadium lacks the capacity to host a BCS game of even moderate proportions, and it is my sincere hope that it will be divested of the privilege forthwith.

As I am writing this review I have yet to see my food. We have been given complimentary chips & salsa. However, I have seen 2 other tables get their food before me. This is terrible service...please beware of this chili's as you will wait for food for it to be warm.

"It is my profound displeasure to recount the utterly deplorable quality of service I received during a recent visit to this establishment, which, regrettably, has rendered it necessary for me to express my extreme dissatisfaction in such unequivocal terms. Specifically, despite my having been led to expect a telephonic response from this office, I was left to languish in futility, awaiting an answer that never materialized. Furthermore, the personnel assigned to retrieve me from my place of lodging failed to manifest themselves, thereby necessitating my own arrangements for transportation. In light of these transpirings, I am constrained to aver that this office would be better served by a comprehensive overhaul and, in all likelihood, benefit substantially from a rigorous assessment of its operational protocols."

"They incurred a fee of \u00a32 for wireless internet connectivity, which I found to be exorbitant and utterly unacceptable, particularly in light of the fact that certain establishments have been known to provide complimentary access to such amenities. It is my conviction that any business that imposes charges for basic necessities such as bread, water, and internet connectivity will invariably receive unfavorable critiques. Furthermore, the quality of the culinary offerings and associated services at this establishment was merely mediocre, with prices that were neither exceptionally high nor low. It is worth noting that this location had previously been renowned for its exceptional quality approximately five years prior; regrettably, it appears that standards have declined precipitously since then."

AVIS epitomizes egregiousness with their exorbitant tariffs, callous disregard for customer satisfaction, and pernicious business practices that fleece unsuspecting patrons. Despite securing reservations well in advance, the "pay now" option, ostensibly more economical, ironically precipitated an unjustifiable $25 penalty upon cancellation, juxtaposed with the "pay later" alternative at the airport, which would have obviated such an unfair charge. Following a futile attempt to elicit a modicum of empathy or remedy through customer service, our experience unequivocally bespeaks a steadfast commitment to avoid future dealings with AVIS, and we caution others against succumbing to their Machiavellian machinations.

Only ordered from this place because it was convenient. Last 2 times was very disappointing. Probably will not go again.  Too many kids running the place with no visible manager to give them direction.  They forget about orders, don't care how they come out and really are going to take a good investment and ruin it for the manager/owner.  Try another place if you can help it.

"I have been an ardent patron of this establishment for an extensive period, and today, they incurred a lamentable lapse in their customary fastidiousness, misplacing a crucial string from my maternity shirt, thereby precipitating a profound sense of disillusionment and necessitating a shift in my allegiance towards a more reliable dry cleaner."

Ugh, if I could give this place a negative rating of ten stars, I most certainly would. What an unmitigated nightmare! To begin with, during my initial visit, I nearly ingested a large shard of plastic that was concealed within my salad. Then, to my utter dismay, the bartender nonchalantly exclaimed, "whoops," and carelessly discarded the contaminated beverage on the floor.  
Fast forward a couple of months, I decided to accord this establishment a second opportunity. (I must have been experiencing a temporary lapse of sanity due to extreme hunger.) Firstly, the bartender displayed blatant rudeness, sluggishness, and an utter lack of proficiency in mixology. My companion and I placed our orders, and approximately twenty minutes later, my friend's meal arrived. However, after an agonizing wait of nearly an hour, my pizza remained conspicuously absent. 
When I inquired politely about the status of my order, the surly bartender merely shrugged and retreated, leaving me ignored and irate. Following a prolonged period of waiting, someone finally deigned to speak with me, informing me that the manager was supposedly "indisposed." Eventually, after an interminable delay of one and a half hours, I received my mediocre pizza. 
My sincere gratitude extends to the kitchen manager for fulfilling their responsibilities and engaging in a dialogue with the clientele. Nonetheless, a stern reprimand is warranted for the bartender who worked earlier on New Year's Eve. They demonstrably lack the aptitude and customer service skills required for this line of work, and their continued employment would be utterly unjustified.

"Josh served as our aquatic maintenance specialist, yet his communication regarding his duties and actions surrounding our pool's upkeep were inadequate and often characterized by elaborate justifications or rationalizations when he deigned to speak at all. Following the instance wherein the pool's water appeared verdant, an analysis conducted at Leslie Pool Supply revealed an utter absence of chlorine within the liquid mere days subsequent to Josh's visit. When confronted with this evidence, he chose to discontinue his services without informing us for a period of two months, which we found profoundly unsatisfactory and indicative of an unprofessionally managed enterprise."

"Similarly, TAO Beach suffers from an inflated reputation, much like its nightlife counterpart. While the female patrons may enjoy complimentary admission, their male counterparts are burdened with a $20 cover charge. Upon my initial visit, I must admit that my expectations were elevated, primarily due to the captivating tunes emanating from the venue. The musical selection, characterized by a fusion of top 40 hits and electronic pop, proved to be quite appealing. However, one soon realizes that the ambiance is not worth the hefty price of admission. The space is minuscule, leaving little room for movement, and the audio can be enjoyed from the adjacent Venetian pool without incurring the additional cost. Furthermore, the absence of any unique features renders TAO Beach unworthy of a visit, unless one is able to secure a luxury cabana. My companions and I experienced a brief and unremarkable excursion, culminating in our swift departure. The sole redeeming quality of the establishment lies in the novelty bracelet bestowed upon patrons, which serves as a mild consolation for the disappointing experience. Essentially, TAO (club) shares the same shortcomings as its beachside counterpart - overcrowding, diminutive size, and an overall sense of disappointment. novice club-goers may find themselves drawn to the venue, only to be disillusioned by its subpar offerings. Nevertheless, the presence of attractive women lounging in the indoor tubs remains a notable attribute. In conclusion, TAO, in both its beach and club forms, falls short of expectations, save for a few scattered redeeming qualities."

This establishment is utterly deplorable! It is my conviction that the entire \"discounted\" notion they promote is merely a ruse designed to deceive individuals into believing they are making a frugal purchase! 

I ventured into Michael Kors in pursuit of a timepiece and was informed that the price was $350...the identical item is available at the store situated within Fashion Square for the sum of $275, and at Dillard's for an identical amount. Thus, refrain from attempting to persuade me that this is a genuinely discounted location. 

Furthermore, Charlotte Russe offers a buy-one-get-one deal for their footwear at the price of $12.50 per pair...whereas at their primary storefront, the cost is $15.50 for each pair. 

Moreover, the H&M located here shares identical pricing with its counterpart in Scottsdale. 

In conclusion, I have always harbored a certain level of skepticism towards outlet malls; however, this particular establishment takes the proverbial cake in terms of sheer ineptitude.

"The establishment's ambiance and operational efficacy are suboptimal, precipitating an unpleasant experience for patrons due to prolonged queuing times at both the fabric cutting and checkout areas, thereby hindering the expeditious completion of purchases and undermining the overall satisfaction of customers, particularly those with young children eager to engage in creative activities."

"Substandard patron assistance and sluggish staff comportment are prevalent at this establishment, as evidenced by my recent visit. Upon requesting that our server supplement our meal with an additional item, he demonstrated a lack of familiarity with the identity of our table attendant and departed abruptly, leaving us in a state of uncertainty regarding the fulfillment of his obligation. Furthermore, a considerable duration of time elapsed before we received our order, contributing to an overall unsatisfactory encounter."

"The impetus behind my inclination to utilize Yelp stems from an inherent desire for diversion and a reliance on the collective opinions of others in determining where to allocate my financial resources, thereby rendering it essential for me to contribute my personal encounters. My motivation does not involve obtaining complimentary items; rather, it is rooted in a genuine interest in sharing my experiences. Although infrequent, my negative appraisals are reserved for instances where the ambiance poses a potential health hazard, as was the case with Zoe's. Subsequently, a manager at Zoe's solicited my telephone number, expressing a desire to acquire further insight into my visit. Willing to divulge my encounter, I provided him with my contact information. Following a courteous conversation, he extended an apology and offered a gesture of goodwill in the form of a gift certificate, which I deemed superfluous yet appreciated nonetheless. However, upon furnishing him with my mailing address, a span of two weeks has elapsed without any tangible manifestation of the promised token. In light of this, I felt compelled to communicate with the customer service representative who had initially established contact with me, merely to inform her that the anticipated gift had not materialized. The extent of mismanagement within the organization has become glaringly apparent, prompting me to question the present state of Zoe's, the answer to which has become increasingly evident."

"The patrons who frequent this establishment display a propensity for animosity towards individuals who do not share their fervent enthusiasm for the Green Bay Packers football team, but we encountered an exceptionally hospitable server during our visit. This venue would be ideal for devotees of the Packers franchise, and their chicken wings were delectable."

"Upon reconsideration, my culinary inclinations impelled me to revisit this establishment, however, it proved to be an unfortunate choice. The salad I ordered was disappointing, to say the least, with limp, brown lettuce and an unappetizing shade of brown guacamole that bordered on rancidity. Furthermore, the dish was overpriced at more than ten dollars, which seemed exorbitant in comparison to neighboring eateries such as Gadzooks and Chipotle, where I could obtain a superior quality meal for several dollars less."

"It is my conviction that this establishment has been undeservedly lauded, prompting me to visit after witnessing its feature on 'Man vs Food.' Unfortunately, the quality of the crawfish served to us did not live up to expectations, as the minuscule portions were not only lacking in freshness but also appeared to be frozen. Our order of two pounds yielded a paltry amount of meat, with the majority consisting of the head and leftover skin. It is my belief that the restaurant's popularity can be attributed to its exposure on the aforementioned television program, however, I would advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative options, such as the buffet at Wynn, rather than squandering their resources on an unsatisfactory dining experience."

We visited this establishment on Labor Day 2014, entering the premises with the expectation of being promptly accommodated, only to be met with an ostensible paradox - an abundance of unoccupied tables, numbering no less than 20, yet we were informed that there was a 15-minute delay in seating, further compounded by the presence of multiple other patrons awaiting a table. Perplexed by this incongruity, I queried the hostess regarding the reasoning behind such a policy, to which she responded that the restaurant's reluctance to seat us was attributed to the presence of several sizable gatherings, thereby precluding them from accommodating additional customers. My previous experiences at this venue have been underwhelming, characterized by unremarkable cuisine reminiscent of a traditional diner, rendering it all the more imperative for the management to maximize occupancy and foster a positive patron experience, particularly given the intense competition within the local culinary landscape. Disillusioned by this encounter, I am disinclined to return and will instead seek alternative dining options.
Went here with some coworkers for lunch. Was not impressed with the pizza at all. The garlic bread tasted store bought. Will not return.

I arrived during the week preceding Thanksgiving, which customarily constitutes an off-peak season, thereby resulting in a relative dearth of crowds and a heightened sense of tranquility throughout Las Vegas.

Pros:

* My accommodations were remarkably silent, as I failed to detect even the slightest murmur emanating from neighboring rooms throughout my entire stay.
* The location of the hotel was ideal, as I have always preferred establishments situated removed from the central strip.
* The dÃ©cor was indeed captivating, and it was primarily owing to this factor that I opted to book a room at this particular hotel â?a decidedly unique and refreshing change of pace from the ubiquitous gambling dens and boisterous nightlife venues that proliferate the city. The ambiance was utterly serene, devoid of the pervasive din and revelry that often accompanies such locales.
* Complimentary parking and internet access were also provided, although I did notice a somewhat dubious charge totaling $100 upon checkout.

Cons:

* The youthful personnel responsible for check-in procedures appeared to be woefully lacking in both basic manners and customer service skills, their assistance being characterized by an extreme degree of unhelpfulness. Having booked my accommodations through Priceline and paid the entirety of the room fee well in advance, I was taken aback upon arrival by their demand for an additional $75 per night under the guise of âincidentals.â?This exorbitant charge struck me as patently absurd, particularly given that I had never encountered such an egregious fee at any previous hotel stay. Despite my protestations, the staff proved unsympathetic and wholly unwilling to offer any manner of assistance. Ultimately, I was able to cajole them into accepting a single payment of $75 for the initial night, with the understanding that I would settle the balance of $75 the following morning â?an arrangement that struck me as manifestly unfair, given that I had already paid for my accommodations in full. It is my firm conviction that such questionable business practices are highly detrimental to the reputation of any establishment.
* In light of the above, it is my strong recommendation that potential guests seek alternative lodging arrangements, as the prevailing attitude displayed by the hotelâs staff seems to be one of pervasive apathy and disinterest.

"My apologetic sentiments are conveyed in conjunction with the notion that this culinary establishment does not serve an authentic Pad Thai dish, as the gustatory experience was utterly disappointing and subpar, and furthermore, the hospitality we received was inadequate, as no staff member bothered to attend to our needs, necessitating my own efforts to seek out someone capable of presenting me with the invoice, thereby rendering any future visits to this eatery highly unlikely."

Jamba Juice, a purveyor of ostensibly salubrious beverages, was my destination of choice due to their prominently displayed concoction featuring an alluring visual representation; however, upon my arrival, I was dismayed to discover that two of the four essential components were conspicuously absent, thereby rendering my desired consumable unattainable; as such, I have resolved to abstain from patronizing said establishment in the future.

What do they fill the windshield washer bucket with? Swamp water? Port-a-potty \"juice\"? I'm all for recycling but this was so disgusting.  My husband spilled one drop on his shoe, and even though he wiped it immediately with some baby wipes we had in the car, it didn't matter.  As we drove away from the gas station I was noticing the skunk scent, I couldn't stand the smell.  I made him turn around and go to the grocery store bathroom to wash his shoe.  YUK!  Those shoes are going in the dumpster.

"The culinary delight known as pizza, while palatable, has been unfortunately accompanied by a series of unfortunate events pertaining to its delivery, which, regrettably, has transpired into an unmitigated disaster. Following the placement of an order via digital means at approximately 6:50 PM, the anticipated time of arrival was slated for 7:50 PM, a duration deemed excessive in light of the proximity of the establishment, Wolfman, being merely two miles from my domicile. Upon contacting the establishment at 8:00 PM, I was assured that the order had indeed departed the premises. However, subsequent communication at 8:20 PM revealed that the general manager had taken on the responsibility of delivering the pizza personally. Disturbingly, a subsequent telephone call at 8:50 PM, two hours subsequent to the initial order, divulged that the order had yet to be retrieved from the digital platform. This sequence of events underscores a flawed process and raises concerns regarding the veracity of information provided by employees, rendering it unwise to consider remote orders from Wolfman, thereby necessitating personal attendance or self-pickup to ensure successful procurement of the edible product."

"The Apple Store in question is seemingly ubiquitous in its subpar quality, particularly for American patrons. Its frequent visitation by foreign tourists in Las Vegas does not warrant disparagement, but rather serves as a salient factor in the store's divergent nature. The staff's indifference and lack of initiative are palpable upon entry, as an absence of welcoming personnel is commonplace. This phenomenon can be attributed to the employees' cognizance of the fact that tourists will purchase their products irrespective of the level of service rendered, thereby rendering superfluous any concerted attempt at customer satisfaction by both staff and management."

It is most certainly not Tacos El Gordo! I have visited this establishment on two separate occasions, with the initial visit being sufficient enough to satiate my culinary desires, thus rendering a trip to Tacos El Gordo unnecessary. However, my second visit, which took place during the same week, was an unfortunate disappointment. The woman stationed at the burrito area was engaged in a conversation in Spanish, uttering derogatory remarks, labeling us as foolish and intellectually challenged individuals. This was all precipitated by a warmed-up tortilla that she was compelled to discard. We placed an order for two burritos, and upon completion of the first burrito, I courteously requested that the order be altered to carne asada fries. At that point, she began speaking in a derogatory manner, unaware that I was able to comprehend her words. Consequently, everyone in the vicinity was laughin at us, and I subsequently ordered two tacos, one consisting of seso and the other made with cabeza. The gentleman informed me that I could simply pay for my order and he would retrieve it for me. Unfortunately, both tacos exuded a rancid odor and their taste was reminiscent of old, stale food. I did not consume them further. 
  It is truly lamentable that this series of unfortunate events transpired, primarily due to the actions of an older woman named Veronica, who worked at the burrito area and was responsible for throwing away a warmed-up tortilla. Her intentional actions led to the contamination of our food, which could have potentially caused food poisoning. This unpleasant experience occurred at the Tropicana location, and needless to say, we will not be returning to this establishment again. Moreover, we will not venture to try the other location.

These reviews are so right this is the worst store I have ever been to. There is a man who works there named Jason that is the rudest person I have ever met.  I have only found one sales person in there that knows what they are doing and has a good attitude.

"I would express a desire for an even lower rating, were it possible, in light of the fact that the absence of flour chips has rendered the establishment effectively indistinguishable from a plethora of other eateries serving similar cuisine; such an omission, in my opinion, significantly diminishes the dining experience, thereby warranting a designation commensurate with my profound disappointment."

The gastronomical experience that I had the misfortune of encountering during my recent visit to this establishment was, without a doubt, the most unpleasant and unsatisfactory since the advent of the new millennium, with the service being characterized by an unacceptable level of ineptitude and the filet mignon possessing an unfortunate similarity in texture and flavor to a piece of cardboard, leaving me feeling utterly disillusioned and disinclined to ever consider returning to this restaurant again in the future.

"It is imperative that you seek assistance from a different establishment, as my experience at this particular Goodyear location was utterly unsatisfactory and, quite frankly, unacceptable. Upon arriving at 7:30 am to replace my tires and undergo an oil change, I was met with a service writer who attempted to sell me his personal tires, which he had stored in the back of the shop. This should have been an indication to vacate the premises immediately. Despite being informed that the process would take two hours, I elected to wait in the lounge area. However, after four hours had elapsed and my vehicle was still elevated, I became increasingly agitated. Eventually, I received a complimentary transportation home, which somewhat alleviated my frustration. To my astonishment, once the service was completed eight hours later, they delivered my automobile to my residence. Consequently, I expressed my gratitude and offered a gratuity. Unfortunately, two months subsequent to this encounter, I traded in my vehicle, and the dealership revealed that the oil dip stick handle had broken off entirely. It is evident that the individuals at Goodyear intentionally severed it, cognizant of the fact that I would not be inspecting beneath the hood for an extended period. One can only speculate regarding the extent of their meddling with my car. I shall divulge my experience to all acquaintances to prevent similar occurrences."

"Upon each visit to this establishment, I invariably depart with the self-assurance that the inferior quality of their garments, in conjunction with the exorbitant prices, shall serve as a sufficient deterrent against any future patronage. However, I find myself inexplicably drawn to return, only to be met with an equally underwhelming experience. During my most recent excursion, Scott, the cashier who attended to me, displayed a striking lack of enthusiasm in his greeting, which was further compounded by his inability to accurately dispense change, opting instead to unload an assortment of coins and bills haphazardly into my hand. It is truly regrettable that such a prominent retailer would fail to prioritize the recruitment of staff members possessing even a modicum of professionalism."

I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions due to its proximity to my workplace and the convenience it offers for a quick lunchtime visit; however, I have decided to cease patronizing this business as the experience has consistently failed to meet my expectations. Firstly, the cramped and overcrowded waiting area lacks adequate seating or standing space, resulting in an uncomfortable and stressful experience for patrons. Furthermore, the nail technicians have exhibited a tendency to aggressively promote additional services during pedicures, which I find annoying and intrusive. My personal experiences with their pedicures have been disappointing as well; specifically, my last pedicure resulted in an improperly done pinky toe and an unexplained discoloration of my toenails, which turned yellow after a couple of weeks despite my lack of exposure to the sun. Moreover, my friend's gel manicure chiped shortly after leaving the salon, which raises concerns about the quality of their products and services. Considering these factors, I have decided to discontinue my patronage of this establishment and explore alternative options for my beauty needs.

Firstly, this establishment exuded sluggishness, wherein my takeout order, placed twenty-five minutes prior, was followed by an additional fifteen-minute wait. It was a Wednesday evening at seven o'clock, and the atmosphere did not convey the impression of being busy. Upon entering, I immediately approached the counter, where three individuals stoodâtwo elderly men and one woman operating the cash register. The two men were meticulously examining the orders, while the woman appeared preoccupied with an unidentified task. Not a single acknowledgment of my presence was offered, leaving me with an extended wait that felt excruciatingly prolonged, much like awaiting the completion of a microwaved popcorn bag.

Regarding the culinary offerings, I can condone subpar service if the food delivers an exceptional experience. In this instance, I requested six garlic knots and a large pepperoni and mushroom pizza. The garlic knots, measuring slightly larger than a quarter, were priced at two dollars and fifty cents, which seemed exorbitant. Their quality was average, at best.

The pizza itself elicited disappointment upon presentation. Its uniform, cookie-cutter appearance did not impress me, and its resemblance to frozen pizza raised concerns about its authenticity. A truly exceptional pizza would exhibit unique characteristics such as varied crust texture, visible bubbles, and distinct color variations. Alas, these qualities were conspicuously absent.

Furthermore, the flavors failed to impress. The crust lacked appeal, the sauce was nearly nonexistent, and the cheese and toppings seemed deliberately scant, as if profits took precedence over quality.

In conclusion, I feel utterly disillusioned and robbed of a satisfying dining experience. My disappointment is compounded by the fact that I will not be returning to this establishment, and I shall continue to drive past it without hesitation. Moreover, I will refrain from spending even a quarter, let alone another dime, at this restaurant, as the accompanying photographs demonstrate.

If I had the option to award them a rating of zero stars, I undoubtedly would, but in order to adhere to the parameters of the rating system, I shall confer upon them a solitary star. While I did appreciate their assortment of spectacles, the quality of service provided by their staff was subpar at best. My experience during the doctor's visit was satisfactory, however, I was merely seeking an answer to a straightforward inquiry: whether my prescription required an adjustment. Unfortunately, the final tally included charges for services beyond what I deemed necessary, resulting in my payment exceeding what I had anticipated. Furthermore, the spectacles I acquired were transition polycarbonate lenses, which functioned adequately for approximately a year before the transition film became riddled with minuscule fissures encompassing the entirety of both lenses. It is worth noting that the guarantee for their work only extended for a period of one year. Therefore, I caution prospective patrons against investing in transition lenses from this establishment. Prior to making a purchase, it is imperative to conduct thorough research. Transitions Optical, the creators of these lenses that darken in response to sunlight, emphasize the importance of obtaining a certificate of authenticity at the time of purchase, which serves as proof of the two-year warranty offered by Transitions Optical. Regrettably, I did not receive such a document. The numerous microscopic cracks that permeate my transition lenses create a blurred appearance, giving the impression that I am not wearing corrective eyewear at all. In light of these circumstances, I would strongly advise against conducting business at this location. Despite my continued fondness for the frames, I shall seek alternative sources for the replacement of my lenses and ensure that the level of customer service is superior, should any issues arise in the future.

"It is with profound dismay that I must recount the utterly unpleasant sushi experience I recently endured, characterized by a multitude of unfortunate events, including, but not limited to, the discourteous behavior of the hostess, the breakage of both toilet seats in the restroom, and the application of adult prices for my 10-year-old son, who, due to his advanced height, appeared to the staff to be of a more mature age, despite their failure to disclose the policy until prompted, and further exacerbated by the unjustified imposition of an 18% gratuity charge, which, upon subsequent investigation, proved to be illegal; thus, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise extreme caution and vigilance when dining at this establishment."

Despite the plethora of unfavorable evaluations proffered on this platform, my proximity to the establishment and yearning for poultry-based culinary delights prompted me to indulge in a visit. Opting for the combination platter featuring both winged and tendered fare, my expectations were regrettably left unfulfilled, as the former exhibited an unfortunate resemblance in taste and texture to pulped paper products, while the latter possessed an unpleasant flavor reminiscent of footwear that had been exposed to an extended period of time in close proximity to a moist environment. Furthermore, the menu item designated as "fries" proved to be merely mediocre in quality. The entire dining experience was utterly disappointing and detrimental to my cardiovascular health due to the excessive quantity of grease employed in its preparation.
By far the slowest Jiffy Lube I have ever stopped at. Thought I would be in and out in a few minutes because no one was in front if me but it took over an hour.

I made the decision to patronize this establishment based on the favorable evaluations it had received on the popular review platform, Yelp; however, my expectations were not met, as the dining experience turned out to be a considerable letdown. Upon entering the premises, my initial reaction was one of utter disbelief and bewilderment, as the ambiance and aesthetic appeal of the interior design were glaringly deficient. Furthermore, the culinary offerings that were presented before me and my significant other were equally unimpressive and lackluster, rendering our meal an unremarkable and unappetizing experience. Consequently, I would not consider returning to this restaurant in the future.

"My associates and I have had the pleasure of visiting the San Diego establishment of Hash House A Go Go on multiple occasions, and we have been effusive in our praise of its culinary offerings and exceptional service ever since. However, our experience at the Las Vegas (Quad) location was somewhat disappointing, as the ambiance and demeanor of the staff were lackluster, which was particularly surprising given the lively atmosphere one might expect from a Vegas venue. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we waited for nearly 20 minutes before a server approached our table, and while our elderly waiter was quite friendly, the overall dining experience was unremarkable, with food that failed to meet the standards set by the San Diego location. It is truly unfortunate that this particular Hash House A Go Go did not live up to our expectations, as it is evident that the San Diego site is vastly superior."

The noontide respite had been accomplished, and an assortment of comestibles and potables were promptly presented at the designated location. The attendant was affable, yet when it came time to settle the bill, a curious dearth of personnel materialized, leaving me to deposit the funds on the table and depart, thereby missing the bus and necessitating a further wait of twenty minutes, much to my chagrin.

When you first walk in it looks like you're about to have a great experience. However I was highly disappointed. First of all they UNSANITIZED tools on me. I was charged for a glitter that I didn't even want AND my gel nail polish chipped the next morning!!! I was not happy to pay $60 for a gel mani and a regular pedicure that didn't even last 24 hours. The one positive thing I can say is that they were extremely friendly.

(Bald) Bartender, manifestly discourteous. This review would be excessively protracted if I itemized our dialogue. I interacted with a manager, regarding his "conduct" toward us. The manager offered an apology and purchased us a beverage. That was considerate of him, but I aspire for the bartender to refine his "interpersonal" proficiencies.

The establishment was not overly crowded, approximately an hour subsequent to a Dbacks match. We did not consume any culinary offerings. I have been apprised of the superior quality of their fare. Baldy Bartender generated a negative ambiance, precluding us from prolonging our visit. I possessed minimal inclination to request the bartender alter the television station, laugh out loud.

Was unable to procure a last-minute booking at Craftsteak, which I hold in high esteem, during my sojourn in Las Vegas, thereby necessitating a reluctant visit to Delmonico.

The level of service provided was satisfactory, as anticipated, yet lacked the warmth and cordiality that fosters a genuine connection between patron and server, leaving me with an unfulfilled desire for a more convivial dining experience.

My culinary preferences lean towards the tenderer side, and unfortunately, the rib eye failed to meet my expectations in terms of marbling and overall tenderness, rendering it difficult to fully appreciate its flavor profile.

Given the abundance of alternative steakhouses in the vicinity, Delmonico's shortcomings are further highlighted, thus making it unlikely that I shall return in the future.

This particular buffet was one of the more costly dining experiences I had the pleasure of indulging in during my stay in Las Vegas, with a price point of $21 per individual for a Monday evening meal, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations in terms of quality and value. In contrast, a comparable dining establishment located in close proximity, specifically the 4 Queens, offered a superior culinary experience for a significantly lower price point of $9.

"Expressing my sentiments regarding the quantity of comestibles presented, I must aver that, upon my initial visit as a customer, I was not particularly enthralled by the culinary offerings. While the fare was palatable, it lacked a certain je ne sais quoi, a quality that would have elevated it to the realm of the truly exceptional. Instead, it seemed rather unremarkable, evoking a sense of familiarity akin to dining at an establishment akin to Olive Garden, but with a certain amplified quality that detracted from the overall experience."

For being so patriotic and the \"All American\" that TK portrays himself to be, it's a wonder that I Love This Bar & Grill can tout they are a love of...well, anyone's. Went to see Rev. Horton Heat (which was quite great) here on Thursday which is why I give it the 2nd star. However, I was shocked to discover that PBR's were $5 a can and a well rum and diet was an eye-popping $8! I cannot judge the food...nor will I ever...as I will not return to this establishment ever again. From the looks of it, the food resembled Applebee's, the bartender didn't seem to know his a$# from a hole in the ground and the prices kept fluctuating throughout the night. Bad service, bad drink prices, Good entertainment (bonus) but overall rip-off.

I genuinely aspired to thoroughly enjoy this establishment, however, my experiences during my two visits were underwhelming. Upon requesting a beverage, specifically water, the server's insistence on adding a lemon was perplexing, as the water's quality was subpar. Moreover, my enthusiasm for their Kreplach soup was short-lived due to its mass-produced, uniform appearance, lacking the authenticity of handmade pasta.
