Perhaps my expectations were skewed due to my familiarity with Pike Place Market. Additionally, the venue itself was unexpectedly diminutive in scale, which was surprising given the region's temperate climate and the resulting abundance of fresh produce available for cultivation throughout the year."

After an abundance of initial acclaim on Yelp, I opted to partake in a culinary excursion to Nourish, eager to sample the fare that this purportedly health-conscious eatery had to offer. As an individual who does not adhere to a vegetarian, vegan, glucose-free, or lactose-free dietary regimen, yet still maintains a penchant for delectable and nutritious cuisine, Nourish appeared to cater to a specific niche that was previously unfulfilled in the local dining scene, with True Food being the sole comparable establishment that came to mind. Unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely met, as certain aspects of the dining experience fell short of my standards. Specifically, the unremarkable taste of their plain water prompted me to appreciate the variety of flavored waters available, while the salads, though undoubtedly flavorful, were minuscule in portion and priced unreasonably high. In contrast, the sandwiches presented a relatively better value, although superior options are readily available at numerous other establishments. Furthermore, the "air-fried" sweet potato fries, while satisfactory, failed to surpass their conventional counterparts in terms of quality, raising questions about the necessity of specifying such a detail. Notwithstanding, the accompanying dipping sauce deserves commendation for its delectability. The ambiance of the restaurant exuded a sense of comfort and relaxation, and the service was indeed impressive. However, the crux of a successful dining venture lies in the quality of the food, which, unfortunately, did not inspire me to consider a future visit.

My husband had the new 5-cheese Mac and Cheese with chicken. Looked pretty good and he said it was tasty.\n\nI however had the tried-and-true baby back ribs. Awful! Very dry to the point the meat was very cooked down and the ends were all but burned. They didn't even try to cover it up with globs of bbq sauce, which is a common stunt. Very BLEH... Won't ever get the ribs there again and highly dis-recommend them from others. Ew.

I really wanted to like this place because I have a soft spot for diners and dives (not so much drive ins). And this place has the traditional diner set up on the inside located in an area of town (the Melrose) that I'm really rooting for to turn into something truly special (it's already pretty cool). But, I just didn't like the food. I ordered the breakfast sandwich which was eggs, sausage and cheese on a croissant. The croissant was ehhh ok. The eggs/sausage/cheese was greasy and not very flavorful. It came with a side of potatoes which were also pretty m'eh. I'll give this one another shot at some point.

Wait staff and service was good.  My steak was excellent (Tabasco peppered Kobe flank). My friends duck was mediocre and the fat was not rendered. We didn't have time to wait for a fix so she just ate it.  The sides with it were good. The worst part of the experience was the fact that they charged $5 for hot water. 35 for mediocre duck and 40 for a steak.  I find charging for hot water ridiculous.

This store is like a Mega store. Maybe they are a little bit over they head because sadly the meats are not the best. They have meat on sale for 3 and 4 bucks and its coloring is brown to black. Meat should be Red. I will shop here but I will stay away from the meat. If you can get pass that the store is really ok.

Just had the worst experience ever at Picture People in Henderson Nevada. The white background of my photos show the scuff marks of the backdrop, they did a shoddy job of cropping, only allowed me a certain number of photos to go on my disk (nowhere in writing does it say I only get \"x\" number of photos), refused to give me a price sheet because \"we just know the price of and tell customers the price\", and above all refused to accept my coupon for $20 off a $100 purchase because they said it excluded the CD...umm... once again nowhere in writing does it say \"excludes the photo CD\"! The best part is the manager was the individual I was dealing with!! If it werent for the fact that my husband very nicely asked me to just woosah the situation I would have flipped out....Now I am just looking at the photos crying. I am definitely going to tell everyone I know not to waste their money.... 100% satisfaction guarantee my butt!   \n\nI gave them 2 stars because Portia was an amazing photographer and was very interactive and animated with my 3 month old to get her to smile

Once again, the culinary establishment within the Station Casino premises has undergone a transformation in ownership and management, with the previous entity known as Guadalajara ceding its operational responsibilities to a new proprietorship under the name of Cabo. 
  Upon conclusion of my work-related duties on a recent Friday evening, my fiancÃ© and I opted to partake in a visit to the aforementioned eatery, primarily motivated by my desire to indulge in a celebratory alcoholic beverage, specifically a margarita, in commemoration of the successful completion of my training program. 
  Unfortunately, our experience at the restaurant was marred by an excessive amount of waiting time, as we were forced to endure prolonged delays in the provision of various essential elements of our dining experience, including the arrival of the hostess, the distribution of chips, and the servicing of beverages, resulting in a considerable delay before the gratification of our thirst and hunger. Moreover, I failed to receive a glass of water that I had requested, prompting me to consume my fiancÃ©'s beverage instead, and no offer was made to replenish our depleted supply of chips. 
  The young woman tasked with attending to our table appeared visibly overwhelmed by the demands of her role, while the supporting staff member, referred to as a 'busboy,' proved to be of minimal assistance in addressing our concerns. 
  Notwithstanding the aforementioned deficiencies in service, the quality of the edibles we consumed was merely average, with the exception of my margarita, which was expertly blended and presented a most satisfying taste experience. Additionally, we received complimentary sopapillas as per the restaurant's policy for checking in, which we elected to take away for subsequent consumption. 
  It remains a mystery as to why Station Casinos persist in altering their dining establishments, but it is evident that this particular transition did not result in an improvement in the overall dining experience. The sole reason for my potential return would be to sample another raspberry margarita, as it was truly the highlight of the evening.

"The quality of service is exceptional, the beverages are quite satisfactory, yet the culinary offerings are merely adequate. Specifically, the stuffed peppers and dates stand out as the most delectable options on the menu. Nonetheless, a pervasive odor akin to that of a soiled dishrag permeates the entire eatery, raising concerns regarding the overall cleanliness and hygiene of the establishment."

Beer is ok.

Food...meh.

After watching more restaurant rescue shows than are healthy I should have learned a long time ago that any place with a menu the size of a phone book does mediocre food at best.  BJs is no exception to this rule.

The menu appeared to be heavy on pizza like products so I figured going that direction was the best bet...so I ordered a flat bread.  It was supposed to have tomatoes, cheese and sausage.  Tomatoes, yes.  Cheese, yes.  Sausage...not so much.  There were a few (and I mean a few, sausage piece like substance on the flat bread, but I wouldn't say it was enough to qualify as saying the flat bread had sausage.

As for the bread part of the flat bread it was crispy in parts and soggy in parts.  Overall not a good effort.

So assuming you can't make the most prominent thing on your menu (pizza like products) well it is fair to assume that the products on the other 90 pages of the menu (yes an exaggeration...its probably only 12 pages long) are, in all likelihood, mediocre also.

We indulged in a culinary excursion during the final evening of Restaurant Week, unbeknownst to us prior to our arrival, and were presented with a constrained bill of fare, which unfortunately did not showcase the gastronomical prowess of the establishment. My spouse's initial course, consisting of pork bellies, was excessively greasy, rendering it inedible, while his primary dish, a rather unremarkable cod, lacked flavor and depth. My own main course, sea bass, was cooked beyond the optimal doneness, resulting in an unpleasant texture and an absence of freshness. However, the concluding portion of our repast, the dessert, proved to be the sole redeeming feature of our dining experience. Our server, possessing extensive knowledge and a warm demeanor, was a bright spot amidst an otherwise underwhelming encounter. Despite the accolades bestowed upon the restaurant, our inaugural visit, marred by mediocrity, left us uninspired to return.

I spent a good three hours studying. Besides having a great facility for wifi, seating, and noise level, the service could use a lot of work. If you're in the service industry, people who apply for this jobs should be mindful that they will be working with people. In other words, they can be more friendly and cheerful no matter how difficult it may be. Other than that, I did enjoy my peach green tea lemonade.

The food is good, but how hard it is to make good Italian food - after all, even the O Garden can get that right. But this place believes itself to be "exceptional Italian food" (which is obvious from the exorbitant prices they charge) and it is not even close. No originality, just another offering of the same tired old foods that every other place is making. 

This is a prime example of what has become a scourge in Vegas eateries of late - high cost, low atmosphere, mediocre cuisine offerings - where people with more money that taste go because they know nothing more about food except the belief that "the more it costs, the better it must be".

Oh and then there was the WORST greeting any bartender could EVER utter:   "I'll be with you in a minute!"   Could I mean any less to them? If I wasn't meeting somebody, I would have walked out.

During my most recent visit, I had a subpar experience, which was unfortunately marred by several unpleasant discoveries. Specifically, upon consuming my chicken curry, I noticed an unsettling presence of errant strands of hair, which I promptly captured in a photograph for evidentiary purposes. Furthermore, the naan bread served alongside the curry was remarkably flat and dry, lacking the customary fluffiness and texture that one would reasonably expect from such an item. Additionally, the chicken in the curry was not particularly abundant, which only contributed to my overall disappointment. However, it is worth mentioning that the establishment offered a diverse array of dishes, some of which were admittedly quite palatable. Unfortunately, the prices charged for this culinary experience were somewhat prohibitive in comparison to similar buffet-style restaurants in the area, leaving me uncertain about the likelihood of my future patronage.

This place was a bit of a disappointment. Sure, it's a nice little restaurant in St. Mark's Square at the Venetian, the ambiance in nice, but the experience was not so good.

Service was slow and spotty. When we were seated, the waitress told us she was sending out water. Said water didn't arrive until we had received our meals and drinks, and only after we asked our waitress about it again. When we were offered parmesan on our food, the man who asked just walked away and vanished. We had to flag down or waitress to get it, who was noticeably absent throughout the evening. She then proceeded to absent-mindedly drop a huge chunk of cheese on the table, only to leave it there throughout the meal.

Food was alright and came out very quickly, though it was almost too quickly, as if it had already been prepared before we ordered it. 

After the whole experience, I would probably not come back. There are many other restaurants nearby to choose from (it is Vegas, after all).

Arrowheads Applebee's is much more enjoyable! Went to karaoke last night an it was so horrible. The dj and his crew sang most of the songs :/ there were some families after 11... I thought there had to be an age limit to be in the bar after 10? There were some annoying high school girls screaming spice girls... Help me!!!!

This establishment undoubtedly offers exceptional yogurt, particularly the oatmeal cookie variant, which stands out as the most superior option among their extensive array of flavors. However, their customer service approach significantly hinders the overall experience, as they opt for distributing samples by hand rather than maintaining easily accessible sample cups. I endured an agonizing wait of over five minutes to receive a solitary sample from the indifferent employee, who barely acknowledged my presence with a cursory greeting. Upon presenting the price, he concluded the transaction with a brusque demeanor, omitting even the most basic expressions of gratitude or well wishes. Needless to say, I won't be revisiting this location, considering the underwhelming encounter I had.

I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, and my experiences have been overwhelmingly positive. However, my most recent visit was not up to par, primarily due to the absence of the sole English-speaking staff member. As a result, communication proved to be a significant challenge. In the past, I have consistently requested the services of Andy, as his proficiency in massage therapy has been exceptional. Unfortunately, he was preoccupied during my visit, and I was attended to by one of the female therapists instead. It is worth noting that the therapists present appeared to be engaged in conversation amongst themselves, which created a distracting environment. Furthermore, the lady who administered my massage seemed hurried and irritable. This combination of factors resulted in a less than satisfactory experience. Following my massage, I made my way back to the restroom, whereupon I observed a male individual being escorted into a secluded back room with a door. This sight piqued my curiosity and raised concerns regarding potentially illicit activities. I must emphasize that I do not condone such behavior and am currently undecided about whether I shall return to this establishment in the future.

"Underwhelmed, to say the least. Contrary to my expectations, I was part of a considerable gathering, thereby rendering my experience somewhat unremarkable. My tardiness, coupled with the fact that my fellow diners had already placed their orders, likely contributed to the server's lack of attention towards me. Upon requesting a beverage and food menu, I was merely presented with the former, and the server's subsequent visits to the opposite end of the table did not alleviate my thirst. It was only after an extended period of time had elapsed and one of my companions brought it to the server's attention that I was still eager to peruse the menu that I was finally able to place an order. Regrettably, by the time I had the opportunity to sample the culinary offerings, my fellow patrons had already devoured their meals. My selection, the apocalyptic pork with a side salad, fell short of my gastronomic expectations. The absence of moisture and flavor left much to be desired, and the haphazard placement of the aioli on the plate only served to further disappoint. The meat, too, was problematic, as it disintegrated effortlessly, necessitating the use of cutlery to consume it properly. In hindsight, I would have been better off opting for the soup."

"Two stars for the frozen hot chocolate, a culinary indulgence that elicited a profound sense of satisfaction, albeit accompanied by an unfortunate concatenation of events that transpired during the dining experience, specifically pertaining to the temporal duration between our arrival and the moment we were seated, which exceeded thirty minutes; the interval between requesting hydration and its actual delivery at our table, which amounted to fifteen minutes; and the additional quarter hour spent awaiting the taking of our orders, resulting in a cumulative delay of forty-one minutes before the consumption of sustenance, which, regrettably, did not meet expectations, falling short of excellence while failing to justify mediocrity, thus prompting the decision to circumvent the conventional dining protocol by opting to place future orders at the window, thereby eliminating the need for a reserved table and streamlining the process, all in pursuit of that delectable frozen hot chocolate."

I stayed at the Rio with a conference in July. It was dirty, musty, mildewed, the pool was closed a lot during normal hours of operation, the food was okay. The game floor was run-down, dirty, stinky (like someone crapped their pants-all the time). The elevators were often crowded and we had to wait in a mob to get on an elevator. There were always long lines at reception and concierge. We were there on weekdays. The shuttle services was poor - always waiting for the second or third shuttle to pick us up from the strip to come back. A cab would've been easier and worth the money. We had a great rate but it was similar to better kept hotels on the strip.  I would not ever stay there again with all of the other options in Vegas. I only stayed because of the conference or I would've changed hotels after the first night.

Maybe because it's a new location they have not got the kinks worked out yet.  We sat in the bar area.  The server took almost 30 mins to come back to take our order after we told him we wanted to order food.  We shared the general Li's dish and asked them to split it.  They just brought  an extra plate.  That's okay, but actually placing the meal on two separate plates would have been a nice extra step and a lot less messy for us.  They were a little stingy with the rice, too.  Not really enough for the rest of the ingredients to balance out the soy sauce, so it turned out too salty.  Tip: ask for extra rice.

"The culinary experience was rather unremarkable, as the dishes we sampled did not deviate significantly from the ubiquitous Chinese fare commonly found in strip malls throughout the region. Specifically, the kung pao chicken lacked any distinguishing characteristics, save for an abundance of celery, which seemed to be an integral component of the dish. Similarly, my wife's cashew chicken appeared visually indistinguishable from my own dish, with the sole exception being the presence of nuts, which served as a faint differentiator between the two entrees."

lame routines and mediocre dancing. I'm sure dancing topless was their aim to distract viewers from noticing the sub par dancing. Holly never speaks a word, and this black chick and white dude do all the singin and talking.  For 113 the view would be pretty good, but for 85 the view is hardly worth going for.  Still 113 for dancing tits is debatable. I couldn't  understand why everyone was so pumped to see this show, and even more so when holly showed her boobs, or someone did something sexy.  sorry fake boobs and small b cups just didn't impress me.  save your money go see La Reve at the wynn.. amazing just like the wynn ;)

"I possess an immense fondness for Pottery Barn, to an enormous extent. Their assortment of furniture exudes timelessness and durability, comprising robust, solid materials that transcend fleeting veneers. As an ardent devotee, I conduct a rigorous examination of each piece by vigorously shaking it; if it exhibits even the slightest movement, I promptly proceed to the next item, as I seek furniture that exudes sturdiness and indestructibility. 

Notwithstanding my profound admiration for their products, I have assigned a rating of two stars to this specific establishment, and the primary reason for this lies in the realm of customer service, specifically, the behavior of the store manager. It bears a resemblance to the scenario depicted in the film Pretty Woman, where Julia Roberts' character encounters discriminatory treatment due to her appearance. Similarly, I have experienced dismissal in favor of more affluent-looking patrons, despite my genuine desire to furnish my newly inhabited abode gradually. Hence, I opt to peruse the display models on the floor and procure my desired items from either Pottery Barn Henderson or through online means. 

In my line of work, it is crucial to refrain from judging individuals based on their external appearance. Instead, it is essential to treat all clients with familial warmth and respect, thereby fostering a reciprocal sense of belonging and loyalty."

"Motivated by curiosity, I opted to sample the culinary offerings of this establishment, despite its modest patronage, consisting merely of two other customers within its confines. The hospitality of the waiting staff was indeed commendable, as they exhibited an attentive and affable demeanor, contributing to the overall appeal of the eatery's ambiance. The clam chowder, in particular, proved to be a gastronomic delight, worthy of praise. However, my order of Angel Hair pasta, accompanied by a Marinara sauce, fell short of expectations, as its flavor profile was found wanting, lacking the depth and richness one would anticipate from such a dish. Furthermore, upon attempting to combine the pasta and sauce, I observed an excessive amount of liquid at the bottom of my bowl, which, ideally, should have been drained from the cooking vessel, thereby preventing a soggy, unpalatable outcome. My dissatisfaction with the dish prompted me to return it, and while my child's cheese pizza was adequate, it failed to impress. Of greater concern, though, was the fact that, despite the waiter bringing my concerns to the attention of the proprietor (who appeared to be the individual in question), no effort was made on his part to address the issue directly with me, leaving an indifferent impression. Although the problematic dish was removed from my bill, and the owner bid me farewell upon my departure, the absence of a personalized apology or explanation left me with a lingering sense of disinterest in revisiting the establishment."

"Visited Ditka's establishment and enjoyed a delectable culinary experience, with the gastronomical offerings being of superior quality. Specifically, the shrimp cocktail was expertly prepared and presented, while the pork chop was cooked to perfection. Additionally, the burgers were flavorful and satisfying, and the dessert menu offered a diverse selection of sweet treats that catered to various tastes. It is evident that the head chef has a proficient grasp on the culinary arts, as the dishes were executed flawlessly. However, our server failed to meet the standards expected of such a fine dining establishment, as numerous issues plagued our dining experience. Firstly, one member of our party arrived prior to the rest and was forced to wait an unacceptable ten minutes before being acknowledged by the wait staff. Furthermore, beverages took an inordinate amount of time to arrive, and the server seemed to forget that a beer was requested, only to materialize ten minutes later. The absence of bread was also glaring, and requests for refills on drinks were met with sluggishness. Disappointingly, our dinner orders were not accurately recorded, resulting in the omission of a salad from our meal. Although the meal was complimentary, the subpar service left much to be desired, especially considering the substantial cost of the bill, totaling $100.25. In upscale restaurants, patrons should never have to request basic amenities; period. While the cuisine at Ditka's merits a rating of 2.5, the unsatisfactory service unfortunately detracts from the overall experience. For optimal results, consider dining in the bar area, where the waitstaff is reportedly more attentive and efficient, and dinner specials are available that are not offered in the main dining room."

"While it may have been accorded an elevated status by some, this production fails to deliver an optimal theatrical experience, with mediocre humor, an underwhelming stage design, and a general sense of antiquation that permeates the entire performance. Consequently, I found myself mentally disengaging from the show midway through, rendering the second half of the production a tedious and unfulfilling experience. Therefore, I would advise against prioritizing this show as the sole entertainment option during a visit to Las Vegas, unless, of course, the ticket is complimentary and the prospect of participating in the audience-interactive elements, such as playing with oversized beach balls, holds significant appeal."

I've eaten at Hubbard Ave Diner many times.  Great pie, good service, average food, really inconsistent execution by the kitchen.  If they aren't busy, you've got a good chance to have your order arrive correct (as in get what you ordered as you ordered it) and hot.  If they are busy, forget it.  They really need to have an expediter in the kitchen.

"Consequently, the majority of my critiques will be predicated upon the culinary prowess and flavor profile of the edibles. I don't encounter exceptionally poor or remarkable service with great frequency; most instances fall within the realm of mediocrity. Now, onto the assessment proper. The initial bread offering was quite delectable, albeit its appeal waned in light of the fact that it constituted the pinnacle of the meal. A considerable portion of our party opted for pasta, which, in my case, was remarkably lacking in flavor (I had the creamy garlic chicken variety). I found it necessary to supplement it with an appreciable amount of sodium, a practice I rarely engage in. My betrothed's fresh tomato mozzarella pasta dish was similarly unimpressive, with the tomatoes displaying a glaring dearth of taste. The sole item among our sextet that elicited favorable comment was the chopped gorganzola salad. In light of the fact that I would prefer to support a locally owned establishment over a chain, I must confess that, given the option, I would opt to dine at Olive Garden instead."

My maiden visit to this establishment transpired last weekend, and regrettably, it failed to live up to my expectations. Following the placement of my order, an appreciable duration of time elapsed before its procurement. Subsequently, upon the arrival of our culinary selections, my order was inaccurate. By the time the kitchen staff rectified the error and delivered a corrected version, my fellow patrons had already concluded their repasts, necessitating that I consume my breakfast ex situ. The server, having removed the check from our table, neglected to proffer any form of compensation or apology for the inconvenience I had endured. Notwithstanding the palatable quality of the fare I managed to consume, I shall not be returning to this dining establishment, as the overall experience left much to be desired. In situations where a restaurant's blunder precludes a patron from savoring their meal in the company of their table, it behoves the management to offer some manner of recompense for the inconvenience incurred.

"My culinary preferences do not include burritos that have been subjected to moisture, as it utterly negates the fundamental purpose of said burrito. During a recent visit to an establishment that specializes in such fare, I was taken aback by the staff's insistence on exposing my unfinished burrito to heat via an oven, followed by their assertion that any additional ingredients could only be applied to the surface of the aforementioned burrito. Suffice it to say, I nearly departed the premises without consuming my underwhelming burrito, which consisted of mediocre chicken, rice, and cheese, and cost me a whopping twelve dollars."

We indulged in a morning repast at this establishment during our leisurely sojourn, despite the fact that I did not select the venue myself, having heard favorable opinions about it prior to our visit. However, upon experiencing it firsthand, I found it to be merely satisfactory, lacking the exceptional quality and memorability that I typically associate with establishments not affiliated with large corporate chains. My dining companion and I both opted for the eggs benedict, albeit with an avocado-based variation in my case, which, while offering a pleasant departure from the standard iteration, failed to live up to the elevated expectations generated by the menu's description. The remaining members of our party appeared to enjoy their meals without issue, selecting salads and skillet dishes as their preferred options. 
  Our waiting time was not excessively prolonged, yet I felt annoyed by the presence of unsupervised young children roaming the premises, and the service we received left room for improvement, particularly in regards to the considerable delay I experienced in receiving my coffee, a crucial component of my daily routine that I find essential to my overall satisfaction. While I would not consider this restaurant to be exceptional, I do not foresee myself returning in the future.

I entered this establishment with elevated anticipations, courtesy of a personal endorsement, and unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled. Following the culmination of the evening's prime dining period, I opted to procure a to-go order, and although the personnel were amiable, their demeanor conveyed a certain lack of enthusiasm towards their occupational responsibilities. The venue itself featured both interior and exterior seating arrangements, which proved to be a welcome aspect.

I placed an order for two vegetarian sandwiches, tailored to accommodate my vegan sibling's dietary preferences, and as a vegan novice, I took great care to request that the dressing and cheese be served separately. Upon arriving home, I was dismayed to discover that both components had been included in the side salads. Furthermore, a hair was discovered in my salad, which somewhat diminished my appetite. The sandwich itself was passable, albeit slightly soggy, and its flavor profile was satisfactory.

Despite my underwhelming experience, I may consider returning to this establishment if I happen to be in the vicinity.

"Prepare to expend a considerable amount of currency at The Shoppes, where an extra 'e' has been added to the name for an added touch of sophistication and refinement. This upscale shopping center boasts high-end retailers such as Barneys New York, Coach, and Burberry, catering to the affluent clientele who frequent the adjacent Wynn Hotel and its exclusive boutiques. 

Upon entering Michael Kors, my acquaintances and I were captivated by a stylish handbag that caught our friend's attention. However, upon inquiring about the price, the sales associate nonchalantly replied, "That particular design is priced at $1,400." Startled by the exorbitant cost, our friend promptly returned the purse to its display and retreated from the store, leaving us to ponder the feasibility of purchasing such luxury items on our modest salaries. Indeed, the merchandise at The Shoppes is reserved for those with substantial financial means, making it a playground for the wealthy and fashion-conscious. 

While the interior design of the mall may not be particularly remarkable, a stunning two-story waterfall at its center attracts numerous sightseers eager to capture photographs. Feel free to join in the fun and take a picture of your own! 

For those who belong to the working class and seek a more accessible shopping experience, Miracle Mile Shops and Fashion Show Mall are recommended alternatives. Once the sweltering summer heat sets in, these establishments provide a welcoming respite from the scorching temperatures, allowing patrons to browse through their wares in comfort."

"My sojourn transpired on a weekend morning in excess of twelve months prior, and it serves as a testament to the eatery's lackluster service that the nuances of my visit remain indelibly etched in my memory. The establishment appeared to be plagued by disarray, with the proprietor, a female, vociferously issuing directives in a manner suggestive of being overpowered by the demands of her patrons. Perhaps a reservation at a table situated outdoors would have afforded us a more tranquil dining experience, obviating the need for an interior seating arrangement."

This last time was my second time to eat at the Parlor, wanted my boyfriend and my brother to try it, I had gone there for lunch one other time and liked it, I think it was around opening week.  IDK what happened to but the service was BAD! the food was JUST OKAY, the people who worked there were \"really\" cool. the attitude smelled so bad, wait maybe it was the food? i will never return to the parlor again it is over glamourized pizza served with a bad attitde! you can get better at NYPD or PIzzano's if you are looking for pizza in that area!

The individual who performed my nail care services exhibited a discourteous demeanor, and the gel manicure they applied extended beyond the confines of my nails and onto the surrounding skin, resulting in an untidy appearance. It is conceivable that I encountered an inadequate nail technician; however, I observed that the staff members displayed impolite behavior towards the majority of patrons who entered the establishment. Consequently, I shall not return to this salon.
Well, if your address isn't correct and you don't pick up the phone to help with directions you can't expect a great customer response...  Was really looking forward to eating here, now not so sure.

"Indubitably excessively publicized!

Their bread is palatable, yet their meat is rather lackluster, as they merely place a scant amount of filling between the slices of their bread! It seemed as though I had paid solely for their bread. I endured a twenty-five-minute wait for the sandwiches, harboring elevated expectations. Conversely, I still felt famished subsequent to consuming the sandwich and became irritable due to the prolonged waiting period for an unremarkable meal. What was I thinking?!

I shall confer upon them two stars for their bread's agreeable texture and delightful taste. Nonetheless, if one does not relish the sensation of a slightly oleaginous bread, perhaps it would not be to their liking. Without a doubt, there exist superior sandwich establishments in Las Vegas that serve more satisfying fare. Unquestionably overhyped. If the queue happens to be brief, it may be worth visiting; however, it would be unwise to devote a considerable amount of time waiting in line, as Las Vegas boasts a plethora of delectable dining options."

"I have a propensity to perceive Petal as possessing an unpredictable quality, wherein their offerings tend to alternate between being either exceptionally effective or utterly disappointing. Unfortunately, of late, my experiences at Petal have been characterized by a preponderance of misses, with the majority of items failing to meet my expectations due to issues such as poor fit, flimsy construction, or an unflattering silhouette. Furthermore, I have noticed that the staff at Petal seem to be overly vigilant in their efforts to curb potential theft, resulting in a sense of urgency and discomfort during the dressing room experience. This heightened scrutiny not only detracts from my ability to make informed purchasing decisions but also creates an atmosphere of anxiety and stress, thereby diminishing my overall shopping experience."

My oral cavity is experiencing an unpleasant residual flavor, which could have been caused by the unwelcome presence of a periplaneta americana, commonly known as a cockroach, that traversed the distance of the floor and eventually found its way into my culinary creation, specifically a burger. It is gratifying to learn that certain establishments offer complimentary avian appendages on Monday evenings during football games. Additionally, it is commendable that they were able to collect a substantial amount of funds, specifically $1,000, for a philanthropic organization that aims to provide assistance to local adolescents who are in need of support. Lastly, it is worth mentioning that our present location is Wickenburg.

I am not particularly fond of this specific branch, and as a background, I have been a patron of Chase for an extended period of time, possessing two active accounts. Upon entering the establishment, I attempted to cash a sizable check, only to be met by a novice accounts specialist who persistently endeavored to persuade me to open yet another account. Feeling pressured, I hastily provided my contact information in the hope that he would not overhear one of the digits. However, my efforts were futile, as the specialist continued to call me for a fortnight, leaving a voice message urging me to return and open the additional account. Furthermore, during my interaction with the teller, I inquired about a sign posted on the entrance window, advertising a feature that enables users to scan checks and deposit them through their mobile devices. When I asked if this service was compatible with Blackberries, the teller was unable to provide a definitive response, instead opting to search for the answer. While her diligence in seeking the truth is commendable, it is also reasonable to expect that such fundamental knowledge should be readily available to her. Lastly, upon entering the premises, I noticed an unkempt plastic waste receptacle positioned beneath the sole ATM in the room, giving the appearance of neglect over an extended period. This unsightly scene does not present a favorable initial impression, particularly for prospective clients who are considering establishing a new account.

We conducted an exhaustive search of this establishment prior to our impending departure, in conjunction with a companion, and our culinary experience was merely satisfactory, whereas the hospitality was adequate; however, the ambiance left much to be desired, eliciting an intense feeling of dissatisfaction that precludes any future visits.

"I have a profound aversion to the notion of queuing up to place an order, as it contravenes my predilection for expediency and efficiency in service delivery. Moreover, the absence of a greeter and the bartender's attempt to compensate by offering assistance only served to exacerbate my dissatisfaction. Furthermore, the cashier's preoccupation with their financial gains at the expense of attending to our needs struck me as particularly discourteous. Additionally, the lack of a receipt and the instruction to proceed to a table without any semblance of communication left me feeling perplexed and inconvenienced. Lastly, the height of the chairs necessitated an uncomfortable act of jumping in order to mount them, which further contributed to my overall disappointment with the dining experience. Notwithstanding the subpar culinary quality of the burger, which fortunately stopped short of being overcooked, the entire enterprise struck me as excessively costly given the need to endure a queue to place an order."

"Eh pizza, an edible flatbread typically topped with cheese, tomato sauce, various meats, vegetables, and condiments, is merely satisfactory in my opinion. However, it's possible that my lukewarm appreciation for this culinary staple stems from the fact that the delivery process took an hour, despite our proximity to the establishment, which is a mere five minutes away."

I have been experiencing mounting annoyance with Danny's Family over an extended period of time, primarily due to their relentless employment of aggressive sales tactics. During my most recent visit, I was asked whether I desired a buff and wax service, despite having recently purchased a vehicle with only 2,000 miles on it. This interaction served as the impetus for me to recount numerous prior instances of similar nature, all of which involved the persistent efforts of the windshield chip repair personnel to convince me of the imperative need for their services. Specifically, I was informed that a minuscule crack in my windshield posed a significant risk of sudden and catastrophic failure while driving, thereby necessitating immediate attention. While I acknowledge the merits of their meticulous approach to cleanliness, I find the prevalence of such strong-arm sales strategies to be utterly exasperating and lament the absence of a more reasonable alternative. It appears that this type of conduct has become standard practice within the car wash industry, leaving me feeling resigned and disillusioned.
Chips and salsa were good but that's where it ended. Dry meat on my tacos, my wife had a really bad salad. Chicken coated with sauce that was more like Italian sauce than anything Mexican.

I have to say St Rose Pediactrics is wearing super thin on me. Appointment time was 11:00am. 45 minutes after we are put in a room. 25 minutes later a doctor still has not come in. It's about time to scale back the number of clients and/or appointments you take. Look, I've even had enough time to write this review AFTER reading all the others.

"The culinary offerings were utterly flawless. I opted for the delectable galbi burger, accompanied by a side of house kimchi. My query pertains to the unfavorable critique; allow me to elucidate. We entered the establishment with a considerable gathering of twelve individuals or more, and we communicated our intentions in advance. Notwithstanding, the reception we received was warm and accommodating. Hence, my confusion regarding the unflattering assessment persists. It is essential, particularly when partaking in a meal with acquaintances whom one has not encountered in an extended period, to display common courtesy and await the arrival of all dishes at the table before commencing consumption. Alas, two of our party's meals were delayed by thirty minutes relative to the others. The initial courses arrived promptly, comprising of delectable sweet potato fries; however, a considerable interval ensued before the main course. Our server informed us that the kitchen was experiencing a delay and that our burger was being prepared, yet ten minutes lapsed before she returned with the revelation that the order had been overlooked. Eventually, following a thirty-minute wait, the burger was served. I maintain that the subsequent burger should have been ours; regrettably, we observed newer patrons being seated and receiving their meals more expeditiously. When visiting Las Vegas, my companion recommended this eatery, expressing his desire to sample its fare. Unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled, although the cuisine was not the primary factor in the disappointment."

First off, I had a blast cause I was able to spend some quality time with my mom and son, which a rare lately  due to my crazy work schedule, with that said I was very very very disappointed in the customer service or just service in general.  The place is very cute and cool, tons of tv's with tons of sports to watch.  Nice and cool inside, and there wasn't many people when we went.  Our server was not good at all.  Kept forgetting about us.  Forgetting to bring us things, small or big, she couldn't get it together.  Now, just because I myself am a server and work in a restaurant doesn't mean I'm picking on her.  She herself said to me 'am I ignoring you guys alot tonight?' ummmmmmmmm yeah!!!!!!!!! 

The little game area was ok, although the machines kept taking my money and I  had to keep getting someone to fix it.  Annoying!  

Food was ok too.  Loved the house salad.  My pizza kinda sucked, was suppose to be thick crust and was thin.  We had to ask three times for more dressing.  My mom ordered a wheat beer and she was brought ??? well it wasnt  wheat beer, so she ordered something else.  Ten minutes later, still no beer.  I finally had to get up fine the server and ask her to get the beer........now!

We had fun just being together and watching the game and my son play.  But, I wont be going back anytime soon. :(

"Our dining experience at this establishment was merely adequate, as we have had the pleasure of indulging in superior culinary offerings at various other sushi restaurants in Charlotte, Davidson, and Asheville. This particular venue failed to impress us with its uninspired menu selections, which lacked the creative flair and flavorful nuances that we have come to expect from such establishments. Furthermore, the ambiance was rather unremarkable, which only served to enhance our sense of disappointment. However, we remain optimistic about the prospect of enjoying a more satisfying dining experience at another restaurant, courtesy of a coupon obtained through the Ayrsley restaurant."

The waiter, despite my explicit articulation of my culinary desires, proceeded to deliver a meal that was antithetical to my expressed preferences, substituting a cheese enchilada and chicken taco for the beef enchilada and chicken taco that I had ordered; upon being made aware of this discrepancy, the waiter gazed at me with an unsettling intensity, querying whether I desired an additional side dish comprising of beef, an offer that I declined with alacrity and, in light of the totality of the circumstances, have resolved never to return to this establishment again.

The gastronomical experience at this establishment was rather underwhelming, with only a few items on the menu eliciting any semblance of satisfaction. The complimentary chips and salsa were palatable, but the margarita on the rocks was merely adequate, while the spinach dip was passable. The cheese enchilada and chile relleno were mediocre, failing to impress the taste buds. The chicken chimichanga, ordered by my spouse, was not particularly enjoyable, although the accompanying beans and rice were somewhat better. My acquaintance from Canada expressed some degree of approval regarding the beef enchilada and hard shredded beef taco, yet the flan proved to be rather unpleasant due to its rubbery texture.

The food was awful. My mushroom ravioli was rubbery and so unappetizing looking they should have been ashamed to let it out of the kitchen. My daughters chicken was so overcooked she could not cut it. The waiter told us we should have sent it back but he did not come back to check on us. Will never go back to this location again. Stay away there are a lot of other restaurants nearby try one of those

"The solitary motivation behind my allocation of a two-star rating is unequivocally attributable to the exceptional quality of the customer service proffered by Jay and his team. Their promptness in responding to my email inquiry and their cordial demeanor served as a silver lining in an otherwise unfortunate sequence of events. While the cupcakes were regrettably subpar, the staff's sincerity and apologies partially mitigated the disappointment. However, the unfortunate reality is that the cupcakes themselves were unacceptable, with a texture akin to those purchased from Walmart. Furthermore, the decorations, while adequate, appeared amateurish and lacking in finesse. It is conceivable that the less-than-ideal state of the cupcakes may be attributed to the fact that they were supposed to be picked up on a Friday but were ultimately collected on a Monday, as a result of unforeseen circumstances. Notwithstanding, I did inform Jay of the delay via email on Thursday evening. Disappointingly, three of the cupcakes were nearly frozen in the center, giving the impression that they had been crafted several days prior and carelessly stored in a refrigerator. Consequentially, my expectations were not met, and I am disinclined to engage the services of KAK in the future."

The persistent and unpredictable nature of the internet service disruptions has become an exasperating source of frustration for me, with a total of three instances in the past week alone where my connection has been rendered non-functional due to purported "maintenance" endeavors. Despite the service provider's claims of striving to enhance the quality of their offerings, my personal experience has been marred by a complete absence of connectivity during these intervals, which have proven to be particularly vexing and inconvenient. Moreover, the frequency and duration of these outages have led me to question the reliability and competence of the service provider, with its subpar performance rivaling that of Comcast, a company notorious for its poor customer satisfaction ratings.

I yearned to relish this establishment, but my expectations were not met, unfortunately. I opted for the combination platter, which encompassed BBQ pork and teriyaki chicken, accompanied by chicken fried rice. Alas, the BBQ pork failed to impress, its texture being unpleasantly tough and chewy. The teriyaki chicken was an even greater disappointment, the sauce manifesting as a gelatinous, unappetizing mass. The fried rice, too, fell short of my expectations, its consistency being overly soggy, while the beans did not harmonize well with the other components of the dish. It is worth mentioning, however, that the staff exhibited amicable demeanor and efficiently accommodated a large volume of patrons.

Came here for dinner, waiters took a while to get our order and there was not alot people. We ordered \"The Theresa\" and the Corn on cob with chili, cheese and lime. The food tasted fine but i feel like it was overpriced, $6 for one corn on a cob with chili and cheese? come on now.

The culinary offerings were merely sufficient, with the quality of the fare failing to surpass the threshold of mediocrity. The hospitality, unfortunately, was subpar, with the server struggling to communicate effectively in the English language, resulting in an erroneous execution of our order. A one-hour time constraint further limited our dining experience, while the pervasive presence of ginger in every dish overwhelmed our taste buds. The ambiance left much to be desired, with inadequate illumination rendering the menu difficult to decipher. Consequently, we have decided against returning to this establishment, despite its proximity to our domicile.

I have been to this restaurant dozens of times throughout the years. I find the steaks are always good, but the seafood is really hit or miss. Was there yesterday and my lobster was totally over cooked. It was like complete rubber. It was barely edible. I should have known better to order it there, but I love surf and turf so I gave it a shot. Very disappointing.

During my maiden voyage to Pittsburgh, numerous individuals recommended that I pay a visit to this establishment, and thus, I chose to acquiesce to their suggestions. Upon entering the premises, I must admit that I was taken aback by the bedlam that ensued; we were initially instructed to locate a seat on our own accord, only to be subsequently informed that we would be seated by the staff. Following a brief hiatus, during which we awaited the attention of the servers, multiple employees arrived in rapid succession to take our order. The culinary offerings were merely adequate, with the exception of the unique presentation of the fries, which were inserted within the confines of the sandwich. In terms of flavor, the dishes failed to elicit any particularly remarkable sensations. The rationale behind this eatery's widespread acclaim remains an enigma to me, and I cannot help but wonder if the experience was truly worth the venture.

"It is patently evident that the quality of service provided by the hotel staff at Caesar's during my recent stay was subpar and utterly unacceptable. Specifically, upon entering our accommodations, we discovered an unfortunate surprise in the form of a previous guest's intimate apparel, which had been carelessly left behind. Furthermore, it took an unreasonable six hours for the hotel staff to furnish us with an additional blanket, and a staggering 24 hours for the procurement of extra pillows. To exacerbate matters further, the wake-up call we had requested failed to materialize altogether. It is worth noting that such egregious lapses in service are particularly glaring given the hotel's self-proclaimed status as a 'world-class' establishment. When I brought these issues to the attention of the hotel staff, their response was dismissive and lackadaisical, with the manager offering a flippant excuse about the limited availability of staff due to the holiday weekend. In light of these events, I would strongly advise against entrusting one's hospitality needs to this establishment."

"The culinary experience is merely satisfactory, lacking an exceptional quality. The term 'Greek' is loosely applied here, as the dishes served barely embody the authentic essence of Hellenic gastronomy, with Gyro-style skewers and sauces being the primary offerings. The service, unfortunately, leaves much to be desired in terms of both friendliness and attentiveness, often leaving patrons waiting for 20-30 minutes with empty glasses. The price-performance ratio does not quite align, but it remains a viable option for those who cannot secure a table at the nearby Socrates restaurant and have an unwavering craving for Greek cuisine."

I came here with several of my co-workers hoping for fun lunch. While the decor was unique and interesting, I felt the black was a bit overdone. It also seems they designed their own chairs and they were really uncomfortable when you sit back. There is some kind of triangular design on the back and it kept digging into my lower back. It forced me to sit on the edge of my seat. Other than the interior decor, the service was prompt and friendly. But there wasn't anyone else in there at the time.

Each of us got a different ramen noodle soup, an order of the waffle with korean beef, edamame, and the sliders.

The edamame was awesome. Super garlicky with some good dipping sauce. The ramen unfortunately didn't live to my expectations. I had the sesame tonkatsu and the broth felt way too thick and it wasn't hot at all. Maybe room temperature. the noodles were a bit warmer but not by much. I couldn't finish the ramen because it was too thick and it wasn't appetizing because it wasn't hot. My other co-workers agreed that their ramen wasn't hot either. The waffles were okay but not something I would order. I didn't get to try the sliders but they said they were just alright.

I hope for the best for this establishment but it's not a place I would return to.

This place used to be bomb. You can tell they are cutting corners now. They took off their best appetizer queso fundido, service was slow, no longer 24hours, and they barely comp drinks for players,got hasseled everytime I ordered a.drink and I was playing maMuch better options in town, no point of wasting time or money herex credits and fast. there are much better options in town, no point of wasting money or time here

Sadly, we had a really bad experience. Our guacamole had a really strange texture and unpleasant taste and the tacos were hardly even mediocre. The fish tacos had no cabbage, cilantro, or lime, they were pretty lacking in general and were served with wilted green leaf lettuce. The black beans and rice had no flavor. The party at the table next to us had to send their meal back for being uncooked. It was just not a meal I would ever come back for.

My companion and I opted to patronize this establishment while the remainder of our coterie remained in their lodgings, slumbering due to the previous night's festivities. I was experiencing an intense sensation of hunger, yearning to consume any edible substances. Fortuitously, the smorgasbord had commenced at this locale around 11 am for a nominal fee of 11.99 per individual, excluding beverages. It embodied an Italian-inspired assortment of culinary delights, encompassing spaghetti, lasagna, meatballs, and Parmesan-infused poultry. Additionally, they offered a soup and salad course. Unfortunately, I must admit that the gastronomic quality was subpar. My clam chowder was unpalatable, and the sole item I derived enjoyment from my plate was the fettuccine. I somewhat overindulged in bread due to my concern about not receiving adequate sustenance for my financial outlay. Furthermore, I was taken aback by the chilly temperature of certain comestibles, considering that they had initiated the buffet immediately upon our arrival, and we were, in fact, the initial patrons.
It was ok. It is like someone who is drunk and this is what the craved for munchies. They combined a Panda Express with a Taco Bell into one dish. Also the fried rice was terrible

The best word I can think of to describe this place is 'meh'. I went here for lunch and I was underwhelmed by the menu. I ended up getting chicken salad with fruit. It was a small scoop of mediocre chicken salad on top of a bed of undressed greens with some grapes and two strawberry slices sprinkled on. When I asked for some dressing they told me there was some on the table. They must have been talking about the oil covered squeeze bottle containing a tasteless vinegarette. Not impressed.

"I opted to bring my parental units to this establishment primarily due to its picturesque panorama, but also on account of its culinary offerings, which have been lauded with an impressive four-star rating. Upon perusing the menu, we decided upon the peppercorn-seasoned New York strip, which unfortunately proved to be one of the most dense and chewy steaks I have had the misfortune of sampling. The filet and salmon dishes were merely adequate, failing to elicit any particularly remarkable sensations on our palates. The beet-based appetizer, conversely, was excessively acidic in nature, thereby rendering it unpalatable. \n\nA truly unfortunate state of affairs, especially considering the exorbitant cost involved; for a trio of individuals sans beverages, the total came dangerously close to the $200 mark. I cannot, in good conscience, advocate for this restaurant, despite the undeniably breathtaking vistas it affords."

I held an intermediate stance pertaining to the overall quality of this establishment, as my expectations were not particularly elevated nor diminished during my visit; however, I must admit that the all-inclusive champagne brunch we indulged in was quite satisfactory, but unfortunately, my culinary experience was marred by a series of unimpressive dishes, including a lackluster salad with excess moisture, flavorless eggs, and an array of grease-drenched offerings that failed to satiate my hunger, even after consuming a subpar breakfast burrito, which typically would have been devoured with relish given my state of morning-after hunger, rendering my departure from the premises still feeling peckish and prompting me to advise others to forgo this particular buffet in favor of more exceptional options within the city.

"Samurai Sam's endeavors to create culinary delights inspired by the Far East, albeit with questionable success

A trio of gastronomes, including yours truly, visited this establishment recently, each opting for a distinct dish. My own selection consisted of three chicken tacos, which, while palatable, were regrettably lacking in substance, as evidenced by the dearth of meat visible in the accompanying photographs. A plethora of vegetables was present, however.

My companions chose diverse teriyaki bowls, both of which were abundant in rice, yet limited in other ingredients. Disappointment ensued, as the quantity of sustenance was nowhere near comparable to that offered by Panda Express, a similar eatery. Our total cost, inclusive of two soft drinks and a single water, tallied $24.70, rendering the experience a relatively pricey disappointment. Thus, two stars seems an appropriate rating, given the superior quality attainable elsewhere."

We indulged in a culinary experience at this establishment on Thanksgiving Day, which precipitated an unwavering sensation of mediocrity. The menu options were restricted and lacked excitement, while the cuisine was merely satisfactory. The hospitality, unfortunately, left much to be desired â?the food runners displayed a perplexing lack of familiarity with their duties, frequently confusing the intended recipients of their fare, while the servers demonstrated remarkable adeptness at avoiding eye contact and swiftly navigating past patrons. Moreover, the ambiance was tawdry and kitschy, rendering the overall experience forgettable. Therefore, it is advisable to bypass this venue in favor of more exceptional dining options.

"If you are experiencing hunger, or perhaps a hangover, and are seeking a delectable culinary experience that will satisfy your cravings, we would advise against dining at this establishment. While the ambiance and novelty items may be appealing, the fare served here has been described as subpar. We did appreciate the complimentary take-home glass offered with each beer purchase, however, the quality of the food did not meet our expectations. Our server was attentive and personable, but unfortunately, the cuisine did not live up to its potential. We cannot recall the specific dishes ordered by our party members, but suffice it to say, we were underwhelmed. It is recommended to visit this venue for its souvenir offerings rather than its gastronomic delights."

I have been to Claim Jumper in CA.  They have been great!  The one in Avondale is just ok, I have been coming back a few times and it still has not changed my mind.  The service has been just so-so.  One time my chicken was served under cooked.  I do not know if I will return.  I still love in Claim Jumper in Deer Valley.

On two separate occasions during the past four excursions to JJs, we arrived home only to discover that the submarine sandwich did not contain the desired toppings we had explicitly requested. Upon bringing this issue to their attention on the second instance, the establishment's representatives adamantly maintained that the responsibility lay with us, the customers, and proffered an unreasonable solution, suggesting that we return the sandwich and receive a replacement, an offer we promptly declined, thereby eliminating any future intentions of revisiting the establishment.

"The comprehensive encounter was unsatisfactory, characterized by an absence of warm welcome or explicit guidance upon entry. Furthermore, the culinary offerings, specifically the burgers, were prepared with insufficient doneness, failing to align with our predilections. The fare, in its entirety, lacked zest, rendering it unremarkable. In contrast, Smash Burger, located nearby, excels in providing delectable dining experiences. It would be superfluous to draw parallels with 5 Guys, as the disparity in quality is self-evident. Moreover, the management and operations of this establishment appear disorganized, casting doubt on its longevity."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I believe I made a mistake in my steak selection, given the exorbitant price point of $60 per steak, I anticipated a superior quality steak.

Upon perusing the restaurant's menu, I opted for the bone-in steak, cognizant of its rich flavor profile, despite the acknowledgment of its tenderness being inferior to other cuts. Unfortunately, the steak proved to be disappointingly chewy, which was not commensurate with my expectations.

I have had the pleasure of indulging in superior steaks in Texas, which were not only equally rich in flavor but also more tender. The dining experience at CUT fell short of my expectations in this regard.

The sides were somewhat of a mixed bag; the mac and cheese, which was prepared tableside, was undoubtedly a highlight, as was the spinach complemented by a poached egg. However, the remaining sides were merely adequate.

The wine and drink menu, presented via an iPad, was certainly innovative, but the lack of multiple units for a group of seven patrons was somewhat perplexing. Notwithstanding, the cheesy bread was truly exceptional and merited the establishment's two-star rating.

The service was indeed impressive, though it was expected given the upscale nature of the restaurant. In conclusion, my dinner at CUT consisted of an unsatisfactory steak accompanied by mediocre sides, save for the outstanding cheesy bread. The cost of my meal totaled two hundred dollars, which I deem excessive for the quality received. Therefore, I am unlikely to return to this establishment.

"Cold Tuna, frozen vegetables, unremarkable service! As a frequent traveler, I possess an acute awareness of even the most minuscule details, as well as an appreciation for the overall ambiance, and unfortunately, my second visit to this Phillips fell short of my expectations, prompting me to consider alternative dining options, such as California Pizza Kitchen, located in terminal B, for future visits."

The influx of juveniles, conveyed via multiple buses, and characterized by a conspicuous absence of adequate supervision, precipitated a state of utter chaos and disarray within the confines of the science museum. The sheer number of children, coupled with the dearth of authoritative figures to regulate their behavior, engendered an atmosphere akin to bedlam itself, replete with the unbridled enthusiasm and cacophonous clamor inherent to youthful energy. The concatenation of these factors rendered it exceedingly problematic for visitors to fully appreciate and savor the various exhibits on display, thereby transforming an otherwise edifying excursion into a decidedly vexing ordeal. It is imperative that measures be taken to ameliorate this situation, lest the museum relinquish its status as an institution dedicated to the promulgation of scientific knowledge and evolve into a mere playground devoid of any semblance of order or decorum.

"The culinary offerings were merely satisfactory, with certain dishes lacking the optimal temperature. Despite this, the eatery's ambiance was pleasant, boasting cleanliness and well-maintained decor. However, the upholstery appeared somewhat dated. Unfortunately, the service was excruciatingly sluggish, with an inadequate staff-to-patron ratio resulting in an elongated dining experience. Specifically, there was a dearth of servers, with only a single individual attending to our needs, leading to an unacceptable delay. Notwithstanding, I might consider revisiting the establishment if they address these issues, particularly regarding the temperature of the food and the efficiency of service, which are customarily expected from a Chinese restaurant."

Let me start off by saying, the cookies and bran muffin I sampled were absolutely delicious!! Also, the service was fine - patient and kind - even amidst some VERY rude women with kids who sent the children's food back because the toast wasn't crispy enough.. \nThat being said, I ordered the chopped salad with mixed greens and romaine I believe. The mixed greens were not just old, they were decomposing. Mushy and falling apart. Smelled terrible. This really irks me when you're paying $13 for a high-quality salad. I'm disappointed the chef didn't care enough to check what he puts on the plate. Otherwise, it would have been a great salad!\nI'm not that picky, but a lazy chef who doesn't care about food quality before the plate goes out is a bad sign.

"Alright, undertook an arduous excursion from Gilbert to Camelback, primarily due to the effusive acclaim bestowed upon Delux by Phoenix Magazine, which extolled their burgers as among the most delectable in the Valley. Upon arriving at the establishment, we opted for two burgers, a single serving of mixed fries, a lemonade, and a Diet Coke. The total cost of our repast, inclusive of a gratuity, tallied $39. While the fries proved to be quite satisfying, the subpar service unfortunately hindered our ability to fully appreciate the quality of our chilled burgers. In fact, Susan was compelled to seek assistance from one of the other servers, as our designated waiter seemed to have vanished into thin air, leaving us in a state of utter neglect. Everyone surrounding us, who had placed their orders subsequent to ours, was receiving prompt and attentive service, which only exacerbated our frustration. It is unfortunate that we cannot, in good conscience, patronize this establishment again, despite its potential for greatness, given the considerable expense involved in procuring a mere couple of burgers and the unpredictability of the service. Instead, we shall opt for more reliable and familiar options, such as Burger King or McDonald's, where we can confidently anticipate a certain level of quality and consistency."

"Indulged in an early evening repast at this establishment on Sunday, June 28, opting for it due to its proximity to our accommodations and my spouse's and my desire to sample the culinary offerings of the city with our discerning eight-year-old offspring, who boasts a predilection for fastidious fare. 

The hospitality we received was indeed prompt and attentive, the atmosphere resembling that of a bustling gaming facility, while the comestibles proved satisfactory, albeit at a cost that far exceeded their actual worth, in this patron's opinion. Specifically, the charge of $14 for a rudimentary burger, augmented by cheese and bacon, struck me as exorbitant, especially considering the supplementary fee for fries, which seemed an affront to my sensibilities as a consumer. 

In light of the aforementioned factors, I must regretfully decline to endorse this venue, given the glaring discrepancy between quality and cost."

"My experience at Pearl was somewhat disconcerting, as while the quality of the sushi was undeniably exceptional, the overall dining experience was marred by several notable shortcomings. Specifically, the presentation, service, and ambiance failed to meet my expectations, leaving me feeling underwhelmed. To begin with, the positive aspects of my visit must be acknowledged; the variety of sushi options was truly impressive, and the fact that they offered all-day happy hour was certainly a welcome surprise. Furthermore, the taste of the food was indisputably superb. However, the temperature of the food was so extreme that it bordered on being unpleasantly hot, causing us to feel nauseous by the time we finished our meal. Additionally, the plates that our food arrived on were noticeably chipped, which detracted from the overall aesthetic appeal of the dining experience. The service we received was also subpar, as our waiter persistently touched us in a manner that was uncomfortable and intrusive, such as patting us on the back or brushing against us unnecessarily. Lastly, the sequence in which our dishes were served was confusing, as our soup was brought out after we had already received our entrees, which seemed peculiar and poorly timed. In light of these various issues, it is unlikely that I will return to Pearl in the future."

Just placed my order around 8:10 and 40 minutes later it has still not been placed with the restaurant. (they show status updates and it will say \"placed\" when it has been done)  If ALL you do is delivery you better do it D@m*^ well!  I understand if there is a delay getting it cooked at the restaurant or traffic, but they should be placing the order with the restaurant immediately!!  Not cool foodie call, not cool. Not going to use them again unless I have to.  \n\nAlso there is not a great selection of restaurants to chose from.  Maybe Im spoiled, Im from Chicago and every kind of food imaginable is deliverable and super quick, that sure is not the case here in Charlotte!   When I called they just said they were very busy and thin on drivers.  Well hire some more then dude!
La bouffe est bonne, mais je n'y retournerai plus \u00e0 cause de la malpropret\u00e9. C'est un des pires d\u00e9liquants selon les inspecteurs du gouvernement.

Saturday night. Looking forward to this show and we got here before 8pm. Show started near 930. So freaking crowded you can't see the band.  Its so loud you cant hear the band.  Fire Marshall bill would close the place. So over capacity you can't move. Let alone get to the bathroom. All about greed. Need to stop ticket sales while there is still room to move.

"If I were to offer an assessment of this dining establishment, I would venture to say that while the culinary offerings were indeed impressive, the quality of service was subpar and detracted significantly from the overall experience. It is conceivable that my visit occurred on an off-day for the restaurant; however, even taking that into consideration, the discrepancy between the exceptional food and the lackluster service was striking. Initially, our server, Rodrigo, appeared to be making a concerted effort to provide attentive service, but this proved to be short-lived. Throughout the meal, I encountered considerable difficulty in securing the attention of any server, including Rodrigo, and witnessed multiple instances of tables neighboring ours having their glasses replenished with water in a timely manner while I waited an unacceptable fifteen minutes for a refill. This disparity in service was particularly glaring given the high standards one might expect from a restaurant of this caliber and price range. As a patron, I seek an immersive dining experience that encompasses not only delectable cuisine but also exceptional customer service. Unfortunately, my experience at SOL Cocina fell short of these expectations, leaving a lingering negative impression. In light of this, I would not consider returning to this establishment."

Food was almost average couldve been better had hot  wings and fries blah!..Service incredibly slow on a friday afternoon,had to take my tab and go find the waittress to cash out.Guess cant wrong with the drinks and bottled beer here(only miller and coors on tap).Sports on tvs all over gives it 2 stars.......

"An optimal geographic location, accompanied by passable lodging and dining facilities, was unfortunately juxtaposed with an uncooperative and discourteous team. Their behavior conveyed an impression that I was imposing upon them by requesting elementary guidance. The personnel's demeanor was utterly disrespectful, and their countenances suggested they were wretched. The spa was appalling, bordering on squalid, and emitted a pungent odor that made it uninhabitable for me to endure for more than a brief period. Following a futile attempt to partake in the supposed relaxation offered by the spa, I opted to expedite a thorough cleansing of my person in the sanctuary of my accommodations instead. The front desk was unresponsive, requiring an exorbitant amount of time to address my concerns, often taking between ten to twenty minutes on each occasion. There are numerous superior establishments in close proximity, offering comparable prices and vastly improved quality. I shall not consider this hotel for future visits."

I have been deliberating on articulating my thoughts regarding this establishment for an extended period of time. My spouse and I had the privilege of exchanging our vows at the Venetian resort, which boasts exceptional accommodations and services, thus, we make it a point to visit annually. On the eve of our nuptials, our group of six individuals opted to partake in an intimate dining experience at this quaint Italian eatery, primarily due to its captivating ambiance and our shared affinity for Italian cuisine. However, upon ordering a pasta dish, which I cannot recall by name, I specified that it should be served with chicken; alas, the wait staff neglected to include this crucial component. Upon bringing this oversight to the attention of our server, he displayed contrition and ventured into the kitchen to rectify the situation. The ensuing presentation of the chicken, presented in a bowl, raised my suspicions, as it appeared to be pre-cooked frozen chicken that had been hastily reheated in the microwave and was now intended to be incorporated into my pasta dish. This resulted in a comically disconcerting experience, leaving me feeling underwhelmed, and our associates were similarly unimpressed with their pizza selections, merely picking at them.

This critique pertains to the culinary concourse. It is utterly deplorable. The tariff for the quantity obtained is exorbitant, rendering it unreasonable and inappropriate. Personal experience has demonstrated that superior burgers can be procured at McDonald's establishments, and at a mere fraction of the cost.

"The extraterrestrial ambiance, conveniently removed from the primary foyer and offering an unobstructed panorama of the aquatic facility and the illuminated boulevard, fostered a unique and captivating environment. The prevailing vibration permeating the venue was unequivocally athletic in nature, as numerous flat-screen displays were concurrently transmitting the intense intercollegiate confrontation between the Wisconsin Badgers and the Arizona Wildcats. \n\nThe culinary delight known as a burger was undoubtedly satisfactory, yet the hospitable demeanor and attentive focus demonstrated by our server, Erin, a native of South Dakota, unfortunately did not parallel the quality of the food. A prolonged period of time, specifically forty minutes, elapsed before we received our eagerly anticipated burgers. Furthermore, the temperature of the side dish, specifically the rings, was unacceptably low, rendering them inedible. Although the management elected to compensate us for the deficient quality of the meal by gratis, it would have been vastly preferable to receive our nourishment in a timely and thermally suitable manner. Considering the dearth of patrons within the establishment, it was challenging to comprehend the root cause of the delay. However, taking into account the recurring pattern of dissatisfaction expressed in various online reviews, it appears that this eatery consistently encounters difficulties in regard to the efficiency and effectiveness of its service staff."

Perhaps the establishment endured an unfortunate nocturnal slump, for this critique constitutes the nadir of my evaluations.  Coincidentally, my progeny celebrates his twenty-sixth anniversary of nativity today, and we convened at Brat Haus to commemorate the occasion.  Prior to our visit, I harbored optimistic expectations regarding the venue, owing to its prevailing star rating on Yelp and the captivating ambiance fostered by its interior design.  Indeed, the atmosphere boasts a stylish vibe that resonated with me.  Alas, the quality of the victuals and hospitality fell short of my standards.  My offspring requested a chorizo-infused canine edible, which he returned due to an absence of flavor.  My spouse and I opted to share a culinary item classified as a burger, yet the staff neglected to inquire about my preference regarding the degree of doneness.  Consequently, the dish arrived in a state of overcooking, rendering the meat unpalatable and dominated by an overpowering piquancy of pepper.  Regrettably, the gastronomic experience proved subpar, prompting me to speculate that the kitchen staff may compensate for the inferior quality of their beef by subjecting it to an excessive duration of heat application.
