However, subsequent to partaking in their fare for an extended duration, I was compelled to desist. Uncertain whether the issue lay within the salt content or the plethora of processed constituents, but my digestive system and overall wellbeing suffered significantly post-consumption. Which is lamentable, as I harbor a certain fondness for the po'boy sandwich. \nIn summary, if one's dietary preferences lean towards indulging in processed, albeit vegan, victuals, this establishment may serve as a suitable venue. Convenient, expedient, and relatively relaxed, it presents an attractive option for those seeking such attributes. Nonetheless, for individuals prioritizing nutritional value and unadulterated sustenance, alternative destinations may be more suitable."

"I was experiencing an intense desire for some barbecued delights and decided to accompany my mother to this establishment, perusing the extensive menu that boasted an array of delectable options and inducing salivation in both of us. The biscuits, while slightly dense in texture, possessed a satisfying flavor. We opted to share a two-meat combination platter, which proved to be a colossal portion. The beef and St. Louis ribs we selected were somewhat chewy, prompting me to inquire whether the latter was indeed St. Louis or baby back ribs, as the meat was scarce. We were informed that it was the former, yet its taste closely resembled the latter. Furthermore, our experience with the mashed sweet potatoes left much to be desired, as its consistency and flavor strongly evoked the sensation of consuming infant food. However, the apple pie we sampled was generously portioned and exhibited a satisfactory degree of culinary excellence. In conclusion, while this venue appears well-suited for large gatherings and offers copious helpings of food and drink, it fell short in terms of authenticity and gastronomic quality. If I were to choose a chain restaurant specializing in barbecue cuisine, my preference would lie with Tony Roma's."

"Upon visiting this establishment on a Saturday, I was eager to peruse their offerings, having recently relocated to Pittsburgh from New York, where I had access to an array of exceptional juice bars. However, my expectations were not entirely met, as the selection of juices available was rather limited in scope. It is my sincere hope that the proprietors of this business will draw inspiration from esteemed establishments such as Liquiteria (http://liquiteria.com/cold-pressed-juices.php) and Juice Generation (http://www.juicegeneration.com/menu/smoothies), both of which offer a diverse array of cold-pressed juices and smoothies. Furthermore, I would suggest that they consider blending juices and smoothies on-site, as this would undoubtedly enhance the overall experience for patrons. In light of the aforementioned factors, I must express some skepticism regarding the likelihood of our return during the summer months, unless, of course, they opt to expand their menu to include a greater variety of options. Nevertheless, I extend my well wishes to the proprietors in their future endeavors."

"As a native San Franciscan, it is only natural that I have had the pleasure of dining at both Crustacean and Thanh Long within my hometown. However, I must say that the culinary experience offered by this particular establishment is incomparable to either of the aforementioned eateries. During a recent excursion to Las Vegas approximately three years ago, I had the opportunity to partake in a friend's celebratory gathering, which of course necessitated a visit to this esteemed restaurant. Upon ordering the garlic crab and garlic noodles, our server presented us with a crab shell lavishly stuffed with an abundance of crab meat, the taste of which was remarkably dissimilar to that of its San Franciscan counterparts. I must admit that I was thoroughly impressed by the novelty of cracking open one's own crab, an experience that was further enhanced by the slightly elevated cost. Notwithstanding the unconventional gastronomical adventure, the ambiance of the venue itself was quite pleasant, prompting us to indulge in a bottle of wine and optimize our evening's enjoyment."

Very disappointed in the overall quality and flavor of the food.  A la carte entree items, such as the curries and samosas, seemed like they might be leftovers from that day's buffet or even the day before.  The naan bread was overly plain and half-burnt without the texture and flavor I get at other Indian food places.  The food looked \"ok\" (sauces were oddly neon in color), but lacked character and the taste of each item was very one-dimensional.  We ordered all food \"mild\" on heat (although we can handle spicy food just fine), but most members of my party still got an upset stomach later that night.  Wish I could recommend this authentic looking joint to friends and family, but I can't.

"We recently celebrated Father's Day by partaking in a culinary excursion at this esteemed eatery, and while the gastronomical offerings were indeed satisfactory, the quality of service we received was somewhat subpar. Specifically, our server's attendance to our table was sporadic and inadequate, leaving us feeling parched and neglected for the majority of the meal. Moreover, when we required additional condiments, we were compelled to solicit the assistance of an alternative staff member, as our designated server was nowhere to be found. Although it is conceivable that this poor service was simply an isolated incident, it is equally possible that it may be symptomatic of a more pervasive issue. Nonetheless, we shall reserve judgment until we have had the opportunity to sample the restaurant's wares on a subsequent occasion."
I had ordered a pizza for the NFC championship game. I understand you could be busy but my order was cold and the cheese had dried out. Unacceptable.

I'm giving it 2 stars for the service and quickness. Now for the food, we ordered the pad Thai and the pad se ew. The pad thai was a big clump of sticky gummy ramen like noodles you could barely chew let alone swallow, but the flavor was good they need a flatter noodle and the chicken was over cooked. The pad se ew had good flavor but the noodles were not wide the pork was tough.\n\nI prefer the food at the corner Thai kitchen around the corner on trop.  Give it a try and please let me know what you think.  I jugde a Thai place on the pad Thai if they can make that well, you can bet the rest will be good too.

This establishment is vastly overhyped, relying heavily on a singular menu item of minimal culinary ingenuity (a frozen coffee beverage resembling an inferior imitation of a Mocha Ice Blended offered by Coffee Bean) to entice patrons into purchasing their exorbitantly priced fundamental fare. The sluggishness of the service is truly remarkable, particularly for a venue of modest proportions. While it may provide an acceptable setting for socializing under specific circumstances and with a compatible coterie, it falls short of expectations in numerous aspects.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, and I must say that the ambiance is quite pleasant as well. However, if you intend to partake in their happy hour specials, I would advise you to exercise caution when selecting your seating arrangement. During my recent visit, our group of revelers opted for an alfresco table, only to discover that our particular table did not fall under the happy hour pricing umbrella. Had we situated ourselves at the bar to our right or at an alternative table to our left, we would have been able to capitalize on a substantial savings of approximately fifty percent on our total bill. Unfortunately, even the manager proved unable to supersede this policy, despite our protests. It is worth noting that the table in question was positioned between the primary entrance gate and the main entrance of the restaurant, rendering the term 'private' somewhat of a misnomer."

"Experienced an extended waiting period for a seat at a restaurant for a less-than-impressive birthday dinner. Ordered a shrimp pasta dish, but it arrived well after its expected time, and the shrimp had unfortunately spoiled. Requested a substitute dish, which took an additional lengthy period of time to arrive, resulting in my consuming part of my spouse's meal out of impatience. Unfortunately, my child did not complete her portion, and my partner expressed disappointment with her dish, describing its flavor as uninspired. Given the abundance of superior dining options in the area and the relatively high prices charged by this establishment, it is not likely to become a regular destination for me."

I ordered decorated jumbo cupcakes for a small birthday dinner party.  One of the four cupcakes was to have Happy Birthday Grandma written on it.  The cupcake had a plain white plastic circle with the happy birthday grandma written in black marker.  Wow, I'm beyond disappointed.  Tacky, sigh... too late to get something else personalized.

after dinner party .....
the white circle was fondant not plastic...still did not like how it looked
The cupcakes were delicious though.

"It perplexes me profoundly why individuals are effusive about this production, as my expectations were not met, despite my previous admiration for their work on the ABDC. As a Las Vegas show, it falls short in numerous aspects. The only redeeming quality was the musical accompaniment, which elicited momentary hilarity when they briefly performed moves reminiscent of 'Single Ladies.' However, the narrative was unengaging and nonsensical, with an inexplicable focus on a deceased custodian. The choreography lacked synchronization, the attire was unremarkable, and the masks created a barrier that precluded any semblance of emotional connection with the performers. My recommendation is to only attend if tickets are complimentary, as paying for admission would not be worthwhile."

Dear Beat, 
You may be trendy, and you may be in the vicinity of an awesome center for creative space (Emergency Arts), but the hipster staff who take my order are ALWAYS snobby. Please smile and be helpful.
Except for  Heather (she's great) and the cute foreign guy; I like watching him slice my tomato.

Your food menu IS great, and though I think your coffee and espresso are not the finest, the ambiance and weekly events DO make up for that a little. I wish I could love you, but I just don't think the connection is there yet.

"While my inclination would have been to confer a more favorable rating upon Chez Claudette, certain factors precluded me from doing so. Specifically, I had placed an order for a poutine classique to be consumed off-premises, but owing to the inclement weather, I opted to consume it within the establishment, adjacent to the entrance. Our server, a Quebecois woman with a noticeable French accent, informed us that, in the future, we must consume our orders external to the premises if we are to avail ourselves of the 'to-go' option. Moreover, the poutine sauce possessed a conspicuously thick and processed quality, reminiscent of canned poutine sauce. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the poutine remained a delectable offering, which we devoured in its entirety. It is worth noting that the cost of our diminutive poutine was comparable to that of other establishments serving similar fare, at approximately $7."

"Individual, the culinary proficiency of Outback has ostensibly diminished since my last visit. It is my sincere hope that this was merely an isolated incident, rather than a paradigmatic shift in their operational standards. The menu presented numerous inconsistencies, with instances where the listed items did not align with the actual dishes served. Specifically, my spouse requested the Sam Adams on draft, only to receive the Summer Ale instead, which was seemingly attributed to an inventory shortage of the former without any notification or alternative options offered by the server. Furthermore, the chicken artichoke flatbread, while delectable, was excessively bedecked with parmesan cheese, contrary to the menu's description of a "sprinkling." Had I been aware of this discrepancy, I would have explicitly requested a lighter application of cheese. In addition, my steak salad, ordered medium, arrived medium rare, and was accompanied by gorgonzola cheese crumbles, which were not mentioned on the menu. Consequently, I was compelled to return the dish. Although the manager demonstrated politeness in addressing the issue and graciously removed the flatbread from our bill, his attempt to justify the substitution of the Summer Ale for the Boston Lager, due to an alleged absence of the latter, elicited a measure of irritation. Simply put, it would have been appreciated had the server apprised us of this detail initially, thus obviating the need for explanations. Ultimately, the dining experience was unsatisfactory and fell short of my previous expectations."

We had a nice dinner,, but my wife got food posioning..  She woke up 4am and was ill and continued to be ill that day..  Could keep nothing down and very dehiderated.   The management while polite seemed to think I was shaking them down when I asked for a partial discount off our $300 bill..   Rather hard to accept such an event when dining at such a place..  Better luck..

"Upon embarking on a culinary excursion to Las Vegas, it is customary to partake in at least one buffet; however, this particular establishment should not be a priority on one's gastronomic itinerary. Despite offering crab legs and prime rib, the quality of these items was subpar, with the latter being excessively desiccated. Furthermore, the purported French buffet failed to present its macarons in an aesthetically pleasing manner, rendering them unappetizing. The utensils used to handle the food were also sticky and unhygienic, lacking any form of sanitization or wet wipes. The server, seemingly determined to provide exceptional customer service or perhaps seeking a generous gratuity, exhibited attentiveness towards her patrons, particularly those of Filipino descent. On Sundays, champagne is included in the meal, featuring the notable Wycliff Jean brand; however, mixing it with orange juice results in a mimosa that may not justify the $30 expense. For a more satisfying dining experience, it may be wise to allocate funds elsewhere."

Normally, I wouldn't bother reviewing a chain restaurant, but the subpar service I received during my recent visit compelled me to share my experience in writing. This review focuses primarily on the quality of service rather than the culinary offerings. Upon being seated, our server promptly took our beverage order and delivered our complimentary bread, along with our entrees. However, it took an unacceptable 15 minutes for our Blossomin' Onion appetizer to arrive, followed by another 20-minute wait for our main courses. Our server offered a feeble excuse, attributing the delay to a supposed computer malfunction. This explanation seemed dubious, as patrons who arrived after us received their orders without incident. I would have preferred honesty over such an implausible justification. Despite the prolonged wait, the taste and presentation of the food were satisfactory, and we devoured our meals with relish. After finishing our food, we waited an additional 10 minutes for our check, only to spend another 5 minutes awaiting our change. In total, we spent more time waiting than dining. Typically, I leave a minimum of 20% gratuity, but given the lackluster service, we opted for a reduced tip of approximately 12%. At that point, I had become thoroughly disenchanted with the overall experience.

I am not one to write reviews but I had to on this place.  I was super excited to try this place.  It looks cool and seems to have a cool vibe.  I've been waiting for this place to work out some quirks since I have heard bad things and they have bad reviews on yelp.  I thought they are new and are just trying to find the groove.

My boyfriend and I went last night for date night. We saw all the bad reviews, then a couple good reviews showed up and we thought let's give this place a shot, maybe the other reviewers are just not used to this style of Mexican food.  The price is what I would expect at a this kind of place but the food was not.  The chips and salsa were great but the two entrees we got were sooooo bland.  Where is the flavor, it seems to be non-existent.

Our server was great, she even offered to take one of the entrees off the bill.  Which I think is super cool because I assumed we would just pay for them and be unhappy.

Bottom line, I will not come back for food!

I did see they have happy hour and I have heard the margaritas are good, so I will come back and try the discounted margaritas some time. Maybe if we drink a couple margaritas we won't care that the food is bland.

A very ordinary sports bar.  Positives:  clean, attractive (if somewhat sterile) atmosphere; friendly, attentive, gorgeous staff; big-screen TVs and enormous projection TVs visible from any table make it a good place to watch a game.  Negatives:  need more craft beers on tap; menu somewhat boring and food needs seasoning (SW Turkey sandwich bland, side cole slaw lifeless); took 10 minutes to get my first beer even on a slow Sunday night.  Would give an extra star for fixing any one of those issues, two if all were fixed.

"A further Asian-inspired food chain, you say? Oh my, do we genuinely require another eatery of this nature in Champaign? We already possess an abundance of Chinese and Korean restaurants in the campus area, which, might I add, are vastly superior to Flat Top in terms of quality and authenticity.  

Now, allow me to elaborate on the stir-fry concept that Flat Top has adopted. It is, in essence, a form of Mongolian BBQ, albeit with an extensive array of uncooked vegetables and ingredients for patrons to select from. One must admit that the sheer volume of options can be overwhelming, especially when considering the unusual sauces and food pairings available. My own combination, consisting of brown rice, clams, beef, vegetables, salmon, and roti prata, was merely passable, but I fear that without a well-developed sense of culinary compatibility, one's dining experience may prove disastrous.  

Flat Top's 'pick-your-own-ingredients' approach does possess a certain level of ingenuity, as it effectively transfers culpability onto the patron, should the food fail to meet expectations. However, it would be unfair to place blame solely on the customer, as the grill sensei also plays a significant role in determining the final product's quality. Overcooking by even a slight margin can render a dish unpalatable, irrespective of the excellence of the chosen components. My companion's moo shu, regrettably, suffered from inadequate wrapping, leading to certain rolls falling apart. Alas, such mishaps can significantly diminish one's enjoyment of the meal.  

While a single visit to Flat Top may satiate curiosity, repeated visits seem unnecessary. Only time will tell whether this establishment will mirror Bar Louie's fleeting popularity. A 'one-hit wonder,' if you will."

"While it would be inaccurate to describe the culinary offerings at this establishment as anything approaching exceptional, it is undeniable that certain aspects of the dining experience merit commendation. Specifically, the quality of the edibles, which, on a scale of one to ten, with five being the minimum acceptable threshold for gastronomical satisfaction and ten representing an unparalleled degree of epicurean delight, rates a respectable seven. However, it must be noted that the ambiance, while not unpleasant, falls short of truly captivating, garnering a mere six on the same scale. Furthermore, the value proposition, taking into account both the cost and the quantity of sustenance provided, earns a middling rating of eight. Notably, the service, characterized by an almost perplexing lack of attentiveness, leaves much to be desired, warranting a meager five on the aforementioned scale. Nonetheless, it is advisable to sample the creme puffs, which, despite their unremarkable provenance, prove to be a satisfying indulgence. Be that as it may, the experience is marred by an inexplicable tardiness in settling the bill, which, compounded by the sluggish pace of table turns during the luncheon hours, renders the overall experience somewhat less than optimal. In conclusion, while the novelty of the restaurant's conveyor belt system, reminiscent of those found in Japan, may hold some appeal for the uninitiated, it cannot compensate for the various deficiencies in the dining experience."

I utilized him, Paul, about 3 years ago for a termite problem.  I picked him based on Yelp reviews.  He did the treatment and then had to come back to retreat about 4 months after the original application.  I called him on the phone and he said he would come back but he was not going to make anything since it was under warranty.  When he came to the house again he made it very clear that this was costing him money because it was all under warranty.  I have never experienced having a business owner try to make me feel bad for asking them to honor their warranty, a warranty that I paid extra for.  I will never utilize his services again.

"Well, color me disillusioned, as I must confess that my expectations were not entirely met during my recent visit to this establishment with my kin, despite my previous experiences which had been rather satisfactory, albeit not exceeding ten occasions. Specifically, the absence of the customary discount associated with the 'Clam Bake' feature, which previously served as the primary motivation for our Saturday excursions, proved to be a considerable letdown. Furthermore, the inclusion of crabs as an additional option at an extra cost only contributed to our collective disenchantment. Although the culinary offerings still maintained a certain level of palatability, the inflated prices precipitated a significant downgrading of this eatery's standing in my esteem, sadly relegating it to a position inferior to its previous lofty perch."

The pizza is pretty good. Especially at 2am. But when it takes over an hour for delivery, no thank you. I shouldn't have to call 3 times to find out where my pizza is. Then when he finally showed up he asked for a tip. That's the best way to not get a tip.

I visited this establishment with my significant other last week for an evening meal, and I must say that my expectations were not entirely met. Despite the courteous and obliging demeanor of the waiting staff, the culinary offerings took an inordinate amount of time to arrive, and there were only a scant few other patrons present in the dining area. Upon the eventual arrival of our repast, my companion's poultry dish was unfortunately not adequately cooked. The waitress, however, demonstrated great proficiency in addressing the issue by promptly removing the item from our bill and ensuring that it was properly prepared before its return to our table. Although the flavor profile of the dish may have been somewhat lacking, we were, at that juncture, primarily concerned with the satisfaction of consuming palatable victuals. In light of this experience, I would not wholeheartedly endorse partaking in a dinner meal at this venue, but it may prove suitable for those seeking indulgent desserts.

I discover it perplexing that individuals possess a predilection for this establishment, as the culinary offerings are, in my opinion, subpar. I have an unwavering fondness for any dish that incorporates chilli cheese; however, the chilli cheese items available at this venue are, regrettably, unpalatable. Even a novice chef such as myself can effortlessly prepare superior quality hot dogs in the comfort of their own abode. My sole motivation for repeatedly visiting this eatery is to indulge in their delectable ice cream and lemonade float, an indulgence that elicits a profound sense of satisfaction. Despite my reservations regarding the edibles, I persist in partaking of their menu, with the jalapeno poppers being my preferred victual, which, fortunately, exhibit a satisfying degree of flavorfulness.

This is from a visit about a month ago.   I had a burger and a couple beers and my wife had a chicken flat-bread and a couple cocktails.  My fries were limp and overdone and the burger was lukewarm when served.  My wife's food quality OK.  The one thing that stood out was the lack of any urgency whatever to service.  I didn't time the wait staff or anything like that, but there were delays being seated, getting a menu, getting drink reorders, getting food orders from the kitchen, and finally, getting a check.  It was very obvious to me that the slot players and a couple \"regulars\" got a ton of attention and prompt service from the staff---everyone else, not so much.  Docked Mr. John a star for crappy service.  Even though I live close, there are so many consistently better neighborhood joints and I won't choose to return.

This culinary establishment offers fare that is economically priced, ostensibly due to its perceived quality. The egg rolls possess an unmistakable texture reminiscent of flour, while the fried rice lacks both flavor and warmth. Although the vegetables in the vegetable lo mein exhibit a satisfying crunch and freshness, their taste is overpowered by an excessive amount of garlic, rendering them unpalatable. The eatery's location, situated on a rather unsavory thoroughfare, belies its interior, which boasts cleanliness and relative tranquility. Given the abundance of Chinese restaurants in Madison, it remains unclear why patrons would opt to dine at this particular venue.

It's not enough to inspire me to change the star rating on my review, but it is worth noting that David, the General Manager of Rice and Company, contacted me to express his concern and regret about the lack of service I received on my visit. That's the kind of attention to customers I would have liked while I was at the restaurant. Maybe there will be some kind of trickle down effect, or whatever the economic term might be, but doubtful I'll volunteer to test that firsthand the next time I'm in town.

"It is patently evident that this establishment boasts an impressive array of Rebel merchandise, yet the prices associated with said items are nothing short of exorbitant. Indeed, it is utterly perplexing that a comparable hat can fetch $30 within these very walls, while its identical counterpart can be acquired for a mere $20 at a live ballgame or a paltry $16 through an online retailer directly affiliated with the manufacturer. However, for those who are unwavering in their quest for exceptional Rebel memorabilia, this venue does offer a plethora of unique items that are unlikely to be found elsewhere. It is advisable, therefore, to have a sufficient quantity of quarters on hand to facilitate parking, lest one encounter unnecessary difficulties in securing a parking space."

"Initially, it became apparent that their apparel was organized according to hue, rather than being categorized by dimensions, which, although aesthetically pleasing to the proprietors of second-hand establishments, proved to be inconvenient for prospective patrons seeking attire in a specific size. Additionally, the cost of their merchandise was exorbitant, with many items that piqued my interest available for purchase at a marginally higher price if acquired brand new, thereby rendering the premium prices incongruous with the unkempt and unsanitary state of the store; consequently, we will not be revisiting this particular location."

If we were able to transition my grandparents' healthcare network to an alternative provider, I would never again permit them to seek treatment at this particular St Lukes facility.  The quality of patient care is contingent upon the competency of the staff members assigned to a given shift and floor, which can be inconsistent and unpredictable.  While the Cardiology Department and Intensive Care Unit personnel have consistently demonstrated exceptional proficiency, the staff on the seventh floor and in the Emergency Room exhibit varying levels of expertise, ranging from adequate to inadequate.  This irregularity raises questions about the motivations and aptitudes of individuals who choose to pursue careers in the healthcare industry, particularly those who appear ill-suited to handle the demands and responsibilities associated with working in such an environment.

"It initiated auspiciously, being seated in less than ten minutes, and our server commenced with an air of proficiency, yet unfortunately, it deteriorated from that point forward. The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, but they neglected to provide our initial course. Attempting to locate our server proved arduous; we were compelled to repeatedly request replenishments. They also failed to present the dessert for my acquaintance's celebration. When it came time to settle the bill, we were once again obligated to seek out the server. Bearing in mind that the establishment was not particularly crowded, we ultimately managed to procure the services of a busboy to handle the transaction. Perhaps I shall endeavour to visit another branch."

"The culinary excursion pertaining to the consumption of a pie-like dish known colloquially as 'pizza' transpired to be merely adequate in its overall quality, despite my selection of Vinnie's, a variant of said dish that afforded me the opportunity to choose five toppings of my preference, specifically Italian sausage, black olives, onions, garlic, and basil; however, it must be noted that the gastronomical experience did not ascend to an exceptional level, but rather maintained a mediocre status, save for the hospitality displayed by our server, whose cordial and accommodating demeanor served as the zenith of the encounter."

"The culinary offerings are of satisfactory quality, however, it is a considerable source of vexation that they are delivered to my domicile on certain days and not others, which seems to be arbitrary and unpredictable. Furthermore, their delivery radius is three miles, while Grubhub indicates that my residence is situated at a distance of 2.8 miles, and MapQuest estimates it to be 3.3 miles. Therefore, it is reasonable to assume that my location falls within an acceptable proximity. Consequently, I implore them to refrain from acting in a capricious manner and to provide me with the desired Asian cuisine in a timely and consistent manner, without any further delay or inconvenience."

My vehicle experienced an operational failure within my residential garage, prompting me to contact this towing company, based on the recommendation provided by my automotive dealership. Following my initial telephone call, which transpired at 10:30 am, I was informed that the estimated time of arrival for the tow truck would be approximately 90 minutes. However, upon the lapse of said time frame, with no signs of the tow truck in sight, I opted to place a follow-up call to the company at 12:30 pm. During this second communication, I was assured that the tow truck would arrive within 30 minutes. Notably, the representative also requested that I provide my personal information once again, sparking my curiosity regarding the fate of the data I had previously conveyed during our initial conversation. As the hours passed, my frustration mounted, and I began to ponder the possibility of seeking assistance from an alternative towing service. Ultimately, after enduring a three-hour wait, the tow truck finally arrived at 2:30 pm. Although the driver exhibited a friendly demeanor, he encountered notable difficulties while attempting to jump-start my vehicle, necessitating the utilization of specialized equipment to facilitate its removal from the garage. Upon completion of the task, the driver departed without extending a farewell gesture or expressing gratitude for my patronage, leaving me feeling undervalued as a customer. In light of this experience, I am unlikely to engage the services of this particular towing company in the future. Moreover, I cannot help but wonder whether exceptional customer service has become a rarity in today's business landscape.

Went here for lunch today. Ordered two burgers and a large cajun fry to share. We waited for about 15mins for our food. Normally we would not have minded but we were the ONLY people in the place. When we got our food our fries were not cajun so we brought them back to the counter. The gentleman at the counter, larger guy with glasses, asked us if we want them remade, we said yes. Then he said, \"Actually, here is some seasoning\" He gave us one container of cajun seasoning. We said we would prefer them remade, it tastes great fresh and with the seasoning. At that point, he was ignoring us so we just went back to our table and began eating. \n\nI'm not impressed with their lack of customer service. We ordered something, we should get it. I've had much better service at the location on Val Vista and Baseline at Dana Park. I would drive the extra miles to get great service and quality food.

"The establishment presented itself to be merely adequate, with pancakes that failed to impress. The taste was reminiscent of a pre-made mix, lacking the fluffiness and texture one would expect from a quality pancake dish. Furthermore, the addition of powdered sugar, which I personally find unappealing, only served to detract from the overall experience. The waiting period, both for seating and food delivery, proved to be within the realm of averageness, neither particularly lengthy nor expedient. Unfortunately, the orange juice served did not fare much better, possessing an unmistakable similarity to the economical brands commonly found on grocery store shelves. Despite my initial enthusiasm for supporting a non-chain restaurant, my encounter with the pancakes left me underwhelmed and skeptical about their ability to deliver a truly exceptional dining experience."

I would confer upon STK in Las Vegas a rating of five stars, were it not for their deplorable customer service, which regrettably compels me to reduce my evaluation to two stars. Specifically, the blonde woman who processed our reservation exhibited an unmistakable haughtiness, bordering on impertinence, and her mannerisms struck me as utterly inappropriate for someone in a client-facing role. Furthermore, our server seemed overeager to expedite our dining experience, posing queries such as "Are you done now?" without first ascertaining whether we desired to procure additional sustenance for takeaway. This brusque behavior, coupled with his precipitous removal of our plates while one of my companions was still partaking in their meal, led us to deliberately prolong our ordering and consumption of desserts, ultimately resulting in a gratuity of merely 10% on a $400 tab. It is my conviction that courteousness and attentive service are indispensable components of a satisfactory dining encounter, and I cannot help but feel that the staff at STK fell short of these expectations. Notwithstanding the aforementioned deficiencies, I must admit that the culinary offerings at this establishment are indeed quite delectable.

Pathetic, utterly deplorable, and patently unacceptable, charging exorbitant fees for a meager glimpse of automotive masterpieces cordoned off by flimsy barriers, thereby denying enthusiasts the opportunity for an up-close examination and tactile experience with these magnificent machines. A glaring contrast to the welcoming atmosphere fostered by the Arizona Ferrari dealership, where an extensive array of vehicles is accessible for perusal at one's leisure, sans the burdensome constraints imposed by the aforementioned venue. A veritable travesty, leaving visitors feeling shortchanged and disillusioned.
Turns out eating here, appropriately, is a crap game. Food always OK To good. Service, you need to bring your luck.

Second time here, ordered a Greek Salad with Chicken Kabob.. the plate was so small i couldn't cut my chicken or even fork out the cheap iceberg lettuce without some falling on the table, chicken was way too saucy as well. Stick to a gyro, had that last time and it was golden. Seems like good people, they are nice.

We indulged in an impromptu visit to this establishment today, and our culinary excursion yielded a rather ambiguous outcome. While the tofu summer rolls demonstrated a certain degree of gastronomical prowess, their quality was somewhat diminished by a lack of exceptionalism. In contrast, the lemongrass soup exhibited a profound depth of flavor that was nothing short of remarkable. However, my pad see ew, despite its inherent merits, was regrettably compromised by an excessive saccharinity that bordered on the unpalatable. My spouse, whose gustatory preferences are notoriously discerning, experienced a series of unfortunate events that began with the Penang curry, which, much to his dismay, was prepared with coconut milk despite our server's assurance to the contrary. This unforeseen development precipitated a chain reaction of gastronomic disappointment, culminating in a Pad Thai dish that, while undoubtedly delectable, was marred by an overpowering sweetness and a formidable capsaicin kick. In conclusion, while Curry on Murray earns commendation for its ambiance and hospitality, the cuisine, unfortunately, falls short of true excellence.

"Individuals were expressing to us that they were experiencing such intense hilarity that it precipitated lacrimation. However, we did not encounter a considerable amount of mirth or sorrow. It remains uncertain whether this was due to our inability to establish a connection with the content or whether it was attributable to some other factor. Nonetheless, this program appears to be tailored towards an audience of individuals aged 45 and above."

We made the decision to visit this establishment based on perusing various reviews; however, my expectations were unfortunately not met, as this coffee shop proved to be nothing extraordinary.  Accompanied by my spouse and one of our twin children, I had intended to order the breakfast burrito, but I expressed a preference for turkey sausage instead of the customary pork sausage.  Unfortunately, the young woman behind the counter informed me that accommodating my request was not feasible.  Thus, I opted for the turkey sausage, egg, and cheese on an English muffin instead.  When I requested a scrambled egg for my infant daughter, the counter attendant regretfully stated that their eggs are pre-cooked into patties, which lacked appeal, much like my running shoes post-workout.  Consequently, I elected to cancel the food order and solely pay for the coffee and bottled orange juice I had purchased for my baby.  It is unfortunate, as I am perpetually seeking suitable breakfast locales.

"The establishment's pretentious attempt at sophistication was glaringly discordant with the subpar service and unjustified tariffs, leading me to question the validity of their claims to excellence; the panoramic view and exorbitant prices being the only redeeming features of an otherwise underwhelming experience."

Seriously!!!  I would never ever pay $50.00 for a pedicure EVER.. Well again and I wouldn't have paid it this time NEITHER.  We asked for pricing, I stated what I wanted  and the only change i made from time of check in to done was that I now wanted french tips.  Had I wanted to spend this kind of money, i would have gone to TheBathHouse.\n\nthe other thing that puzzled me was \"why, were they mopping the floor at 9 am in the morning, when the salon JUST opened\"  Who really wants to be at a Salon when they are cleaning up yesterday mess.

"It was a Thursday evening when we arrived at the club, and it proved to be a rather uncomfortable and lackluster experience. Despite our group of nine individuals receiving complimentary admission, allegedly due to the promoter's courtesy, the ambiance within the venue was underwhelming. As a first-time visitor to Las Vegas and club-goer, my expectations were not met, as the atmosphere was characterized by a pervasive sense of apathy among the clientele, who primarily consisted of older individuals. The only accessible area was the rooftop outdoor patio, which made socializing a challenge due to the throng of mature women and men. Furthermore, there was only one bar available, which was severely overburdened, leading to extended wait times for beverages. Ultimately, our visit was disappointing, and we have not returned to the establishment since."

"The quality of service was satisfactory, however, the culinary offerings did not meet my expectations, specifically, the soup and pasta dishes were subpar. Upon ordering the Tuscana Sausage Soup, I discovered that the potatoes were not adequately cooked, resulting in an unpleasant texture, and the seasoning was excessively salty, although the sausage itself was palatable. Furthermore, the Build Your Own Pasta option, which included spaghetti, bologonese sauce, meatballs, and mushrooms, was disappointing, as the noodles were only lukewarm, and the accompanying ingredients lacked flavor. Notably, the meatballs had an unmistakable taste and texture reminiscent of store-bought, frozen products. In conclusion, my experience with the pasta dishes was underwhelming, leading me to consider alternative options, such as a slice of pizza, for future visits."

I had a profoundly unfavorable impression of this establishment, as my predilection for vintage aesthetics and the allure of a 'dive' ambiance was not adequately fulfilled by its unremarkable and uninviting atmosphere; furthermore, the prices were not commensurate with the quality of the culinary offerings, specifically the burgers, which were subpar and failed to meet my expectations. The layout of the premises also presented an inconvenience, making it arduous to access the soda fountain for refills. My conviction is that this eatery's continued existence is largely attributable to the patronage of tourists who are oblivious to its shortcomings. Consequently, I would not consider returning to this restaurant.

"Our dining experience was marred by the unfortunate encounter with an extremely discourteous server, which led us to question the validity of leaving a positive review. Notwithstanding the palatable quality of the culinary offerings, we were compelled to confer a solitary star in light of the egregious behavior exhibited by the aforementioned staff member. It is worth mentioning that a comparable establishment, located in close proximity, offers not only a more satisfactory dining experience but also presents a significantly more affordable price point. A cursory examination of the menu revealed the presence of vegetarian options, which, while appreciated, proved insufficient in mitigating our overall dissatisfaction with the restaurant."

I fervently desire that I could have successfully established communication with Sherry's Pampered Pets, thereby enabling me to procure the reservation that I deemed essential. However, despite my concerted efforts, which included two telephone calls and an unreturned voicemail, I was unable to progress beyond the initial stage of securing said reservation. Following a protracted period of three to four days, during which I awaited a response to my voice message in vain, I opted to pursue alternative arrangements. It is utterly unfeasible for me to consider entrusting my canine companion to your care if I am unable to attain a responsive dialogue with your organization.

"We opted for a single night's stay at this establishment, primarily motivated by financial considerations, but unfortunately, our expectations were not met. Despite its visually appealing exterior, the hotel's interior appeared outdated, and the service we received was subpar. Specifically, we requested a 'non-smoking' room, but upon arrival, the room was permeated with a strong odor of smoke and tobacco. Following our complaint, we were instructed to proceed to the'manager's desk' to obtain a new room assignment, but our attempts to secure assistance were met with indifference and disinterest by multiple staff members. Eventually, we managed to engage with a representative who directed us to the farthest end of the desk, where we waited for approximately 10 minutes before being attended to. Unfortunately, the staff member who eventually assisted us seemed annoyed and informed us that we needed to wait further. After another 10-minute delay, a different employee arrived and instructed us to relocate to the opposite side of the extensive front desk, which proved challenging given the size of our luggage. Our overall experience was marred by poor customer service, and while we might consider returning if absolutely necessary, we would generally avoid this hotel due to the unpleasant encounter."

"Due to the dearth of adequate Chinese cuisine in my immediate vicinity, I opted to venture slightly further afield to sample the culinary offerings of Chopstix, based on the acclaim bestowed upon it by patrons. Unfortunately, the establishment's card reader was non-functional, prompting the staff member attending to me to request that I procure cash to facilitate the transaction. In light of this, I undertook a brief excursion to the nearest automated teller machine located within Smiths, incurring an additional fee of three dollars due to the fact that it was not affiliated with my financial institution. Upon my return, I found the premises devoid of any other patrons, with the same staff member who had initially attended to me now engaged in a personal telephone conversation on his mobile device, utterly disregarding my presence. I persisted in waiting for several minutes, during which time another employee was occupied at the counter, similarly neglecting to acknowledge me. Eventually, he glance up and enquired if he could provide assistance, to which I replied that I wished to settle the payment for my meal. At this point, the previously engaged staff member finally terminated his phone call and accepted my payment, without offering any expression of regret, discount, or token of appreciation for my trouble. The culinary items I selected, specifically wor wonton soup, house fried rice, and orange chicken, were satisfactory, but the experience was significantly marred by the unacceptable level of service, rendering future visits unlikely."

No. With all of your other options in Vegas for buffets (Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal), this just doesn't cut it. Food was dry, sitting out too long, and the cheaper price attracts a ...cheaper crowd...if you know what I mean. You're in Vegas, spring for the good buffet!

"The culinary experience was merely satisfactory, and the prices of the menu items were slightly excessive. I opted for the street-style pork sandwich, and the meat was cooked to a palatable doneness akin to a blue rare. However, the sandwich itself was diminutive in size, akin to a small biscuit, and the portion was disappointingly inadequate. Prior to this, I had ordered a pork taco with green salsa, whose name escapes me at present, and while the pork was cooked to perfection, the tortilla was regrettably soggy due to the pork's grease. My companion had dim sum, which, although not substantially sized, was accompanied by an unpleasant odor, according to her account; however, the taste was reportedly acceptable. In conclusion, the establishment fell short of expectations, and I would not consider revisiting it. It is worth mentioning that the beverages served are presented in bottles, which precludes the possibility of complimentary refills. Furthermore, these bottles vary in size, and depending on the selection, the quantity received may be less than anticipated, with certain bottles containing less contents than others. I would not recommend this venue to anyone, as the prices are exorbitant, and the cuisine is unappealing."

Our first visit here. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The location is priceless. Westgate  is a super fun place to hang out. Too bad the pizza wasn't so great. It tasted like a frozen pizza I could have cooked at home! Bland. Sauce was gross. Crust was thin and too soft. Its too bad. Given the location and competition... the pizza shod be much better! Too many other choices!

"The personnel exhibited a profound lack of impressiveness, their culinary offerings were merely adequate, and the prices were exorbitant relative to the quality provided. It appears that management is endeavoring to establish an upmarket eatery, but significant strides must be taken before such a lofty goal can be attained. The wine selection is meager, portion sizes are minuscule, and the service staff exudes an air of haughtiness. In comparison to other dining establishments within the city limits of Charlotte, this establishment falls short in numerous aspects."

I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Now that have, I'm good. 

It's the kind of place you go to after a night of partying when your standards aren't so high. It wasn't all THAT bad, but not great  either.  

I judge Latin-style restaurants on their chips and salsa. If it's not good, I know what to expect from their kitchen. With that said..
the chips were greasy and salsa tasted like Pace picante. 

I had the two taco plate of grilled chicken and steak tacos with re-fried beans and rice. The grilled steak taco had good flavor, but the chicken was VERY dry. I added lime and salsa to try and moisten it up. All and all...it was decent, but not any better quality than a late night taco place. 

Service was ok.

We indulged in a brief sojourn at this establishment during a recent family excursion, and our experience was largely satisfactory, with the accommodations and sanitary facilities being suitably clean and well-maintained.  Its proximity to Interstate 77 rendered it an ideal location for those seeking convenience, while its close proximity to a premier shopping center further augmented its appeal.  However, upon our return visit a mere year later, certain aspects of our lodgings did not meet our expectations, specifically in regards to the tidiness of the bathing area and the excessive noise emanating from the air conditioning unit, which significantly impaired our ability to obtain a restful night's slumber.  Despite these issues, the hospitality displayed by the staff remained consistent and cordial, yet we may opt to explore alternative accommodations in the future.

"Underwhelming culinary experience with too much repetition."

The text is: "Cool restaurant great neighborhood concept but the food is so bland. Store bought chips for the dips. Kids Mac and cheese is gritty and flavorless. Chicken in salad is overcooked and not seasoned. Heaping pile of raw arugula on my pizza. Salt is a great resource. Thanks but no thanks, not again."

The modified text is:

"Amidst an ambiance of trendy sophistication, the gastronomic offerings of this establishment fail to deliver a palatable experience, marred by an uninspired selection of flavors and questionable preparation methods. The utilization of store-bought chips as a complement to dips raises questions about the quality of ingredients used in the kitchen. Moreover, the kids' macaroni and cheese dish disappoints with its lackluster taste and unpleasant texture, while the chicken in the salad suffers from overcooking and an absence of discernible seasoning. Topping it all off, a generous portion of raw arugula threatens to overwhelm the senses, rendering the pizza unbalanced and inharmonious. Notwithstanding the value of salt as a culinary staple, the overall impression of this dining excursion sadly falls short of expectations, making future visits unlikely."

The food is still great and terrific value for $4, but unfortunately the `douche factor` has gone up to 11! I should have known better when I heard some fat suit walk out with three others and say `4 people for under $30, what a deal!` I was like, oh no, they`ve invaded it. I got there at around 1:20pm after the Friday lunch rush and usually it`s some students or a couple having a late lunch, now it`s full of soccer moms and cheap douchebag suits who found out about it on FB or Yelp, please stop these greedy people from making long line ups impossible to eat good food!!!

"It is utterly disappointing to discover that there are no reservations available post 5 o'clock, which unfortunately coincides with my schedule and renders the establishment unsuitable for my purposes. Furthermore, the absence of a phone charging station within the premises is a significant inconvenience that hinders my ability to maintain communication with my associates during my visit. Notwithstanding these shortcomings, the service provided by the waitstaff, particularly the exceptional and remarkable performance of the waitress, deserves recognition and commendation. However, the inexperienced nature of the new bartender resulted in an extended duration for the preparation of my desired beverage, thereby necessitating additional time expenditure on my part. In light of these factors, I regretfully conclude that future visits to this establishment after 5 p.m. are unlikely."

"For a pizza venue boasting a plant-based culinary selection, it was nothing short of perplexing to discover that post 10:30 pm, not a single vegan pizza remained available. It appeared that every other pizza variety was being offered, yet the absence of a vegan-style pizza was glaringly conspicuous. As a patron who has previously enjoyed their fare, I felt utterly disillusioned by this oversight. It would be reasonable to assume that a vegan pizza option would be readily accessible, particularly during peak hours, in order to cater to the diverse dietary preferences of their clientele. Moreover, the lack of any accommodation or offer to create a vegan pizza was, in my opinion, subpar customer service. My sentiments were akin to disappointment and frustration.":

"The solitary motivation that would compel my return is the presence of a musical ensemble that warrants my attendance to such an extent that missing their performance would be unthinkable. Having stated this, I shall proceed to expound upon the aspects of the venue that elicited my approbation, commencing with the security personnel who exhibited remarkable cordiality and accommodatingness, particularly when my companion opted to seize the opportunity to propose to his significant other, for which I extend my sincerest gratitude. However, I must caution potential attendees against the exorbitant parking fees and limited availability of spaces, which necessitates arriving prematurely to secure a suitable parking spot. Furthermore, while the sonic quality of the performances was passable, it fell short of excellence, a sentiment that I dare say was shared by numerous patrons. Lastly, I must express my indignation at the egregious prices charged for beverages, which, coupled with the aforementioned limitations, leads me to label this establishment as one that exploits its privileged position as a primary host of notable touring acts. In conclusion, I implore prospective concertgoers to exercise fiscal prudence and either abstain from consuming alcoholic beverages or surreptitiously introduce them into the venue, a practice that, albeit unethical, seems necessary given the exorbitant rates charged by the management."

"My culinary predilection gravitates towards the notion of relishing in savory, wholesome gastronomy. Following four consecutive excursions to this establishment, my expectations have been utterly disillusioned, as the eatery has persistently failed to deliver a reliable dining experience. During my maiden visit, the fare was palatable, yet the hospitality was regrettably subpar. On my second foray, I opted for their signature flatbread, only to discover that it was conspicuously absent from the menu. Perplexed, I settled for a barbecue beef sandwich, which, to my surprise, was quite delectable. Alas, the accompanying sweet potato fries were unfortunate casualties of an egregious culinary misstep, having been charred to an unsightly, inedible state. This blatant display of gastronomical negligence only served to deepen my skepticism. My third visit proved equally underwhelming, with the kitchen seemingly struggling to maintain even a semblance of consistency. Succumbing to curiosity, I decided to sample their morning fare on my fourth visit. An hour beyond the appointed opening time, I found myself standing in a vacant dining area, with nary a soul in sight, nor any discernible indication of a breakfast menu. After a full four minutes of being ignored by the indifferent staff, a solitary employee finally acknowledged my presence with a tardy greeting. It is with profound disappointment that I must conclude that this establishment has failed to meet my expectations and, accordingly, cannot be recommended."

I have been to this location many times, and let me say that Einstein's is vastly superior as far as bagels are concerned. That stated, Bruegger's does serve good softwiches...however, I could get better bread and bagels elsewhere.

There should be legislation precluding Greek eateries from adopting a corporate paradigm. I anticipate my Greek restaurants to be familial establishments, administered and operated by unsightly, hirsute, and corpulent Greeks (inclusive of both masculine and feminine proprietors). Indeed, the more unsightly the proprietor, the better, as I posit an inversely proportional relationship between the caliber of Hellenic cuisine and the physical attractiveness of the restaurateur. Was there not a cinematic production featuring rotund Greeks who owned a diner... wait... I must procure some Windex, as I am experiencing a nascent pimple. Anyway, Daphne's validates my assertion. Upon craving flesh, bread, and frites, I opted to dine at Daphne's, given its proximity. I would characterize my gyro as a "styro-gyro." The meat was frigid and devoid of flavor, having been carved several hours prior. The pita bread resembled a vintage, sun-rotted Frisbee that had lain beside the domicile throughout the summer, crumbling into fragments. The frites were pipping hot, yet I could discern the taste of the frozen sack in which they were packaged. The sole redeeming feature lies in Daphne's offering of a delectable diet Soba grapefruit-flavored beverage at their soda fountain. That was indeed a tasty diet drink. Oopah!

Oh dear. Drinks decent but service awful.

Tried to book a table 5 days in advance. Tried 3 times and no one would pick up the phone and gave up as the Germany vs Brazil Blitzkreig was starting.

Called back two days later - after an extended discussion about seating arrangements (size of group & suitable tables) then high table by window was confirmed.

Arrived at designated time, table given to someone else and they didn't know about the booking. Just as well a couple of the gang didn't make it as they'd given away our big table which was made such a big deal of when I tried to book. Saw 4 walk-in's arrive after us and get served before us. No acknowledgement when I arrived. Took 40 mins to get the drinks - cocktails (nearly 25 mins after arriving before the order taken and got some water as knew cocktails might be a bit slow). Then 10 mins after that to get snacks that we had to ask again for. 

The guy that ended up serving us was really nice but he only arrived 25mins in as he was a bit more aware than the girl serving when we arrived.

So Juniper, nah. Had I not been using a voucher, I'd have walked. And the voucher was a 2nd chance after friend's horror stories of bad service...

"The establishment in question boasts a proficient and skilled team of mixologists, with a few notable exceptions. It is advisable to exercise caution when selecting a bartender, as the quality of service can vary greatly depending on the individual attending to your needs. While some bartenders demonstrate exceptional expertise and dedication to their craft, others may fall short of expectations, thereby compromising the overall experience. As such, it is recommended that patrons visiting this establishment refrain from frequenting it on specific days of the week, lest they risk encountering subpar service."

2/5 for great people working there, and the friendly vibe you get just walking in the door. BAM, smells like a pickling factory but do not fear, the bar area looks fun. Our experience was bad however-- the noodles in our ramen were cooked Al Dente, and you know what that means once an amalgam of them begins to expand in your stomach. They definitely weren't cooked all the way, so thus, I felt like I was going to LITERALLY lose my food after I finished a relatively small bowl. Yeah, I'm a small person, but you know, I can still eat! I just felt so sick afterwards.

The spinach- strange & refreshing.
The carrots- lovely.
The pork- cold, but good.
The nori- you know, your standard nori.
The broth- yeah, a little salty, but good. We tried the Pai Ton, the tonkotsu broth without the Pork ordeal.


But the noodles! They made me so sick, and I really want to love this place because their ramen is so diverse. After the meal, one of the friendly staff members made us some little non-alcoholic shots, so like I said-- SUPER NICE people! I just can't handle their style of food, it doesn't agree with me at all. If you're sensitive like me, try Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe-- they'll be a more classic and authentic option for you. 
Cheers!

Upon arrival, my expectations were elevated due to the pre-existing buzz surrounding this establishment, and I must say that my initial appraisal of the interior design and ambiance did not disappoint. However, upon ordering a pizza, I found the price point to be somewhat prohibitive in relation to the quality and quantity of toppings provided, which unfortunately resulted in an underwhelming dining experience due to the ease with which the toppings could be dislodged from the crust. Furthermore, my order of cheesy bread paled in comparison to the offerings of a certain competitor, specifically Little Caesar's. Although the server was amicable, her attentiveness waned during prolonged periods, leaving me feeling neglected. Despite these shortcomings, I would consider giving this restaurant another chance by exploring alternative menu options, such as the calzone, which appeared visually appealing.

"While our culinary excursion garnered a mere four stars, primarily due to the unbalanced composition of our dishes, specifically the excessive cheesiness of the chili and the overwhelming oiliness of the beef stroganoff, which respectively hindered the palatability of both dishes, we must commend the prompt and attentive service proffered by the wait staff, particularly during a peak period on a Thursday evening. Notwithstanding the aforementioned drawbacks, we may consider revisiting the establishment to sample their burger offerings."

After a relentless and ardent endorsement from a acquaintance that persisted for an extensive duration of six months, I felt compelled to partake in a culinary excursion to this establishment. Upon indulging in their offerings, I must confess that my turkey sandwich was rather unremarkable and lacking in distinction, failing to elicit any profound sentiments of satisfaction or delight within my gastronomical sensibilities. Furthermore, I must express my utter dismay and disappointment at the glaring omission of a vital component, specifically Sweetener, for their unsweetened iced tea. Such an egregious oversight serves as a sufficient deterrent against any future visits, thereby rendering my experience a singular and regrettable occurrence.

I use to enjoy this place. But, I just had a bad experience for lunch. I even heard my server talking to his colleagues about how bad the tip was from the previous table. Also, they were out of the first two beverages that I asked for.  Will not be going back anytime soon.

The commemoration of my birth anniversary was celebrated at this esteemed culinary establishment, and it is with great regret that I must convey my utter disappointment and disillusionment with the gastronomical offerings presented before me, despite the exceptional quality of the hospitality extended by the staff. The fiscal responsibility associated with the consumption of such victuals far surpassed the paltry sum of two hundred fifty dollars, for which I received a scant selection of ribeye, pork, bone marrow, and a mere pair of wineglasses. In light of this egregious discrepancy, I would strongly advise potential patrons to seek alternative dining options, specifically those offered by the illustrious Bobby Flay, where a superior cut of meat can be obtained at a comparable price point.

"Airport ambiance permeated by licentiousness; alcoholic beverages, gambling, and unquestionably, strip clubs will succeed. Numerous culinary options abound, perpetually spotless, and effortless navigation prevails. Consequently, five stars would be awarded --- were it not for the interminable queue for taxis. This phenomenon is utterly objectionable and raises astonishment at the lack of efficient methods implemented by gaming establishments to expedite the process, thereby facilitating prompt entry into their revenue-generating premises. The taxi line must undergo enhancement!"

"Two stars is an accurate assessment, as our experience was merely average, with a few notable drawbacks. Our initial accommodations at a Motel 6 were inferior, but we did notice a slight improvement upon switching to Windermere. However, the bathroom facilities were subpar and required more thorough sanitization. A comprehensive deep cleaning of these areas would likely elevate the overall rating by one star. Notwithstanding, the rooms were spacious, and the presence of a balcony was a welcome feature. The pool and hot tub were also enjoyable, but their potential for excellence was hindered by the lack of regular maintenance, specifically the removal of fallen branches and leaves.  \n\nDespite these shortcomings, the customer service staff exhibited friendliness and helpfulness, and the breakfast offerings were satisfactory. Windermere, attention to detail in cleanliness and upkeep will greatly enhance your establishment's appeal."

We have been patrons of this establishment for an extended period, having partaken of their culinary offerings on numerous occasions in the past, specifically within the confines of the Mirage Hotel. Our most recent visit, however, proved to be a profound disappointment, as the server failed to demonstrate even a rudimentary understanding of the soup du jour, responding in a manner that could only be described as eccentric and hurried. Furthermore, the quality of the food was subpar, prompting us to return it due to its unacceptable temperature. Additionally, we found the prices to be disproportionate to the level of quality provided, leading us to question the overall value proposition offered by this establishment. Considering the plethora of dining options available in Las Vegas, we would not recommend planning a return visit to this particular venue, as they seem to employ a policy of charging excessive prices for mediocre fare.

They have great food if you can get service.   Last time I went wewaited 30 min and didn't have any service at all so we left and done 20 min to another restaurant. We just phone order wings and pick them up now

"Perhaps owing to my predilection for upscale dining establishments in New York City, specifically steakhouses, my expectations were not entirely met during my recent visit to this restaurant, which I must admit was somewhat disappointing, especially considering the fact that I was part of a sizable group of ten individuals who had gathered together for a midday meal; while the lunch menu did offer an impressive array of options, unfortunately, my steak was cooked beyond my desired level of doneness, which left me feeling somewhat unsatisfied; furthermore, I couldn't help but wonder why the menu did not feature any porterhouse steak options, which I believe would have been a welcome addition to the menu, particularly given the high standards that this establishment purports to uphold; lastly, while the wine selection was undoubtedly extensive and of excellent quality, the prices were somewhat prohibitive, even by Las Vegas standards."

"Ew, indeed! My gastronomical sensibilities are hardly so refined as to be unimpressed by the uninspired culinary offerings presented at this establishment. However, I must confess that the flavorless canned mushrooms and frozen spinach incorporated into my omelet lacked even the most basic semblance of seasoning, resulting in an unappetizing, amorphous mass deposited haphazardly upon my plate. Furthermore, the interminable delay between placing our order and its eventual arrival only served to exacerbate my already waning enthusiasm for the dining experience. Hash browns notwithstanding, I remain perplexed by the ostensibly high acclaim lavished upon this eatery."

"It merely requires a negative mindset and an inflexible demeanor to transform a positive encounter into a detrimental one in a remarkably brief period. Unfortunately, this phenomenon transpired at 360 Physical Therapy, where I was prepared to compose a laudatory review, predicated on the quality of their physical therapy services. My overall impression of the physical therapist was favorable, and I felt that I received adequate care. However, the clinic maintains a stringent policy regarding appointment cancellations, which entails the imposition of a substantial fee. Regardless of the numerous $35 copays I have paid (a sum that I deem exorbitant, yet that is a separate issue with my healthcare provider), and despite my diligence in informing them of any potential lateness, the billing manager remains resolute in demanding payment for an alleged missed appointment that I adamantly maintain was rescheduled beforehand. The impasse has become an arduous and unyielding contest. 

My central contention is that preserving customer satisfaction is paramount. In my case, I had attended multiple sessions at their facility, consistently arriving punctually and settling payments promptly. I was the embodiment of a model client. Were it not for this minor yet contentious issue, I would continue to patronize their services and recommend them to others. Alas, their reluctance to relinquish this trivial dispute renders it unfortunate that I cannot do so."

The entire property is run down, kinda creepy and pretty yucky.  I had rented some inline skates thad had moldy inserts.  I think they may be the only roller rink in Madison so you don't have too  many options.\n\nObviously this place is popular with kids and they don't seem to notice all the blight so we would just grin and bear it.

Recently visited Frank and Lupes. Food was very good but service was slow. In fact, we had to go to the bar to order drinks because our waiter wasn't coming over to our table.  At the end of dinner, my dinner partner left the table to use the restroom, and our waiter came over and asked me if I was waiting to be seated......this after he had been already waiting on me for an hour and a half.

"Upon contemplating my intended remarks regarding the MarchÃ© Bonsecours, I found myself concurring with Virginie's sentiment that the edifice and its exterior are undoubtedly impressive. However, for me, this is where the appeal ends. Every time I enter, I find that it has transformed into an exclusive shopping center tailored solely for affluent tourists. While they claim to showcase works by local artists and artisans, the products appear homogeneous and are significantly more expensive than elsewhere. If you are in the area, feel free to visit and admire the architecture of the building, but do not expect to be impressed by the overpriced and monotonous offerings within."

I have been here twice and had 2 different experiences. The first time we liked what the menu looked like so we had lunch here.  Food was good, standard bar food so nothing overly special but good. Service was decent, it was not busy so we were checked on regularly.  We found out they have the UFC fights so we wanted to go here to watch them. Fight night; we show up and it is $10 per person! What!?! Every other place in EV only charges $5/pp. We were already there and they were just about to start so we stayed. Next our waitress informs us that she needs a credit card or id as a security for the table. What?!? We are a 40 something couple, you think we are going to dine-and-dash...really. After a bit of discussion, I reluctantly give up my card. Then the fights start but because it is March Madness, not all the TV's are turned to the fight as they said they would be. So I have to crank my neck in order to watch them, even after the game ended they still did not turn the tv's. \nThe food again was ok and service was good so we will go back for food but not to watch a fight, I will stick with Old Chicago or Tilted Kilt for my UFC viewing.

"Although the quality of the burritos may not be optimal, they serve as a satisfactory temporary solution to satiate one's hunger during periods of intense work-related commitments, thereby obviating the need for an alternative breakfast option. Personally, I consume these burritos with moderate frequency, approximately once every two weeks. However, it is unfortunate that the service accompanying this culinary experience leaves much to be desired. Frequently, upon placing a telephonic order, I am subjected to an extended period of waiting, often resulting in abandonment of the call without receiving any assistance whatsoever. This necessitates initiating the process anew, which ultimately leads to the successful placement of my order. In the event that a comparable establishment offered delivery services, I would seriously consider patronizing their establishment instead."

This accommodation establishment, characterized by its aged and deteriorated state, failed to provide an adequate level of cleanliness and maintenance within its guest rooms, specifically exemplified by the presence of dust and the absence of essential amenities such as cups and laundry bags, and additionally featured a bedding ensemble with a soiled sheet exhibiting a conspicuous bloodstain, compelling me to request the attention of the housekeeping staff for the purpose of replacing the bed linens.

"The availability of beer on tap was restricted, prompting me to facetiously remark that I could affix a label to a tap and designate it with a name of my choosing, although such an action would not render it factual. Furthermore, even if they possessed the entirety of the beer they professed to offer, it would remain insufficient to justify the moniker of a 'world' of beer, owing to its limited nature in terms of both supply and diversity. Consequently, our gathering opted to venture towards an alternative venue, located further up the street, whereupon we discovered a more extensive array of options."
Super slow service compared to other EBs. IlI go to the one on Sahara even though its 10 minutes out of the way next time.

"The luncheon special is available exclusively until four o'clock post meridiem, priced at an economical sum of seven dollars and ninety-nine cents. While the culinary offerings were satisfactory, they failed to possess any remarkable qualities that would motivate my return. The hospitality, though adequate, did not surpass expectations. In conclusion, my gastronomic experience elsewhere has been significantly more enjoyable."

"I visited the establishment for the purpose of consuming a midday repast on this present day. This marks my second occasion of partaking in sustenance at this particular venue, and unfortunately, my order was once again botched. I had placed an order for a chicken ceaser salad burrito, erroneously assuming that said dish did not contain tomatoes, as my recollection of a traditional ceaser salad does not include such an ingredient. However, I was mistaken, as this particular iteration of the dish did, in fact, incorporate tomatoes. As I am not particularly fond of tomatoes, I requested that the kitchen staff prepare an alternative burrito, which they graciously did. Although the second burrito exhibited a marginal improvement in taste compared to the initial offering, it still fell short of my expectations. It is conceivable that the restaurant had an excess of tomatoes and sought to eliminate them by incorporating them into their dishes. In retrospect, I might have been better served by patronizing Costa Vida, but alas, that establishment tends to be quite busy, leaving me discontent and dissatisfied with my burrito-related experiences."

"My daughter and I embarked upon an excursion specifically dedicated to acquiring these bagels while they were still fresh from the oven in the morning, and I must say that my expectations were not entirely fulfilled. In fact, I would venture to assert that my predilection for New York-style bagels (a preference that has motivated me to undertake similar pilgrimages in the past) was not entirely satiated by the offerings of Montreal's bagel purveyors. While I acknowledge that there exists a certain je ne sais quoi associated with the city's unique bagel variant, characterized by its thinness and subtle sweetness, it does not necessarily conform to my individualized culinary inclinations. Moreover, it was rather disconcerting to discover that a few of the dozen bagels purchased during our excursion exhibited telltale signs of staleness and were only suitable for consumption after a period of maturation. Amongst the assortment we sampled, the sesame variety was perhaps the most satisfactory, but it was not enough to persuade us to abandon our allegiance to the superior quality and authenticity of New York-style bagels. It is my conviction that many Americans who have had the privilege of indulging in premium bagels within the confines of New York City would concur with my assessment. Incidentally, I am of the opinion that several establishments in Boston offer comparable or even superior alternatives. Suffice it to say that Montreal's gastronomic landscape boasts an array of exceptional French cuisine, which, in my estimation, renders it unnecessary for the city to attempt to rival New York's preeminence in the realm of Jewish delicacies. (It is worth mentioning that Schwartz's, a local eatery, is, in my opinion, vastly overrated.)"

I have never been an ardent devotee of Olive Garden, but a novel and luminous one recently materialized near my domicile on the western periphery. My spouse and I speculated, "Why not sample it once more after an extensive hiatus?" Our rationalization proved to be a misguided endeavor, as the culinary experience was utterly unsatisfactory. It is perplexing why we subject ourselves to such frustration when our instincts caution us against certain gastronomic indulgences. In the future, I shall adhere to my intuition.  

My companion and I opted for the fried mussel de napoli, which was merely adequate. The mussels were cooked and immersed in a garlic butter sauce, rendering them unremarkable.
