Thus, we opted for take-out, which, regrettably, entailed an interminable wait exceeding 10 minutes on multiple occasions, even in the absence of a queue. Despite the prolonged delay, the culinary offerings were relatively satisfying, albeit resembling grilled wraps more closely than authentic burritos, as astutely observed by a fellow reviewer. It is worth noting, however, that the restaurant's payment options were woefully limited, with only cash transactions facilitated, a decidedly antiquated practice in this era of ubiquitous digital payments. Furthermore, the parking arrangement, characterized by angled spaces requiring a precarious traversal of the sidewalk, struck us as hazardous and ill-conceived. To avoid endangering pedestrians while exiting, we advise exercising extreme caution."

"Murphy's boasts an advantageous location, situated in a prime plaza proximal to the central district of Chandler, thereby presenting an excellent opportunity for growth and development. As an Irish pub, Murphy's fills a void in the local market, catering to a demographic that has been historically underserved in the region. Although the establishment itself is somewhat diminutive in size, the bar, which spans nearly the entire length of the suite, can accommodate a diverse clientele comprised primarily of adults ranging in age from their late 20s to their early 40s. Furthermore, Murphy's offers an extensive selection of beers available on tap, ensuring that each patron can find a brew that suits their individual taste preferences. The staff at Murphy's is amiable and attentive, making a concerted effort to provide quality service to all patrons, despite the occasional presence of live musical performances, which may occupy limited space within the venue. Notwithstanding, concerns regarding the longevity of Murphy's are mitigated by the recognition of its potential value to the surrounding community."

Drinks were great, but the bartender was rude! My party and I had already had a few drinks over at VBGBs, and we walked over to Willies. Once in, we went up to the counter to order some drinks. Having never been there before, my friend asked what drink tasted like chocolate, and the bartender snarked at her that \"Chocolate tasted like chocolate.\" When we tried to order the Call-a-Cab, he asked if we liked Robatussen. While I do appreciate being warned about the flavor of the drink, his attitude was pretty annoying. I've also been to the Myrtle Beach location, where the bartender was very sweet, offered to get us samples, and kept checking back in on us since we were seated at the bar. \n\nAs everyone else has warned, don't order Call-a-Cab by itself - it's hard to drink. But everything I have tried (Shock Treatment, Chocolate Thunder, Sour Apple) was delicious.

"The Saturday night smorgasbord boasts a price tag of 26.95 per individual as of this writing, which, in my opinion, would be a reasonable rate at 20, but the current cost of 27 is slightly elevated. While some delectable offerings graced the table, such as the savory steak and succulent salmon, as well as the rich yet not overwhelming peanut butter chocolate cream pie, a notable disappointment emerged in the form of the purported French onion soup. Unfortunately, this dish was fabricated with what can only be described as subpar ingredients, closely resembling the questionable ones served by McDonald's on their sandwiches, and barely palatable even for a budget-friendly buffet priced at a mere 7 dollars. In fact, a cup of Lipton instant soup would have been a superior alternative. It is worth mentioning that fresh onions are not particularly expensive, and while a truly exceptional French Onion soup does require some time and effort to prepare, it is hardly an arduous task, even for a novice culinary student. In summary, I concur with previous assessments; the quality of the buffet varies greatly, ranging from impressive to unacceptable."

Pros:
Good music on radio.They played Todd Rundgren during dinner

Lots of server attention

Decent selection of draft beer

Pulled pork was good

Corn side was good

Portions were large

Cons,

Hush puppies were unbeatable.Awful

Beef brisket was waaaay too salty

Mac and cheese was a fried puck with cheese sauce 

Tiny serving of vinegar sauce

Expensive$24 for two meat platter with one beer.NYC prices

here's the deal: if you come here expecting berthillon, you will be disappointed.  if you come here expecting very fine american style gelato, you'll probably leave very very happy.  \n\ni came somewhere in the middle---i recognize that i can't get a certain quality of gelato this side of the atlantic, but i was expecting a little bit more.  the choc was milk choc.  gelato ought to be made with dark choc.  i'm not sure i'd trust the fruity gelato, knowing it won't compare to france/italy.  but, i bet the nutella is great---i'll try that next time!

"Dim-sum enthusiasts seeking an early morning culinary excursion in Las Vegas may find solace in the fact that this particular establishment boasts an uncharacteristically early opening time of 10:00 am, a full hour prior to the customary commencement of operations at neighboring eateries. While the quality of the diminutive steamed dumplings, known colloquially as har gow, may fall short of expectations due to their unremarkable proportions, the flavors therein remain palatable. It is worth noting, however, that the prices charged for these delectable morsels are somewhat elevated in comparison to those offered at alternative venues, presumably as a consequence of the restaurant's location within the Rio Casino complex, which, despite its once-luxurious appointments, now exudes an air of faded splendor."

"Commissioned their culinary services for an occasion, and the gastronomic offerings were indeed of superior quality, boasting two varieties of quiche that garnered effusive praise from all attendees. However, a fruit platter was inadvertently omitted, fortunately, I had prudently arranged for a surplus of sustenance, rendering it a relatively insignificant misstep, although admittedly, not the most favorable first impression. Additionally, the delivery was precipitously expedited, arriving some 15-20 minutes ahead of schedule, while punctuality is generally appreciated, the premature arrival of hot fare presents logistical difficulties...nonetheless, the victuals were fastidiously prepared. It is likely that their services will be solicited again, albeit with rigorous quality control and emphasis on precise timing."

"Concerning the culinary offerings in question, certain dishes have been deemed commendable, specifically the plantain and black bean mash, lump crab nachos, and chipotle ribs. However, it appears that the quality of service is inconsistent and unpredictable, with some patrons receiving attentive and efficient care while others are neglected or ignored. Furthermore, the enchiladas have been described as unremarkable and lacking in flavor, while the greens, though healthful and nutritious, are uninspired and unimaginative in their presentation. Of note, the grilled corn, once a highlight of the menu when served on the cob, has suffered a decline in quality since its removal from the cob, ostensibly due to concerns regarding messiness. A suggestion for improvement would be to prioritize the culinary experience over superficial considerations of cleanliness."

Last evening's experience was somewhat disillusioning, as it failed to meet the expectations established by previous visits to this establishment. Despite the ambiance of the patio, which was enhanced by the presence of heaters and a live DJ, the culinary offerings and service fell short of satisfactory. Specifically, the food, while adequate, lacked the flavor and quality anticipated, with the mozzarella and tomato panini being particularly unimpressive. Furthermore, the service was subpar, with a waitress who exhibited bizarre behavior, including sarcastic and underhanded comments, spilling water on the table, and taking an inordinate amount of time to deliver the bill and process payment. It is conceivable that the waitress was experiencing a personal difficulty, but her conduct was nonetheless unprofessional and detracted from the overall dining experience. Notwithstanding this, Bomberos remains a popular venue, and future patrons would be advised to avoid the panini and exercise caution when interacting with the waitstaff.

"One of the aspects I thoroughly enjoy about this establishment is the alfresco seating during the more temperate seasons. Additionally, their Bellini, Toasted Ravioli, and Rosemary-Chicken Pizza are culinary delights that never fail to impress my taste buds. However, there is certainly room for enhancement, particularly in regards to their takeout system, which has led me to seek alternative dining options on multiple occasions. It is my belief that offering designated pickup windows for loyal patrons is not an adequate means of expressing gratitude, especially considering the premium price point. Oregano's, you must recognize the abundance of exceptional competitors in the Central Phoenix area and subsequently revamp your customer service approach in order to maintain a competitive edge. I shall endeavor to sample your offerings once again in the near future, and I look forward to observing any improvements."

"I requested the seafood trio, which was served atop a bed of risotto, and while I cannot deny that the culinary elements themselves were satisfactory, particularly the salmon and shrimp, the portion size was conspicuously diminutive in comparison to my fellow diners', and the cost was disproportionately elevated. As an aside, the calamari and spinach artichoke dip that we partook of as appetizers were indeed delectable, and the peanut butter mousse that concluded our repast was likewise enjoyable. However, taking into account the totality of the dining experience, I must confess that it fell short of being truly exceptional or memorable, eliciting neither profound animosity nor unadulterated adoration. Therefore, if an individual were to express a desire to visit this establishment, I would not actively discourage them, but I would not enthusiastically endorse it either, nor would I personally go out of my way to return."

"Pizza can be likened to sexual intercourse; even when it's subpar, it remains enjoyable. This establishment elicits a similar sentiment from me. While the pizza itself was not particularly impressive, I did appreciate the garlic-infused flavor incorporated into the crust. Unfortunately, my order was botched, and instead of the requested pepperoni and garlic combination, I received a pie adorned with pepperoni and olives. The service staff failed to express any regret or offer a discount, leaving a sour taste in my mouth. In addition, we sampled their chicken fingers, which were unremarkable but edible. It was evident that they used low-quality ingredients. Considering the cost, I might return (two medium two-topping pizzas and five chicken fingers for $15)."

As others have said, this is a cheap stay and that's what you should expect. The benefit is the location - right smack in the middle of the strip. Even the penthouse didn't impress me here. I have seen better. One really fun thing is the dealer-impersonators. That was a treat, until I noticed that they just repeat the same performers a couple times per night. Still cool, though.

"On this particular occasion, it was my maiden visit to this establishment. I opted to place my order via the internet to facilitate a convenient and expeditious retrieval of my culinary selections. The digital ordering process was remarkably efficient and user-friendly, allowing me to complete my transaction with minimal effort and expediency. Upon arriving at the venue, I was pleased to discover that my order was being prepared at that very moment, ensuring that my meal was delivered promptly and maintained an optimal temperature. It was reassuring to note that my food was not left to linger and become stale or unpalatable.

I elected to sample their Brisket Burger, a delectable combination of a cheeseburger augmented with BBQ sauce, Brisket, and bacon. The portion of sauce accompanying my meal was appropriately proportioned, thereby preventing the bun from becoming overly saturated and compromising its structural integrity. The flavor profile of the Brisket was satisfying, although I would have preferred a more tender texture. My burger was cooked to a well-done finish, which was slightly disappointing as I generally prefer a slight pinkish hue to indicate a less thorough cooking process. In retrospect, I should have included this specification in the comment section while placing my order online.

In addition to the burger, I also requested a bowl of chicken tortilla soup as a supplementary item. This proved to be an excellent decision, as the soup was truly delicious and brimming with rich, bold flavors. The spicy kick was subtle yet discernible, and the generous helping of shredded chicken and corn elevated the dish to a superior level of culinary excellence. In fact, I found myself enjoying the soup more than the burger.

In conclusion, while the meal was not without its minor shortcomings, the overall experience was positive, and I would consider returning to sample additional menu items."

I must confess that my cinematic inclinations have been molded by my previous occupation as a projectionist during my collegiate years, which has rendered me somewhat fastidious regarding the manner in which I consume films. While I do not object to viewing motion pictures in various settings, I cannot help but feel that the quality of the presentation significantly influences the overall experience.

Unfortunately, my initial impression of this establishment was less than favorable, as it appeared to have deteriorated prematurely despite its relatively recent inception. The ambiance of the theater seemed to be tainted by an unsettling patina, akin to the effects of excessive nicotine consumption. Although the facilities boasted impressive appointments, their cleanliness left much to be desired.

My cinematic experience was merely passable, as the seats were not designed with adequate legroom, resulting in discomfort when surrounded by fellow patrons with diminutive bladders. As someone who has grown accustomed to the luxurious amenities offered by certain modern theaters, such as in-seat service of adult beverages and culinary delights, I must admit that I am unlikely to make a special effort to revisit this venue in the future.

"PROS:  
    1. The burgers possessed an impressive magnitude, their copious proportions rendering them ostensibly indulgent, although their exorbitant cost could be perceived as somewhat prohibitive.  
    2. The onion rings exhibited a remarkable crispiness, their substantial girth contributing to their overall appeal.  
    3. The Black Milk Tea boasted an unparalleled delectability, its boba manifesting an unforgettable flavor profile.  
    4. The Kimchi burger represented the epitome of culinary excellence, its sublime taste elevating it to an unrivaled position among its peers.  
    5. The staff members displayed an unwavering commitment to hospitality, their affable demeanor fostering a welcoming ambiance.  
 CONS:  
    1. My Kiki burger and Ronin burger suffered from an unfortunate similarity in taste, their initial mediocrity giving way to a faint improvement midway through consumption.  
    2. The Oxtail Chili fries, despite their promising appearance, proved forgettable and arrived belatedly, long after our burgers had been devoured.  
    3. The bar counter and tables were subjected to a questionable cleaning method, employing a cloth redolent of mildew and eliciting concerns regarding hygiene.  
    4. The limited availability of individual bathrooms resulted in an extended waiting period, further emphasizing the need for additional facilities.  
    5. The prices charged for beer were deemed excessive, bordering on extortionate."

I'd revisit this establishment to sample alternative burger offerings or perhaps simply relish in the kimchi burger's excellence once more."

"My experiences at Mimis have been varied, to say the least. On multiple occasions, I have visited this establishment, and the quality of the cuisine has fluctuated greatly. Specifically, my breakfast experiences have generally been satisfying, while dinners have tended to fall short of my expectations. My most recent visit occurred over the past weekend, during which I opted for the three-course steak meal priced at $9.99. Admittedly, I should have been more discerning in my selection, given the price point, but my curiosity got the better of me. The initial salad course was adequate, but the main course of steak accompanied by mashed potatoes proved to be disappointing. The steak itself displayed conspicuous signs of artificial grill marks, detracting from its overall appeal. Lastly, the so-called'sundae' that concluded the meal amounted to nothing more than a solitary scoop of vanilla ice cream topped with chocolate syrup. In hindsight, perhaps I should not have expected exceptional culinary mastery at such an affordable price."

"I visited this establishment for a midday repast, and my initial impression was that it offered an extensive array of culinary options, rivalling those of other prominent hotels in the city. However, upon subsequent visits, my enthusiasm waned somewhat, as the quality of the fare failed to meet my expectations. Despite its spacious interior, the ambiance of the venue struck me as somewhat utilitarian, and the prices, while lower than those of premier establishments such as the Wynn or Bellagio, seemed incongruous with the compromised gastronomic experience. Nonetheless, for those seeking a broad variety of dishes at a relatively affordable cost, this buffet might still prove to be a suitable choice."

"This morning, I procured an assortment of filled croissants for my personal consumption and that of my two sons. While the quality of these flaky pastries was not optimal due to an excessive degree of crispiness, their inherent flavor remained palpable. It is worth noting that the establishment from which I acquired these croissants has undergone a change in ownership, resulting in a significant increase in prices without a commensurate enhancement in quality. In fact, the size and filling of these croissants have been observed to vary, occasionally appearing diminutive and sparse, respectively. Furthermore, the introduction of novel flavors has not contributed to an improvement in overall quality, leading me to surmise that a return to the original formula employed by the previous owner/baker(s) would be preferable. Consequentially, I have elected to procure alternative baked goods from a superior bakery located elsewhere, both to provide a greater variety of options and to obtain better value for my expenditure."

How should I rate and yelp this place without being judge?? Haha I don't care!!! 

Away from the kids once again.... Rent a car, drove to Vegas, got there in 3 1/2 hours at 80 mph. arrived at 12:35am. 

We met with 2 other couples, drag them out from the Baccarat tables at Caesars Palace to go grab a drink with us at OG. 

The best way is to call O.G. and make a reservation, they will sent out a limo to pick you up at your hotel. This way you don't pay a cover charge. You buy a greygoose bottle or any other liquor bottle and get only " Smirnoff " free. The bill came out to be 415.00 include tax & tips. And other entertainments would come out of each individual's pocket. hehehehe We had a nice booth with shear curtains. 

ohhhhh,,, eeewwwwwwwwww,, ahhhhhhhhhh Us girls wondered upstairs to check out the men, It was very empty. Just a few girls with these hot hot men. Their bodies were tight, abs hanging, guns flexing,, yikes .. I was a little intimidated because they started to came at us like fresh meat. We turned and darted downstairs. 

My husband said "back so soon", LOl.... 

Well, we all had lap dances, some good, some horrible, some real, some fake ::)) Use your imagination. 

I recommend to go in groups of couples, you'll have the best time because it is just fun.
Big slices, but not the most impressive place for pizza. Worth a try, but will not be our regular spot for pizza. Price doesn't match quality.

"It so transpired that I found myself within the confines of a shopping mall, specifically the renowned Galleria Mall in Las Vegas, during my leisurely sojourn in that city. Feeling somewhat exhausted and financially depleted due to my relentless pursuit of retail therapy, I opted to take a respite and partake in a casual repast at a nearby eatery. My thoughts were interrupted by an insistent craving for a delectable hamburger, which prompted me to seek out a suitable establishment capable of satiating my gastronomical yearnings. As fate would have it, a Red Robin restaurant happened to be situated within close proximity, thereby rendering it an ideal choice for my culinary endeavors. Admittedly, my initial reaction was tinged with incredulity, as there existed a plethora of exceptional dining options within the city limits, yet I chose to frequent a chain restaurant that was seemingly ubiquitous. However, my desire for a straightforward, uncomplicated dining experience ultimately prevailed, leading me to select this particular venue. Upon entering the premises, I was escorted to a cozy table positioned near a window, affording me an unobstructed view of the bustling mall. Following a cursory examination of the menu, I settled upon a basic, unadorned burger, dubbed the 'Keep it Simple' option. The server, cognizant of the brief delay, offered an apology and proceeded to take my order. The ensuing wait, though perceived as somewhat prolonged, did not unduly perturb me, as I was not particularly pressed for time. Ultimately, my patience was rewarded, as the arrival of my culinary creation elicited feelings of satisfaction and contentment, owing to both its generous proportions and satisfying taste. For those who harbor a penchant for superior burgers, a visit to the Red Robin located within the Galleria Mall is certainly worth considering. Furthermore, I must admit that I am eager to explore the breadth of their menu offerings and sample alternative burgers during a future visit. In conclusion, I would assign this establishment a rating of three out of five stars, thereby acknowledging its merits while simultaneously underscoring room for improvement."
Crepes station is top notch. Seafood was okay.  Kind of worn down in the last 5 years. A deep cleaning would be great for this whole seating area. Probibly backstage too.

I must assess this venue a solitary star pertaining to the entire parking predicament and the simplicity of ingress and egress from the parking area. The person responsible for the design and layout of this establishment undoubtedly lacked even rudimentary cognitive abilities, as astutely observed by Bill.

Notwithstanding, I would assign five stars to this location owing to its proximity to both my place of employment and residence.

My evaluation of the service provided here would be approximately 3.5 stars, given that the staff members are generally helpful and proficient in their duties. Moreover, if one has the fortune of visiting this establishment merely ten minutes prior to closing time, when an extensive queue has formed, the employees may even exhibit amusing behavior, thereby enhancing the overall experience.

It is worth mentioning that a line is customarily present upon my arrival, thereby making it imperative for prospective patrons to allocate sufficient time for their visit, particularly if they require comprehensive assistance.

We have passed by this place a million times on our way to Sushi Creek and finally this morning found some time to stop.  First impression was the place was very clean and after seating ourselves we ordered, Denver omlet and some kind of breakfast bowl.  Food was good, service was very good.  Waiter made sure drinks were refilled and food was to our liking.

I haven't been to old navy in awhile so I was okay with this store. First time it was pretty messy from all the Christmas shoppers but the second time was a little cleaner. They did have good sales for all ages.

Normally I'd give this joint 5 stars bcuz almost EVERYTHING IS *AWSM*
However- just went w/my moms & ewww what a disappointment :(
She had the fried chicken & me a basic burger - burger was ehh ok at best but the chicken was bad news bears!!! The corn bread muffin was delivered warm but turned to a rock shortly after, leading me to believe they nuked it ... The batter on the chicken was nasty & the chicken itself was ALLLL FAT! Even the mixed veggies were gross!
At $14 bucks this dish is NO BUENO!
If you find yourself @ BBD - try the Cali Benedict or the sweet cream waffle & finish w/a personal pie of your liking or the diners specialty - a  big bear bear claw ;) enjoy!

We choose this hotel based on the yelp reviews. The room was clean and welcoming. Comfy beds and and I liked the little balcony. However the free wi fi never worked. We didn't take advantage of the free snacks as this was to inconvenient to go down to the lobby every time we wanted something. It was loud at night with thin walls but it was understandable as there was a wedding going on.  The breakfast in the morning was nice quaint and busy. I didn't see much of the staff, so can't make a comment there. I don't know that I would stay again but it was a nice little get away.

"Concur with the collective sentiment regarding the aesthetic appeal of the establishment; it is indeed a visually stunning property. However, the fitness center appears somewhat diminutive in scale and suffers from an excessive temperature, despite boasting an array of cardiovascular equipment, including treadmills and an Xfit machine. It is imperative to inquire about the status of facilities prior to arrival, as our expectation of indulging in poolside recreation was thwarted by the prolonged closure of the pool, which is slated to persist for an additional month, much to our dismay. Furthermore, we were able to observe contented sunbathers frolicking in the sun at Bellagio from the vantage point of our accommodations, which served as a painful reminder of Vdara's capricious nature. While the staff exhibited cordiality and warmth, their efforts were somewhat impaired by inefficiency, as exemplified by our futile attempt to rectify a burned-out light bulb in the bathroom. Additionally, the coffee provided in-room consisted of a pair of complimentary K-cups, supplemented by an assortment of options in the minibar, although we recommend bringing your own milk, as only creamer is available. Moreover, we were informed that Silk Road, the on-site eatery, would no longer offer dinner service. Prior to making a reservation, it is advisable to verify the availability of amenities, as it appears that the hotel may be experiencing certain operational challenges."

By the time we reached here, we have so much liquid in us.  We stopped and rejuvenated ourselves with whatever soda and water we can find while walking on the strip, well u want to make sure u are amply hydrated with that 105 degree heat.\n\nBut I still wanted to taste at least 3 float samplers, but the line was too long and unruly, ppl were darting in and out like crazy, so that was enough for me.  C'mon, kids, move along...perambulating, to the M & M World.

I came here with a group for drinks before a group dinner...didn't like that you couldn't seat yourself at the bar without the hostess helping you.  We tried some drinks and french fries...all were good, albeit overpriced, but nothing to rush back for!
It's ok, it needs more fresh produce somewhere in the market. there are nice vendors there, but it needs more market types.

"It is an establishment belonging to the fast-food chain known as Burger King, and it is characterized by its lack of distinctive features or remarkable aspects worth mentioning, yet this particular location is well-maintained and provides a satisfactory level of service; furthermore, it remains open for business around the clock, which is convenient for customers who may require sustenance during unconventional hours, and it offers my preferred beverage of choice, specifically VAULT soda, which is dispensed from a tap."

"The nomenclature of this culinary establishment is analogous to denominating a topographic location, such as 'The Pizza', 'The Burger', or 'The Taco'. However, upon gastronomical exploration, it becomes apparent that 'The Sushi' excels in terms of flavor, yet falls short in relation to portion size and cost. The interior ambiance is cozy and intimate, boasting a state-of-the-art four-screen television system reminiscent of a basketball arena. Were it not for the fiscal constraints and diminutive serving sizes, this eatery would readily qualify as a five-star sushi bar, given the meticulous preparation and scrumptiousness of the sushi and sashimi. Unfortunately, the tariffs associated with this dining experience surpass those of neighboring sushi restaurants, while the teriyaki dishes, in particular, are seemingly designed for rodents rather than humans. Notwithstanding, the staff maintained a courteous demeanor and extended an offer of complimentary hot tea or water to patrons awaiting takeout orders. Ultimately, a lukewarm endorsement is warranted, contingent upon an individual's financial indifference and moderate hunger levels."

"My affection for this diminutive establishment is profound. Edinburgh's commitment to preserving the traditional public houses in the city center is laudable, allowing future generations to revel in their timeless charm. The Rose St Brewery, in particular, exudes an endearing quaintness, with its upstairs lounge serving as my preferred area within the premises. The ambiance is further enhanced by carpeted floors and vintage photographs depicting the city's rich heritage adorning the walls, while a plaque proudly proclaims the pub's distinction as the Pub of The Year in 1985. \n\nUpon entering the establishment for a midday repast, I opted for a goat cheese salad, a deviation from my customary carnivorous inclinations, but one that seemed appealing due to its promised light and refreshing qualities. The dish arrived with two sizable chunks of goat cheese resting upon a bed of mixed greens and seasonal vegetables, complemented by a subtle dressing. When paired with a well-poured Guinness, the culinary experience was nothing short of perfection. While the staff's attentiveness left something to be desired, it is important to remember that, at its core, the Rose St Brewery remains a quintessential boozer, where one should not expect excessively formal service. Nonetheless, kudos are extended to the establishment for its efforts in maintaining a welcoming atmosphere, and one can only hope that it continues to thrive without succumbing to the pressures of modernity."
Seems to want to be O. But it did have good effects, music and talented artists. However, the actual story is lacking coherency and things aren't as stemless as a Cirque show.

"Evaluating the overall quality of a coffee shop based solely on a single French soda is inherently challenging, as it is difficult to accurately assess the diverse array of factors that contribute to a truly exceptional coffee experience; however, this particular establishment appears to possess certain attributes that suggest it may be worthy of further exploration. Specifically, the price point of approximately $3 per French soda is somewhat elevated, yet the taste is reportedly satisfying, and the utilization of high-quality syrups suggests a commitment to using premium ingredients. To form a more comprehensive opinion of the shop's offerings, it would be necessary to repeatedly visit and sample their coffee products in order to assess the full scope of their culinary capabilities."
Small, quiet casino - check. Clean, spaced out machines - check. Drink options followed by food - check. Low traffic = little smoke - checkity check!
Grabbed a couple of dozen bagels and took to work.  Man they don't last long.  Bagels are good and the service is friendly.  They were real busy but make time to chat will working.

"Captivating venue with an endearing atmosphere and satisfactory culinary offerings. My significant other and I celebrated our birthdays at this establishment during the summer season. The primary motivation behind my desire to dine here was my curiosity regarding the Matilda Wong, which surpassed my expectations and left me utterly captivated. I strongly advise suspending all current activities and indulging in this delectable delight immediately. We initiated our culinary journey by sampling the Sweet Potato Ravioli complemented by a Gorgonzola Cream sauce. Although the sauce was somewhat overpowering and excessively rich for my taste, the four ravioli pieces were undeniably scrumptious. The dish was garnished with walnuts and accompanied by bread. My companion enjoyed the Hanger Steak, while I opted for the Muffuletta Pizza, excluding meat. Unfortunately, my pizza was excessively salted, likely due to the olive spread, but my partner appreciated his steak. However, nothing could compare to the sublime experience of savoring another Matilda Wong. We shared a dessert, but its name escapes me, as it was not particularly remarkable. Following this dining experience, I would consider returning to explore alternative menu options, such as the Farro Saute. The prices seemed reasonable, with $12 for ravioli, $12 for pizza, approximately $20 for steak, and less than $10 for dessert. Additionally, the mini pitchers of the Wong were priced at a very affordable $11."

24/7 Local video poker sports bar, everything you'd expect. It seems like I'm always just stopping in for a cheap breakfast, the Pt's Platter is way better than its Ihop and Denny's counterparts and the waitresses are much friendlier. Unfortunately, I always get sucked into the video poker machines and end up leaving with a full tummy and an empty wallet.

I ventured to that establishment to commemorate my spouse's successful culmination of her second year of dental education at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. The interior design boasted an aesthetic of sophisticated elegance, which was complemented by the hospitable demeanor of the hostess who greeted us upon arrival. Despite the brief delay in the serving of our meals, we opted to partake in the Steak Special designed for two individuals. Unfortunately, the waiting staff member appeared to be overwhelmed with his responsibilities, as he failed to provide adequate attention to our needs throughout the dining experience. Specifically, he neglected to replenish my water glass, compelling me to utilize my partner's water vessel and drink from it. In light of the cost and ambiance, the quality of service we received fell short of expectations.

A succinct update subsequent to my maiden commercial excursion in excess of eight months has necessitated an augmentation of concerns pertinent to my lactational responsibilities, which now involve a heightened level of scrutiny at security checkpoints. Specifically, at 5:00 AM on a Friday, which tends to be somewhat congested due to the influx of business travelers returning to the Eastern Seaboard, I encountered a peculiar scenario wherein each of my transparent containers were subjected to a meticulous examination by means of a sophisticated device designed to detect traces of explosive material. Fortunately, the TSA representative displayed remarkable courtesy and clarity in elucidating the procedure and potential consequences, thereby alleviating any apprehensions I may have harbored. Notwithstanding the substantial quantity of luggage requiring screening, the entire process was completed within a mere five minutes.

Terminal 3's Delta sector, while relatively limited in its offerings, does feature a few establishments that cater to early risers, such as Starbucks and Wendy's. However, the queues tend to be rather lengthy, particularly during peak hours.

Following the completion of renovations, locating the shuttle service for rental cars has become significantly less arduous. Furthermore, I was pleasantly surprised by the relatively brief waiting period at 12:30 AM, despite the considerable number of individuals who had arrived later than anticipated. It is worth mentioning that the shuttles themselves often exude a strong fragrance reminiscent of soap-based air fresheners, which can be somewhat overwhelming. Nevertheless, this is arguably preferable to an atmosphere tainted by unpleasant odors.

In conclusion, #Yelp365 - 169/365 serves as a testament to the unforeseen challenges and experiences that punctuate the existence of a nursing mother embarking upon commercial ventures.

If you happen to be inebriated to the extent that your cognitive faculties are significantly impaired, resulting in boisterous, rowdy, or disoriented behavior, and you are seeking a culinary establishment that can accommodate your current state, then this particular venue may be an ideal choice for satiating your gastronomical desires. It is not uncommon for patrons who have indulged in excessive alcoholic beverages to experience memorable moments within these premises, as they endeavor to regain a semblance of sobriety amidst the aromatic ambiance of freshly baked pizza, which, although palatable, may not be the most advisable option for consumption during the daylight hours due to its rich, artery-clogging characteristics, yet somehow manages to tantalize the taste buds in a manner that is particularly satisfying when consumed at an ungodly hour such as 1:45 am.

"Pros: The eatery boasts a relaxed and convivial atmosphere, which is further enhanced by its prime location within the luxurious Cosmopolitan complex. The interior design is a unique blend of lucha libre and Las Vegas elements, featuring striking red lamps suspended from the ceiling and video screens displaying images of renowned Mexican artist Frida Kahlo and influential Chinese leader Mao, among others. \n\nCons: While the menu offers an extensive array of options, the dishes themselves are somewhat disappointing. Particularly considering the restaurant's laid-back setting, the prices are slightly elevated for what essentially amounts to a selection of fried rice and tacos. Employing a tapas-style service model, multiple orders are necessary for sharing, which may not necessarily constitute a cohesive fusion of Chinese and Mexican cuisine, but rather a menu showcasing unremarkable renditions of each."

"On the eve of Christmas Eve, pondering what to do, we opted to perambulate around Carolina Place Mall, capitalizing on its extended hours until 11 pm, and observe the frenzied shoppers seeking gifts. While not my preferred shopping venue, I acknowledge its convenience for those residing in the southside of town, particularly with the presence of an H&M, a welcome addition for those craving a diverse range of apparel options. Although not necessarily outdated, the mall exudes an old-school vibe, characterized by traditional anchor stores. Not a top choice for a shopping excursion, but a feasible alternative when proximity is a factor."

Came here for brunch before a Cardinals' game. Food was good and drinks very generous. Love that they have the bus to the games. Very nice that everyone could enjoy their time and nobody had to worry about driving.

Food was absolutely delicious,  but pricey. We were dressed in comfortable clothing (jeans/shorts/sweatshirts) and clearly did not fit in; this is a dressy crowd. We were also the youngest people there... it was mostly older adults 65+. Great views and good service.

This club is the new hit in Vegas for being so big but I didn't see anything that great about it. There's so many stairs. For a girl in heels and having to go up and down stairs all night to go back and forth between rooms is a hassle. The main room at the very top of the stairs is where they have their big shows/djs. The set up there sucks because there is a row of tables lining the front area and everyone stands up at those tables so you can't even see the performer no matter where you are standing. Always fun staring at a bunch of people's backs when a top DJ is playing and you paid money to see them. Same for the balcony in this main room. Just a row of tables right in front of the balcony so you can't see anything. Club is definitely made to try and force people to get tables. On the other hand Lights was a really awesome club. I suggest going there for shows instead.

I'd really wanted to like this place, but it just isn't happening. Family has eaten here several time and we've had excellent meals (burgers in particular), but not consistently. There is always something wrong: burger over cooked, cold food, orders not correct. If a restaurant is going to charge the higher prices, I expect consistently good food and service - not hit and miss.
I love the location, it is very \"little main street\" feeling. The food is good and priced very well. The service is slow, so i would not come here if you are in a rush.

"I received exceptional service, as they meticulously ensured that I was properly fitted with the ideal bicycle, following an unfortunate incident involving incorrect sizing from another Landis store. They dedicated considerable time to assisting me in selecting the appropriate footwear, and provided comprehensive responses to my numerous queries regarding my first road bike purchase, despite some reservations I had regarding their unconventional methods. Although I have yet to utilize their repair services, I am eager to assess their proficiency in that regard once I bring in my dilapidated mountain bike for maintenance."

Was a good show, funny guy, he only did about four stunts to prove his skill, talked the rest of the time.  The things he did made you wonder how he knew that.  At the end of the show he told the whole audience winning lottery numbers.  Well lets see who plays them in what state and wins.  Lol.  Don't think I would go back, but that's the kind of person I am, once something is done I do not repeat.  Time to move on.

I absolutely love this place for breakfast.  I have never seen so many selections for breakfast.  I'm definitely coming here again when I'm out in Vegas.\n\nDinner:  its 108 for 2 people and I don't really think its all that.  Yes, they have crab and a seafood selection but I was disappointed.  I thought dinner was going to be better than breakfast.  For that amount of money you can get a nice meal at Mesa Grill located in Caesar Palace.

"Underwhelmed experience with too much repetition."

"Not a huge fan" can be rephrased as "Underwhelmed experience" to convey a more negative connotation.
"It was okay at best" can be rephrased as "Average, nothing exceptional" to convey a more neutral tone.
"I've been to a few of these types of places around town" can be rephrased as "Familiarity with similar establishments in the local area" to sound more professional.
"This one was average" can be rephrased as "Underwhelming experience with too much repetition" to emphasize the lackluster nature of the establishment.

The modified text would be:
"Underwhelmed experience with too much repetition. Average, nothing exceptional. Familiarity with similar establishments in the local area. Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

This text uses longer and more complex sentences, as well as more professional vocabulary, while still conveying the same meaning as the original text. It also stays within the 512 token limit.

I was excited when this breakfast restaurant opened up in my neighborhood as I love to go out for breakfast almost everyday.

I have eaten there 3 times now but I only order 1 thing on the menu which I do enjoy quite a bit because their other items are a little unusual for me.

I went to eat there again yesterday and I was very sorry to see they have removed all side items off their menu. So I cannot order an omelet or 2 scrambles eggs with bacon, or a side of toast. Its one of the nine items or nothing. That does not work for me so that is why i have given this restaurant 3 stars. I hope they reconsider offering the basic breakfast items or I will probably not be back.

This establishment represented my second venture to indulge in the culinary delights of tapas while situated in the city of Las Vegas. The gastronomical offerings were merely adequate, with the exception of the paella, which proved to be a highlight of the dining experience. The duration of time allocated for the preparation of the meal was approximately 40 minutes, however, the delay was deemed acceptable considering the novelty of the dish. 

The hospitality displayed by the staff, ranging from the initial greeting upon entry to the attentive service provided by the wait staff and management, was truly commendable. Notwithstanding, the tariff associated with the consumables listed on the menu was, in my opinion, exorbitant, even when juxtaposed with the elevated prices customarily encountered within the Las Vegas Strip. This factor served as the primary deterrent against a potential return visit.

It is worth mentioning that alternative destinations offering tapas on the Vegas strip provide a superior value and variety, rendering a revisit to this particular venue unnecessary. The ambiance of the restaurant was quite pleasant, boasting an airy and well-lit atmosphere, accompanied by a bar section. The level of noise was moderate, and the premises were well-maintained, with the staff demonstrating efficiency in clearing tables upon completion of meals.

In conclusion, although this eatery presented an acceptable dining experience, there exist superior options within the vicinity, thereby diminishing the likelihood of a future visit.

This eatery is characterized by inconsistency, with the quality of service ranging from mediocre to inadequate. The culinary offerings, while diverse, are often unpredictable in terms of taste and texture, specifically regarding the chicken fried rice, which can be excessively oily or unpleasantly dry. Furthermore, the orange chicken dish is frequently overcooked, resulting in an unpalatable chewiness that does not contribute to a satisfying dining experience. While the prices are reasonable, they do not justify the variable quality of the food. In conclusion, this establishment does not rank among the superior options for Chinese cuisine in North Phoenix.

A luncheon in commemoration of a colleague's departure led me to this establishment, whereupon I was less than enthused by the precursory popover bread, possessing an unmistakable ovum flavor that nearly satiated my gastronomical inclinations, yet thankfully, my fungi and gruyere panini proved to be delectable and of generous proportions, accompanied by an abundance of fries, and ultimately, all patrons relished their culinary selections, furthermore benefiting from a minor rebate extended to financial institution staff members, constituting an added advantage.

I was happy to find this restaurant in my hotel.  It was late and I didn't want to venture out.  The bar had more people than I expected for a Monday night.  I ordered the gnocchi, which I believe was misspelled on the menu (\"gnocci\").  I planned on pointing this out to the waitress until I heard the way she pronounced gnocchi (\"knock-y\").  (I wonder if she told people she worked at \"Bigelow Grill-e.\")  Somehow this made my dining experience seem a little less upscale.  Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with the ambiance - aside from the thick cigarette smoke at the bar.  \n\nThis sentence had me scratching my head for a while, \"Bigelow is serving innovative and imaginative interpretations of ethnic Pittsburgh classics.\"  Maybe some Pittsburghers will fill me in sometime.

"The early riser does not necessarily secure the prized vermiculate at Marche Atwater, particularly on a frigid winter Sunday morning when the majority of establishments remain unopened, with only a select few merchants offering their wares; however, fortune smiled upon us, enabling us to procure an assortment of delectable pastries at Boulangerie Premi\u00e8re Moisson, which served as an excellent initiation to the day's culinary pursuits. As the clock struck 8:30 a.m., a gradual influx of vendors began to populate the market, showcasing their fresh produce and artisanal goods. Marche Atwater, though smaller in scale than anticipated, still presented an array of options for those seeking gastronomical delights, although the absence of outdoor vendors during the winter season was palpable. In hindsight, a visit to Jean-Talon might have proven more fruitful."

Since my culinary predilections incline towards delectable lobster rolls, I opted to partake in this establishment's offerings during the meridian hour. In conjunction with my spouse, we elected to apportion a combination platter. The lobster roll itself was merely adequate, as the minuscule fragmentation of the meat evoked memories of canned tuna. Furthermore, my contentment was diminished by the superficial incision of the bun, which only extended partially through the bread, leading me to surmise that the restaurant was endeavoring to conserve their lobster supply. As my companion and I indulged in each bite, the lobster meat had a propensity to escape from its bread-based confines. The chowder fries, while not particularly remarkable, were palatable. However, considering the price point of over $20, I felt that the quantity of sustenance provided was insufficient to satiate my hunger, leaving me feeling underwhelmed.

"My predilection for fastidious gastronomical indulgences precipitated my visitation to this establishment, as the lyrical allusion had piqued my curiosity. Alas, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled, as the culinary offering, while not necessarily deplorable, did not quite meet the lofty standards I had envisioned. In fact, my palate found the patty to be somewhat akin to those proffered by Freddy's Frozen Custard, Culver's, and Steak and Shake, which, in my opinion, are superior. My initial inclination was to sample the burger in its standard configuration, which unfortunately included an excess of saccharine relish that proved to be an unfortunate choice. Consequently, I shall exercise greater discernment in my condimentary selections during future visits."

"Satisfactory and palatable midday meal offerings, albeit marred by a few drawbacks, including an inattentive server who failed to replenish our hydration vessels on multiple occasions, thereby necessitating repeated prompts from ourselves for the complimentary bread accompaniment to our principal dishes; the seafood fare was passable but lacked the zest and freshness we have come to expect from such establishments."

One of the stops on the Light Rail Bar Crawl, I felt that the Gin Mill was the most \"dive-y\" with a lot of dented chrome and scarred wood a bathroom that needed a flamethrower and some seriously loud music. I sat at the bar with my beer and watched the young-uns dancing to the DJ's tunes on the \"stage\". This vantage point gave me a great opportunity to see the bartenders in operation. Fast, efficient and friendly. Picking up abandoned empties and serving out drinks quickly. Impressive.\n\nBouncer at the door checking ID's. Taxi stand outside ready to take the wobbly folks home, but I was good. It's a very short walk to the Light Rail station that gave me time to sober up (I only had four drinks over five hours) while riding back to my parked car.

I have really enjoyed Dos Chandler for a few years now, I used to just drink their Negra Modelo and Dos X, but recently started eating the super ewey gooey chimi, which I would recommend to anyone.  Their quesadillas are awesome, they don't get much better than that.  (And I work in a New Mexican style kitchen). I feel they should offer more Mexican beers on tap, and definitely need more tequila options.  The frozen margaritas aren't anything to brag about, however.  The tables are usually sticky now whenever I sit down..and I haven't had a consistent server or bartender in a long time, there is always someone new, but they do a decent job taking care of me, but I can tell they don't have much support management-wise on the floor.  I give three stars due to dirty tables, poor beer selection on tap, and the usual generic tequila selection.  Being a Mexican restaurant they need to step up their game and clean the place up.

"Upon entering the establishment at approximately 8:45 a.m., I opted to partake in their breakfast offerings, specifically 'the handful,' comprising of two eggs, two pancakes, potatoes, and an additional two slices of bacon. However, upon requesting a substitution of said bacon for vegetables, I was informed that such a modification would incur an additional fee of one dollar, despite the fact that the cost of the bacon exceeded that of the vegetables on the menu's side item list. Perplexed by this incongruity, I elected to proceed with my original order, the quality of which was satisfactory yet unremarkable, thereby precluding me from offering a resoundingly positive endorsement."

August trip: Arrived here by taxi (cheaper than using a shuttle!) from the airport. The Bell-Man took our luggage so we did not need to wait in line for the luggage area. Check-in took about 30-45 minutes on a Sunday. We stayed in the newly renovated Grand Tower. Amenities included king bed, expensive mini fridge, awesome upgraded view for our anniversary. The spa was terrific except for the nude woman inside the women's hot tub. Germs - EW! Beware of the pool. I came back with an unwanted bacterial infection on my legs that took 4 weeks to clear up with antibiotics.

This is the Grand Lux Cafe situated within the premises of the esteemed Venetian resort. It is worth mentioning that there exists an alternative location of the same establishment in the Palazzo, however, according to local patrons, the quality of service and culinary offerings at this particular branch are deemed superior. For the sake of comparison, it is pertinent to note that the author has had the pleasure of visiting another Grand Lux Cafe situated in the Beverly Center of Beverly Hills; and while both establishments share certain commonalities in terms of their ambiance and gastronomical offerings, this specific location boasts the unique distinction of being open for business on a twenty-four hour basis.

Upon arriving with a sizable contingent of approximately fifteen individuals, the group was able to secure seating arrangements without incident, despite the fact that it was peak dining time and no prior reservations had been made (it is customary to reserve tables at least two hours in advance).

The author and a companion opted to share a pizza pie adorned with sausage, pepperoni, and mushrooms. While the dough was somewhat overly soft and difficult to handle without the toppings breaking apart, the flavor of the crust itself was quite satisfying. As a result, the author and her companion found themselves consuming the crust of each slice, leaving behind the toppings.

It is important to note that the menu at Grand Lux Cafe features an extensive array of culinary options, which bears a striking similarity to that of Cheesecake Factory, given that the two establishments share a common affiliation. Nonetheless, it is recommended that patrons exercise caution when selecting items from the Asian-inspired section of the menu, as the authenticity of such dishes may be subject to debate.

I was somewhat skeptical regarding a cafe that publicizes coffee that lacks the characteristic flavor profile associated with coffee, yet my reservations were partially alleviated upon sampling their espresso, which demonstrated a level of quality that surpassed my expectations, although it failed to elicit an exceptional degree of enthusiasm within me, and its overall quality was inferior to that of Starbucks' offerings.

good food. consistently slow and lousy service.  I had forgotten that it was nearly exactly a year since I'd been here,  and had the exact same experience (and my companions remembered too).  Very attentive manager,  but indifferent servers ... unbelievably slow.   It took an hour and a half since we arrived to go from order to meal.   Twice I had to get up and ask the manager about the status (oh and we ordered sushi, which doesn't need to be cooked!). \n\nFood was very good though.  So if you want great food without caring about the wait,  or attitude of the staff then Kona Grill is the place for you!

My Partner and I flew into Phoenix last week for the Christmas Holiday and we stopped here for lunch before heading out to the family.    I was fairly impressed with the cuisine and the ambiance.

I had a burger with all the trimmings and it was prepared perfectly.  I would have liked a few more fries with the burger, but I probably didn't need them.

I have to say the 80's hair band music videos playing were a little weird though.

If I find myself back in Phoenix, I will eat here again.

This is exactly what I was looking for in a hotel during my one night stay in Pittsburgh. Close to the city, but far enough out to get free parking and a reasonable rate (under $100).

The room was fairly small, but I was only planning on sleeping in it. It was clean so I couldn't ask for much more. The people at the front desk were very friendly too.

If I go back to Pittsburgh, I will absolutely stay here again.

"I had the pleasure of dining at Rigatonys this evening in the company of my sibling and niece, partaking in a delectable array of culinary delights. My niece and I opted to share a serving of manicotti, which, while not the most extraordinary example of its kind, was still palatable enough to warrant consumption. My sister, however, elected to sample the Mahi special, which was served with a side of asparagus and quinoa pasta. Her enthusiasm for the dish was unbridled, praising the creamy dill sauce adorning the fish and the generous helping of salami, cheeses, olives, pepperocini, and other assorted vegetables accompanying it. To conclude our repast, we indulged in a portion of spumoni, the authenticity of which was undeniable and satisfyingly sizable. Our server, Bryce, provided attentive and informed service throughout the meal, taking care to apprise us of the supplementary fee associated with splitting a plate. Additionally, a complimentary basket of bread was brought to our table, contributing further to the overall enjoyment of our dining experience. In conclusion, our visit to Rigatonys was thoroughly enjoyable, and we look forward to returning in the future."

I visited this establishment on a Saturday afternoon with the intention of partaking in their midday repast, but upon arriving, I encountered an abundance of patrons already present, thus leading me to opt for taking my sustenance with me instead. Upon eventually consuming my torta ahogada, I noticed that it had become saturated with the piquant sauce in which it was submerged, rendering it unpleasantly soggy and prone to disintegration at an accelerated rate. While I typically possess a certain degree of tolerance towards pungent culinary creations, I must admit that the overwhelming sensation of fiery heat permeated my taste buds to such an extent that it eclipsed any other discernible flavors. My companion elected to sample three fish tacos, which, regrettably, proved to be minuscule in size. Consequently, they remained unsatisfied and sought sustenance elsewhere, thereby leading to an overall experience that fell short of my expectations, given the copious favorable assessments I had previously encountered on Yelp.

"Culinary experiences can be gratifying on occasion, albeit briefly, when the ambiance is revamped to create an atmosphere of sophistication. However, during our recent visit, the service was subpar, specifically with regard to the eggs, which were overcooked and lacked the desired doneness. Furthermore, the demeanor of certain servers bordered on impertinence, epitomized by their reluctance to acknowledge our presence, let alone address our concerns. Notwithstanding, the management's indifference towards our grievances was palpable, as they prioritized the interests of unremunerated patrons partaking in recreational activities over those of paying customers. Perhaps the establishment could benefit from the introduction of a poker club, whereupon we, as patronizers, might be inclined to voice our dissatisfaction and effectuate improvements in the quality of service."

I've made plenty of bad decisions here.\n\nHave you ever been somewhere where it means nothing, but somehow, means everything? I like coming to Maz. They don't have a good selection of beer. Or drinks. They don't have good pool tables. There are plenty of shady things that go on here. But still I find myself here every once in a while; generally I'm in a really crappy mood, or I'm feeling to good to go home and too mashed up to go anywhere else.

The service was a bit slow but the food made up for it. The sushi was delicious and the burger was unique and flavorful. We also got the mixed delux fries basket which was phenomenal. I would definitely come back.

Moderate place to stay in a great location - so close to the conveniences of the mall, movie theatre, etc. and just 10-15 minutes from the main shopping and tourist bits. Also just a couple blocks from the cute and trendy but relatively calm and tourist-free cafes on Broughton Street. Within the hotel there's a nice lounge with a fireplace to spend time in with a beer, cocktail, or coffee. And a full restaurant if you're feeling lazy. \n\nAs for the room itself, the walls are quite thin so you can hear people coming and going quite easily, and the wifi, though free is slow as a snail, maybe slower. Not a place to spend much time, but a fine place to return to after a day of exploring.
Came in. Waiter was alright. Gave me a stair like I didn't know what I was doing. He gave mediocre service. I'm full

Qdoba is merely adequate, as it employs a similar concept as Chipotle Grill, but regrettably, the culinary offerings fail to impress, lacking an indispensable element that would compel repeat visits. Additionally, the uninspired ambiance, characterized by the utilization of concrete floors and metallic tables, contributes to a chilly and somber atmosphere, even during the peak summer months.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment to commemorate the birthday of one of my colleagues. Prior to this experience, I had never encountered any issues with this specific chain of restaurants; however, on this particular occasion, upon ordering the shrimp and spinach salad, I discovered an unidentified synthetic substance intermingled within my culinary masterpiece. The manager and waitstaff promptly expressed their sincerest apologies for the unforeseen occurrence and demonstrated an expeditious willingness to rectify the situation. I was presented with a novel salad, which I opted to consume off-premises due to my associates having already completed their meals, and upon the food being delivered to me, the manager once again extended his deepest regret. My repast was also complimentary. Despite the fact that I do not attribute blame to either the manager or waitstaff, I cannot help but surmise that the culinary artisans responsible for preparing the victuals may have been remiss in their duties. Notwithstanding, my salad was indeed quite delectable!

I customarily visit this establishment every Sunday during the football season; however, today's visit was an impromptu decision. Upon entering, I sat down at the bar and was greeted by my preferred Asian bartender in the United States. She enthusiastically recommended their delectable chicken wings, which I ordered along with the Kobe burger. Upon arriving home, I opened the box and was utterly dismayed to discover two putrid tomatoes that not only had an unpleasant appearance but also emitted a foul odor reminiscent of organic fertilizer. I promptly returned to the restaurant to request a replacement, only to be informed by the assistant manager that the tomatoes' condition was allegedly "normal." It became evident that this individual lacked a fundamental understanding of culinary quality and customer satisfaction. Fortunately, the general manager was present to mediate the situation and prevent any further dissatisfaction on my part. Notwithstanding, I must express my gratitude towards my bartender, whose exceptional service was the sole redeeming factor of this unfortunate experience, and the primary reason I might consider returning to this establishment in the future.
Horchata is delish! Familiar faces is nice. Pretty good veggie burrito, bomb breakfast burrito, seriously good. Decent prices, but their guacamole could use some work.

I go to this facility usually 3 nights per week at about 2am and love it. Its jot crowded at all, usually having about 3-5 people in it. I can have the basketball court to myself I wanted and move freely through workout stations.

At first glance, this store looks like a tourist trap as it is in old town and they are selling Mexican trinkets. However, I can't say with absolute certainty, the prices seemed to be pretty decent.  I bought a colorful straw sombrero for 5 dollars.  I saw some other items that seemed to be priced right.

You can find all your Mexican things to make for a fantastic fiesta.  Or you can find pieces to decorate your home with in this store -- from the colorful Dia de Muertos Masks to the plates and cups to the garden pieces.  

I did not find the ladies in the store to be friendly at all.  But the store is neat and you will be happy, I am sure, with the HUGE selection of trinkets.

We have been patronizing Pediatric Partners (PP) for an extensive period of seventeen years, during which time Drs. Chiles and Salek have been rendering exceptional medical care to my offspring, having witnessed numerous personnel changes within the facility without any detrimental impact on the quality of service delivered; however, subsequent to the merger between PP and a comparably sized healthcare organization, the ambiance of the office has undergone a transformation, resulting in a diminished sense of familiarity and warmth, despite which, our unwavering loyalty towards the practice remains steadfast, primarily attributed to the continued exceptional care extended by our attending physicians, whose proficiency and dedication have proven invaluable, particularly now that my children have matured, necessitating fewer appointments.

Patience is required as they take their sweet time and it isn't even busy. It's been 30 minutes and I don't know that they'll be done soon. I would come back because it's cheap but definitely not during 'rush' hour.

What a monstrosity.  This place is huuuuuuge!  If you enter from the sidewalk on the strip and try walking all the way through the casino to try to find either the lobby or the monorail, you're bound to become lost.  The signs have arrows pointing this way or that way, but they are sometimes contradictory.  You can end right back up where you started at and not have a clue as to how you arrived back there.

It's a lovely hotel and pretty well maintained, but starting to show its age in some ways.  At one time it had a Wizard of Oz/Hollywood theme.  Now that's completely vanished, and I'm not sure if it even has a theme anymore.  If there is one, it's not apparent.  

Everything is also green.........veeeeeerrryyyy green.

Just wanted to update. Manager contacted us. Was willing to give full refund or have the top installed for free. Seems there was a communication issue. Issue was resolved, even kept the truck box cover. Did have an issue, but company did resolve in a timely manner and apologized for the miscommunication

I'd give Dolce 3.5 stars (if it were possible).  I really like the location and the atmosphere is cozy.  I've never eaten at this location other than some hummus and pita chips.  Based on other reviews, I might increase my rating once I sample the fare.  As a wine bar, I'm always happy to stop in to get a glass of red and talk with friends.  At times, I haven't found the servers to be friendly or warm; however, I haven't had any particular problems.  It's just a vibe.  I also wish they would extend their wine list.  As another reviewer commented, there just isn't a lot to choose from.  If you're in the area, I'd definitely stop in, although I wouldn't drive into NoDa just for this venue.

We stopped here for happy hour as I was lazy and it is close to work. Turns out they have a decent happy hour with assorted drink specials, half off selected apps and a pick 2 food special that runs open to close for $6.99. I selected the Tortilla soup and cheese enchiladas. The soup was good and enchiladas was also good and came with rice and beans. Our server was great and I wish I remembered her name but after a couple of the happy hour Margaritas names escape me.

I can here solely based off a recommendation from a friend who told me this was "the best pizza in Vegas". I consider that something of a dubious distinction since Vegas, to my knowledge, is not known for any pizza places. And if CA can barely get pizza right, I had a hard time believing Vegas could do any better. 

For the record, I live and die by NYC pizza. There is nothing on this planet that even compares. Yes, Chicago, that includes you. 

They were having a special deal where all pies were half off, so we got a large topped with pepperoni, sausage, and black olives. The quality just wasn't there for me. The pizza wasn't crispy enough, for one thing. Every time I folded a slice in half the front would start to droop like it was going flaccid. The sausage and pepperoni didn't help things since both were so greasy the pie was getting soggy. I'm cool with pepperoni, but those little blobs of meat called sausage do nothing for me. I should have vetoed that topping suggestion when it came up. Pretty good crust, though. Nothing that saved the dish but it worked all the same. 

Is this the best Vegas can do? Decent doesn't cut it for me. I can't grade on a relative scale.

I have sat in the dining room as well as the hibachi grill on several occasions at this restaurant. I've never had a bad experience while dining at the grill. The food has always been superb and the chefs are very entertaining!

The dining room experience is less than satisfactory, however. Each time I've been there for sushi, I've had to wait 30+ minutes for my meal (the wait has always been acknowledged by the staff...last time each waiting table was given complimentary edamame). Not enough sushi chefs (only 1 person was working on each occasion) and/or wait staff.

I'd love to give this restaurant a higher rating, but until I see stellar service throughout the establishment, I have to go with ***.

Took my commuter in for an oil change and was very pleased with the cost and speed that it got done.  The location is perfect as well to just take a walk over to Costco to shop or snack while waiting.  \n\nFYI Check for coupons on their Yelp page before going it might save you some money like it did me :)

This was supposed to be Las Vegas' latest and greatest club... I thoroughly enjoyed the sound and the vibe of the House floor, but it was so crowded that you couldn't dance let alone stand anywhere without it being shoulder to shoulder. We opt to say in the Hip Hop area that was equally as crowded, but luckily we found a small corner to dance in. After a while, we got even luckier as a girl invited us to dance in her table reserve area and Warren G performed. Being West Coast girls my group knew all the songs and had a great time watching his show. We left immediately after because it was just too packed for us.\n\nDon't buy bottled water b/c the small bottle costs $9 talk about rip off.

"My initial experience at this establishment was enjoyable, and I intended to bestow a perfect rating, as the culinary offerings were satisfactory and I consumed them on consecutive days. However, upon my return, I perceived a decline in quality regarding the sandwich I ordered. Specifically, the absence of lettuce in all four Earl's club sandwiches was glaring, and an excess of bacon resulted in an overpowering saltiness. Consequently, my enthusiasm for this venue has waned, and I shall not experience cravings for its fare in the future."

A viable alternative to Pita Jungle, albeit with a tad elevated price point relative to the quantity and quality of the fare in comparison to its competitor. My personal experience has been limited to the Togo option, which, while satisfactory, may not always provide the most pleasant dining experience, particularly when taking into account the ambient atmosphere. Notwithstanding, they accommodate Hooka smoking on the patio, a feature that, although potentially bothersome to some, does not detract from the culinary enjoyment. Upon collection of my Togo order, I must steel myself against the pungent Hooka odor that permeates the outdoor seating area. Despite these minor drawbacks, the cuisine generally meets expectations, leaving room for only slight adjustments to enhance the overall dining experience.
The tacos were greasy and unflavorful. I was quite disappointed with my order. There was also dirt on the floors and the people making the food didn't speak much English

Kitty's cafe is located in the El Cortez Hotel and Casino....... 
and you get the friendly service in here that you can experience everywhere else in this hotel.
It is an old style vegas hotel diner, with booths and the traditional counter service.
The ladies working there call everyone "honey" or they know most of them by name. 

The menu is what you would expect from a downtown hotel diner.
Nothing fancy, but large portions.
I tried the grilled sourdough melt - with turkey and ham.
Large, average.....
On this day there was a "new cook" and the food was slow getting out.

Late at night - it might be the place to get that bite you are needing - (it was for me) ....... otherwise - I am sure you can find better places to eat for the same amount of money.
Yes - all those "old school $1.99 deals" are gone.

This Starbucks is I guess owned by NY NY hotel so they don't use the App...sucky store!! No fare to the app users when you don't have cash on you! Good thing I had money this time and didn't loose to the slot machines here!  \n\nIt's always busy here but goes pretty fast and has a good selection of goods to eat. They open 24/7 which is a good thing. They make their coffee good. Of course, I will be back since this Starbucks is in our hotel but start using the app payment and have them work with Starbucks so we can get our points! Hahaha

"Upon arriving at this establishment, we were immediately greeted by Melissa, our effervescent server, who extended a cheerful salutation, thereby setting the tone for a pleasant dining experience. Following the standard ten-minute delay, which serves as an indicator of quality, we were presented with our beverages; specifically, a robust coffee possessing a full-bodied flavor profile and a diet cola characterized by an optimal level of carbonation. Notably, the expedient delivery of our egg dishes allowed me to complete merely three sentences of this review prior to their arrival, underscoring the efficiency of the kitchen staff. Additionally, our glasses were consistently replenished, ensuring that our hydration needs were met throughout the meal. Overall, this venue offers a satisfying breakfast experience."

It was a convenient walk over from the FireSky hotel across the street. We started with the green pork chili. It was tasty, but not hot. We also had the lamb fondue, which is lamb rack with a squash sauce to dip them in. The squash "fondue" part was quite tasty. The lamb was cooked well.

For the main course I tried the braised short rib. It was really big. It didn't have a ton of flavour; a shame for such a tasty meat. It needed salt & pepper and the core seasoning just didn't stand out.

The food is good, but I feel it's all a bit under seasoned. Everything (except the lamb fondue) could have had some extra punch to it. Still, it wasn't so bad that you feel ripped off, so I'm going 3 stars on this.

"The gastronomical experience at this establishment was rather dichotomous, as the tapas were delectable, particularly the fungi-based risotto, while the paella exhibited an excessive sodium content. Notwithstanding, the oxtail was tender, the potatoes were delightful, and the poultry dish was savory, although I accidentally ingested a clove of garlic, which may have been problematic for vampiric individuals. Furthermore, the quality of service within the eatery was unremarkable, in contrast to the superior hospitality offered at the adjacent cafÃ©."

There were limited options for dinner before the show we were seeing at the Luxor. The 20 year old ticket agent suggested T&T. Said it was great. I should have known we would not have the same palate. We started our meal with a set of mojitos. Our waiter indicated they were very good. I order them whenever I can so I have had my share of mojitos. These were very very sweet. I ordered club soda twice to add to our drinks to reduce the sweetness. Nothing saved these drinks. We didn't even finish half of it. Horrible.
The chips and salsa were also not very good which is fairly unusual. Pretty easy to make good chips and salsa. I had tacos for dinner and my friend had a shrimp dish. Both were very average.
Our server was friendly and even came around at the end and offered free tickets to the show. We already had purchased our tickets but the offer was very kind.
I wouldn't go back to this restaurant because if I had known the Asian restaurant had a good menu I would have gone there.

Easily the best meal I enjoyed in Vegas this past week. I was on a vacation with my sisters. Knowing we would be eating out for 6 days we tried to keep the budget in check. This restaurant was recommended by a friend of my sister did not disappoint as far as the food was concerned. It is tucked away in the back of the food court. Location isn't great...I suppose that is how they keep the prices down. \"Outdoor tables\" are actually inside. Lighting in the interior of the restaurant is way too bright.\nService was very average...our waiter was a hyper-macho Italiano who kept himself busy fawning over the young girls eating next to us, and chatting with his buddies out in the food court plaza. At the end of our meal he was so carried away with his buddies that he had totally forgotten about us, and need to be retrieved by a bus boy. \nThe Caeser Salad that we shared was good. Filet mignon meatballs with spaghetti and red sauce were delicious, as was the wood-fired Quatro Stagioni pizza. I highly recommend the food...the service not so much.

"I thoroughly enjoyed recognizing The Dog empire during my prolonged weekend excursion to Edinburgh, as it boasted an exceptional and stylish design, accompanied by remarkable eatery concepts, including The Dog, UnderDog, SeaDog, and Amore Dog. I sincerely wished I had ample time to sample all of their delectable offerings!
