Due to the optometrust where  got my eye exam, my insurance indicated I wasn't eligible fir frames. donna called to rectify the situation, but wasn't able to because the optometrist was closed. Donna let me know that I would have to wait until the next day so my insurance could void the issue at the optometrist. We went back the next day, and Donna had already taken care of the situation. I got my glasses, and am happy with the service I received. Donna and Heather were the wo shinih stars at this location!

This is my go to spot for lunch appointments and even dinner with my wife. It has a great local feel. Friendly staff, clean, and great tasting food. I can't get enough of the green tomatillo salsa. I recommend the salmon and shrimp tacos. The service isn't the best because all of the servers are young local kids with probably their first server job so they are learning. But that's part of what makes it a cool local place.

Great food! Friendly environment! Modern decor! Gay! All of these things describe Switch to a tee! I had been telling my wife for months that I had heard great things about this restaurant, especially their brunch menu. Unfortunately for me, she is not a big fan of Sunday Brunch, so when we did finally make it there last Sunday, I had already missed out on the brunch menu and the $3 carafes of Bloody Marys. 

We ordered a carafe anyways... only $6 for approximately 4 good sized Bloodys! They were made well, but for the most part tasted pretty generic, yet still exactly what I expected for only $6!! I ordered one of the tastiest burgers I've ever eaten, topped with guacamole, salsa and jalapenos! Each plate was also served with a small house made ceasar salad, which I thought was a nice touch! Our service was very prompt and friendly!

I will definitely be coming back to Switch for my favorite meal of the week: BRUNCH :)

I like MadHouse, but this actually isn't a review at all--I just wanted to say that when I try to access MadHouse's website, I ALWAYS get a trojan warning from my browser. I think the site is infected. I hope the owners see this!

Star Nursery is the cream of the crop when it comes to plant nurseries in Vegas.  They have everything you'd want for your home or business landscaping needs.

It usually surprises people that I'm a fan of plant nurseries.  My first real job was at a plant nursery when I was 15.  It made such an impact that I majored in landscape architecture and ran my own landscape company back home.  Walking around Star Nursery really makes me miss my old line of work!

The stock of plants and materials here is really top notch.  Everything from bedding plants to shrubs to trees is here, and all of it is well taken care of.  And all the soils, mulches, fertilizers, and pesticides you could need are here too.  And the staff is both very knowledgeable and friendly.

If you're doing any landscape work at your house, do yourself a favor and skip the sub-par Walmart and Lowes stock and come to Star!

When in Vegas,

1) buy a delicious "adult slurpee" in a delicious flavor right outside the Imperial Palace
2) bring said special, yard-long beverage into the Imperial Palace Karaoke Club
3) sing or mock karaoke
4) enjoy!
5) your pre-game is complete... time to go out!

Love this place but giving it a 4 star as it can be somewhat slow and few healthier options to select from. Yeah I know, penalizing them for not "healthy" is probably silly as you know when going to let's say a fast food joint you are not eating so good. That being said the food at Defalco's is very high quality - almost as if you are in Italy and am not comparing it to fast food.

I suggest you wait to try out Defalco's when not in a rush as its worth the wait. There order system is very similar to local places back east (basically avoiding technology) and that probably ties into part of the slower process of ordering and getting your food. I am from back east (NY area) and finding a good Italian deli / grocery store in the Phoenix area is not an easy task. A friend introduced me to Defalco's and anytime I am headed south on Scottsdale road (which is often) and after passing Thomas my stomach seems to pick up we are near Defalco's as it starts giving me the rumble noise.

I have tried many things on the menu such as Eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken Parmigiana, and Cheese steak and three of those are worth a shot. I recommend to bring a friend and each get a different large sandwich and share.

We took advantage of the Travel Zoo voucher, which afforded us the opportunity to relish a delectable triad of appetizer, entree, and dessert. Opting for the combination appetizer platter, we were presented with an assortment of flavors and textures that piqued our palates. Although the alligator meat was somewhat chewy in consistency, the frog's legs were equally firm and challenging to consume. In contrast, the crab cake delighted our taste buds with its delicate blend of succulent seafood and savory spices. The gumbo, a traditional dish native to Louisiana, was satisfying and rich, yet lacked the authentic Creole zest we had anticipated. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment exuded a charm reminiscent of the Big Easy, with generous servings that rendered the dining experience even more enjoyable.

The epitome of refined dining establishments, this eatery exudes an air of elegance and tranquility, ensuring a memorable experience for patrons seeking to commemorate momentous occasions such as milestone birthdays or anniversaries. Frequented by esteemed members of Montreal's political elite, the restaurant boasts an atmosphere of sophistication, further enhanced by the courteous and affable demeanor of its wait staff, who, upon successful engagement, may even regale guests with amusing anecdotes. The culinary offerings, rooted in traditional French gastronomy, showcase meticulous preparation and presentation, making each dish a veritable masterpiece. Of particular note is the Escargot, a delicacy that unfailingly impresses even the most discerning palates.

Usually come here on Friday nights with my friends who are regulars.

Food is pretty solid the lamb meatballs and Johnny's nachos are very popular with our group. Even their ranch dressing is really good and I am not a big ranch fan. I also like the Guinness stew.

The only thing keeping this place from being a full 5 stars is that it's probably a bit on the pricy side for what it is. Beers start at $6 (i think I haven't had one cheaper) and pretty much any food item is $10+ with sandwiches at $12. Shave a couple bucks off and they would be in solid 5 star contention.

The service here is also good as all the servers are friendly, keep up well with groups and splitting checks (always hard since our group can be anywhere from 4-12), and they are willing to joke around with us and not throw us out (always a possibility with our non-pc humor and discussions).

"A bowl of rice and an extremely reasonable price point coupled with an abundance of spices is what attracts me to this establishment. Specifically, I can acquire a salmon bowl accompanied by brown rice and an ample amount of fiery seasoning for a mere $7 or less. Upon entering the premises, I noticed a queue leading up to several cash registers and a menu displayed prominently on the wall, featuring an array of traditional Japanese dishes such as chicken teriyaki bowls, providing options for a diverse group of patrons. For my part, I opted for the aforementioned salmon bowl at a cost of $5.99, which represents an excellent value considering it includes fish that has not been deep-fried, thereby making it a suitable choice for a midday repast. However, I must confess that I find the teriyaki sauce to be somewhat overpowering, so I requested that it be applied sparingly. Furthermore, for an additional $0.25, I was able to enhance the nutritional value of my meal by selecting brown rice instead of the standard white variety. After receiving my bowl, I made my way to the condiment station, whereupon I discovered a variety of hot chili powders, sauces, and sliced green onions. The latter particularly caught my attention and appreciation. It is worth mentioning that the negative assessments of this eatery may stem from the fact that Japanese cuisine generally lacks the potent flavors associated with Chinese and Thai culinary traditions."

Since this place is popular, the line for this buffet is long, but I guess there's nothing that can be done about that.

The servers were attentive and removed our plates. One minor nitpick I have is that even though I'm glad they leave the utensils behind, they tend to place the utensils on the table, which I personally like to avoid since I usually put them on napkins. It would be nice if they offered replacement utensils other than just the ones on the table, although I guess maybe it's like that so that too much water isn't wasted.

There were a large variety of food dishes to choose from. They make the price of $40/person a good deal by offering a lot of expensive dishes. There were crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, and creme brulee. They also offered complimentary drinks like raspberry iced tea and sodas.
This place is a wonderfull place to go to... inexpensive and very friendly bartenders and some sexy ones at that... woo hoo!!! Love the screens in there and the food is excellent!!!
This place is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Fat free - new, clean place, plenty of parking - nice staff - and did I say fat free?  Great spot!

Marquee is an utter debacle, albeit an aesthetically pleasing one, characterized by an air of bedlam and disarray, yet, quite paradoxically, the doormen and bouncers manage to maintain a semblance of order amidst the chaos, deftly orchestrating the entrance process with aplomb; there exists no stringent dress code policy, which, rather unfortunately, leads to a somewhat lackluster ambiance, as some patrons opt for decidedly casual attire, such as flat shoes and leggings, while others sport athletic footwear and plain t-shirts, rendering the overall atmosphere somewhat less than glamorous; navigating the club's interior can prove to be a somewhat arduous task, as the stairs can be quite treacherous, and the dance floor tends to become oppressively congested, giving the impression of being packed into a small, confined space, much like sardines in a can, but these drawbacks can be readily overlooked; the disc jockey and other performers are truly exceptional, the sound system is impressive, and the bartenders are not only visually appealing but also quite affable.

I think this is one and only Indo-chinese restaurant in Phoenix area. Nice and clean place. Food was really good. We went on a Thu with reservation and was not crowded. \n\nTry the Manchurian Chicken ... Tasty

"Prior to purchasing tickets, it is imperative that you are cognizant of the fact that the performance will consist of a scathing critique of the audience, with the majority of the jokes relying heavily on stereotypes pertaining to race, gender, sexual orientation, age, and physical characteristics. Therefore, if you are easily offended, it would be advisable to avoid this production altogether. While the material presented is largely novel, there may be some instances of repetition, such as the quip regarding the notion of pondering one's mother's lips performing fellatio on one's father during a familial greeting. As an ardent devotee of comedic entertainment, I have had the privilege of exposure to a vast array of standup routines broadcasted on various platforms, including Comic View, Comedy Central, HBO, and Showtime, thereby increasing the likelihood that I have already encountered such humor. Nonetheless, the show promises to be an amusing experience, albeit not suitable for juvenile audiences due to its explicit nature (rated NC-17/R).\n\nThe venue's intimate setting is reminiscent of academic institutions, wherein attendees will be subject to unwavering scrutiny, analogous to the atmosphere of a high school or college environment. Consequently, it is essential to acknowledge that participation in the performance is mandatory, and individuals must be prepared to assume an active role in the show, as there are no hiding places."

The crab cake is the best in town. If you order the Caesar salad with salmon, request it to be blackened. Game changer. If you are into beef, go for the marinated flank steak. Heaven on a fork. 

The bar is very good sized and has full service for food and lots of TV's. 

Bon apatite.

Decent mocha. Hipster heaven. Loud and angry music. Brought me back to my youth.

The culinary offerings appeared visually appealing, and the beverages were economically priced. I aspire to revisit the establishment for the "remedy," a potion consisting of ginger and whiskey.

The best thing about the Excalibur is that it's more economical than other hotels on the strip. The cost of the hotel room was $27 (booked through Expedia). Of course, with all the vegas hotels these days, resort fee of $15 which gets you amenities, including wired internet in your room. The deal also included $20 food and beverage credit, which can be used at mostly bars, and the one restaurant I saw on there, which was the steakhouse (which is on the pricier side. Look up my review of the steak house at camelot for more info on the coupon there). Also included was a free play at the Dungeon, aka the midway arcade. The coupon book didn't include any match plays, unfortunately.

The room itself was nice. Spacious enough. The tv is large. There is an ethernet cable for you to plug into your computer for wired internet service. The internet was a bit slow. 

The beds were fine. They give you 3 pillows, so you get some extra fluff. 

The elevators were separated floors 1-18 and 18 and up. So if you want a fast elevator service and a high floor, book Floor 18 or so. 

As for the casino, it was stingy. Many of the blackjack tables use continuous shuffler machines, which I am not a fan of. Most minimums were around $10 for most table games.
First time going to this restaurant.  The service was great. The staff is very friendly.  Will definitely come back. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I had a reservation at another noted steakhouse near the strip and wasn't in the mood to follow through. So I started at the south end of the strip and thought I'd walk until I found something to suit my mood. Stepped into a few spots and kept walking. I swung through Cosmopolitan and an irresistible steakhouse aroma clutched me. I asked a hotel concierge to tell me the source and in a short walk I was sliding on to a stool at the STK bar- fine for a solo. I liked the atmosphere which was lively and busy with a great DJ mix as a backdrop. The volume issues that I've read from others was not an issue for me because I wasn't engaged in any challenging conversations. 

I had the foie gras french toast, bone-in rib and a moscow mule. I enjoyed everything about them. 

I will say that I can't appreciate the rest room format. Get in line outside? Wait your turn? Follow the attendant's commands? Sir, may I use the bathroom? NO! What? Fix that.

I'll be visiting Vegas again soon to celebrate my son's birthday and I'm pretty sure he'd like it as much as I, so I'll be back.

I have not been to Nello's in ages.  A friend suggested for lunch.  The three of us show up and the place was getting busy.  We were sat immediately.  Got to have pizza here, right?  We ordered a large pizza:  thick crust, bacon, basil, mushroom, and 1/2 with sausage.  OMG... It was good but they forgot the basil.  =(  The garlic bread was very good too....  \n\nThe waiter was eye candy and he provided great service!  =)

WOW!! What a hidden gem in Vegas! 
We went to the Rio to go see a show, and decided to grab a bite before.
We foolishly did not make reservations (I suggest that you do!) but the hostess offered us a cozy spot at the bar. Which we took.

Had a meatball appetizer, which was recommended by another patron. YES! SO delicious!! I would go back just for that! Then had the specials. One scallop dis and my partner had a sea bass dish. Both were full of flavor, tasted super fresh, and over all great dishes!

I would go back in a second!

p.s.- Locals with a T.Rewards card and NV ID get 25% off! If you are seeing a show, you get 20% with ticket stubs! What a deal for an amazing dinner!

I was going to downtown Las Vegas last night for a show, so I decided to stop for dinner at the Bar + Bistro.  I made one error in that it was First Friday in the Arts District and the restaurant has an abbreviated menu for that evening.

I went with two of their tapas plates and a dessert.  I started with their roasted tomate soup.  It was excellent.  The second dish was their 5 cheese mac and cheese a combination of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp.  The pasta was gigli.  The mac and cheese was very tasty, too!

I rounded out my dinner with a warm chocolate ganache cake.  It, too, was excellent.  It was served with a small scoop of sorbet and it was a perfect ending.

All things considered, I'd rather have come here on a night when I could have ordered from the full menu, but I had the chance to taste some of their good cuisine.  I think it's a bit pricey for what you get.  I enjoyed the decor a lot.  The tables shaped like artists' palettes with a metal well in many.  One thing that got me several times was the thought that I had dripped something onto the table.  When I looked, it was merely some spattered paint when they were decorating the tables.  Every time I looked down, it was a "gotcha."

Its been said before, but they deliver until 3 AM.  We were not in the state of mind to drive and have been getting a little sick of hungry howies.  It took a solid hour for our food to arrive, but that seems pretty normal for late night Tempe. Everyone raved about the food.  It was very good for late night delivery.  The chicken bruchetta pita was excellent although a little small.  I recommend 2 pitas for anyone with any kind of appetite.  You might not get through both, but the one was just a little too small to satisfy.  My only complaint, and the reason for 4 starts instead of 5 was the traditional hummus.  I didnt not think it was very good at all.  Many places in Tempe have much better.

Lovely looking place with gorgeous high ceilings. Really nice coffee to be had here and every member of the staff is friendly and warm. I come here for lunch now and then as it is close to my office. The little toasts are always super good and come with all sorts of toppings: Russian egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, various types of meat, etc. The desserts are all quite gorgeous looking as well, but usually I am too full to go there! I will say that it is kinda pricey, but at least the food is good, so that helps to take the sting out of the lunch bill.\n\nThey lose a star for saying that the soup was vegetarian...it had chunks of bacon and the guy shrugged when he saw me picking them out.

We went for a friends birthday party. I like the intimate setting. I'm usually not a comedy fan, but I laughed quite a bit at 3 out of the 4 comedians. There was a Fetish Ball going on next door, which confused me at first b/c I didn't understand why leather masks and nipple clamps were the dress code for a comedy club, but once I saw the little neon \"Comedy Spot\" sign, I figured it out. Overall its a great place to go on a  weekend. Assless chaps optional.

Absolutely delicious Thai food offered by a pleasant server.  Ordered green curry with extra veggies and tofu and it was so yummy I ate the rest for dinner. My friend had the broccoli chicken and spring roll and she was really impressed. Ambiance is very hole-in-the-wall and kitschy, but that's not why you go. You go for the delicious food and good service, and you won't be disappointed.

I have been very happy with the care my dog has received at Squaw Peak, they take good care of my pug. The staff is very kind, I can always get a last minute appointment, and I never have to wait. They treat my dog as if he is their own, as others have said.

A puppy was found at work, and when I brought him in to Squaw Peak, he was diagnosed with distemper, and the best course of action was to put him down. When I asked about the cost, the vet was kind enough to take care of it at no cost. 

They have also been willing to bill me for needed vet care and allow me to make payments when I was having financial difficulties, however, I was not pleased about receiving a collections notice from the office after making a payment that covered the majority of the amount owed. The person in charge of billing told me I could make another payment for the remaining amount ($70) this month, and I just needed to call in and make arrangements. Given my positive experiences, I can only assume this was an oversight.

Finally got here for dinner, heard about this restaurant from my friends many times! The food quality is good, environment is not bad, doesn't feel like those typical Japanese restaurants, I definitely will come back again!! Had a great dinner here!! Love it..!!!

Excellent!\nI love the ambiance of this restaurant. We were seated next to window with a peek of the fountain show. Foie grois was great and hamachi was good. I ordered medium duck. Unfortunately it was not seasoned well & was too chewy. Server was in tuned & offered to exchange dish for a sea bass. It was delicious!

On June 22nd, we arrived with a considerable assemblage during the evening hours and were accommodated at a spacious table that featured the option of engaging in recreational activities such as checkers and scrabble while awaiting the culinary offerings, which we thoroughly relished. My spouse opted for the miso salmon, while I selected a burger and fries, both of which proved to be satisfactory in terms of gastronomical quality and service efficiency, until the presentation of the bill, that is. Although the bill was meticulously itemized for each individual party, much to my appreciation, a cursory examination revealed an unsolicited inclusion of a gratuity charge, which, while not necessarily problematic in and of itself, did strike me as somewhat dubious, particularly given the lack of transparent communication regarding its addition, leading to the possibility of unwitting duplication of tips by certain patrons, which, in turn, prompted me to bring it to the attention of those seated nearby, who expressed gratitude for the heads-up. While it is conceivable that this practice may not have been the intentional policy of the eatery per se, but rather that of the server, it remains, in my estimation, a questionable custom that warrants scrutiny.

Probably one of the best steaks in Las Vegas. Comfortable seating and busy. Very busy. Lobster appetizer was a bit pricey for the little, but delicious amount you got. For a new restuarant the staff was very well trained. Looking forward to next visit, minus lobster app.

3.75 stars\n\nOther than the outlet LV store in Japan, this is probably the first lv store i went into.  The security guards were a little bit intimidating, staring at you and looking bored out of their minds.  In other nice stores at caesars, they at least smile or say have a good nite.  Anyway, like Fern mentioned, the purse bar was kind of interesting and fun.  Once the associate found out my aunt might get something, she pulled out 7-10 bags for us to see and took off the protection tape on each.  I forgot her name, but she was very patient and very helpful.  She disappeared for a long while after we decided, but I would still recommend it if you are seriously looking, and even though they would probably ignore me if I was by myself!

They boast an extensive array of delectable offerings for their midday repast, encompassing both vegetarian and carnivorous selections, which are presented in a format that allows patrons to sample a variety of flavors and textures, all of which are carefully crafted to satiate one's hunger and delight one's taste buds. Furthermore, their assortment of sweet treats and yeast-based flatbread infused with the pungent essence of garlic consistently impresses and satisfies those who partake of them. Additionally, the personnel who attend to the needs of guests display a high level of cordiality and hospitality, ensuring that each individual feels welcome and valued during their dining experience.
Great atmosphere, good food, a nice choice of lunch sandwiches, not too many so it won't take forever to choose. Raspberry Soda is delicious.

I've always been a happy camper leaving this place. 
They have a very cool looking bar with their bottles lit up and colorful. I like sitting at the tables around it even though the lighting is bad. It's like the flashlight under your face effect. Not cute!
I prefer the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna for the appetizer. The tuna comes out on a slaw that tastes amazing with a soy dressing and a side of wasabi you can mix in. This isn't a fish restaurant but I get on a fish-kick and LOVE their Blacked Fish Sandwich. It's always cooked perfectly and really like the sauce. The steamed broccoli are big pieces and always fresh. I wouldn't recommend the honey roasted carrots - they are soaked in whatever they are calling honey roasted and just tastes like carrots coated in sugar. Yuck. 
I like dessert and like chocolate but don't like anything from here. Maybe too much white chocolate for me.

"I would posit that this establishment represents the pinnacle of dining experiences within the boundaries of Sun Prairie. We have had the pleasure of partaking in their culinary offerings on numerous occasions, totaling six visits to date. Our orders have encompassed a diverse array of options, including steak, fried fish, and various entree selections. Each dish has demonstrated consistent quality, leaving us thoroughly satiated. Additionally, the restaurant's commitment to catering to younger patrons is evident in the well-portioned kids' meals, which have proven tantalizing enough to entice even the most discerning of youthful palates. Furthermore, the establishment's practice of regularly rotating both their menu and selection of beers on tap serves to enhance the appeal of repeat visits. It is worth noting, however, that the venue tends to bustle with activity, particularly on Fridays, underscoring its popularity among local diners."

The Filet Mignon was absolutely delicious and I couldn't get enough of the sauce. I did not even need steak sauce to enhance the taste. The service was wonderful, my boyfriend and I had a nice conversation with the waiter. Our waters were constantly refilled, which is always a plus for me because I drink my water like a whale. The price wasn't to shabby either, especially for a good steak. The only complaint  that I have are the frites (i think that is what they are called). It is way too salty. All in all, its a great place to have lunch on a beautiful day.

Great place to stay. Rooms are spacious and clean. The price is fair. It's at the end of the strip so there's less foot traffic which is a blessing. The air is cleaner vs other hotels. Lots of things to do in the hotel: beach, mall, bars, clubs, spa, many others.

Although we were compelled to wait 30 minutes for a table, it proved to be well worth the delay. We opted to sit outside, which offered a picturesque setting and an excellent vantage point for observing passersby. I selected a caesar salad and was delighted when it arrived promptly, within a mere five minutes. The flavors were exquisite, with the cheese and dressing being particularly noteworthy. Additionally, I chose to sample the traditional quiche lorraine. As a child, my grandmother frequently prepared quiche for me, instilling a deep affection for it that has endured to this day. This quiche Lorraine transported me back to those halcyon days, evoking fond memories of my youth. It was truly exceptional, possessing a rich, creamy texture that was both satisfying and filling. In fact, I found it so delectable that I was unable to consume all of it! \n\nOur server was extremely personable and attentive throughout our visit. The culinary creations emerged from the kitchen with remarkable celerity, allowing me only a brief interval to savor my caesar salad before the arrival of my main course. My companion opted for the warm chicken and brie sandwich, which featured paper-thin slices of apple and caramelized onions atop a bed of crispy bread. It was an unmitigated success, boasting flavors that were at once complementary and contrasting. In summary, our experience at this esteemed establishment was nothing short of magnificent, characterized by superlative fare and an ambiance that was both refined and welcoming. We shall undoubtedly return to partake in their gastronomic delights once again upon our next visit to Las Vegas.

This is a pretty cool store to shop in! They have a ton of interesting, high end kitchen appliances available. It seems like everything is chrome, very high end, and awesome looking. Plus, they will give you a coffee while you're shopping when they are demonstrating their high end coffee maker. It's a fun experience for sure.

"Perhaps I incline towards attire with a slightly more metropolitan essence than the typical Caucasian male, yet I found this location appealing and am fond of the concept of appearing stylish without breaking the bank. Its vastness is truly remarkable, offering an extensive array of choices catering to diverse tastes and preferences. From urban apparel to formal wear, and including various accessories, this store presents a veritable smorgasbord of options. My sole grievance pertains to the dearth of assistance beyond the confines of the fitting rooms, although such oversight can be anticipated given the reasonable price point."

Union Pig & Chicken has some of the best BBQ that I've found in Pittsburgh. The brisket is soft and falls apart with a fork, although some of the pieces can be overly fatty. Every time I've been the service has been decent, but slow. Union is also a surprsingly good place to go for lunch, The sandwiches they serve are delicious. One last note, definitely get the mac & cheese. It's that good.

"We visited this establishment in the company of my spouse and our two adolescent offspring, with the intention of sampling a variety of beverages and thereby facilitating a shared experience. Each member of our party opted for a distinct item from the menu, which afforded us the opportunity to indulge in a diversity of flavors and textures. The staff members present on the premises demonstrated a high level of cordiality and hospitality towards us, which greatly enhanced our overall enjoyment of the visit. Notwithstanding the aforementioned positive aspects, I must confess that the cost of these delectable concoctions did seem somewhat prohibitive, and it is my fervent hope that future patronage will not be unduly burdened by such elevated pricing, as it would greatly enhance my inclination to partake of them with greater frequency."

Walnut Grill is one of my favorite spots for an afterwork drink or a quick, fresh meal. Their menu is American fare with a twist, their wine list is excellent, and the atmosphere is always fun. They recently expanded the bar area to have more seating and comfy booths. The servers remember you if you're a frequent flyer and are always efficient. They have great live music some nights, too! I'll pretty much always be a regular here!

After the manager read my review he contact me and apologized. I have yet to return to the place, but the manager assured me my experience will be different. Since then the server that served me was terminated. Looking forward to going again.

It's about time that Steak N Shake came to the valley. I LOVE the frisco melt, it's crazy greasy deliciousness. The place is clean and the service is friendly, which to be honest, feels weird when I'm used to a surly waitress giving me the stink eye when I order my food at this chain.  \n\nI wish they'd stay open 24 hours like standard Steak N Shakes, but ah well. I don't mind the smaller menu, but I do mind that they do not have the peppers. They are missing some key elements that dispite the smaller menu they could do better.  I agree with a fellow reviewer that the milkshakes are not Steak N Shake quality. However, I'm willing to overlook all of that for my Frisco melt with fries and a side of cheese sauce.

I know it is a McDonald's. I get it. But as far as a fast food chain goes, this particualr McDonald's has my loyalty. \n\nTalk about your fast friendly service. Whether I am ordering just coffee or a couple hash browns for my boy and I on the way into school I know I will be through the drive-thru in 5 minutes tops!

This is a great late night spot located in the California Hotel. If you're a fan of ox tail soup, you'll love this place. The oxtail soup is only served late night and the entire menu has Hawaiian/Filipino influence. This place is so well known for their ox tail soup that if you check-in on Facebook, it will say it's the HOME OF THE OXTAIL SOUP. \n\nTips: 1. Be prepared to wait in line. 2. Get your oxtail soup without peanuts. 3. Don't forget to get your parking ticket validated.
The location is nice and the food is delicious! I got the market fish, which was very good. The meat was so tender. Other yummy dishes were duck and pork.

Great hotel. The rooms are super clean, there's water in the fridge, and the gym is decent. My only critique is that you have to refresh the Internet connection every 24 hours (and must pay $10 bucks per device - iPhone included), the breakfast is not very good (unless you get it made to order), and they left my previous nights room service tray outside my door until the next afternoon. Besides that, everything else was fantastic. The location is convenient, service attentive, and overall experience pleasant.

A recommendation from an employee at a beverage establishment led me to visit this particular venue on multiple occasions when I was in Las Vegas. My culinary exploits at this eatery have been restricted to their pizza and chicken wing offerings, both of which have proven to be exceptional choices for satisfying my nocturnal hunger cravings. Its proximity to the Stratosphere Hotel makes it an ideal location for those seeking sustenance after a night of revelry. The ambiance and quality of the food suggest that it is a popular haunt among local residents.

I liked their crab legs. I was second in a huge forming line. They are cracked, so no work has to be done. Sushi was very fresh. They have really cute bite sized desserts, so you can sample a lot of things. The dessert section is hidden away from everything else, so I think there is a good chance a lot of people forget about it. They have gellato in many different flavors like sour cherry. Very cute desserts. I don't know what kind of dessert I was eating. White chocolate with edible silver balls and soft center. Good what ever it was. I am very picky, and I found a lot of stuff I could eat. However for the price, I think I like the Bellagio better. Their is also a buffet on the stip with circular aquariums at the buffet with tropical desserts that are out of this world. Just can't remember the name of it :( I just remember you take an esculator down to get to the buffet. If you love Sushi Todai is a great fish and sushi buffet for reasonable prices. They have chicken and beef too!

Quality 24/7 food in vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip!\n\nIf you want good portion sizes, a meal thatll keep you full, and want to pass up on mickey Ds and Dennys, hit this place up.

So we end up at XS after being unable to get in to Hakkansan and trust me we were not disappointed! This place is incredible the inside was gorgeous and the outside was a great spot to enjoy the music and get some fresh air.\n\nWe end up seeing Rusko  and dancing the night which was a blast.  I would defiantly recommend checking it out here!

Yep, this is one of the best buffet place among a thousand other Vegas casino buffet.   It was cheap as well.  I would come back again :) good food, cheap price, I can't expect more from Vegas buffets :)
I thought that I could only get some good noodles here on the East Coast but boy was I wrong! I cant stop thinking about how good it was. Next time I am in town, Im heading straight there!
I love the food here omg and 12.45 for 3 well vodka coke drinks!?!? Yummy!  We had a blonde servee...marcia...merc....something... but she was nice :)
Not bad, service was on the slower side, but then again it was lunch time 12-1pm but very friendly and quick cashier

I have read some of the Yelp reviews and at my first visit at the Ingleside Grooming I was not too impressed with curt response to some of my questions as she seemed initially annoyed with my presence, however, I continued to request their services to groom my pet.  When I returned the next day with my pet, I was significantly late at dropping her off for her appointment.  I also told her that my pet is a nervous pet and has always pooped whenever I took her to Petsmart or to the vet.\nThe person who was there (the same person whom I spoke to the day before), I apologize and she was very understanding and did not seem upset at all for my tardiness.  I felt really comfortable at that point.  When I returned to pick up my pet the same person who I have been dealing with was so nice and told me how my dog behaved and how sweet she was and, best of all, didn't poop!  And my dog's new look (she's 3 years old and never had a hair cut, so she was pretty bushy) is fantastic!  and the cost is very reasonable with what comes included!  I highly recommend her!

Found this place b/c of Yelp and glad I did.

Great Sonoran hot dogs.  I got two and was uber full.  The first time I went I recall less than optimal communication.  I asked how many types of dogs they had, and the answer was "how many?".  

Today was the 2nd time and things went much better.  Very helpful and once again a great meal.  I also feel like it was a bit cleaner this time, maybe they straightened up or repainted.

It is in a below average neighborhood but worth the adventure.  Go for the food, not the ambiance.

We weren't planning on visiting here but saw a billboard (they work!) saying Jerry Seinfeld was on that night and we just couldn't miss out that opportunity!\n\nSo we ended up with seats towards the back but the view was still great along with the acoustics. Would make for a great venue to see some live acts in as well.

I really liked this show.  There were a couple of cheesy parts but overall I thought it was excellent.  There is something for everyone and it's all quite tastefully and artistically done. 

The twins are hilarious and it's awesome to see a couple of big girls out there strutting their stuff.  The rest of the bodies are lean dancer bodies, for the most part, featuring real breasts.  Hooray for real breasts!

The choreographies are beautiful and tasteful, overall... and some are quite poignant. It's not all about the shock value ...  it's about love,  lust,  joy,  pain,  pleasure,  desire,  distress,  giving,  taking,  the physical, the emotional, the silly and fun ...   The total human animal...    Watch closely. 

Standouts for me were the African dancer, the suspended bondage act, the water gymnasts, the transvestite torch singer ... and that amazing red cape that covers the entire stage is fucking *spectacular*.  

A must see, IMO... and I would definitely go back.  I enjoyed every minute.

Time: 10am. Place: Poppy's. Impulse purchase: Bagels, doz. Intent: I get to play Bagel Fairy all day with a dozen of the best bagels in Charlotte.

I distributed my cache of carb thoughtfully, but thoroughly. And not before eating two in one sitting. Bagelbloat, yeesh.

Coffee was just OK but I honestly don't think they care much about anything except the bagatorial arts up in Poppy's and in that distinguished category, they get an A+. Sad to me that Bore's Head is what they have for slices and cheeses since that stuff is just nasty, but hey.

No more Bruegger's for me. No more terrorizing Owen. I get Poppy bagels, I eat Poppy bagels, I love Poppy bagels.

note - these suckers are such globs of gluten that they don't age very well - freeze 'em, if you must, instead of sitting 'em in the breadbox.

"An exceptionally hip drinking establishment, characterized by an ambiance that exudes a relaxed and welcoming demeanor, courtesy of the affable personnel who tend to patrons' needs with alacrity and cordiality. The menu boasts an array of delectable edibles and potables, available at prices that are eminently reasonable and pocket-friendly, ensuring that indulging in the epicurean delights on offer will not exact an unreasonable toll on one's financial resources. Additionally, the venue offers a diverse selection of libations at reduced prices during the euphemistically designated 'happy hour,' a time when the already convivial atmosphere becomes even more festive and jovial. Despite its diminutive size, which may result in a capacity crowd on occasion, the bar remains an unwaveringly enjoyable destination for those seeking a gratifying and memorable experience."

I engaged in an activity while visiting Las Vegas that I rarely partake in, particularly when surrounded by acquaintances and loved ones; indeed, I relished the opportunity to savor a delectable meal in solitude, thereby earning the esteemed title of "ohitori-sama," a term used by the Japanese to describe a lone diner who is accorded great respect. My culinary escapade transpired with remarkable ease, as I secured a reservation at a prime time, received a warm welcome from the hostess, and was treated to exceptionally attentive and cordial service that struck a delightful balance between the relaxed ambiance of an American bar and the refined elegance of a French bistro. Furthermore, the exquisite cuisine warranted no further deliberation, although this author, hailing from California, found the foie gras to be a notable highlight, boasting a satisfying crispness on its seared surface. Notably, the prices were surprisingly reasonable, given the city's reputation for extravagance, with a four-course menu accompanied by an amuse bouche available for $78, and a streamlined pre-theater option offered for $48 prior to 6:30 pm. Additionally, I took advantage of the establishment's wine list, discovering that half-bottles of Champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape could be obtained for a reasonable $88, while my neighbor, a man of discerning taste, secured a full bottle of Sancerre for a mere $40, much to my admiration. However, my tranquility was momentarily disrupted by a fellow solo diner seated beside me, whose striking appearance and suave demeanor brought to mind a fictional assassin portrayed by actor Jason Statham; regrettably, his proximity shattered the illusion of a romantic French bistro experience, as he engaged me in a lively conversation replete with references to hockey and his native Ottawa.
Every time I go to Whataburger, I get chicken strips. It is the only place I can think of that gives you a piece of toast with your meal.

"The quality of service was exceptional, and the ambiance of the dining area was thoroughly clean and well-maintained. Our culinary selections encompassed both the alloush and June's special (mushroom melt), which were undoubtedly delectable and were presented in a timely manner. However, a few minor drawbacks prevented us from giving the establishment a perfect five-star rating. Specifically, the bread was unpleasantly soggy and lacking in texture, contradicting the crunchy appearance suggested by the toasted marks. Additionally, the spinach used in the sandwich was underwhelming, lacking the freshness and crispness one would expect from such a component. Nonetheless, we wholeheartedly endorse this eatery while acknowledging these minor imperfections, allowing patrons to make informed decisions and potentially enhance their dining experience."

We've been twice in the past couple years and enjoyed both performances (Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly) immensely. Unfortunately, by the time we fly in and find a hotel (even at Jerry's) we only feel like we can afford the cheap seats. The chairs are a little narrow up there in opera glass country. Might have to open the wallet a little next time. Check if there is a pre-show lecture - worth the time and you might get closer parking in the garage. Parking is a good deal for AZ.

This location is a very good example for what a Starbucks should be.  Usually, the service is good and timely, even if you go during a rush in the afternoon.  The wifi can be hit or miss depending on how many people are using it.\n\nThe reason for the four star rating is the problem that is common to most State St/Campus open areas - the transient/homeless population.  It's not unusual for one table to be taken up by someone's plastic bags or someone to be sitting out panhandling.  It's not Starbuck's fault - you see that at most coffee shops in the area.  There's really not much they can do to control the problem, short of kicking them out.  That's an issue for the city of Madison to deal with.
fun joint, right on the strip you can people watch, get hammered, DJ booth coming soon right on the patio \"I heard\" this is a deff go to place during the summer!

"I have an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which was initially precipitated by my inaugural visit in 1996. The eatery's commitment to catering to vegan patrons is laudable and undoubtedly contributes to its enduring appeal. My most recent dining experience at this venue was marked by the consumption of two delectable dishes: a flavorful papaya salad and an assortment of fresh spring rolls, the latter of which boasted an uncommon mintiness that, while unexpected, did not detract from their inherent palatability. Furthermore, I sampled their 'Dinner #3,' a platter comprising a singularly scrumptious fried roll, a bowl of coconut soup replete with an array of mushrooms and crowned with a pungent garlicky oil (the Thai terminology for which escapes me), and a serving of pad thai that, regrettably, proved too piquant even when solicited with a request for mitigated seasoning. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the quality of the culinary offerings and the attentive, cordial service I received during my visit left an indelible impression, ensuring that I shall return in the near future to partake in one of their tantalizing lunch specials."

"Ikea for President." The notion itself prompts a consideration of what governance would be like if it adopted the efficiency, affordability, and utility characteristic of the renowned furniture retailer. Indeed, Ikea presents an array of options for home furnishing across various price points, rendering it accessible to diverse consumers. The quality of assistance provided by Ikea staff fluctuates between adequate and exceptional, and the company thoughtfully supplies an assortment of supplementary items, such as rope, large bags or carts, measuring tools, writing utensils, and note-taking implements. As a personal preference, I highly esteem the Hemnes collection, which features authentic wood, and have successfully incorporated it into both my master bedroom and living area, yielding satisfactory results. Previously, I have invested in the Malm range, which, while modest in cost, delivered durable and long-lasting furnishings. The sole drawback of Ikea lies in the instruction manuals accompanying their products, which rely solely on illustrations, thereby necessitating considerable patience and unwavering focus during the assembly process, particularly when tackling more intricate items. Consequently, I tend to delegate the task of construction to my partner, as my own threshold for frustration is surpassed within a brief span of five minutes.

I live nearby  and have driven past this place many times. Today my wife called me and asked that I bring her lunch. Needless to say, we were not disappointed by these gyros. Savory meat piled high with the right amount of sauce atop a a fresh pita was a great lunch.

"In our household, we tend to engage in activities multiple times, as evidenced by our current celebration of our anniversary weekend. I suggested dining at DW Bistro, a culinary establishment that had previously impressed me during my birthday weekend with my friends. Upon entering the restaurant, my husband was immediately struck by the aromatic ambiance, which was a testament to the quality of the cuisine. As a former restaurateur himself, it was challenging to impress him. We opted to share a house salad, which was a delectable medley of mixed greens, fruit, cheese, and nuts that was truly a highlight of the meal. Additionally, I savored the short rib sandwich, while my spouse enjoyed the salmon entrÃ©e; both dishes were expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. Our server was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu offerings, further enhancing our dining experience. Needless to say, we are eager to return and sample their brunch fare."

"The performances were truly exceptional, encompassing an array of diverse acts that would undoubtedly advance to the later stages of America's Got Talent, showcasing a plethora of unique and unconventional talents that I had not previously witnessed, thereby providing a truly captivating experience for the audience. Furthermore, the cost of a single mojito, albeit well-crafted and satisfying, seemed somewhat disproportionate to the quantity of sustenance it could procure, particularly for an individual of local residence such as myself, who might otherwise allocate said funds towards the acquisition of various culinary delights. Nonetheless, the overall quality of the entertainment presented did surpass my initial expectations, as I was initially uncertain about the nature of the acts that would be showcased."

Capprioti's \"Bobby\" took steroids, bulked up here at Eddie D's, and now calls himself sir \"Robert.\" His exterior is tougher, but deep down inside, he's still the soft, cranberry sweet , lovable stuffing we all have known to love. Robert takes gravy baths now so the chicks will love that.  Most girls will dig the 6 in Robert, but for the heftier gals, Robert transforms into 12 in also.  So don't hesitate, when you're lonely for lunch, hit up Eddie D's and find Robert waiting for your company.

I really like Paradise Bakery, I was at this location every morning for about 2 years. The staff was always friendly but sometimes the line can get long if a lot of people come in at once. It can be a long wait to get served. Being a big muffin fan I always loved the apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins and they are consistently good.

The Paradise rewards are a nice perk, compared to other coffee shops it is easy to earn free drinks and food if you are a regular and would spend the money anyway.

The only reason this location looses one star is the sometimes pushy home business folk that take over every available booth and camp with their laptops. This is during the week. On weekends you get whole families with screaming kids. This does not seem to happen at the other locations in the area, could be the proximity to the hotel next door.

it's already been said in every other review, but the Mattress Factory is pretty amazing.  They have installations that are extremely unique and orginal.  You won't find art like this anywhere else in the city.

I was a huge fan of the Avalon in Oakland a couple years so when I passed this in Mt Lebo I had to stop! 

Design: Eye catching, funky clothes in the windows, neon sign

Organization: Typical layout of most buy trade sell shops. Pants. Shirts. Dresses...yada yada.  Nice area upfront with bags and jewelry. There is also a higher end selection( Prada, Gucci, Jimmy Cho) for the desperate housewives of Mt. Lebo. 

Selection: Pretty good. Buffalo Exchange has a more stylish/funky selection though. Wide Shoe Selection. 

Price: Affordable 

Service: Cashier was nice. We briefly chatted about our favorite stores. 


Pros: Doesn't smell like cat pee which most resell shops tend to. Very Organized and great design. Very Affordable ( Tank $8.00 and Dress $8.00) 

Cons: Could use to clear out some inventory ( old Hollister tanks, plaid short short from '98). Whiney mid-aged women shop here. 

Overall: Great place to stop when you have no money but still have the itch to spend and need a break from the Urban Outfitters circuit. Definitely plan on making this a constant in my shopping rounds.  

Check it out!
Very upset this place has closed. Please come back! One of the few places in town where you can get healthy take-out.

Very nice hotel - new, modern and non-smoking! It was nice to not have a casino here. We liked being up on the 29th floor - could see a lot. Loved the automatic shades in the room, the large shower, the quick and quietly flushing toilet, and especially the tub!!!\nPrices in the market cafe were a little steep, but that's LasVegas. I appreciated being able to get a latte there in the morning.\nWe took advantage of the free valet parking. The valets were very nice and efficient. We also got to check in early - wasn't expecting that we could but a nice surprise.

The culinary offerings were of a satisfactory nature, albeit the absence of embellishments upon my "smash fries" rendered them comparable to their conventional counterparts. Furthermore, the demeanor of the young woman responsible for delivering our victuals to our table was perceived as discourteous, specifically when my significant other requested an additional quantity of mayonnaise.

This is probably my favorite hotel I've stayed at in Vegas. I've stayed at at more than 10 different hotels in Vegas and I always enjoy my stay here. I have the M Life card so I've gotten comps and discounted rooms from here and other MGM owned hotels. (If you stay At any of these hotels I highly recommend getting this card.) The rooms here are huge and the staff is very nice. The beach setting at the pool and wave pool are awesome, especially when it's 104 degrees outside. My favorite restaurant here is the Burger Bar! The Kobe burger is great! \n\nThere are 2 minor things I don't like about this hotel, which knocks it down to 4 stars. 1) This hotel has become more of a family oriented hotel over the past 2 years. That's not a bad thing but it's not what I'm looking for in Vegas. 2)The TVs are old and not HD, at least in the rooms I've stayed in.

I have had the pleasure of visiting Vanguard on multiple occasions, and I must say, it is an exceptional establishment for those seeking a unique and expertly crafted cocktail experience. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but notice the fastidious attention to detail in the maintenance of the bar area, which contributes to a welcoming ambiance that exudes sophistication and elegance. Furthermore, the staff has consistently demonstrated proficiency in efficiently accommodating patrons, even during peak hours, ensuring that imbibers can readily partake in their desired potations without undue delay.

Personally, I possess a penchant for exploring diverse beverages at various drinking establishments; however, when patronizing Vanguard, my preferences become decidedly narrowed, as I invariably opt for the Jack Rose cocktail, composed of apple brandy, maple syrup, and black cherry. The mere mental reflection upon its delectable flavors evokes an intense yearning within me for a glass of this sublime elixir. It is worth noting that the assorted beverages offered by Vanguard are indeed delectable, and following a couple of libations, a brief respite may be advisable to allow for proper digestion and appreciation of their intricate flavor profiles.

While Vanguard presents itself admirably, there are occasional drawbacks, specifically pertaining to the weekend evenings, when the atmosphere transforms into a more boisterous and vibrant setting, complemented by the presence of a disc jockey. Additionally, it is not uncommon for individuals hailing from Fremont to enter the establishment, engaging in eccentric behavior, such as aimlessly meandering or performing brief, impromptu dance sequences before departing. Despite these minor shortcomings, Vanguard remains an exceptional destination for those seeking a refined drinking experience.

We arrived at this esteemed culinary establishment with the expectation of partaking in a delectable dinner, and indeed, the gastronomical offerings did not disappoint. The various cuts of meat and seafood that adorned our plates were cooked to perfection, eliciting expressions of satisfaction from all members of our party. However, it is with great consternation that we must report that the pace of service was somewhat languid, resulting in an extended waiting period for our repast. Notwithstanding this unfortunate circumstance, the management saw fit to present our patriarch with a complimentary box of decadent truffles and a generous gift card valued at twenty-five dollars, a gesture that served as a token of their acknowledgment of his milestone birthday.
Food rating: 4.5
Service rating: 3

"The Bamboo Club offered an exceptional dining experience, characterized by delectable cuisine, comfortable seating, and an ambiance that exuded a sense of refinement and sophistication. However, our server's behavior was subpar, bordering on unacceptable, and his actions detracted significantly from our overall enjoyment of the evening. Despite his efforts to mar the experience, we cannot help but reflect upon the evening with fondness, appreciative of the establishment's unique charm and appeal. We arrived fashionably late, at approximately 9:00 PM, and were seated alfresco, surrounded by tasteful decor that expertly blended elements of Asian culture with modern flair. The restaurant's interior design was equally impressive, boasting dark wood accents, strategic lighting, and an atmosphere that struck the perfect balance between vibrancy and intimacy. The culinary offerings did not disappoint, with the Pad Thai and various appetizers showcasing the kitchen's proficiency in creating flavorful, well-executed dishes. Regrettably, our order of seared ahi tuna fell short of expectations, owing to its unfortunate state of being frozen, which rendered it unpalatable. While personal responsibility must be acknowledged, rumors persist that the restaurant could potentially source fresher, never frozen seafood options, thereby elevating the dining experience for patrons with discerning tastes. In conclusion, a visit to the Bamboo Club is worth considering, provided one avoids the seafood menu and maintains a healthy distance from the surly server in question."

The bad: the bar closes at 10pm.  It seems like the western, country, wagon-wheel themed bar that you'd like to close down one night while playing some good tunes on the juke box and eating peanuts.  And also the french fries, file those under bad.

The good: the hamburgers are pretty much delicious.  Definitely go for guacamole, and add whatever you want from the topping wagon.

I didn't try one myself, but I hear the cookies are good.

ShooGoo was sort of a template 4-star place: good food, American menu, big ole portions, and nice service. It lacked the special zsa zsa zsu needed for 5 starrs.

My filet with Béarnaise sauce was excellent. The highlight of our meal, however, was our mushroom with Gorgonzola appetizer. Mmm.
And, of course, they have the nice view, though that was pretty pervasive throughout Sedona.
sunny az... yow, bill

Well, not that anyone can properly place doughnuts in the food pyramid, let alone work them into any meal with justification, but Krispy Kreme is a gift from the sweet tooth heavens. If you're passing by and happen to catch that beauteous glowing Hot & Now sign illuminated in your peripheral, it might has well be your birthday. 

I've experienced many a doughnut endeavor and never once have I been let down by this little shop of warm, melty, glazed dreams. The staff is always fast and can pull a dozen melt-in-your-mouth glazed in no time. 

The inside is great, too. Fun for little kids to watch the conveyor belt churning out doughnuts. This is a place of happiness. Not just breakfast or snacktime, but pure happiness. 

My only gripe is the accessibility. Located on Independence, it is hard to pull in and then come in through the back, pull in to the drive thru or find a spot  in the adjacent parking lot. All of Charlotte knows how 74 is the bane of motor vehicle existence, so just be prepared. 

Absolutely love Krispy Kreme and all they stand for. Except for maybe their odd choice of spelling, of course! Now, onward for Hot & Now doughnuts!

This place is another great dive bar on the strip in Pittsburgh.
The Penn Pumpkin Roll is Amazing, but Make sure you ask for the cinnamon and sugar around the rim.
Also they have a beer called Sprecher, Hard root beer, And it tastes  just like Root Beer, awesome.
There is also an Upstairs for extra room and a great View.

"What a phenomenal manner in which to expend an evening, this being our maiden visit to this particular venue. The seating arrangement, encircling the stage 360 degrees, facilitates a captivating experience for all attendees. The vocal renditions surpassed my expectations, while the wigs adorning the thespians were somewhat kitsch; nonetheless, the evening's merriment prevailed. The sole drawback, alas, pertained to the demographic composition of the audience, primarily senior citizens, whose whispers, despite their efforts to remain discreet, proved rather vociferous and, thus, mildly detracted from the overall enjoyment. Notwithstanding, it was evident that they, too, were thoroughly enjoying themselves. To avoid inconvenience, it is advisable to arrive prematurely, as parking spaces become rapidly depleted. Additionally, numerous eateries in close proximity to the theatre provide an excellent opportunity to partake in a culinary excursion prior to the performance."

"Kelly's represents an optimal venue for socializing with acquaintances while consuming beverages, and perhaps indulging in a delectable meal. Personally, I find this establishment appealing. The ambiance offers numerous opportunities to relax and engage in conversation with companions, whether it be in the spacious outdoor seating area or within the intimate interior setting. Although, one may encounter a few drawbacks, such as a potentially lengthy wait for a table or a slightly sluggish pace of service, these minor inconveniences are more than compensated by the superior quality of the culinary offerings. Furthermore, the presence of a velvet rope does not detract from the overall experience, as it simply adds to the exclusive nature of the establishment. In conclusion, Kelly's embodies the quintessential gathering spot for those seeking a refined and enjoyable dining experience, and I highly recommend the short ribs, which truly epitomize gastronomic excellence."

I have always passed my this place and had never stopped in until and ex was wanted to try them and boy was i glad we did. As you walk in you are taken away from the hustle and bustle of being on South Blvd, and is kinda taken to a different place. The decor is very nice and upscale. I must admit they were a little pricey but in my opinion they were will worth it, The portions are huge and they are enough to feed two people. The staff is amazing and are willing to go the extra mile to make sure your happy and that everything is going great. The night we went the owner was there and offered free drinks and I'm down for a free drink anytime.. lol but over all i would rate this a 4 out of 5

I have developed an enhanced fondness for this establishment subsequent to experiencing its interior. Ladies are extended complimentary admission accompanied by gratis beverages from 10-12 pm!! There exists no queue, allowing for a seamless ingress and egress. The personnel, including the exotic dancers, display amicability and courtesy. The potent potables further enhance the overall experience. Although compact, the venue surpasses my initial expectations in terms of capacity, and it offers a relaxation area that can be accessed without incurring any charges. The DJ's performance was not entirely satisfactory, as he committed a few errors or perhaps selected melodies that did not align with my preferences. This locality is highly suitable for gatherings with acquaintances, where one can indulge in complimentary refreshments and unwind in a welcoming atmosphere. Observing the clientele, it appears that certain individuals opted for a more relaxed attire, including males donning only a tee and cap, partnered with females sporting denim and a stylish upper garment. The age demographic of the patrons tends towards maturity.

The food is great the portions are perfect and the sevice is outstanding...the only problem is they have a 20.00 min to use debt, this is a problem for me Because I usually go by myself and don't carry cash so I probably won't come back because I can get the same great food service and portions two minutes down the street and use debit anytime I want.

Breaking it down:  the Samosas were a 2.5 stars (Potatoes and cilantro???) , good wrap though.  The Naan was naan.  Well baked but about average at 3 stars.  The Kashmiri Dum Aloo was a pleasant suprise and i would give it five stars.  It was well spiced (about perfect 6 out of 10), creamy, and the potatoes were well cooked (not mushy and not to hard).  Last was the Vegetable Jalfrezi, a well made dish that gets one star knocked off for being a bit too heavy on the cooking oil.  \n\nThe rice was perfect.  The service kept my water glass full.  I enjoyed the Bollywood videos on the tv's as well.  I will be back to sample more of thier menu.

I really like this restaurant... for the west island. In town it's nothing special. But thank god someone has opened a proper byow in this area. It's my official go to place when my dad wants to eat dinner now. 

The pizzas are great and I've enjoyed the various pasta dishes I've tried. 

Word to the wise... This place is actually busy so RSVP.

Guys must wear shirts with sleeves, even when the weather is ridiculously hot in Vegas.  Pricy, but the food and interior make up for it.  Lots and different choices of things to be put on the your plate. Their desserts are actually good compared to other buffets. Their corn on the cob is super delicious!!!

Spinach artichoke dip is the bomb, used to be bigger but hey whatever. Drinks are strong, always a good thing. The waiter, Matt, is the bomb. He helped us make decisions and have good time before going out for the night. \n\nMy friend likes the menu since it has weight watchers options, I like it for the two for $20.

"JD and I were seeking a supremely informal dining establishment for our noontime repast on the weekend, and subsequent to his suggestion, we decided upon this particular venue, which proved to be an ideal selection. The complimentary tortilla chips and salsa were of exceptional quality, or perhaps my palate had been heightened by the physical exertion I had recently engaged in at the gymnasium, likely a combination of both factors. 

JD opted for a cheese crisp, which prompted me to facetiously inquire as to whether he was adhering to a restrictive dietary regimen. My jest was quickly rendered null and void, however, when the gargantuan, grease-laden, cheese-topped flatbread arrived at our table. Its enormity was truly astounding! A delicate, crispy tortilla served as the foundation for an abundance of molten, delectable cheese, strategically sectioned into squares, much like a certain type of pie, facilitating ease of consumption. In contrast, my selection of enchiladas, emblazoned with the colors of the Mexican flag, were passable, yet failed to elicit the same level of enthusiasm as the colossal, melted cheese-topped flatbread that sat opposite me. 

In summary, the meal was quite satisfying, and while it may have negated any health benefits I had accrued through my recent gym visit, such is life, and I am content with this reality."

Rito's easily has the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe- now that Pluto is not a planet. 

Don't be scared by the wussies that say the area is scary- I guess when you live in Sun City- the big city can be scary. On any given day the place will be packed with city workers, CPAs, medical staff from Good Sam, teachers and the occasional sketchy dude. 

This family owned spot puts out amazingly good food. The menu is limited-but it's all about quality not quantity. I do not feel that the food is overpriced at all. You are buying fresh made food with soul-if you want heartless crap hit Taco Hell on McDowell. 

If you live a charmed life and they're selling tacos when you are there- for the love of heysoos- buy three. The guacamole tacos are amazing. If they were to become illegal- I would rob old people so I could support my habit.

If only they would step up their game and offer fountain drinks- that would be great. Cans of soda do not help during hot summer months.

This gym is MAJOR!!! When I entered Gold's Gym Elite I felt as if I was checking into a hip hotel like The W. Very modern, stylish and CLEAN!! I am beyond happy about joining! It is extremely clean, which a gym should be. The staff is friendly and helpful. The cardio machines are way cool. Each one has a personal tv to use and a cord to connect your i-POD. How cool is that? It doesn't have a pool which is a bit of a downer. The views from the gym are excellent. I did my cardio workout the other day and watched all of the planes flying into Sky Harbor. It was fantastic! Gold's Gym Elite in Phoenix is not overly crowded which makes working out there so much more enjoyable. I was a member for a long time to a very popular gym in this part of the valley. It was way too crowded, and the bathrooms were filthy. I gladly ended my membership and joined Gold's Gym Elite.

As much as I want to love buffets, my stomach tends to disagree. Mass produced food sitting under heating lamps doesn't hold much appeal for me. Fortunately, Studio B is one of the few buffets where quality trumps quantity and is worth the trip.

Dinner runs about $25 Monday - Thursday, weekend seafood ups the price by about $10. Considering that an entree and a beer at restaurants like Cheesecake Factory runs about the same price, its really not a bad deal. What makes the price worth is the unlimited beer and wine available at buffet. I was surprised to see craft draft beer along with ciders, and a couple wines to pick from.

In terms of food there is something for everyone. Sushi, multiple carving stations along with plenty of vegetarian and healthier options. The desert station features enough to satisfy even the most discerning sweet tooth and gets extra points for having gelato and milkshakes. The buffet itself looks great. Modern design, comfortable seating, unobstructed views of the Vegas strip and a open kitchen ensures cleanliness. 

The lines can get long on busier days so come prepared. Also check out the M Players Club as they offer free buffets for players.

I recently had the privilege of becoming a member of this esteemed fitness facility, and my experience thus far has been nothing short of exceptional. The personnel stationed at the front desk have consistently displayed a remarkable level of cordiality and warmth, extending a friendly greeting upon each visit. Furthermore, I have had the opportunity to partake in my fitness regimen at varying intervals throughout the day, and I have invariably found an abundance of state-of-the-art equipment designed to target specific muscle groups. In point of fact, I have yet to encounter a single instance wherein I was unable to locate a suitable machine for my needs. Additionally, I must commend the juice bar on its impressive selection of healthy beverages, which have proven to be an invaluable complement to my workouts. It is worth mentioning that the staff manning the juice bar have consistently demonstrated a high degree of proficiency and congeniality in their interactions with patrons. Moreover, I have not encountered any difficulties in securing parking accommodations, which has greatly facilitated my visits to the gym. Lastly, I must say that the overall ambiance of the facility is truly pleasant and well-maintained, creating an ideal environment for individuals to pursue their fitness goals. Based on my experiences, I would unhesitatingly recommend this gym to anyone seeking a top-notch fitness establishment.

Three of us ate here last night and I'll definitely go back.  The service was great (Emily was fantastic and SO helpful - even when I called to get directions) and the owner, Daryl stopped by our table after the meal to make sure everything was alright.  What a nice guy! 
I guess if I had a critique to make, it would be that the appetizers should be larger.  They're very inexpensive, so in retrospect we should have ordered two or three of the avacado spring rolls and empanadas - but, I would have preferred them to be priced as two or three instead of one.
Other than that, the food was great.  I ordered the curried tofu (excellent choice) and cleaned the plate.  Martha ordered the Jerk Chicken (HOT HOT HOT) and Binnie ordered the Chicken and Dumplings, which was unique and really tasty.  
All three of us said that we'd definitely go back again.

One of the classic hotels of Las Vegas...due to the BUFFETS :p

  It's a great, simple hotel nothing too over the top but definitely worth the stay here. Despite the age of the Rio they did a great job updating the furniture, making it contemporary and very comfortable.

  There was a long line at check in but what do you expect? It's the weekend, everyone goes to Vegas on the weekends. But once we got to the front of the line the staff was very helpful and cordial.

  Personally if I had to deal with all those people, I would lose my mind haha, so kudos to the staff of the Rio for keeping their cool. Obviously it's a little far from the strip so bring extra money for cabs.

Still a great place to stay after all these years, keep it going Rio :D

Incredible pizza, great ambiance and terrific service. 

We really enjoyed this Old Town spot next to the Poisoned Pen Bookstore. We split an Emiliana salad at the recommendation of the owner followed by an Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both were excellent as was the selection of wines. 

I thought I'd order a Sangiovese as it was lunch, and I wanted something light. They brought out 3 wines to try and we ended up going with a Tuscan Cabernet blend which was terrific. 

This place makes the list of "spots to go back to" in Scottsdale! Great service, great food and really nice ambiance!

"My culinary exploits were rather limited on this particular occasion, as I opted to sample merely a pair of items from the extensive menu; specifically, the green chili burro and beef taco. Furthermore, my dining experience was somewhat compromised by the fact that I elected to procure my meal via takeout, which undoubtedly diminished the overall quality of the fare in comparison to the traditional in-house dining format. However, I must confess that the green chili component of the burro was indeed a notable highlight, striking an impressive balance between piquancy and mildness that elevated it to a position of gastronomic prominence. Additionally, the tortillas accompanying the taco were quite satisfactory, exhibiting a pleasing texture and flavor profile that complemented the savory contents within. While the beef taco itself was certainly palatable, I cannot help but feel that the full potential of its gustatory delight remained unrealized due to my decision to consume it outside the establishment; thus, I shall endeavor to partake of it within the restaurant's welcoming confines at some point in the future."
This was a great venue for my first concert at the Joint. We saw Prince on Friday night and would see him from the floor and from the suite. What a show!

We usually stay at the LaQuinta in Scottsdale when we're in town. Since we had to be at the courthouse early in the morn I booked a room for mom and I at the LaQuinta on Thomas. Bad Idea. When I pulled up, felt like I was bringing my mom along with me on an early evening drug score at the local dingey motel. But it was LaQuinta! We were outta there with the quickness!

Drove up the 17 a couple exits and saw the Residence Inn and my mom practically turned the steering wheel herself and yelled, "GET OFF HERE!!" Just kidding. We were anxious for a comfortable room, safe place.. and we were starving!

Our AAA rate dropped us down 40 bucks. LaQuinta only knocked off 10.. which still would've costed about $99. For that dive?!?!

There were white picket fences around the AC boxed outside the room which added a comfy-cozy touch to the place. The room was a cute studio with a kitchen. They even go grocery shopping for you! Breakfast was the works. Sausage, waffles, scrambles, fruit... none of that continental carbo breakfast crap. 

Comfortable atmosphere, cozy rooms, great night sleep before a stressful day. Thank you, Residence Inn! To top it all off, our court-case concluded victorious! Yippeeee!

This caf\u00e9, conveniently situated opposite McGill, is a very good addition to the downtown scene. The coffee is excellent, and the owner Jason and his colleagues provide friendly service. The pastries, which come from a small bakery in the east end, are delicious (think muffins like mother used to make). I drop in as often as I can.

"I am an immense devotee of Re Salon & Med Spa, and my ardent admiration for their exceptional services has only augmented over time. The entire team at the salon is remarkably talented, and the personalized attention they lavish upon each client creates an unparalleled experience. Having visited the salon on numerous occasions over the past six months, I have had the pleasure of indulging in a variety of treatments, ranging from intricate cuts and colors to meticulous manicures and pedicures. Furthermore, if you seek the expertise of a master colorist and stylist, I highly recommend scheduling an appointment with Bethany, whose proficiency in her craft is truly remarkable and unmatched."

The experience was great, smooth ride, great views and info, and tasty sandwich plus champagne - just as promised in the tour brochure. However there were 6 passengers in our helicopter, and  I felt crushed with hardly an inch to move.  I must add that we were all of average size. Otherwise I would have given this  5 stars.

"A culinary excursion to the Bellagio buffet, characterized by a diverse array of delectable offerings, including succulent snow and king crabs, savory prime rib, and an assortment of other gastronomic delights, all presented in an elegant yet unpretentious atmosphere, with prices set at a reasonable $29.95 per person on Thursday evenings, and service that is both attentive and accommodating, ensuring a seamless dining experience for patrons, makes for a veritable gustatory indulgence that is not to be missed."

I would have probably given this 3 stars if not for the awesome green chili stew and the variety of dessert frybreads that rock my world.
