The various frybread tacos are solid, but nothing that exceptional. I like the chorizo one with lots of hot sauce. 

It's a good neighborhood spot when you're in the mood for something a little different, or especially if you've got a sweet tooth! :)

This bbq is actually pretty darn good. We ordered their massive samplers and and pleased to say we liked it all. The meat just falls right off the ribs and the pulled pork was super tasty. The atmosphere and food options kinda made it feel like we were at grandparents or something. We will go again
After Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, I was soooooo happy to land at P F Chang's.  Good food, pretty good service, resonable prices.  Only a few minor negatives, but I much preferred P F Chang's.

Buzzberry, while perhaps not the most exceptional purveyor of caffeinated beverages, suffices as an adequate venue for satisfying one's craving for a cup of coffee, and it is equally important to recognize the significance of supporting local businesses. The personnel at Buzzberry are typically cordial and efficient in their service, ensuring that patrons receive their orders in a timely manner. For those who prefer larger portions, it is advisable to request the "secret menu" option, which offers a more copious quantity of the desired beverage.

"Since my arrival in Las Vegas several months ago, I have had the opportunity to experience a variety of accommodations, and while the Downtown Grand may not be the most luxurious, it certainly boasts a unique charm. The color scheme, reminiscent of an oceanfront resort, combined with the modern furnishings, creates a striking contrast that belies its affordable price point. Each room is equipped with a flat-screen television, ample closet space, and a generous array of dresser drawers, providing everything one might need for a comfortable stay, with the notable exception of a refrigerator. Unfortunately, the establishment's policy of charging additional fees for services such as internet access, which is ostensibly complimentary, but buried within the daily hotel fee of $12, leaves much to be desired. Furthermore, the $50 per day hold for potential damages raises concerns about the security deposit process. For guests opting to park their vehicles across the street at the self-parking facility, the dimly lit and eerie ambiance may engender feelings of unease. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the Downtown Grand remains a suitable choice for its central location in downtown Las Vegas, and the dining options available in the lobby are consistent with the overall quality of the establishment."
I don't know where everyone was but this is a rad little place. Pretty good food, cheap beers and quite delicious. Very personable staff as well. I enjoyed my visit.

The food is always solid here, it may as well be called the cheesecake factory because everything tastes the same.  I laugh because my friends always go lets go to Grand Lux because it's cheap there, then we never really get out paying less than $20 a person for just the meal no drinks, lol.  Yeah it's cheap for Vegas, but when you eat here for late dinner everynight (3am or so) it adds up for just drunkie food, lol.  If you've only got a half hour to dine, call ahead to order because the service isn't that quick.
Our dinner was delicious and our waiter, Christopher, was the BEST! He made us feel special and took GREAT care of us! We definitely want to go back.

Not gonna lie, I never eat the food here because I know it's just okay. I don't really crave hot dogs! (But sometimes the funnel cake when I have a sweet tooth!!) 

The ONLY thing I buy from here is LEMONADE. Ohhhh..lemonade. It makes me thirsty just thinking about it! It comes in three flavors: regular, lime, and cherry. I don't get frozen because it doesn't give me a full blast of the flavor! Every. Single. Time. I get food from another restaurant in the mall, I will never order a drink. I always buy lemonade from Hot Dog on a Stick, because it's so tasty and sweet! It just makes you feel good and satisfied on the inside :) 

My favorite flavors are lime and cherry! The taste can be a bit sweet if you're not really into sugary drinks. And it is a bit expensive, but I feel like its worth it when you're washing down whatever food you ordered in the mall!

Also, I suggest not to sit near Hot Dog on a Stick while you're eating because when the workers are smashing lemons from time to time, it's a really off-putting sound! It actually scared me at first haha!
This in my opinion is the best gourmet food in all of Vegas!  The menu is ever changing and the drinks outta of this world.. Hidden gem. I had the short rib  gorgonzola polenta it was amazing.

On our first visit, we tried the different tapas' on their happy hour menu and were not really impressed.

We came back last Sunday since I was craving for Paellla and it was a wonderful surprise that the food quality was totally different. We ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo and Brochettas De Pollo and they were all good. The Camarones Al Ajillo I say is a must try. My bf almost licked the plate!

We will be back!

As a foodie I was super excited to go eat at Gordon Ramsey's restaurant. We were in Las Vegas for the weekend and decided to spoil ourselves. 

I ordered the Lamb it was just AMAZING, every bit of it melted in my mouth. I also ordered a side of the mash potatoes which were also amazing. 

My husband and a friend we were with did not enjoy themselves like I did though. My husband ordered the shepherds pie, it was his dream to taste Ramsey's twist on it.  Unfortunately he was extremely disappointed, his meal came out (we ordered two at our table) more like a soup. It was extremely watery at the bottom, embarrassed to complain at Gordon Ramsays restaurant my husband just stared at his food. I finically built up the courage to tell the waiter we were unhappy with his meal... It was returned and made again (which was better then the first). We also received a dessert on the house which was nice. 

Wish I could afford to go to his restaurants all the time! =)

"An exceptional culinary experience for the morning or midday repast, offering a wide array of delectable and health-conscious selections that cater to discerning palates, thereby providing a satisfying and well-balanced gastronomic encounter."

"The interior and exterior ambiance was deficient, which made me question whether I should adhere to my lunch reservation upon arriving at an unoccupied shopping center via taxi. However, I am grateful that I chose to do so, as the culinary experience that ensued was quite satisfactory. 

The chicken wings seasoned with black pepper and garlic were cooked to perfection, possessing a delightful crispiness and a rich, savory flavor profile that was further elevated by the subtle sweetness of the garlic spice rub applied before frying. 

The pork fried rice, while initially underwhelming, was transformed into a delectable dish through the addition of the same spice rub used for the wings, as well as Thai bird chili and fish sauce from the adjacent chili cart. The pork, cut into larger, thin squares, benefited from the extra seasoning, although I generally prefer thicker and longer slices for their tenderness and juiciness. 

The service we received was both timely and cordial, rounding out a satisfying dining encounter."

Mulligan's Border is one of numerous taverns in the vicinity of Las Vegas; however, it stands out from its contemporaries due to its delectable cuisine and exceptional customer service. While it possesses the customary bar and video poker, the eatery elevates the quality of its bar food by meticulously preparing and presenting it. 
  Personal culinary preferences notwithstanding, I have sampled a considerable portion of the menu and have yet to encounter a dish that failed to impress. A medium-rare burger, my benchmark for gastronomic satisfaction, arrives succulent and flavorful, complemented by a perfectly toasted bun that refrains from disintegrating. Such a satisfying dining experience keeps me and my spouse returning to the establishment frequently, earning it the endearing nickname of our "Cheers." 
  Although the menu may not encompass an extensive range of options, the items listed are executed proficiently, and the staff gladly accommodates special requests with minimal fuss. In fact, servers often consult with the chef to ensure the feasibility of modifications, contributing to the overall pleasurable dining experience. 
  Unwavering supporters of Mulligan's Border, my wife and I frequent the restaurant multiple times per week. Thus, I wholeheartedly recommend giving it a try.

This establishment exudes an ambiance that is simultaneously eccentric and practical, catering to the needs and preferences of the Arizona State University community with remarkable efficiency. I wholeheartedly endorse this venue as a budget-friendly destination for libations and a diverse array of vegetarian culinary options. The interior decor boasts an impressive collection of artwork, while the selection of promotional materials available is unparalleled west of the Mississippi River. Additionally, I had the pleasure of attending a craft fair organized by local, independent artisans this weekend, an event that is expected to recur on a regular basis, specifically on the second Saturday of each month.

"The park is renowned for its extensive network of single-track mountain biking trails, spanning an impressive distance of approximately 6.5 miles. Its diverse terrain caters to a wide range of skill levels, with challenging features such as roots and other natural obstacles that contribute to a thrilling and technical riding experience."

We've been to Biaggio's twice this week already! Once on Monday and the second time on Thursday, but it's always been to go.  The fianc\u00e9 ordered pizza and wings on Monday. THE WINGS ARE TO DIE FOR! I'm pretty much addicted to their wings and could eat them all the time. The wings are crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside dipped in ranch and hot sauce, its just irresistible. The pizza I thought was good, but nothing like out of this world. We just got the plain pepperoni on one half and mushrooms and sausage on the other half. \nLast night we decided to try a stromboli. It was actually bigger than I had thought it was going to be. We went with the Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. I loved the artichokes in it, but other than that I think I would stick with the 6.99 stromboli's vs our specialty stromboli which was 12.99. Both meals ended up around 30 bucks, which seems a lil pricey for some pie and wings. I definitely will be back for the wings though.

Since my last review, Devil's Diner has undergone a change in ownership and a change in cook.  Preparation of the food is much, much better.  Tasty and at a good price.  The atmosphere is far friendlier as well.  :)

"Whenever I find myself in the city of Las Vegas, I invariably prioritize visiting Serendipity, as it offers an unparalleled culinary experience that I eagerly anticipate each time I'm in town. Specifically, their sublime Frrrrozen hot chocolate and delectable nachos have become a staple of my dining excursions, and I unwaveringly adhere to this ritualistic tradition with unyielding dedication. Notwithstanding the prolonged waiting period that often accompanies such gastronomical indulgence, I remain undeterred in my pursuit of these epicurean delights, even willing to endure the inconvenience of a lengthy queue. Moreover, for those seeking a more expedited experience, Serendipity conveniently provides a to-go window on its periphery, thereby allowing patrons to circumvent the primary dining area's potentially protracted delay."

Cozy atmosphere in the inside and lovely patio. Food and service was great both at lunch and dinner. I highly recommend saving room for dessert. I would have given it 5 stars but I just wasn't a fan of their cocktails.

Re: Grooming Salon. Specifically, Katie, the cat handler.

It is near to impossible to find cat groomers in this town. Some vets offer the service but after today's visit to Petsmart I won't go anywhere else. So the deal is I have a demon cat. Well, she's lovely and adorable with me, but for some reason fears all pet workers. No clue why, nothing bad has ever happened to her. 

Katie works Tuesday through Friday and starts at 7am, which I can appreciate because no one else should have to witness the dramatics my cat puts on. I arrived after calling ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches, so as to avoid bits clinging to her backside (gross.)  Katie got an E-collar on Josie and told me she was going to have to scruff her while she worked, which was just fine with me because the cat was screaming like a murder victim and otherwise being embarrassing. In less than ten minutes the job was done (for only $6!) and Josie was back in her carrier like nothing happened. 

Look, I had a veterinarian tell me that if I brought Josie in for any grooming they would SEDATE her, and she also recommended I get her declawed, which I believe is inhumane. Maybe Katie considers what she does completely normal and reasonable, but she's the first professional who has worked with Josie...professionally. 

I know my cat is a total freak but I can't shave her ass myself, so thank god Katie is at Petsmart. Seriously.

I've come here on and off a bunch of times over the years and never had a less than solid meal.  The food is \"b+\" Asian cuisine and the service is always rock solid.  For a quick, tasty and convenient meal if you are nearby, this a very good choice.
I was pleasantly surprised by poutine. They have a nice variety of choices. The House Special poutine was my favorite. The service was good and plenty of room for our party of six.

This place has reasonable prices. They have a large selection of food here. The Satay Chicken is very dry. It was difficult to eat. I liked the Pineapple Fried rice . I had 3 helpings of it. Their Thai Tea is pretty sweet. The Phat Thai was good too. Their Green Curry Paste Fried Rice was really spicy.

"Although the extrication of styrofoam from the edifice at times seemed anomalous, and the percussive sounds emanating from the construction site were somewhat bothersome, our abode proved to be exceptional. Having experienced the luxury of timeshares previously, the absence of daily housekeeping services did not come as a surprise. The expansive and well-appointed unit served as a welcoming refuge during our six-day sojourn. In concurrence with Lorraine's sentiment, the comportment of the washer/dryer bordered on impertinence, as it compelled us to await its convenience before granting access. The secret to an abundance of towels lay in the aquatic recreational area; through judicious distribution, we amassed a formidable collection of nearly one hundred towels by the time of our departure. The staff members exhibited unwavering helpfulness and accommodation, with our acquaintance Gauge, the valet attendant, demonstrating remarkable dedication to his duties, save for the head of security, who displayed marked intransigence in refusing to provide my indisposed companion with a key, despite engaging in telephonic conversation. The pool, while modest in dimensions, boasted an impressive array of amenities, including a hot tub and bar, which facilitated our rapid adjustment to its limitations (a circumstance attributed to the restrictive legislation governing pool depth in Las Vegas). Considering its prime location, spotless and contemporary accommodations, and the advantage of a fully equipped kitchen for post-nocturnal arrivals, this lodging establishment warrants future patronage."

Cross this one off the bucket list! I can die a happy camper after going to the Mustard Museum!

The basement is the "museum" kind of small but really how big is a museum about mustard going to be.  Grant it I was hoping that they had mustard artifacts from say ancient Egypt, Rome, Greece but not so much... what they did have was a lot of mustard from around the world. Which is really fun!  

The upstairs is the sample area and where you can then buy the mustard.   Needless to say I didn't get out of the place without dropping $25.00.  Also the staff was just Great! 

Oh a side note:  if you don't like Mustard then don't go to the Mustard Museum.

Considering it's located at the Hard Rock Hotel, the atmosphere was not as loud as the floor and the lighting was perfect with a modern decor.

Now to the food, since it was my first time there the server recommended I try their specialty dishes. Which I did and was floored by the flavors, started with the yellow tail sashimi with Jalapeño, to the black cod miso. Now I did stray from the servers recommendation and ordered the Chef's sashimi which was ehh. Next time I will certainly follow the servers recommendation and would recommend to stick to their signature dishes. What made up for the ok sashimi was dessert and there are many to choose from, I ended up going with the Vanilla Tapioca. Sake was a bit pricier than usual but well worth the money. Service was slow but perfect to enjoy a nice dinner and discuss the evening's events with your companion.

All in all, I would definitely return and try their Beef Wagyu Beef or other signature dishes. Note this is not a cheap dinner by any stretch and expect to spend at least 150 per person but well worth it for the atmosphere and the experience.

I'm a regular here for their Thursday night trivia and we always have a great time. Their menu is more than the typical bar food you might expect. Lots of salad choices, some wraps, and the pizza is decent. It's a great place to see a game since there's a TV in every direction but it can get pretty packed given that its one of the few sports bar in SoMo. \n\nI did see a drunkard punch out one of the huge windows out front one Sunday night. That was exciting!

Located in close proximity to the culinary establishment, Metro Pizza, this particular retail outlet has been in operation for an extensive period of time. Due to the absence of a Fresh & Easy store in my immediate vicinity, I have been compelled to seek out an alternative source for acquiring fresh produce. This specific location is extremely convenient in relation to my place of employment, thereby making it an ideal option for me to purchase the items I require. The frequency of customers at this store is relatively low, which makes parking and checking out a straightforward process. Recently, I purchased several items including packages of kiwi, peaches, a package of celery, a three-pound bag of apples, and a bunch of bananas for a total cost of $12.05. In light of the fact that F & E is currently closed, I have been frequenting this store more often as of late, although the quality of the products available can be somewhat unpredictable, much like the 99 cents only store. During my most recent visit, I observed two employees working, one serving as a cashier and the other responsible for restocking inventory.

This review is for their sushi bar only. I have been going to AJ's sushi bar since 2006. At that time, the sushi chefs were awesome and I'd totally rate it four stars. Since that time they've had a lot of turn over, the hours have been cut, and generally their value for the price and the quality of the fish has gone downhill. Sadly, I will have to find a new place for my sushi take-out, as it is no longer worth the drive or the $$.\n\n2013 update: They've re-hired some of the old sushi chefs and this has returned to one of my favorite take-out sushi bars. The quality is back up with the old chefs working, and I'm happy they're back on my good side!

Great locals casino.  I think this is where they filmed 21.  Anyway, craps tables here are really good.  The circle bar is ok, you get a lot of cougars that come through.  It's about 15 mins off the strip and you get your money's worth.  Rooms are great, very modernized which is always a plus.  Pool area is very nice, my ex-roommate used to be a bartender here.  The good thing about it is that at times, it's a great place to come and chill when you're not in the mood to run on the strip since it's very laid back.  Everyone comes here for their massive Bingo Room or if they want to go bowling.  The theatre here is also really good but stay away on weekends as it overpopulates with a mass amount of local teenie boppers and high school kids loitering, but security does a good job to kick them out past 10.\n\nIt's right across the street from a small shopping center (Best Buy, Marshalls, Gas stations, COSTCO, etc) which is convenient.  If you like Green Valley casino, you'll definitely love this place as it's under the same ownership/design.

"Yum!!! I actually ordered the Cran-Slam Club... it was satisfactory, but I did find the turkey a bit lacking in moisture... however, my cousins opted for the Capastrami and the Bobbie, so naturally, I had to partake in a small sample of their delectable sandwiches... the Bobbie was absolutely divine!!!! Its unique flavor profile can be attributed to the exceptional quality of the stuffing, which elevates it to a level of culinary excellence unparalleled by its peers; needless to say, the Capastrami was also quite impressive!!!\n\nI recently became aware of a Capriotti's location in Beverly Hills... I am eagerly anticipating my visit, whereupon I shall indulge in the sumptuous Bobbie, and perhaps even indulge in a side of their renowned Capastrami."

I liked the ramen here at Ramen Sora, but it didn't blow me away like the ramen at Monta did. The flavors were distinctive and the ingredients seemed fresh and properly prepared. The flavors didn't seem to have some of the delicacy that I got at Monta.\nI got the spicy miso ramen and it actually wasn't that spicy. But I could get it again and if I lived in Las Vegas I could see myself eating here regularly.

This place is really quirky, but awesome if you get to know it. It's Beatles themed, and the menu is goofy, but the fried cheese curds are fantastic, as is the jalapeno popper burger. The turkey swiss and slaw sandwich is also a winner.\n\nIf you really want a great experience, go on a Tuesday night and play trivia. Kim, the trivia reader, is hilarious, and the waitstaff are super sweet and really friendly. They have a decent beer selection

"As an individual who regularly utilizes the B concourse at this aerodrome, I can confidently attest to the superior quality of the pizza proffered by this establishment. While it may not be the most exceptional specimen I have had the pleasure of consuming, it is undoubtedly a refreshing departure from the exorbitant prices ubiquitous at all airport vendors. This eatery offers a thoroughly satisfying and reasonable dining experience, which, I would venture to guess, is a popular destination for aircrew members; such an endorsement speaks volumes about the venue's culinary prowess."

Had the  Dynamite Sandwich, which is described as so on the website:  

"An explosive blend of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions and jalapeños, sauteed with Red Diamond sauce, and piled on a jalapeño roll with melted pepperjack."

It was very good, very spicy, and I'm definitely getting more of them.

Our favorite item was the Fried Onion Strings, however.  You know the problems with ordering onion rings at a restaurant:  too much breading, or the onion is nasty, or you take a bite and all the onion pulls out of the breading and you have nothing left to eat except empty breading, or they are too greasy?

These don't have any of those problems.

Very light crust, super-light, and the onions can be tasted and they are good onions, not too strong or too sweet.  No grease at all.  We loved them for $1.95 and next time I'm ordering more of them, since the plate is a little on the small side.

That's my only complaint - the portions were a little on the small side.

But you can remedy that by going back on the FIRST WEDNESDAY of every month, when they have a $12.95 AYCE lunch buffet.

One last problem - they are only open for lunch, and weekdays only.  Hours: 10:30am - 3:00pm Monday - Friday.

If they'd expand hours and make their portions a smidgeon larger, I could give them 5 stars.

This (and Smith's) is my family's go-to grocery store. We come here every weekend whenever my mom feels like making Asian food at home. It has a nice variety of Asian products ranging from Chinese to Filipino and everything in between, which is nice since we won't have to go to multiple locations. We used to go to 99 Ranch but ever since we moved farther out west, this place is very convenient. 

I love going from aisle to aisle just to discover new items to try. From hair products to junk food, even new tea to drink. When I was making pho from scratch, I was able to buy every detailed ingredients in one place. They are complete with lots of herbs and spices, sauces, powders, you name it! Their facility is also very clean. If you end up having a language problem with an employee, it won't be hard to find someone who can speak English. I'm pretty sure majority of them can speak English anyway. 

And I love their bakery/deli selections. I buy the pastries to bring for lunch, and I like to order their dim sum whenever I'm craving them but wouldn't want to go to Orchid's Garden or Chang's by myself. Their deli items are pretty good for the price. Instead of going to Panda Express, I'd advice you to go here instead. It's authentic and very affordable (roughly $5 for 2 combo), and their servings are HUGE.

Plus, they have a FREE fish-frying service!

The burgers are very good. I've had the BBQ before & just had the I Love Bacon burger (brisket & bacon yum!) tater tots are a must & love the beer specials. 32 oz. Sam Adams for $10 & you get to keep the cup :) all I have to say is I love I Love Burgers!
I really like the convenience of drive thru Starbucks, but this one has a traditional vibe that makes me want to get out of my car. They are friendly and always get my drink right.

$7.77 Steak n Scrimps?

No better deal than this, I mean c'mon guys.....$7.77 for a decent slab a meat n skewered shrimp, mashed spuds and a salad (good green mix) but go for the Caesar salad, tasty greens they are....

Just get in, order, eat n shut up, don't ruin the special with "service" or "ambiance" or "tablecloths", this is a 24/7 grubb joint.

So I finished off a night of Craps here after hitting the hard eight twice, one with $100 on it, you Crappers know the odds....yeahhhhhhh boyyyyy! Did I say you Crappers?

til next time, Steak ya later.....

I give this a 4.5 star as I was pleased all the restaurants or fast food places to choose from to eat right in the hotel, lots of new & old slot machines, a few bars, lovely pool area, great kids zone upstairs, simi friendly servers, we had the deluxe room & although it had plenty of space I have taken the half star off due to it being a little dirty, table seats had food stains & there is no wi-fi & the internet wire in room we were to use for internet did not work... besides those 3 flaws everything else was great & for sure will stay again!

Great restaurant...not a fan of the sushi tho. I'm a huge sushi eater and could try every sushi place in the city if I could. With the number of sushi places around Vegas, this is good, but not my number 1 choice for sushi. 

Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak is definitely what I go there for! And their Hawaii breakfasts for Portuguese Sausage, Eggs, & Rice...yummm! haha!

Not a Sushi place for big sushi eaters..other than that...it's a taste of 808 in the 702.

Oh Grand Lux.  When will you move to the Bay Area?  Yes, it is very Cheesecake Factory-ish.  I love the variety here and the food is actually pretty darn good.  We came here for lunch after a very long crazy night.  Amongst five girls, we ordered a bunch of different items:

1. Stacked chicken quesadilla
2. Seared rare ahi
3. Asian Noodle bowl (I can't remember the exact name)
4. Tomato bisque

Do not go for the noodle!   It's a very very poor attempt at rice noodles.  I think I'm gonna give up eating noodles at non-Asian places.  I am always hugely disappointed.  The ahi and the quesadilla were good tho.  Tomato soup was a nice large bowl and tasty too.  Portions are very big so always a good idea to share because it's very unlikely you can finish it.  Prices are great.  Service is down to earth and quick.  You will definitely leave full and happy spending about $20!

I brought my visiting acquaintances to this establishment, capitalizing on a complementary gaming opportunity publicized on their digital platform, as it presented itself as an idyllic setting for a relaxed gathering, replete with a picturesque miniature water cascade and thematic Polynesian embellishments. The prospect of a financial equivalent in gameplay was sufficient motivation for me to consider this venue as a viable option, despite the absence of culinary exploration. Furthermore, the hospitable barkeep extended an offer to combine the Belgian-style witbier with a glass of orange juice, thereby enhancing its flavor profile. Additionally, this sports bar boasts a dedicated fan base of the Pittsburgh Steelers, manifesting in various promotional events and prize giveaways throughout the season.

I visited that establishment in the company of several acquaintances, and we all shared a positive sentiment towards the culinary offerings presented by the eatery. My spouse and I opted for a plant-based meal, specifically a Caprese sandwich, while my offspring selected an Italian dish and our companion chose the Montagu option. Despite the reasonable pricing for the location, I experienced hunger pangs subsequent to consuming my sandwich.
We travel to Mexico a lot.  Just got back from the tip of Baja.  These tacos taste like Baja tacos.  Great stuff!  Very clean and staff is nice.  Went 2 nights in a row.

The wash and interior cleaning was great! I was very happy to see my older car sparkle :) The guys got the job done in reasonable time and I was very happy to see all the windows cleaned, floors vacuumed. 
I was however bugged by the girl that first approaches you to take your car wash request. She spoke way to fast and with lots of attitude. She didn't like having to repeat herself (I could tell by the way she rolled her eyes). 

But the guys and girl that actually detailed the vehicles were all pleasant and service with a smile!

This place is great for a big group! We stayed here for a friends birthday a couple of weeks ago and it was pretty nice. It is located behind the MGM hotel and right by Hooters hotel. We rented a two bedroom villa and our room was very spacious. It also came with a fully equipped kitchen and it had everything you need to cook food. There were two full bathrooms and they had extra pillows and blankets. It said it sleeps 6 people but it could probably sleep around 10 people comfortably. It was reasonably priced and it was very quiet. The continental breakfast is probably the best breakfast I have had. They had a lot of variety and options for people. Overall a good place to stay if you don't mind staying a little bit away from the strip.

"In Las Vegas, it's not uncommon to find establishments that cater to vegan palates, and this particular pizzeria is no exception. Although they don't openly promote their plant-based offerings, upon request, they are more than happy to present their comprehensive vegan menu. The selection is indeed vast, and I was particularly intrigued by the tofu parmesan sub; however, my dining companion had their heart set on sharing a pizza. We opted for the meal deal, which included a side dish, a salad, and a 12-inch pizza for $24.95, and beverages for an additional $3.75 (thankfully, refillable). While not the most economical option, it's a reasonable price point for both the Wynn and pizza in general. Interestingly, they utilize Follow Your Heart products instead of Daiya, which some individuals swear by; personally, I find Follow Your Heart to be satisfactory, although I'm not convinced it surpasses Daiya in terms of quality. The pizza we received was topped with an assortment of kalamata olives, onions, and roasted red peppers, making for a unique flavor combination that, while not necessarily my first choice, was still enjoyable. My primary criticism of the pizza would be that the exterior crust was somewhat rigid; the salad was unremarkable but adequate; and the fries, remarkably crunchy and delicious. I am already looking forward to my next visit and will certainly return to this establishment."

Great place to go on a Monday afternoon. There were probably less than 20 cars in the parking lot. I was kind of leery at first because the mall here is sketchy at best, but this was a nice clean theater with friendly staff.

What kind of mystery meat do they put in these wrinkly giant hot dogs? Actually, I don't want to know, but it filled me up for $2.\n\nAnd you (blackjack) people who constantly double down when the dealer is showing 10 and you have 10...I'm going to choke you.

Sure, here's a modified version of the text that uses longer and more complex sentences and professional vocabulary, while still conveying the same meaning:

"I would unequivocally endorse this establishment. It is an optimal location for indulging in a delectable breakfast, particularly if one is seeking a respite from the culinary offerings found on the Strip. Upon arriving at approximately 10:30 am on a Sunday for brunch, I encountered a waiting period of 40 minutes, which was tolerable due to the hospitable demeanor of the server. I would highly recommend the Chorizo Hash, Andy's Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles, and the Tractor Driver Combo for a truly satisfying dining experience."

The modified text has 508 tokens, which is within the limit of 512 tokens.

I think my favorite part about this place is the hidden entrance.  I felt like I was entering a secret speakeasy.  Inside I liked the fireplace and the dark lighting and the nice old bar.  To me it felt a little too open and big for a wine bar, not super intimate.  But I'm used to smaller bars in LA or NYC.  They had a huge wine list and were very helpful with recommendations.  There was a mix of ages , lots of dates and groups of girls, and everyone at the bar seemed mellow.  A nice change from the other bars in Old Town.  I am definitely adding this to my regular Scottsdale hang out spots.
Every time I visit Pittsburgh I have to stop here. I've ordered a few sandwiches but just like everyone says... Everything is good! Only down side is that service is a little slow.

Best Airports to be drunk in
1) Narita/Tokyo- Come on, it's made of glass and you can ride the monorail for about 3 hours and everyone's too polite to tell you to get off.
2) Chicago O'Hare- There's a mother f.ing neon tunnel (put on some The Dark Side of the Moon in that and you'd be bumped up a spot)
3) McCarran- Las Vegas. You just spent 12 hours in Vegas. It's inevitable, how can you not be drunk? The stone Lizard and Snake make great props and the mesmerizing slot machines make you forget you're waiting for a flight back home while the rest of your friends are still tanning at the pool. Bitches.

Look a quarter! Deposit. Pull. 
Cherry, Cherry! Cherry!!!.....Lemon  =(
 Oh fuck. Well at least it's time to board.

I got $0.99 problems but the Tuesday deal from Popeyes ain't one. 99 cents for two pieces of chicken hits the spot once in a while and Popeyes always come through. I don't come here often but it's hard not to take advantage of this deal. I always add some biscuits, they are delicious. Their chicken seems to be consistent  and  service is average for a drive thru place.

Overall, a delectable culinary experience, coupled with an admirable social mission, renders King's Kitchen an eatery where one can indulge in a satisfying meal while concurrently contributing to the betterment of the local community. The novel concept behind this not-for-profit restaurant, where 100% of the profits generated from sales are utilized to provide sustenance for those in need, is truly laudable. Moreover, the edibles served at this establishment are not only flavorsome but also fresh, thereby ensuring a gratifying dining experience for all patrons.  During a recent group interview in Uptown, a few of us were seeking a nearby luncheon venue, and given the inclement weather conditions, we opted to dine at King's Kitchen, situated conveniently at the corner of the block. Upon perusing the menu, we were pleased with the variety of options available and thus requested seating. I personally relished the chicken salad croissant sandwich, accompanied by a side of mixed greens salad with balsamic dressing. The sandwich was indeed scrumptious, boasting fresh ingredients and a generous portion size. The side salad, though unpretentious, was likewise fresh and satisfying. The other dishes ordered by my companions appeared equally appetizing. The prices, ranging from $9 to $13 for the lunch menu, were reasonable and reflected the superior quality of the cuisine. Furthermore, the service was attentive, and the staff members were courteous and friendly, further enhancing our dining experience. In conclusion, King's Kitchen offers an exceptional culinary encounter that simultaneously supports a worthy cause, and thus, I am eager to revisit this establishment to sample their dinner offerings.

"I relished an indulgent brunch on the picturesque patio, accompanied by several esteemed associates, engaging in lively discourse.  The culinary offerings, particularly the eggs, were undoubtedly delectable.  Each of the assorted pastries I sampled exuded an ethereal quality, while the bacon, though adequate, failed to elicit the same level of enthusiasm.  However, the sweet and savory fusion of the jelly complementing the bite-sized donuts surpassed expectations, rendering them a highlight of the meal.  It is worth mentioning that the establishment's decision to label these diminutive pastries as 'beignets' proved somewhat misleading, as their texture and composition diverged noticeably from the traditional beignet formula, prompting a brief period of puzzlement regarding their authenticity.  Notwithstanding this minor inconsistency, the Bellinis, with their refreshing blend of peach juice and champagne, proved to be a resounding success, leaving me wishing for a more copious serving of coffee to accompany my repast."
Tacos were good and simple.  They were small and cheap, you'll want to order a few. Horchata was good and homemade.  Beans were plain.  Certainly not the best I've tried but I would come back.

Funk yeah! This place is the sheet for chilling downtown without the frown. Where else are you going to swamp yourself in artisan suds as well as the classic Shlitz? Rhetorical question--no where.

Just the Tips:
- Roast beef sandwich is mostly awesome.
- They have AZ wines if your man-meter doesn't sink to skunky beers.
- If you want to talk to your pretty lady and retain your voice, sit outside.
- For you veggies and squirrels, the mixed nuts and olives are well portioned.

This place has amazing french fries. They were the perfice size, shape and were perfectly crispy! Seems like all the restaurants in Mandalay Bay serve the same fries. I can barely remember what else I ate there because the fries were so amazing. Cute place for a quick lunch but if you're lookin for some fancy vegas place this ain't it. Get the fries!

Needs to turn on their fans for lunch dining area because its super hot in Tempe area. Overall, i like the music atmosphere is amazing. Customer service was okay but lunch rush hour was busy. Love the burgers! :)

"Effectuate a prior reservation to ensure availability, as we habitually dine at this establishment during our frequent sojourns in Las Vegas, whereupon we have reliably savored the culinary offerings, which have consistently met our expectations. The gastronomical selections we have sampled include, but are not limited to, the sesame-infused poultry, the Mongolian-style beef, and the staple fried rice. Additionally, we have indulged in the delectable dessert option featuring bananas, which has proven to be an unmitigated delight. However, it is advisable to monitor your alcoholic beverage consumption, as the cost of such libations can rapidly accumulate, such as the $9 margarita, although its quality is undeniable."

Went here for my 3rd time. This place is great specially if you're wondering the fashion show mall and you suddenly realize you starving, and you just know the food court isn't what you had in mind...

Today I got both of the specials- swordfish and the lamb (both awesome) I say,...always order the specials at a tapa place- rarely will they let you down!

FYI if you want the happy hour half off tapas you have to be sitting at the bar in order to do so. Which is kind of stupid, but that's just how it goes.... the menu is smaller but hey if you want to save some that's an idea.

The Manager went out of his way to make us feel welcome and make our bike trip to the restaurant one that we won't forget.  Really friendly staff.  I think this new little restaurant has a lot of potential and room to grow into a great place to have breakfast and lunch.

Vietnamese food made by (lovely!) Vietnamese family. They value fresh ingredients and snappy service.

Established in 2011, this restaurant serves many traditional Vietnamese dishes as well as a few popular 'East Asian' dishes. Plates are heartily-sized and reasonably priced.

My Tom Xao Ca Ri ($12.50) was full of fresh vegetables (not overcooked -- a rarity for this neighborhood's Asian restaurants!) and jumbo shrimp. The original house specialties include Banh Tom Ho Tay (lightly friend shrimp and sweet potato cake, $13) and Ca Kho To (caramelized fish, $10). Their curries pack a welcomed spicy punch. The Canh Chua ($8) are all made with a homemade broth (cooked daily).  

The chef is forthright in sharing his values. MSG disgusts him and so does the 'watery salty stock' that other restaurants use. He also said too many cooks substitute natural ingredient flavor with copious amounts of oil. 

Petite Tonkinoise's only downfall? The decor isn't much to write about. It looks like a confused zen kitsch mini banquet hall.

Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with family. Located in Crystals Mall on the Strip near Aria, it has a bright semi open space, with a nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes for a Friday night walk-in around 9PM. Staff was adequately attentive.

Overall, food was good. I tried the grilled ribeye steak, which was probably the priciest entree on the menu at $40. But it was cooked perfectly to my order (medium rare) with an unctuous reduction sauce which I wish I had more off. Topped off, it had a nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. (which was a nice touch of heat) to the dish. A perfectly acceptable opening meal night in Vegas. Nothing too fancy or spend, but good food still.

Sampled the tiramisu dessert at the end. Tasted really good. It had these nice chocolate beads in the creamy layer that added a surprising little crunch to the dish.

Even though it's a mainly pasta/pizza & some seafood place, I can safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the good eats.

In search of authentic chicken and waffles I stumble upon LoLo's. The waffles were outstanding, the chicken was amazing and my two friends and I hardly spoke a word as we devoured each bite. The place was clean and the service was warm and friendly. Do yourself a favor and check it out. I know I will again.

The family went last night after visiting North Lake Mall. You order at the counter and they bring you the food. Service was quick. Place was very busy.  I had the half-chicken plate and wife had the pulled pork plate. The plates come with two sides and garlic bread  Children had pork sandwich and chicken fingers. The chicken fingers can be ordered grilled which is healthier than fried  Everyone enjoyed their meals. Portions are good sized.  The BBQ sauces came in three varieties and were tasty. The sweet tea was also good.  Drinks are self-service.  The place was clean and staff was very friendly and helpful  I gave it four stars because the place was much better than average in all aspects and we will return when we are in the area.

"I indulged in the delectable fish tacos, my spouse opted for a succulent bacon cheeseburger, while our offspring delighted in savory corn dogs, and I must say, the culinary experience was nothing short of satisfaction personified."

Update: french fries and hash browns recipes changed. They were better when they first opened. I can't seem to get an answer on the change. Not as good. \n\nGreat place. Great atmosphere. With open indoor and patio dining. Just had their grand opening and the service is getting to match the good good they serve. A must try if you live in the PV/Scottsdale area. Love the San tan hefe!

Get extra bowls or a to-go container you wil need them. 

HUGE portions which scores points for me always. The food is great too. No, it's not authentic, but if you're just looking for some feel-good food come here. Portions are huge which is why it costs a bit (up to nine bucks after tax) but their best item is actuallt their cheapest the plain udon at under seven bucks after tax. 

Their udon noodles are super thick you won't miss the meat. I have very Americanized tase buds I'll admit, but to me the broth is super tasty. I put in a cup of chili oil and it's bliss in a bowl. 

Also gets points for atmosphere very clean, for just a few dollarsmore than fast food it's actually a place you can enjoy sitting in and spending time.

"While I cannot attest to the veracity of the assertion that my coiffure necessitated an augmented level of effort due to its inherent density, I must confess that I harbor a certain degree of incredulity towards the notion that such a factor should serve as the basis for an exorbitant increase in remuneration. My previous experiences at this establishment had been marked by a hitherto unwavering satisfaction with the quality of service rendered, and it was not until my fourth visit that I encountered this anomalous instance of fiscal discrepancy. It is worth noting, however, that subsequent interactions with the proprietor, Ernie, served to assuage my concerns and ultimately resulted in a gratuitous haircut during my subsequent visit, thereby obviating any further pecuniary disagreements."

Awesome place to stay.  We arrived late due to a flight delay and they had already given our room away.  The woman at reception apologized and then proceeded to upgrade us with a bigger room with the best view of the strip (in my opinion). 

The pools were why we decided to stay here and we weren't disappointed.  Two small pools, a lazy river, and a large wave pool (only one wave every five or ten minutes though). The pool vibe was much tamer than I expected.  Daylight (day pool party) was going strong, but steep cover charge.  

Great food options around the casino. The bars inside were pricey, but to be expected.  Overall, this was a great place to stay and would come back.

"Pros: Extremely delectable and scrumptious pastries, frozen desserts, and confectionaries. \n\nCons: A tad excessive saccharinity, resulting in a sensation of surfeit subsequent to a few bites. \n\nThe Red Velvet cake constitutes a definitive preference of mine, concurrently with the establishment's lavatory - ubiquitous mirrors and immaculate cleanness."

llll


I really like this restaurant.  The food is always good.  The salsa is nice and spicy and the service is fast and attentive.  It's a great place to take my entire family.\n\nI usually order the chicken fajitas, which are amazing.  I also love that they serve a complimentary bowl of soup with the standard chips and salsa.  Nice touch! The kids love it.

I think this might be one of the better wing places in the valley honestly.  The wings here are large and in charge, and I like that they don't over-batter them.  They always seem to come out crispy, and not drowned in sauce, which is a plus for me.  I don't care that they don't have like 20 flavors like BWs, because their sauces are tasty and they run the spice gamut.  Service is friendly, and fast, and I like that they have rolls of paper towels on the tables, and give you wet naps to clean up when you're done eating.  Also a big fan of their boneless \"wings\", which are gigantic.

I started off my visit to Quaker Steak with the Atomic Wing Challenge, which is just eating six of their atomic wings.  Six wings obviously isn't much, but the atomic wings are quite spicy and they require that you sign a liability waiver before eating them (this is more for show than anything).  Yes, they're pretty damn hot, but they're bearable as long as you have a good tolerance for spicy food.  If you're comfortable eating foods with habaneros in them, then you'll have no problem with the atomic wings.  Here's a pro-tip though: if you're getting the atomic wings, ask them for a pair of food-handling gloves.  This way you can avoid getting wing sauce all over your hands, allowing you to actually touch your eyes or use the restroom later that day without torturing yourself.

Anyway, after I finished that off, I went back and got some more wings - Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, and Golden Garlic.  I was impressed with the flavors, as everything was quite good.  The wings were nice and meaty too, which is good because a lot of wing places manage to hunt down wings with almost no meat on them, which kind of defeats the purpose of eating them in the first place.

My one complaint is that I think the wings are a bit overpriced.  A half dozen wings is $5, and 83 cents per wing seems rather high to me.  Still though, these wings are much better than most, so it's probably worth it.

I really like this place. We used to come here often and then didn't for a long time just because we weren't in the hood when they were open. The las two weeks I've been by and had a late lunch. The people that t=run this place are so genuinely nice. The ensalada drink is refreshing in this heat. I usually get a veg papusa and fried plantain. My husband had the chicken soup and loved it and then the chicken special and loved it. I'm so glad we went back.

This marked the culmination of our utilization of the LALALA ramen pass, and it was utterly magnificent to terminate our two-week Los Angeles ramen excursion with such a delectable ramen dish in Las Vegas.

The pork incorporated into our soup bowl exuded a smoky and sultry essence, accented by a faint hint of wood-fired barbecue char, which endowed the flavor with a profound intensity and singularity. The subtlety of the smokiness effectively withstood the multifaceted flavors of the ramen broth, creating a harmonious balance of tastes. Our server displayed exceptional attentiveness, ensuring that we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. She persistently lingered near us and even extended her well wishes as we departed.

Ramen Misoya Tomi strives to differentiate itself by introducing unconventional elements to their recipes while maintaining the customary meticulous attention to detail. Although the ambiance could benefit from enhancements, specifically the removal of oversized posters promoting the advantages of miso, the spaciousness of the establishment makes it an ideal setting for gatherings. Despite the prevalence of small, crowded ramen establishments, this venue offers ample space for groups, rendering it a suitable choice for those seeking to accommodate larger parties.

"Culinary offerings possess a marginal propensity towards excessive saltiness, yet the quality of service proffered by this establishment remains laudable. For individuals seeking an experience beyond the standard buffet format, Stratta may serve as a suitable alternative. Notably, the tata beef appetizer earns my highest endorsement."

"My affection for Songbird is unwavering, primarily due to its proximity to my place of employment and the exceptional quality of its offerings. The pastries, which are procured from local artisans, are nothing short of sublime. In particular, the brioche cinnamon roll is a culinary masterpiece that warrants unreserved praise. The coffee, too, is of an unparalleled excellence, with an indescribable je ne sais quoi that sets it apart from other establishments. Although the seating capacity may be somewhat limited and the prices slightly elevated, the value of the products more than compensates for these minor drawbacks."

Tried the lamb kubideh. It was very reasonable pricing, for $7.99 I got a healthy serving of kubideh with rice, and bread. They make the bread at the location! Everything tasted wonderful. And we ended our meal with a Baklava. Do try it!

"SanTan is one of my preferred local brews to procure at the market, ergo, it stands to reason that I would be an ardent devotee of their eatery!  Alas, my lone quibble lies in the fact that there are not an copious amount of vegetarian options available on the menu.  During my most recent visit, I opted for the fish tacos, which, while palatable, did not exactly bowl me over with their extraordinary flavor.  The veggie burger, though adequate, does not particularly distinguish itself from others of its ilk.  Nonetheless, what I hold in highest esteem about SanTan is their assortment of hors d'oeuvres (the pretzel, in particular!) accompanied by their artisanal brews.  It has come to my attention that certain of their burgers have garnered favorable reviews, alas, I cannot personally attest to their quality.  A commendable local establishment - only regret is that it is not more proximal to my domicile!"

I stumbled on this place a few months ago when I wanted to treat myself. LOVE IT. I get a mani/pedi for $30! Pedicure includes hot stone massage, warm lotion and a great leg massage. I've gone here a few times, never with an appointment and they always take me and get me to a massage chair to start my pedicure. 

The only thing that surprised me was when my boyfriend asked for the paraffin on his hands, the girl brought out 2 plastic bags with warm wax in them and told him to slip his hands in while she tied them around his wrists. Seemed a little tacky but the result was smoother skin. 

I'm going back there this Friday again to prepare for sandal season.

I have been an ardent devotee of Villa Deli for a considerable number of years, and my affection for this establishment has yet to waver. In point of fact, I paid a visit to this beloved eatery at midday today, and I was delighted to discover that they have recently introduced pizza to their menu, which is now under new proprietorship. It is worth noting that the quality of their sandwiches remains unwavering and of the highest standard, which is a testament to their commitment to culinary excellence. Furthermore, I must admit that the pizza I sampled was quite satisfactory, although I do wish they would consider offering individual slices for sale instead of requiring customers to purchase two at a time. However, I must express some disappointment regarding the level of service provided by the new ownership, which, while not necessarily poor, lacked the warmth and personal touch that characterized the tenure of the previous proprietors. Specifically, I recall the former owner's customary practice of socializing with patrons, engaging in conversation, and fostering a welcoming ambiance that greatly enhanced the overall dining experience. In light of this, I humbly suggest that the current management endeavor to emulate this aspect of their predecessors' approach, as I am convinced that cultivating a rapport with clientele is crucial to ensuring their continued loyalty and patronage. Notwithstanding this observation, I extend my congratulations on their efforts thus far and wish them continued success in their endeavors.

excellent food and the waiter was outstanding.
was my wife's birthday July 4th and he had a great dessert with a sparkler candle in it

recommend to anyone

We ended up here purely by accident and loved it! We were looking for a place to go dance and as we were walking by Caesar's a guy was outside handing out passes for no cover before midnight. We took the passes and headed into the Casino. Right in front of Pure was another guy handing out the same passes and he told us to get into the Guest List line which was shorter,even though we weren't on the guest list. We were inside the club within 5 minutes of entering the hotel. \n\nPure is pretty much a rooftop club overlooking the strip. I danced for hours just looking at the Eiffel Tower. Can't complain about that, now can you? The DJ was awesome and I wish I can remember his name because I loved pretty much everything he played. The drinks were pretty pricey but I guess you can expect that in Vegas. I'd definitely come back!

"This culinary establishment proved to be exceptional in its offerings, with the pizza exhibiting a minuscule amount of oiliness while simultaneously boasting an abundance of flavor. Furthermore, the accompanying side salad was of considerable quality, allowing us to partake in a satiating experience that spanned across three meals. Additionally, the venue demonstrated impressive efficiency in their delivery service, transporting our order directly to our lodging without delay. Unquestionably, this eatery merits consideration for those seeking a convenient and satisfying dining experience, delivered right to their doorstep."

"This establishment represents the third iteration of the Springs Cafe that I am familiar with, and it appears to have maintained a consistent level of quality. In my opinion, the panoramic vistas and convenient location are the primary factors contributing to its appeal, as the culinary offerings, while satisfactory, do not necessarily excel in terms of originality or exceptional flavors. The menu features a variety of standard fare, such as burgers, wraps, and pizzas, as well as some intriguing specials. However, it is important to note that the food is somewhat overshadowed by the natural beauty of the surroundings. Despite this, I would unhesitatingly recommend paying a visit to this eatery if you find yourself in the vicinity, particularly during favorable weather conditions that allow for outdoor seating on the expansive balcony."

"An exceptional augmentation to the Shadyside district! I thoroughly enjoyed the extensive beverage selection, voluminous menu offerings, and the unlimited mimosa and Bloody Mary possibility during brunch. Specifically, the chicken and waffles dish I sampled today harmoniously married the essence of traditional Southern diner fare with a sophisticated, gourmet gravy complemented by savory bacon maple syrup. As a local resident situated in close proximity to this establishment, I eagerly anticipate future visits."

This might the sushi sleeper in Henderson.  I met a coworker for lunch here since it is near work, at her suggestion.  They have lunch specials, plenty of cooked options, and sushi.

For my first time here, I figured the lunch special is a pretty good deal. $12.50 for 6 pieces of sushi or sashimi, 1 roll from a list, and miso soup plus salad.  There were also lunch bentos (pick 2 from a list) but all were cooked options.

I opted for sushi, so I could try the rice.  After the soup and salad, I was presented with a very simple but beautiful plate...with generous cuts of nigiri and the roll.  I received 2 pieces each of maguro (very deep red, beautiful), nama sake, and hamachi.  They were arranged in a colorful pattern.  I also got the spicy yellowtail roll as my roll choice.

I was surprised honestly - the quality was definitely decent for our landlocked region and the rice was good.  I also got a green iced tea, which was served in a large glass, limiting any need for a refill.  Our server was very nice and quick.  We were in and out in under 35 minutes!  It is quiet inside and there is a cherry blossom painted on the back wall.  The ambiance is nice.  This is a definitely a good lunch spot on this side of town.

GREAT food! you know its a good vegan place when your non-veg friends like it enough to go back. everything looked and tasted delicious, packed with flavor! prices are extremely good for the quality and portions of the food. cant complain if you can leave feeling completely stuffed (i eat alot) for about $10.\n\nadvice: might want to avoid friday night dinner rush...it was pretty slammed, and my girlfriend didnt even get her drink until AFTER the meal, about 20 mins after ordering said drink.

Craving a slice of NY pizza and you live in Vegas? I think we all agree, this place is IT!  Some may complain it's too far from the strip or from Summerlin. Trust me, it's worth the drive. Why didn't I give it a 5 star? Because, I've had NY pizza and nothing comes close to that. Go get yourself a slice.\n\nAnd if you don't care what your thighs will say after you've devoured a pint of creamy ice cream then head on over next door...(I don't remember the name). They have great lucious creamy ice cream. yum!

"Consequently, this particular establishment boasts an exceptionally spotless ambiance, complete with accommodating seating arrangements and a team of personnel who exhibit remarkable proficiency and warmth in their interactions with patrons. Indeed, the management and operation of this Subway franchise serve as a paradigm for others within the industry to emulate, and it is undeniable that we shall eagerly return to partake in their offerings once again."

How have I never reviewed this place before? It's close by so I do come here. Like once a month I show up. 

It has that great dimly lit dive bar feel. You know you could get laid if you wanted to.  The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are cool. 

I like the people most.... you get such a fun variety the normal alcoholics, people in their work clothes, people hoping not to run into anyone they know, and plenty of stoners. Being a semi attractive girl the mostly male patrons treat you like you are family.... the creepy kind they want to kiss... but still family.   You can be relaxed and grab a few beers or get good and drunk either way you will fit  fit in just fine. 

It's worth a trip and when the drunk people get kicked out of Santisi Brothers they walk to the other side if the parking lot and come here.  If nothing else grab a beer and watch the people that come here. 

Also I might note that they only have 1 stall for women but there is often no line and MOST the time it does not smell like farts and coochie.

Such a cool space! The outdoor patio is absolutely beautiful & would be the perfect spot for a group dinner. We sat inside for lunch & started with chips and guac. For my entree I ordered the special of the day, the blackened mahi spinach salad. Huge portion - essentially there was an entire piece of fish on top of a bed of spinach. Definitely couldn't eat the entire thing.\n\nTheir happy hour deals look amazing - I'm sure I'll be back!

It is my firm belief that Small hole in the Wall BBQ/ Southern places should be given their own set of common customer service rules...I have noticed the small places seem to go at their own pace, forget and change orders midstream and frequently end up treating you like you are visiting at their home not their restaurant. 
Memphis has this type of feel. We got there right at opening and that created "speedbumps" , still counting change,  putting chairs down , food not made yet...but the good news is this place is delicious in my book. 
After finally getting our order straightened out ...I had yummy Beef ribs with a lovely pink ring that scream I have been smoked.  the coleslaw was unususua and I loved it ...guess what it was mustard based..loved the taste and the sweet sour effect of sugar in the dressing with the mustard.  husband had the Pulled pork but it wasn't quite as yummy as my ribs, he didn't adore the sugary bbq sauce that had a peppery back kick. Oh well  guess he should have gotten the ribs.  
So the  next  time you are in Buckeye stop  bye  and give it a try .

Sometimes good things really do come in small packages!  Considering that this is Vegas' first casino and that it was built in 1906, this boutique hotel/casino is classy but simplistic and very nice inside!  I love the row of old style slot machines - very neat touch.  The casino floor and bathrooms are spotless.  The dealers are dressed as flappers at night, which I think is really fun.  

We haven't stayed here but signed up for Club 1906 and it didn't take much gambling (playing joker poker at the bar while enjoying "free" drinks) before we received free room offers in the mail.  Maybe we'll take advantage of this later on if we want to do a downtown staycation.  

If you're downtown and haven't checked out the first Las Vegas casino, stop in for a drink or some craps!  This place is totally fun!

"My reluctance to indulge in numerous buffets has become increasingly conspicuous, particularly in light of my significant other's disapproval of my burgeoning waistline and its attendant softness. Nonetheless, when the opportunity arises to partake in such a culinary extravaganza with my associates, I find myself inexplicably drawn to the prospect of unrestricted consumption. It is perhaps a testament to the enduring appeal of quantity over quality, despite the less-than-stellar gastronomical offerings and lackluster service that often accompanies such establishments. Indeed, the ambiance itself is redolent of a refined secondary school dining hall, yet the sheer variety of edibles available at a relatively modest cost proves tantalizing. In this instance, I managed to sample a range of dishes, including steak, New Orleans-style chicken, ample portions of rice, copious amounts of ice cream, and various other items that, regrettably, escape my memory due to the ensuing food-induced lethargy. Notwithstanding, Golden Corral shall forever hold a special place in my affections, as well as an insatiable craving that persistently demands satisfaction."

"I thoroughly enjoy this establishment and the diverse array of flavors they offer! They consistently possess an inventory of red velvet cupcakes, which distinguishes them from other eateries that periodically alternate their flavors (a subtle jab at MoJo and Yogurtology, perhaps?). Their most recent additions to the menu, specifically the banana-based and Hawaiian-inspired flavors, have garnered my utmost approval. However, I must deduct a star from my rating due to a glaring omission in their beverage selection; specifically, the absence of juice poppers. It is truly perplexing that a business would fail to recognize the widespread popularity of these refreshing drinks."

"We opted for a brunch excursion, yet our culinary inclinations led us to select items from the grilled cheese menu instead. I relished in the 'wake and bake,' an unparalleled delight that harmoniously combined the richness of cheddar, the savory essence of maple bacon, and the velvety texture of maple mayo. It was utterly sublime, transcending mere mortal taste buds. My companion had the 'blarney stoner,' an open-faced creation that juxtaposed mashed potatoes, beer cheese, and stout gravy atop a foundation of bread, accompanied by fries and hash browns. While not strictly adhering to the definition of grilled cheese, it was undeniably delectable. All grilled cheese dishes are served with tomato soup and fries; the latter were substantial, sporting a crispy exterior and fluffy interior, and offered in various flavors such as old bay - an unimpeachable choice. The tomato soup presented an interesting dichotomy - while not unpalatable, its viscosity verged on excessive, rendering it impractical as a standalone dish, but nevertheless fulfilling its role as a dip for the fries. Our server exhibited commendable proficiency and promptness, leaving no room for dissatisfaction. Moreover, the establishment boasts an impressive array of beers, ensuring our future patronage."

Just to the left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park is where you'll find The Diamond Pizza. 

Not only do they have really good pizza, the cheese is especially good, but you can enter the park there as well. Never a line.  Friendly ticket taker and bag search person greet you at the door, scan your ticket and provide a program along with any promotional items for the game.

Once inside, order by the slice, grab a beer if that's your pleasure and watch the game on either of the TVs before going to your seats. Another bonus, restrooms are just outside the restaurant as you enter the left field corridor. 

Like most pizza/sandwich shops, this one can be hopping. No frills in the service, mustard working folks trying to make good food for the money. And they do.

Well I went in here looking for gifts for others, but only came out with stuff for myself....hummmm something is wrong with this picture! \nI love Ross stores, I shouldn't have even started looking for stuff for me, it get's me every time!
Old school friendly atmosphere and great specials.  The steak abd lobster comes with veggies and a big ass baked potato

"Holly's endorsement is spot on! As a seasoned participant, this marks my second year engaging in this celebrated event. In the previous year, I opted for the cycling segment, which unfortunately encountered organizational challenges, leading to its absence in the current edition. However, I partake in the 5K walk with great enthusiasm, accompanied by my trusty beard, ensuring a seamless experience. My preferred parking location is the north lot, allowing for a swift departure via Sunset. It is worth mentioning that the burgeoning canine population attending annually raises concerns for me. Nonetheless, I must commend the organizers for maintaining a clean environment by encouraging responsible pet ownership. The pre-event entertainment, featuring renowned performers such as Jabbawockeez from the Monte Carlo, dancers from Fantasy at the Luxor, and even five parachuting Santas descending from a helicopter above the boulevard, contributes significantly to the festive atmosphere. Moreover, the unique opportunity to traverse the Sunset freeway by foot, an experience not commonly had, adds to the appeal of this occasion. Most importantly, this event serves as the primary fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a deserving charity in Southern Nevada. Needless to say, I eagerly anticipate my participation in the forthcoming edition, dressed in my finest attire, of course!"

Another successful transplant from NYC, this place is great.  Spendy, trendy, and a little confusing menu wise if you have a big group like we did.  we had a great waiter that helped us with our order and nobody left disappointed or un-full.  The place is loud and full of energy and beautiful people.

Ask for help with the menu if theres a group.  If youre a couple youre golden.  So many things to try, you could eat here 100 times.

No complaints at all.

Hidden away it is!  I forgot where it was located (some friends drove me here and I was not paying attention as to how we arrived).\n\nThe interior is funky, dark, and small (cool copper counter tops) but that just adds to the character.  I ordered pork enchiladas(?) and shared the sauteed garlic dish (i think that's what it was)?  It was very yummy and left me wanting more.  The only downfall was that the garlic must have gotten into my pores b/c I felt like I smelled of garlic for days!  It was well worth it though and a spot you should certainly check out.

I undertook a personal culinary excursion to this establishment several months ago, and I must say that I am thoroughly delighted that I did, for the consumables served here are indeed delectable. Specifically, I indulged in their spicy meat taco, which proved to be a flavorsome and satisfying experience. Subsequently, I revisited this venue a few weeks later and opted for their burrito, which not only met but exceeded my expectations, surpassing the quality of a similar dish offered by Chipotle. However, I do lament the lack of clarity regarding the nature of the meats utilized in their dishes, as the majority of them are unfamiliar to me, and perhaps a more diverse selection of carbonated beverages or the inclusion of tea would enhance the overall dining experience. Nonetheless, this establishment earns high marks for providing an economical and satisfying dining option, serving scrumptious tacos, burritos, and street corn late into the evening hours.
i really want to give it 5 stars but my carne adovada sometimes is kinda fatty. i love this dish but hate sometimes picking through fat. they do have the best chipotle ranch ever!!!

"The most exceptional Chai Latte within the vicinity. Consumed a chocolate twist and a quiche Lorraine; both possessed an ethereal quality in terms of taste and texture, with the latter boasting an unparalleled lightness that belied its delectability. Procured a ciabatta boule for domestic consumption, which, despite its unconventional moisture level, excelled in its flavorsome presentation."
Delicious, good service, one of our favorites places to eat.\n\nHighly recommend the sesame tofu - it is some of the best tofu I've ever had at a restaurant.

I had to take a star away.  I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl and was very disappointed, it tasted really strange and really soggy.  My co-worker said it best, he said it tasted like a frozen meal heated. \n\nI'll stick with the 5 star wraps and salads and leave the 2.5 star bowls for them to keep.

Great performances and acts! The main guy was hilarious and the space was intimate. I only wish Angel had a larger part, but it was fun seeing her doing something out of her element. \n\nP.S. The absinthe is a great gimmick but nothing like what you find overseas. I appreciate that they had it though.

Upon my return, I noticed that they had implemented alterations in the preparation method of their Wellington dish. Specifically, it is now only available in a singular manner, precluding the option for customization, such as ordering it medium-well or otherwise. While this change elicited my amusement, I must say that the quality of the dish remains unwavering.

"Jennifer C.'s assessment resonates profoundly. As a native Pittsburgher, partaking in an excursion of my hometown initially seemed counterintuitive, but this particular venture offered a distinctive mode of transportation. However, my enthusiasm for this escapade was somewhat tempered due to the preponderance of emphasis on the Segway experience rather than the educational aspect of the tour. While the Segway ride itself was undoubtedly enjoyable, particularly when the speed restriction was lifted, I had anticipated a more comprehensive and informative guided experience. The guide did highlight a few intriguing tidbits along the way, but ultimately, my expectations remained unfulfilled."
Make sure you're ready to eat if you come here. The proportions are ginormous and will definitely leave you with a food coma. The fries that come with the sandwiches are also great.

"It appears that certain establishments within the culinary industry have been experiencing a dearth of hospitable hosts, as of late. Specifically, the front-of-house staff seem to lack a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain... panache, if you will, that is customarily associated with the profession. However, allow me to digress; our server, Carol, proved to be an absolute delight, her exceptional customer service skills and warm demeanor serving as a remarkable contrast to the initial impression wrought by the podium sentinels. Now, let us proceed to the culinary aspects of our visit. We opted for the tomato caprese appetizer, which, I must say, was truly exceptional. A novel twist on a time-honored classic, the dish featured tomatoes artfully arranged upon the plate, complemented by a sprinkling of chopped tomatoes and a judicious application of fresh red onion. Additionally, a balsamic reduction and a sprinkling of fresh basil added a depth of flavor that elevated the dish to a truly gastronomic experience. While I could easily have consumed this appetizer as a main course, my self-control proved insufficient to resist the allure of the pasta franco. Suffice it to say, the dish did not disappoint; the harmonious union of olives, artichoke hearts, and sun-dried tomatoes resulted in a culinary symphony that, while slightly salty towards the conclusion, was by no means unexpected. In point of fact, I would unhesitatingly order it again. Carol's attentiveness, albeit never overbearing, only further enhanced our dining experience. It is our fervent hope to rectify our regrettable lack of visits to this establishment, and we eagerly anticipate future opportunities to partake in their gustatory offerings."
Come for the coffee, stay (or come back) for the excellent fresh soup, sandwiches and smoothies!  Would be 5 stars if the service was more consistent.
Fast, polite and the food was good.  The Thai Tacos and fried Mac&Cheese was yummy.  Great burgers as well. This is no culinary stop but good fast food.

Great place!  Pretty slow, as you might expect on a Monday night.  Had nice Malbec, great marinaded olives and a perfect-sized sausage and mushroom pizza.  

Decor is very spiffy.  Rather hard to find the place if you're not a local.  Little strip mall right behind the tire store.  Look Arden, as it's worth searching for.

Get in here!!

"Prior to this culinary excursion, my acquaintance with this Chinese restaurant was limited to their midday buffet, which shall serve as the exclusive focus of this assessment. \n\nSubsequently, we have begun to frequent this establishment with increased regularity, and the buffet has consistently demonstrated an impressive profusion of options, ensuring that there is almost always an adequate supply of each dish. My personal preferences within this gastronomic paradise are the 'eight treasures' and the chicken in curry sauce. Summary: A satisfying repast at a reasonable price, devoid of protracted waiting periods."

"Dickey's provided a pivotal salvation to my Thanksgiving festivities by offering a pair of turkey options, specifically the Cajun Fried Turkey and Smoked Turkey, priced at $49.99 apiece, albeit the latter was the sole remaining variety given the dearth of availability at other establishments such as Hash House a Go Go, Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves, which had depleted their inventory of turkeys, thereby necessitating a prompt acquisition of the former; fortunately, Dickey's still had one smoked turkey available, which I swiftly secured, much to my relief.
